top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Shiny
reviews.text: This is hands down the best vegan sushi I’ve ever had! I was lucky to snag a seat right away, with no wait. I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. The sauces and ingredients were perfectly balanced and complemented each other beautifully. Since I don’t eat raw fish, finding this vegan sushi spot was a real treat. The hype is definitely justified! The service was fantastic, and my food arrived super quickly. I can’t wait to come back and sample more dishes from the menu.

reviews.author: Rahul Somani
reviews.text:
Recommended by a family member and what an amazing spot!!! We got super lucky with being seated by walking in around 9pm on Saturday night.

The team was super helpful in accommodating us and requested we be ready to order as soon as we are seated. We ordered a bunch of different roles along with tempura and tofu appetizers.

The ambiance and comfort in this restaurant is very inviting which made the experience that much more fun. Ohhh and their hot sauce is AMAZING which is homemade!!!!

reviews.author: Jeremiah Perez
reviews.text: This was a very great dining experience. Everything the staff, the food, the atmosphere. The food comes out as things are ready which gives the table an opportunity to sample things as they are fresh. The rolls were innovative and delicious. Every bite a flavor explosion. I had two none vegans at my table and they thoroughly enjoyed the meal and felt satisfied.

reviews.author: rajat kabra
reviews.text:
Sushi here has unique flavors and presentation and the fact that they serve so many options of vegan sushi is beyond impressive.

Loved the boddy & soul  and the green mango nigiri followed by candlestick. The surprise ending was interesting and I got the habanero sushi but not as good as the three mentioned before.

Had karage for the first time ever and it was sweet so not a fan, though I'm not sure what real karage tastes like.

reviews.author: Neesha Patel
reviews.text:
A really popular vegan sushi restaurant and with good reason! There was something for every taste.

They have rotating 90 minute spots and they are usually booked. They do seat a few people at the bar. But if it’s your first time, Highly recommend reservations for the full experience.

We needed the full 90 minutes and enjoyed every minute of it. Between 2 people, we ordered shishito peppers, 2 Nigiri and 3 specialty rolls. I think 2 nigiri and 2 specialty rolls would have been the perfect amount!

Highly highly highly recommend the boddy and soul. Probably one of the best on the menu! The fine balance between textures and tastes is amazing.

top_10.name: Golden Era
top_10.address: 395 Golden Gate Ave, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Huyen Tran Nguyen (Vysturbed)
reviews.text: There's so many vegan options here and sooooo delicious. I wish I had this in Michigan as I love Vietnamese food but wish there were more places that used mock meats as a former meat eater for that nostalgic taste. I still love all the tofu options though and they have some cool snack options like canned vegetarian pate and even hot dogs.

reviews.author: Shaili Jha
reviews.text:
Edit: we went back and had crispy cauliflower, Indian fried rice and lemongrass deluxe (again) Everything was delicious!

Great vegan food! Went on a solo date and got the Lemongrass Deluxe. It was delicious! The right amount of spice as well. Definitely recommend and would visit again next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Shivakshi Gupta
reviews.text: I have visited this place multiple times, and it consistently offers some of the best food I’ve ever had. Their desserts are exceptional as well. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience and delicious food.

reviews.author: Jen Dawn
reviews.text: This is an absolute must try. I haven't been for over 15 years when they were in the old location. The new location is fantastic and the food is even better than before. Every option is on point with great flavors and freshness. The Queen was really good!

reviews.author: Kalia Juell
reviews.text: Very cute and quiet atmosphere. This was my first time coming it and it was very delicious. We order a steam bun, golden egg rolls, lemon grass chicken and the gourmet fried rice. Everything had great flavor and each dish was very filling. The waitress we had was very helpful for our first time here and very friendly. I would come back again.

testimonials: There's so many vegan options here and sooooo delicious. I wish I had this in Michigan as I love Vietnamese food but wish there were more places that used mock meats as a former meat eater for that nostalgic taste. I still love all the tofu options though and they have some cool snack options like canned vegetarian pate and even hot dogs.

Edit: we went back and had crispy cauliflower, Indian fried rice and lemongrass deluxe (again) Everything was delicious!

Great vegan food! Went on a solo date and got the Lemongrass Deluxe. It was delicious! The right amount of spice as well. Definitely recommend and would visit again next time I'm in town!

I have visited this place multiple times, and it consistently offers some of the best food I’ve ever had. Their desserts are exceptional as well. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience and delicious food.

top_10.name: Wildseed
top_10.address: 2000 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Kristina Femal
reviews.text: It's nice to have an upscale vegan restaurant in SF and I love that there's lots of options like non-alcoholic drinks  or gluten free menu options. Delicious juices and seasonal menu based on available product is a highlight for me. Expensive overall but worth the occasional indulgence, especially if it's for a special occasion. The service is always great and I recommend sitting at the bar if in a group of two.

reviews.author: EddyOneTake
reviews.text:
Wildseed in San Francisco has quickly become a gem in the vegan dining scene, and for good reason! As vegans, finding great food can feel like an uphill battle, but Wildseed makes it effortless—and incredibly enjoyable.

The moment we walked in, we were warmly greeted by Jarod, I believe the manager, who immediately made us feel welcome and accommodated. His enthusiasm and attentiveness set the tone for an incredible experience.

Our server, Shadwa, was nothing short of amazing. From the start, she checked in on our preferences and any allergies we might have, ensuring every dish was tailored perfectly for us. Her friendliness and genuine care made our meal feel special—and her warm smile never left her face throughout the entire experience. What truly impressed us, though, was when Shadwa requested a slight modification to one of our dishes on our behalf. It’s clear that Wildseed’s team is all about going above and beyond to make sure their guests feel celebrated and cared for.

The food? Simply put: fresh, vibrant, and full of flavor. Every bite felt like a celebration of plant-based cuisine, with dishes that were as visually stunning as they were delicious. The ambiance was equally impressive—modern, clean, and inviting, with a lively energy that made us feel right at home.

From start to finish, Wildseed exceeded our expectations in every way. The combination of outstanding service, nutritious and flavorful food, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere makes this place a top contender for the best vegan restaurants in SF. If you’re in the area and (especially if you’re vegan), Wildseed is a must-visit.

Thank you to Jarod and Shadwa for making our experience so memorable—you truly shine, and we can’t wait to return!

reviews.author: Oliver Pe
reviews.text:
May 2025 Original Wildseed branch offering trendy and farm based vegan cuisone and creative mixology.

We have loyally been going to the Palo Alto branch and this originating one was definitely a welcome find in SFO and the Pac Hts area.  If you arent sold to vegan cuisine this resto may change your mind and condition your taste buds.

Their seasonal section is always worth trying as well for the regulars.

The drinks are very diverse and offers unique themes and blends.

Staff have been consistently professional and accomodating.

The layout is spacious and can provide privacy with enough variety of indoor and outdoor choices.  From counters, cubicles and free standing tables.

Ideal for all types and sets of diners.

One of our more favorite causual dining restos in the Westcoast.

reviews.author: jewls r
reviews.text: Great vegan food and wine selection - a bit pricey for some dishes and a few odd tastes here and there like the sausage in the paella but overall 8/10 dinner experience and 9/10 brunch experience with great decor and ambiance + stellar service. Highly recommend the spicy curry, corn fritters, mezze and the breakfast sandwich

reviews.author: Alison Quaglia
reviews.text: Everything was insanely delicious, the vibe was on point and our server was super friendly and helpful! We had the Andalusia salad, squash pizza and rigatoni alla vodka and would highly recommend all. We had such a hard time choosing because every plate we saw looked amazing. We hope to come back again soon next time we’re in town!

The service is always great and I recommend sitting at the bar if in a group of two.

top_10.name: Firefly Restaurant
top_10.address: 4288 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Lydia Simmons
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

reviews.author: Tim Wagner
reviews.text: This is a painful review to write because I wanted to love this place. The atmosphere is homey and welcoming, the staff was fantastic, and some of the food was delicious: every starter was amazing, and the sweet potatoes were a knockout. But then there were the misses. The fried chicken main arrived cold and greasy, and the brownie sundae was burnt to a crisp... Literally a crisp, as it was almost impossible to even cut it. The biscuits were also overbaked to the point of being painfully dry. And while the starters were good, it's mostly variations on carbs, with limited vegetable or other options. If the food was more evenly prepared and they added a little variety to the small plate options, this place would be amazing. Note their license is beer & wine only, no hard liquor.

reviews.author: Don Walling
reviews.text:
We really enjoy firefly. My wife is strict vegan, and they have many dishes which either are or can be made vegan. I am not vegan. We always get the seed loaf, really enjoy the rustic flavors. I enjoy the Pao de Queijo, and the onion jam that comes with it is my favorite. The Mexican street corn is mild and delightful.

My wife enjoys the daikon radish cakes and usually gets them as her main, supplemented with something else since they're a starter and a little small for a main. The choppy salad is excellent even in vegan form. The spring salad is also excellent as a vegan option. I've had both the fried chicken and the braised pork; both are excellent. The only quibble is that the "damn fine buttermilk biscuit" hasn't actually been that great on two occasions - it tends to be overcooked and not so tender. The cornbread is much better although it too tends to be overcooked. The Mac and cheese is fine but not spectacular.

For dessert, the chocolate peanut butter bar is excellent, but get the vanilla ice cream rather than the coffee cocoa nib vegan ice cream if you can. The dulce de leche pot de creme is excellent but very rich. And the key lime pie is also excellent, not too tart or too sweet - just right, but smaller than I would like.

reviews.author: Frances Peterson
reviews.text:
Five star, creative DELICIOUS food. Easy Street parking. Friendly, professional, knowledgeable staff. Nice restroom. Casual yet festive ambience. Fun place for celebrations or dates.

They do NOT do take out. The focus is on the people who are present to them. And in turn, they are present to the people enjoying the warm, hospitable welcome.

Pricey but SO worth it.

reviews.author: Madison Gaynor
reviews.text: Excellent food, wonderful service, great environs. My only wish is for the portions to be larger as they can sometimes be quite small, especially the starter plates. Example: corn cakes were only two small cakes for $12, which felt steep when they arrived. The entrees are a good size, though. It means you must order multiple dishes to fill up, though all are delicious.

testimonials: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

top_10.name: Vegetarian House Vegan
top_10.address: 520 E Santa Clara St, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

reviews.author: Vincybie Lee
reviews.text:
We walked for 30 minutes from our hotel, filled with high hopes for our meal at Vegetarian House Vegan, which boasted an impressive 4.6 rating on Google Reviews. Upon our arrival, however, we were informed that indoor dining was only available on weekends, leaving us with the outdoor seating option. Initially, we tried to remain optimistic and chose a table, but to our dismay, we were met with a strong smell of urine in that area. We quickly moved to another table, hoping for a better experience.

Next, we attempted to place our order via the QR code, but the process proved frustratingly slow. After about 20 minutes, we still encountered issues with card payment, adding to our stress as we were on a tight schedule for medical appointments.

To make matters worse, our meals were served on disposable plates, bowls, and utensils—something we hadn’t anticipated based on the reviews we read. Regardless of whether these disposables were biodegradable, it detracted significantly from the dining experience. Eating from proper plates and using real cutlery enhances the enjoyment of a meal, and the use of disposables reminded me of the less favorable takeaway experiences during the pandemic. Thankfully, we always carry our own stainless steel chopstick set, which at least provided some comfort.

Now, let’s discuss the food itself. We ordered Bun Hue, stir-fried mixed vegetables, and Malaysian fried curry noodles. As someone from Malaysia, I was particularly looking forward to the curry noodles, but I was disappointed to find them overly saturated with coconut milk—far from the authentic flavors I know. Both noodle dishes were excessively soggy, and the Bun Hue soup had a taste that was quite peculiar. The only redeeming dish was the mixed vegetables, which were nicely prepared.

Overall, the experience felt more like dining in a national park without proper amenities, rather than enjoying a meal at a well-reviewed restaurant. It was disheartening to miss out on what could have been a wonderful dining experience in San Jose. 😕😕😕

reviews.author: Usha Aluru
reviews.text: We went here for Mother’s Day lunch! Even though it looks crowded we didn’t have to wait for long, it’s a big place. It seems very popular people kept coming in constantly. We had mango salad, mushroom kebab, pot stickers, and for main course pineapple fried rice and spicy mambo, everything was great, tasted amazing. We also had vegan desert, they have couple of options, we ordered strawberry cloud cake. It was delicious! Really enjoyed the vibe and food here, we will be back

reviews.author: Shruti Daga
reviews.text: We were not aware that they have indoor dining only on limited days but the food did not disappoint.. Their menu is all vegetarian and a massive menu to choose from. If the indoor dining is shut they have this outdoor seating and one can order and eat there and its self service.

reviews.author: Vignesh Muralidharan
reviews.text:
By far one the best Thai Curries I had in the Bay Area! I absolutely loved the food here.

- Pho:
Pho Soup could be slightly better though. The broth could be a little thicker.

- Thai Curry:
There was something unique about the Thai curry here that I'm not able to find at other places. Plenty of veggies, tasty curry. You have to order rice on the side though.

Cons:
The only con here is the pricing. It's very expensive for the quantity they offer.

reviews.author: Eugenie Ooi
reviews.text:
As a regular omnivore, the vegan options at this restaurant did not make me miss meat. On the contrary, some of the items, if I was not told what they were, I would have not guessed they were vegan.
I actually did not enjoy the desserts so I can't recommend them, but my favorite dishes that we tried were the Queens Joy, Spicy chacha (not actually that spicy), the crispy mushrooms and the caulipower. I would gladly go back for any of those dishes. The mango salad was also nice. Everything in general was yummy so you can't really go wrong.
The staff were very friendly and nice to us, even though we were a big group.
I didn't get to take pictures of some of the dishes because our group ate them so fast.

testimonials:
We walked for 30 minutes from our hotel, filled with high hopes for our meal at Vegetarian House Vegan, which boasted an impressive 4.6 rating on Google Reviews. Upon our arrival, however, we were informed that indoor dining was only available on weekends, leaving us with the outdoor seating option. Initially, we tried to remain optimistic and chose a table, but to our dismay, we were met with a strong smell of urine in that area. We quickly moved to another table, hoping for a better experience.

Next, we attempted to place our order via the QR code, but the process proved frustratingly slow. After about 20 minutes, we still encountered issues with card payment, adding to our stress as we were on a tight schedule for medical appointments.

To make matters worse, our meals were served on disposable plates, bowls, and utensils—something we hadn’t anticipated based on the reviews we read. Regardless of whether these disposables were biodegradable, it detracted significantly from the dining experience. Eating from proper plates and using real cutlery enhances the enjoyment of a meal, and the use of disposables reminded me of the less favorable takeaway experiences during the pandemic. Thankfully, we always carry our own stainless steel chopstick set, which at least provided some comfort.

Now, let’s discuss the food itself. We ordered Bun Hue, stir-fried mixed vegetables, and Malaysian fried curry noodles. As someone from Malaysia, I was particularly looking forward to the curry noodles, but I was disappointed to find them overly saturated with coconut milk—far from the authentic flavors I know. Both noodle dishes were excessively soggy, and the Bun Hue soup had a taste that was quite peculiar. The only redeeming dish was the mixed vegetables, which were nicely prepared.

Overall, the experience felt more like dining in a national park without proper amenities, rather than enjoying a meal at a well-reviewed restaurant. It was disheartening to miss out on what could have been a wonderful dining experience in San Jose. 😕😕😕

We went here for Mother’s Day lunch! Even though it looks crowded we didn’t have to wait for long, it’s a big place. It seems very popular people kept coming in constantly. We had mango salad, mushroom kebab, pot stickers, and for main course pineapple fried rice and spicy mambo, everything was great, tasted amazing. We also had vegan desert, they have couple of options, we ordered strawberry cloud cake. It was delicious! Really enjoyed the vibe and food here, we will be back

We were not aware that they have indoor dining only on limited days but the food did not disappoint.. Their menu is all vegetarian and a massive menu to choose from. If the indoor dining is shut they have this outdoor seating and one can order and eat there and its self service.

top_10.name: Om Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1668 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Natasha Bartolome
reviews.text:
THE BEST GLUTEN FREE GARLIC NAAN OF ALL THE LAND!!!

Oh my…this place is a GODSEND for us gluten intolerant people! (Celiac here) Finally able to have garlic naan after so many years. It was glorious, especially paired with some butter chicken. Not to mention, majority of the menu is GF friendly! The salmon pakora was a nice surprise, super flavorful & interesting texture! The free papadam with the sweet sauce reminded me of fried wonton and sweet/sour sauce, which I also haven’t had in ages. I don’t think I need to tell you this, but do not skip out on the mango lassi!!! Yes it is neon orange but it’s their homemade recipe using Kesar mangoes! It’s got right balance between sweet, tangy, and tart. Perfect pairing to calm the spice ☺️

Everything was absolutely divine and well-priced. We even ordered a GF pesto garlic naan to take home, so worth. Servers were graciously nice and attentive. Ambiance—my only complaint was the front of the restaurant kind of smelled like cat pee 😅 thankfully there is a quaint dining room in the back, tucked away from that/the street!

Regardless, I would bring all my friends here. Staff was super friendly and accommodating to the couples and large groups dining in, and the menu is super inclusive. I appreciate establishments like Om Indian and I would definitely travel to eat it. Such a special place to me/us GF eaters!!

reviews.author: Joshua Yuan
reviews.text:
Not busy on a random night and got seated. Interior is a bit weird but it's ok (we were seated in some hallway next to the bathrooms...)

Food was good and didn't take too long. Very appetizing. Would come back when I'm in the area and cravd Indian food.

reviews.author: Patricia Segovia
reviews.text: Such an underrated spot! Went in for just a quick bite but ended up ordering more food because it was just that good. 🤩 Got the chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, a paneer dish, chicken tandoori, garlic naan and laasi! All four of us in our party agreed that it was one of the top 3 meals we had during our 3 week trip to the US. 👏 Wish I took more photos of the food but we devoured everything so fast 😅

reviews.author: bhumi patel
reviews.text: Allwin and his team provided very good customers service and food was really awesome. Me and my mom enjoyed great time together. It’s my first time here in San Francisco and I really appreciate and love the food. He also makes sure that my food is special and spicy as I requested. I’ll definitely recommend it to anyone 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.author: sarah halversen
reviews.text: Food, service, and vibes: awesome. We got the butter chicken, a vegan potato and eggplant curry dish, garlic naan, and a ton of complementary papadam. All was delectable. I’m unsure what I was expecting ordering the margarita, but i like what I tasted. Can’t complain. Shoutout to the kings at OM ❤️

top_10.name: Good Karma Fine Ales Food & HiFi
top_10.address: 37 S 1st St, San Jose, CA 95113, USA

reviews.author: Jackie Wolfe
reviews.text: Let me start by saying I’m not personally vegan but I would ABSOLUTELY come back here because the food was that great & I couldn’t even tell it was vegan! I got the 1 item plate with Jamaican Jerk with brown rice (pictured) & my friend got the Pulled “Pork” street tacos which were also spectacular. We also ordered a couple desserts, Mom’s Apple crisp & the Baklava, which was also super delicious! They also have a wide beer selection! I have to point out how rad & laid back the atmosphere is; all the art & vinyl records makes this place truly one of a kind! We went on a Saturday night & they had a live jazz band playing which made it even more special. If you’re vegan or not, you have to check this place out!

reviews.author: pk Patel
reviews.text:
My wife and I visited this vegan restaurant last Sunday afternoon, and we had a great experience. The streets were quiet, which made the outdoor seating even more enjoyable—peaceful and calm, just what we needed.

The food was delicious with fresh flavors, and I especially loved their cider beer—crisp, refreshing, and full of excellent taste. It really stood out!

Overall, a lovely place to unwind and enjoy a good plant-based meal. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that there’s still a little room to elevate the experience even further. But we’ll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kaitlan Zizzo
reviews.text: The staff is great, the vinyls are always on point, the ambiance is super chill and relaxing, and the FOOD is incredible!! I'm so lucky I work so close to the best vegan place around downtown San Jose

reviews.author: Matthew Israelson
reviews.text: Amazing place to stop for snack and brew. Craft beer selection on point. Music is the vibe here. Cool record/cd collection played over the system. Food was ok. Not mind blowing but decent veg fair

reviews.author: Rust Man
reviews.text: Good Karma is the best of both words: Tasty craft beer and vegan food. The Fork and Knife nachos, baklava served hot, a great selection of beers on tap and in the can. Super nice people working to make sure everything is great. Went twice while in San Jose. I highly recommend this spot.

top_10.name: Casa Borinqueña
top_10.address: Casa Borinqueña, 945 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: april
reviews.text:
Are you sure this is vegan? The chicken skewers were fantastic! The yucca fries with impossible beef was very flavorful.
And the cake was so moist and just the right amount of sweetness. The owner was was a doll and made us feel right at home.

reviews.author: Jordan C Peralta
reviews.text:
Built up an appetite browsing through Ikea next door, then crossed into Saluhall, a hip eatery on mid-Market where Casa Borinqueña can be found. The Puerto Rican (PR) stand gave major island vibes and reminded me of the food I would find in Little Caribbean, NYC, but vegan.

The sample platter is the way to go with sweet BBQ skewers on a bed of rice and plantains. A PR meal wouldn’t be complete without tostones, topped with your choice of chik’n or beef. While you can get one of each, I have a slight preference for the chik’n. Wash it down with a Malta India, a popular carbonated malt drink from PR. Despite its name or bottle shape, it’s non-alcoholic. It was a nice touch that Casa Borinqueña carried this; it added to the meal.

reviews.author: Vianney Villaurrutia
reviews.text: first time trying puerto rican food and it was amazing!!! ordered the sampler plate and everything was not only super worth it but incredibly tasty! it’s the type of food that makes you say “can’t believe it’s vegan” (but the best part is that it actually is). cashier was kind and service was quick. :]

reviews.author: Sydney Evans
reviews.text: The sample platter was incredible! We come down to the city to try new vegan spots and this did not disappoint we will definitely be back! There is a lot of love that goes into this food!

reviews.author: Raghav B
reviews.text:
Who knew there would be a dedicated place for Puerto Rican food that is 100% vegan. The BBQ platter is a delicious assortment of flavors and very filling. They have vegan Tres Leches!  You definitely need to try that -- this dessert is reason enough to visit this place. SO good!

Friendly service and the food court offers plenty of seating. The location is a great, clean, lively respite in a somewhat borderline shady location of downtown SF. Walking distance to all the major theaters nearby.

top_10.name: aíso
top_10.address: 4068 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Wilton Gorske
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious and thoughtful cocktail bar with creative menu and drinks. Really good non-a option on request. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Personal favorite was the jerk sliders and pineapple tofu skewers, but truly everything was great.

reviews.author: Kosal Bo
reviews.text:
aiso is the latest hot spot in the Castro that curates a menu catered towards a plant-based diet and exquisite cocktail taste.  The restaurant is a love letter from neighborhood legend, Corbin C. and his long history with and commitment to the community.

Food is on point. Drinks are delicious. Service is exceptional.  Check it out for yourself and bring a friend or few.

reviews.author: Katrina Yu
reviews.text: This was a delcious meal at a cute cozy restaurant. We ordered every item on the menu and enjoyed every dish, especially the oyster mushroom skewers, the spicy hummus with the cauliflower, and the passion fruit sorbet. Every dish was prepared thoughtfully and was very pretty. High recommended even for non vegans!

reviews.author: Katherine Zorn
reviews.text: The breakfast burrito on the brunch menu was delicious. Can’t wait to try more

reviews.author: Veysel Rodi SANSARKAN
reviews.text: Everything was very good, especially the oyster mushrooms were great, they were my favorite. Soggy dollar was my favorite of the cocktails, I had 3 of them. The prices were more affordable than many places in the castro and the music selection was great.

testimonials: Absolutely delicious and thoughtful cocktail bar with creative menu and drinks. Really good non-a option on request. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Personal favorite was the jerk sliders and pineapple tofu skewers, but truly everything was great.

Food is on point. Drinks are delicious. Service is exceptional.  Check it out for yourself and bring a friend or few.

Every dish was prepared thoughtfully and was very pretty. High recommended even for non vegans!

top_10.name: Judahlicious
top_10.address: 3906 Judah St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Lauren
reviews.text: YUM. As a health food-oriented vegan, I’m can be so choosy that there’s usually only a couple dishes that entice me even at vegan restaurants. But at Judahlicious, I had a tough time deciding what to get because almost every single item on the menu sounded AMAZING. The raw section - wow. (Always a good sign when there’s a raw section.) The smoothie section - crazy. The hot food section really spoke to me, and I went with the 1/2 nekked burrito. I’m not entirely sure why it was named that way, but it was basically the perfect burrito. I opted for the corn tortilla, which was thick and delicious and homemade. Absolutely loved the black beans, brown rice(!!), grilled veggies, and cashew creme (made with olive oil!) and the mixed green salad topped with delicious walnut parmesan rounded it out into the perfect meal. Satisfying and filling in a light, healthy way. Cannot wait to come back here hopefully soon (and really enjoyed visiting Other Avenues Grocery Cooperative right around the corner).

reviews.author: Amritpal Bhagat
reviews.text:
Judahlicious – San Francisco
Amid the clamor of Judah Street, Judahlicious stands firm—an unshaken outpost of nourishment and quiet benevolence.

We arrived early, seeking breakfast not just to fill the stomach, but to greet the day with intention. The Waffle Açaí was both hearty and refreshing, marrying the crisp warmth of waffles with the chilled vigor of açaí—a contrast that, like life, balances sweet with substance.

The Nekked Burrito reminded us that food need not be overcomplicated to be fulfilling. Unadorned yet complete, it offered grounding flavors wrapped in simplicity.

We shared the Velvet smoothie—banana, peanut butter, and oat milk—a drink that held the dignity of restraint, yet soothed like an old truth rediscovered.

While we dined, a man without a home asked for juice. It was granted without fuss or spectacle. In that quiet act, there was more nourishment than any menu could hold.

Judahlicious feeds body, mind, and, on occasion, spirit.

reviews.author: Jimit Pandya
reviews.text:
100% vegan!! This place is really really good!
Their Nekked Burrito is yum!
Waffles and Açaí Bowls are super yummy and healthy!
We tried their new menu item “burmosa” which is supposed to be a Samosa Burrito… however  don’t recommend eating that. It does not taste like Samosa at all .. I would stick to other items on their menu.

reviews.author: Estrella S.
reviews.text: Some of the best food in San Francisco. My bf and I are not vegan but we are obsessed. Come with an empty stomach, get the necked burrito, house chili, and sem sandwich. Just do it. You’ll be in a savory, fresh, comforting, crunchy heaven. Then come back later and get an açaí bowl with the jungle granola mix if you’re adventurous enough to take your tastebuds on a journey  and have them changed forever. (I ask for the granola on the side because it’s so dang good to snack on.) I came here a lot when I lived in SF, and I come back every single time I’m here. It’s under the same management but a new owner that works alongside his crew to deliver excellence and deliver the dream of genuinely good, healthy, DELICIOUS food. Get the food while you can!! This special establishment likely wont be around forever!! This is a rare gem.

reviews.author: Mike Leone
reviews.text: Oh the blueberries are blended in. Nice touch. This place has good acai bowls. The acai is flavored properly. Id come here again and recommend it to others. A lot better than Palmetto. I did try the strawberries they tasted fresh and ripe. All the fruit tasted good and ripe.

top_10.name: Baklavastory.
top_10.address: 1830 Harrison St Ste B, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Mert Ucmer
reviews.text: As a Turk, I’ve tried baklava everywhere I could find it in the US, and this place truly stands out. It's even better than many places back in Turkey. The quality and flavor are exceptional. Everything is freshly made daily, even hourly. I honestly don’t like coming here because it completely ruins my diet. I just hope they never compromise on the freshness and taste. Love that place!!

reviews.author: Dorukhan Oguz
reviews.text: Absolutely incredible! BaklavaStory delivers the most authentic and delicious baklava I’ve ever tasted outside of Turkey. Every bite is perfectly crisp, buttery, and just the right amount of sweet. You can tell they use high-quality ingredients and put real care into their craft. Whether you’re treating yourself or gifting to someone special, this is a must-try. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Dee Whitt
reviews.text:
Run do not walk to this place! When I say this is hands-down, one of the best things I have ever eaten, I mean it this baklava is light as air with the perfect touch of sweetness and crunch from which ever nut you choose, which they had a selection of walnut and pistachio. My friend and I are sitting and devouring the whole tray and I don’t feel guilty about it at all because literally literally this is the best baklava actually, the best dessert I have ever had! The customer service is on another level two I came in and my friend waited outside since she had a big stroller and without me saying anything the man at the front went out and gave her a piece to try as well.
Such an inviting little place. Lastly, this is truly so good. I literally called to tell them it made my day. Please support this business and their delicious treats

reviews.author: Sanan Guliyev
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! The baklava from Baklavastory is by far the best I’ve had outside of Turkey. Perfectly flaky layers, just the right amount of sweetness, and a rich, nutty flavor that melts in your mouth. You can tell it’s made with love and tradition. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Megan Satterthwaite Freiman
reviews.text: This is the best baklava I have EVER had - great example of doing one thing and doing it PERFECTLY. Beyond the perfection of the pistachio and walnut recipes, Tolgay (the owner) welcomes everyone into his shop with a smile and free samples (aka a full piece of baklava!). He sources the pistachios from Turkey himself and it’s clear that he and his team put so much love and thought into each piece. Worth the trip and wait - don’t walk but run to this place!

The quality and flavor are exceptional. Everything is freshly made daily, even hourly. I honestly don’t like coming here because it completely ruins my diet. I just hope they never compromise on the freshness and taste. Love that place!!

top_10.name: Neighbor Bakehouse
top_10.address: 2343 3rd St UNIT 100, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Vivian Anne
reviews.text: We stopped by Neighbor Bakehouse on a Sunday at 8 am. There was plenty of street parking available. As we were walking to get in line (3 parties in front of us), 2 employees rudely pushed past us on the sidewalk. It was clear they were late as the bakery was supposed to open at 8 am but did not open until 8:15 am. We got the char siu croissant, ube croissant, pistachio blackberry croissant, and ginger pull apart. The char sui croissant is more like a Danish but a good alternative for people who like savory pastries. The ube croissant was ok - although the interior was pretty, I thought the ube flavor was lacking. The pistachio blackberry croissant has a nice tartness from the blackberry filling. The ginger pull apart was very unique and delicious - I really like ginger flavored things so I enjoyed it (this is more like real ginger flavor and not gingerbread). I would get all the pastries again except the ube croissant. Overall, I enjoyed the pastries but I think B Patisserie and Arsicault are still my favorite bakeries.

reviews.author: Hilda Liu
reviews.text: We came here on a weekend afternoon. There was still plenty of bread inside! The server is friendly! Once you walk in, you will smell the sweetness of the bread and it is amazing. I got the ginger pull apart, the raspberry pistachios croissant, mushroom tart and the cream. They are all unique and good! Recommended!

reviews.author: Dharma M
reviews.text: Nice place to have unique croissants. We had mushroom croissants, charsiu croissants, and chocolate hazelnut twice baked croissants. All are yummy. You have to go early as by noon, most of the items are sold out. We got the last mushroom croissants.

reviews.author: Sia A.
reviews.text:
I love the food, no argument there. The only complaint is the service. Some of the cashiers are friendlier than the others. Also, there is no one fulfilling the orders, at least on the weekends. So, the cashier has to give you your order before getting to other people which makes a long wait. I would go back for the food, but not the vibe, unfortunately…

Update in July 2025:
Unfortunately, the unfriendliness issue still persists. Quite frankly, I walked out of there today pretty bummed. I talk very highly of this place and the quality of their pastries. I second guessed myself today. I suggested to one of the cashiers to post a picture of their pasty options online, and they said “you can just take a picture”. I just politely suggested it because as I told them, too, I didn’t want to hold the line while deciding what to get. It was very rude of them to not take it and maybe just pretend they were open to feedback. So this is the only place for me to write a feedback on their customer service. I don’t find myself as interested in their business as I used to be anymore and that’s a shame. Fortunately, there are plenty of bakeries around here with new ones opening all the time.

reviews.author: Khushboo Katara
reviews.text:
I did hear about the bakery from people and decided to go. And indeed it was worth it. I went at 11:30. There was a small queue.
I ordered strawberry matcha croissant and ginger pull apart (veg). Both of them were good. It was crispy and flavourful. They have various bread options.
Must try

testimonials: We stopped by Neighbor Bakehouse on a Sunday at 8 am. There was plenty of street parking available. As we were walking to get in line (3 parties in front of us), 2 employees rudely pushed past us on the sidewalk. It was clear they were late as the bakery was supposed to open at 8 am but did not open until 8:15 am. We got the char siu croissant, ube croissant, pistachio blackberry croissant, and ginger pull apart. The char sui croissant is more like a Danish but a good alternative for people who like savory pastries. The ube croissant was ok - although the interior was pretty, I thought the ube flavor was lacking. The pistachio blackberry croissant has a nice tartness from the blackberry filling. The ginger pull apart was very unique and delicious - I really like ginger flavored things so I enjoyed it (this is more like real ginger flavor and not gingerbread). I would get all the pastries again except the ube croissant. Overall, I enjoyed the pastries but I think B Patisserie and Arsicault are still my favorite bakeries.

We came here on a weekend afternoon. There was still plenty of bread inside! The server is friendly! Once you walk in, you will smell the sweetness of the bread and it is amazing. I got the ginger pull apart, the raspberry pistachios croissant, mushroom tart and the cream. They are all unique and good! Recommended!

Nice place to have unique croissants. We had mushroom croissants, charsiu croissants, and chocolate hazelnut twice baked croissants. All are yummy. You have to go early as by noon, most of the items are sold out. We got the last mushroom croissants.

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 397 Arguello Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Michael Guynn
reviews.text:
This is a capital B bakery, no frills, not a cafe, specializing in high quality French pastry. The line down the block does not lie.

They have a system, it moves fast. Once you're inside, you have your order in what feels like seconds.

The croissant base is the star of the show. You can have it plain, with chocolate, almond, sugar, cinnamon, or some combination thereof, whatever you choose. But you don't really need it. The pure buttery, flaky crust is perfection by itself.

Between the four of us we tried about half the menu, and there wasn't a bad bite to be had. Get whatever you fancy, and enjoy a pastry made with the care and technique it demands.

reviews.author: Maggie Hughes
reviews.text:
Absolutely loved Arsicault!!
Tried the almond croissant, kouign amann, morning bun, and the cranberry coconut scone (not pictured).
Everything was so delicious, definitely recommend trying a few different things!
There can be a wait to order, but it's all worth it!
If you are from out of town or new, definitely add it to your list of bakeries to visit!

reviews.author: Alex DeMartino
reviews.text: This little hole in the wall has the best croissants in San Francisco. We got a plain, chocolate, ham and cheese croissants, a morning bun and a kouigam-amann. All of them were delicious and my favorites were my wife's least favorites so they have something for everyone. Btw there will be a long line unless it is pouring down rain. My favorite was the kouigam it was like a crisp cronut with a slightly sweet glaze. Her favorite was the plain croissant, with the outside just falling off but the inside having a light and fluffy texture. The morning bun was both of our middle with its cinnamon sugar flavor and doughy texture, it has a strong lemon flavor so that's the one down side to our entire order. The chocolate was a good mix of flavors and texture with the chocolate not being too strong. The ham and cheese was a little bit of ham and cheese placed in the middle of a plain croissant.

reviews.author: RC
reviews.text:
Excellent pastries. Fluffy and light, but crispy on the outside. The almond filling was a sweet compliment to the puffy croissant. Definitely would come back again.

Though there maybe a long line, it moves rather quickly. They’re very efficient and quick.

reviews.author: James
reviews.text:
Phenomenal bakery that truly has some delicious croissants. While I think their regular croissants are a little plain, their chocolate croissants are insanely good and full of flavor.

They are all reasonably priced and while there might be a line outside the door, it's mainly because they only allow one party inside at one time. But at least you can enjoy the freshly baked good smell as you wait.

top_10.name: b. patisserie
top_10.address: 2821 California St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Alex DeMartino
reviews.text: We got the chocolate chip cookie, a banana almond croissant, chocolate kouign-amann, and a peach scone. The kouign-amann was like a mini croissant with a melted chocolate topping. The banana almond was like crossing banana bread and a croissant, the best part was the crispy edges, they were like crispy chocolate chip cookie pieces. The chocolate chip cookie was like a Panera cookie. The scone was ok but plain and had very little peach flavor.

reviews.author: Michelle L
reviews.text:
My first time here and everything was so beautifully made. I came here during Chinese New Years week, and so there were a lot of delicious Asian flavours like black sesame. They also had black sesame latter which had a lot of black sesame taste to it. Definitely get their kouign amann. It was very good. The puddings were not too sweet, velvety smooth and tasty.

Everything I got was great and delicious. I would definitely come back when I'm in the city.

reviews.author: egc
reviews.text: Spectacular! The cookie is one of the best I’ve had in my life. The raspberry almond croissant was perfectly balanced both in taste and texture. Everything was absolutely delicious.

reviews.author: John de Souza
reviews.text: Decadent, fresh, warm- food for the heart and soul. Take whatever is warm - it’ll be amazing. The Bostock was warm, soft, moist- just perfect. I really enjoyed the sesame latte as well. The line can be long but you’ll realize why and it moves quickly.

reviews.author: Vaishakhi Pilankar
reviews.text: Really good baked items! We ordered a croissant, chocolate and seasonal (passion fruit) kouign amann, and a pain suisse. All the items were fresh and good, but we especially liked the chocolate kouign amann and the pain suisse (which was a little on the sweeter side but went very well with the coffee). There was a bit of a line, but it moved quickly, and there was good enough seating. Their coffee was good too.

testimonials: We got the chocolate chip cookie, a banana almond croissant, chocolate kouign-amann, and a peach scone. The kouign-amann was like a mini croissant with a melted chocolate topping. The banana almond was like crossing banana bread and a croissant, the best part was the crispy edges, they were like crispy chocolate chip cookie pieces. The chocolate chip cookie was like a Panera cookie. The scone was ok but plain and had very little peach flavor.

Everything I got was great and delicious. I would definitely come back when I'm in the city.
Spectacular! The cookie is one of the best I’ve had in my life. The raspberry almond croissant was perfectly balanced both in taste and texture. Everything was absolutely delicious.

top_10.name: Arizmendi Bakery
top_10.address: 1331 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Alex DeMartino
reviews.text: We got the pumpkin muffins, the sourdough croissant, a pecan roll and a daily special pizza. The muffin was the only thing that was worth the wait in line. It was soft and sweet with little bits of sugar on top. The croissant had that bad sour chemical taste. The pecan roll had raises in it which threw off the taste and texture of what would have been a very tasty roll. The pizza was better than Costco but not more than double the price good.

reviews.author: Kristin Bass
reviews.text:
Arizmendi Bakery is a must-visit gem in San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood near Golden Gate Park. I highly recommend it for locals and tourists alike.

The sign outside brought me in. For those of you who've seen Inside Out, do you remember the scene about broccoli pizza? Arizmendi inspired it. I came in for the pizza by the slice, but left with more goodies from their extensive and delicious bakery shelves. The breadsticks in particular are not to be missed. As for the pizza, you can get a palm-sized hot slice for $3.50. That's an excellent value for something so tasty. It was enough for a light lunch, but I could have easily bought two without breaking the bank. There's a parklet outside and some other benches to sit and eat. Golden Gate Park is about a 10-15 minute walk away if you'd like another option for a great picnic.

Arizmendi is a worker-owned cooperative (co-op), which also makes them stand out. You see it in the care that the worker-owners take in their goods, and in the assistance the front-of-house staff offer their customers. I'm very happy to support this unique and important business model.

I can't wait to come back to Arizmendi Bakery the next time I'm on my way to the  Japanese Tea Garden, Botanical Garden, DeYoung Art Museum, the Cal Academy of Science, or anything else in the nearby area. Save a couple of broccoli slices for me 😋

reviews.author: Mat Lit
reviews.text:
I really like the corn cherry scones and bran muffins. Pizza is best when it’s very fresh, so eat there or get a half bake and warm it at home. The cookies are quite chewy—would prefer them slightly more tender but they are still fine. I also enjoyed a honey wheat bun here. Chocolate cake is decadent.

Bottom line is that this is a fine bakery that really knows how to put out good products.

reviews.author: Dan H
reviews.text: Went with my daughter, this place is fantastic. Wonderful baked goods. Got strawberry blackberry scones and bialys. So delicious with their coffee. And some chocolate cherry sourdough bread to take home. The atmosphere is really nice too, very friendly, non commercial coop. Like hanging out with your next door neighbors❤️

reviews.author: Guillermo
reviews.text: Great local bakery, line moves fast. They have  awesome pizza slices. Great little affordable lunch place if you are visiting.

testimonials: We got the pumpkin muffins, the sourdough croissant, a pecan roll and a daily special pizza. The muffin was the only thing that was worth the wait in line. It was soft and sweet with little bits of sugar on top. The croissant had that bad sour chemical taste. top_10.name: Cinderella Bakery & Cafe
top_10.address: 436 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Fatima Saldivar
reviews.text:
I've been wanting to visit this place for a long time, and finally, last Saturday, I had the chance to have lunch there. I will return every time I get the opportunity. It has a reputation for a reason: delicious, simple food, a wide selection, reasonable prices, fast service, and the food tastes simply amazing. Everything I tried was fantastic!

The only thing I wish for is a bigger place, but I suppose that's something we all want to. I just want more stomach and time to try every dish on their menu! If you haven't visited this place yet, don't hesitate. I do not doubt that every item on their menu is worth trying and tastes delicious.

reviews.author: Maryna Stupak
reviews.text:
My husband and I came to San Francisco today from Sacramento and chose Cinderella Bakery & Café for lunch. We ordered borscht and fried dumplings — everything was delicious and very home-style! Authentic Ukrainian food that brought back warm memories. We especially loved that there’s a wide variety of baked goods, pastries, and Ukrainian dishes and drinks.

The staff was friendly and attentive. We enjoyed the outdoor seating area with covered benches — cozy and surprisingly dust-free even though it’s near the road. Portions are generous — you’ll definitely leave full.

The only downside was that the tables were a bit sticky and the interior felt a bit dated — though that kind of added to the nostalgic charm. If you’re craving real Ukrainian food, I definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: Small bakery and cafe spot. Their borscht seems to be one of the most popular dishes, as I have seem quite a few people eating it anytime I come by to grab an Eclair. Which, by the way, are great! Hard to find a decent eclair in SF, and this place definitely scratches that itch! All sitting is in the outside, so if its a windy or rainy day, you might want to consider take out.

reviews.author: Tuya Bliss
reviews.text: It's one of my must-visit destinations for soulful food when I have guests from Mongolia.  My sister can't handle any spicy food. The Cinderella bakery got everything we wanted. Hot dumpling soup with plenty of dumplings shared by 3, borsch, beef piroshki, blinchiki, all came in quite fast. We were so hungry so I've got hot tea, cappuccino, and yummy pastries to eat while waiting for but didn't get a chance to eat them, kkk. Great food if you like European style, the waitresses are so beautiful, efficient, and quick to serve!

reviews.author: Kevin Wong
reviews.text: Very Friendly service and the food was good. But I probably wouldn't get the salmon pie again the piroski was better. Nice home cooked meal but im not sure if its something I'd get again when I come back to San francisco

testimonials:

top_10.name: Schubert's Bakery
top_10.address: 521 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Brita Spano Villanueva
reviews.text: I ordered the strawberry shortcake for my daughters 2nd birthday and was delighted to pick up this beautifully decorated cake. She was so excited when we presented her cake and she loved the bee, lady bug, and butterfly decorations, which were an extra special touch added by the bakery! The cake was delicious with a soft cake, fresh strawberries, and a subtly sweet whipped cream. Thank you Schubert's for helping make my daughters birthday special!

reviews.author: Vivian Anne
reviews.text: We stopped by Schubert's on a whim and tried their pretzel croissant and custard croissant. The croissants were ok. However, we saw a lot of locals coming in to pick up cakes so I wonder if they are more known for their cakes. They had the cakes in a variety of different sizes. I would have tried a Princess Cake but they didn't have that as an individual serving.

reviews.author: Sophia Robinson
reviews.text:
Such a delightful Customer Service experience and incredible cake! I stopped by last minute on a Saturday to get a cake for my friend’s birthday. Not only did they have an incredible selection of truly artisan cakes but it tasted incredible!
She loved the princess cake so much she thanked me again the next day🥰 will definitely be ordering from here again!

reviews.author: Mirco Lost
reviews.text: This review is for the princess cake only: it’s absolutely pathetic.  They use fake cool whip or equivalent and not whipped cream, the sponge cake is tasteless, kirsch nowhere to be found, and the marzipan is not made in house.  Not sure what the positive reviews are about but clearly people are either lying or ignorant.  Go to Tartine instead and have a real treat.

reviews.author: Аlisa Paludeti
reviews.text: I was looking forward to visiting this famous bakery in Richmond, the number of positive reviews for Shubert is really impressive. But unfortunately, after trying their pastries, I was rather disappointed. Being a European myself, I have tried many traditional cakes and pastries in different countries, which gives me an understanding of the balance of their tastes and textures. From what I tried, the raspberry mousse cake only looked good, but the biscuit and mousse (not even similar to raspberry) were separate components that did not interact with each other. Puff pastry with cream was just sweet and very fatty, I think it would not hurt a little vanilla and some sour note. Also, this bakery lacks coffee and a place to sit and taste their goods, fully grab and go spot. Overall it’s unlikely that I’ll give them another try.

She loved the princess cake so much she thanked me again the next day🥰 will definitely be ordering from here again!

top_10.name: Arizmendi Bakery
top_10.address: 1268 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Sanyukta Agarwal
reviews.text: Randomly discovered while walking on Valencia, a great place with quality pizza slices with unique topping combos. A lot of bakery items ran out by 4pm so I would recommend going in earlier. Great staff also.

reviews.author: Jamie Ginsberg
reviews.text: First time at the SF Arizmendi, as a vegan I passed over classics like the cheese roll, and the corn muffins in the photo which looked amazing. I grabbed 2 warm English muffins, resisting the temptation to eat one immediately, and a tomato round, which I took multiple bites of while in line. Why? Because the tomatoes were still warm and each bite was a choreographed dance between the crust, middle, and sweet juicy tomatoes. Yes, in the future I will warm this up before indulging!!! Amazing worker owned cooperative bakery, step inside the double doors and get something delicious.

reviews.author: Arthur Glauberman
reviews.text: We first discovered Arizmendi’s in Oakland and couldn’t believe our good fortune when we were walking to a clothing store on Valencia when we were impressed by the long line waiting to buy their breads, muffins, cookies and outstanding pizzas! Margo was so enthusiast about the bakery that I couldn’t help but keep buying more of their delicious treats!

reviews.author: B
reviews.text: Quality bakery with a diverse selection of goodies. I enjoyed the strawberry scone and jalapeño bread sticks. Delicious mint chocolate cookie for $3

reviews.author: Michael H
reviews.text: Wonderful bakery with fantastic pizza and sweet options. The pecan twist is so good and the pizza is incredible. Great spot.

testimonials: Randomly discovered while walking on Valencia, a great place with quality pizza slices with unique topping combos. A lot of bakery items ran out by 4pm so I would recommend going in earlier. Great staff also.

Margo was so enthusiast about the bakery that I couldn’t help but keep buying more of their delicious treats!

top_10.name: Butter&
top_10.address: 690 Indiana St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Sneha Sunder
reviews.text: Best cake ever. We order from butter& all the time. It has sort of become our tradition these past two years. The roast berries and sweet cream is so so good! The gluten free one version is very good too. I can attest that their black sesame and red bean and the sweet cream and roasted berries are simply the best (the photos don't do justice to how good the cake is). Take my word for it.

reviews.author: Mikayla Kurland
reviews.text: This is my absolute favorite bakery in the bay area and the only one I will order celebratory cakes from. Their cakes have graced many, many family events both large and small. They are consistently of the highest standard, both incredibly delicious and beautiful. Their gluten free cake tastes just as good as their regular. I also have nothing but praise for the team, and with the myriad of orders and deliveries I've received there has never been one issue.

reviews.author: Melissa Le Man Business
reviews.text: We are so thrilled with our wedding cake from Butter& … a lot of research went into finding a cake that was healthier than your traditional wedding cakes, customizable and represented our timeless wedding theme. Butter& exceeded our expectations - our cake was so fresh, divinely tasting and we couldn’t be happier. We ordered a mini cake as it was a small intimate wedding with family - and it was the perfect size. The house-made compote of pureed strawberries was amazing!!! wow wow wow! It did not disappoint. Highly recommend especially if you are looking for a healthier option that packs all the yummy flavor

reviews.author: Rachael Wade
reviews.text: I’ve ordered from Butter& for years and have been a happy customer! I love their beautiful shop, but even before that, online ordering, pickup, communication, and customer service have always been efficient and easy. The icing on the cake (pun intended ;) is the yummy cakes and beautiful decoration. Our family likes to try new flavors from time to time, and they’re always good. You won’t be disappointed. Thanks, Butter& family.

reviews.author: Chia Chang
reviews.text: Tried the lemon and pistachio & rose flavors. Both were soooo good!!! I like how both flavors are mild yet still very rich (not sure if that make sense tho). I personally enjoyed the pistachio & rose one more. I like the subtle rose aroma aftertaste. Note that the cake should be eaten at room temperature. The texture will be kinda like a more moist pound cake. Tbh the flavors weren’t particularly surprising, but the texture of the cake and cream was incredible, and I don’t think I’ve had anything quite like it before.

The gluten free one version is very good too. I can attest that their black sesame and red bean and the sweet cream and roasted berries are simply the best (the photos don't do justice to how good the cake is). Take my word for it.

top_10.name: Jane The Bakery
top_10.address: 1881 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Maria
reviews.text:
Loved the vegan banana bread which was also gluten-free. In my opinion it could’ve had some chocolate chip or walnuts in it as well to add a bit more variety but it was delicious nonetheless! They also had a chocolate chip cookie, a snickerdoodle and a muffin which were vegan and
gluten-free. I’ll be back to try the other options for sure

reviews.author: Ozge Ustundag
reviews.text: We were four people sharing different kinds of croissants — plain, chocolate, pain au raisin, and almond. My personal favorite was definitely the pain au raisin. We also had the prosciutto & burrata sandwich, which was amazing. The salad sandwich was packed with fresh ingredients, but the bread was a bit soggy and too soft, which took away from the overall experience. There was a long line and unfortunately no seating available, so we ended up eating in the park across the street. It would have been lovely to enjoy our coffee in ceramic cups instead of paper, if only there had been a place to sit. Still, everything tasted great and the quality was high.

reviews.author: Ben M
reviews.text:
The best coffee I’ve had in San Francisco all month – hands down. Made on a La Marzocco machine, it’s smooth, rich, and absolutely worth stopping for. The oat cookie we tried? Unreal. Perfectly balanced, not too sweet, and just the right amount of chewy.

The service was just as good as the coffee, with a super friendly and welcoming staff who made the experience even better. If you’re a coffee lover or just craving something delicious, this place is a must-visit.

reviews.author: Audrey W
reviews.text: Good variety but could have a better atmosphere? Got the cinnamon twist and it was quite dense. Plain croissant was better but not the best ever.

reviews.author: Taryn Conroy
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of working with Emma from Jane to organize breakfasts for 3 weeks of onsite events for groups ranging from 300- 150 people. The experience was fantastic from start to finish. Emma curated a diverse menu that included options for all dietary needs within our budget, ensured timely delivery, and assisted with the setup, making the entire process seamless. Everyone loved the food, and there was a tasty option for everyone! It was a delight to introduce our team to this local favorite. I can’t thank Emma and the Jane team enough—the food and service were truly outstanding.

testimonials:
Loved the vegan banana bread which was also gluten-free. In my opinion it could’ve had some chocolate chip or walnuts in it as well to add a bit more variety but it was delicious nonetheless! They also had a chocolate chip cookie, a snickerdoodle and a muffin which were vegan and
gluten-free. I’ll be back to try the other options for sure

We were four people sharing different kinds of croissants — plain, chocolate, pain au raisin, and almond. My personal favorite was definitely the pain au raisin. We also had the prosciutto & burrata sandwich, which was amazing. The salad sandwich was packed with fresh ingredients, but the bread was a bit soggy and too soft, which took away from the overall experience. There was a long line and unfortunately no seating available, so we ended up eating in the park across the street. It would have been lovely to enjoy our coffee in ceramic cups instead of paper, if only there had been a place to sit. Still, everything tasted great and the quality was high.

The best coffee I’ve had in San Francisco all month – hands down. Made on a La Marzocco machine, it’s smooth, rich, and absolutely worth stopping for. The oat cookie we tried? Unreal. Perfectly balanced, not too sweet, and just the right amount of chewy.

The service was just as good as the coffee, with a super friendly and welcoming staff who made the experience even better. If you’re a coffee lover or just craving something delicious, this place is a must-visit.

top_10.name: Lapisara Eatery
top_10.address: 698 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Adrian R Logan
reviews.text: While we were in the city, we decided to stop by Lapisara Eatery for a nice brunch and it ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. This cozy little corner spot has a chill vibe, street views, and a solid brunch menu. The food came out quick, looked amazing, and tasted just as good. I had the best Belgian waffles I’ve ever had crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy inside. They also had a great selection of lattes and a decent drink menu, which made the whole experience even better. Everything tasted fresh, the service was smooth, and the atmosphere was calm and relaxing. If you're visiting San Francisco and want a brunch spot that really hits the mark, this is one you definitely need to check out.

reviews.author: Felecia Young
reviews.text: Ooh la la! Great discovery! It wasn't too busy, which makes me wonder if people are just missing out. It wasn't the weekend but with it being summer I would think there would be a lot of tourists here. The food was delish and the service was very pleasant! The drinks were very interesting, and the taste was impressive. The chicken and waffles, while not spicy or over seasoned were very good. And crispy outside and juicy inside. It wasn't on the bone but had plenty of flavor. Chicken eggs Benedict, awesome! While a bit on the higher end, worth the splurge for one day for breakfast. The pictures do this place justice!!

reviews.author: Charles S
reviews.text: Pleasant restaurant with their fried chicken being my favorite. The waffles were soft for my liking. I prefer crisp to my waffle. The dunginess crab benedict plate was solid. The potato combination and salad were great compliments to the benedict. The benedict itself was better with the potatoes too add savoriness to the meal. The matcha latte topped with whipped cream and an matcha ice formed bear, salted caramel Irish cream, and espresso macchiato were all recommendable. The service is okay. If I were to recommend a must try, it would be a plate to your liking with fried chicken. The selling point is the amazing fried chicken.

reviews.author: missashley
reviews.text: Great place to come for brunch for Thai fusion food. It you are ok with crowds you would love it. If you don’t like being around lots of people maybe dinner service is better for you. We came for Mother’s Day and had reservations at 12:45 but didn’t get seated until 1:15. That was very irritating because what’s the point of reservations. However once we got seated everything moved really quick. Our waiter was great and recommended a lot of good stuff. We enjoyed so much we went back for take out for dinner before heading back to Oakland. I had the chili bomb omelette and it was good, not spicy and the mixed Berry lemonade was 100% the best! Looking forward to coming back to try new things

reviews.author: Asher Williamson
reviews.text: The panang omelet is so good. I really enjoyed the tie twist on the omelette. The sweet and spicy beef was delectable. The potatoes were soft but seasoned well. I'm not usually a salad but the peanut sauce from the omelette was complementary. Soo good. And if you want the cutest little bear and see him hide his eyes as he sinks into your drink, get the iced latte. I weirdly found it satisfying to see him sink to the icey misfortune.🙈 8.9/10

top_10.name: Heist Restaurant
top_10.address: 678 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Ella Cox
reviews.text: The breakfast at Heist’s is absolutely incredible!! The food here is high quality, fresh, and packed with flavour. Furthermore, the staff who work at this place are very attentive and friendly, they truly care about their customers here 😃🙌  This little restaurant/cafe is very minimalistic, sleek, and has a very cozy, “down-to-earth” vibe. If you are looking for a restaurant in the theatre district that is in a safe area, that is clean with not a lot of homelessness, you will absolutely love this place!

reviews.author: Juan P
reviews.text: Wonderful breakfast spot - the server treated us very well, and the food was fantastic (I got like this veggie burrito). Honestly would return - it’s pricey but absolutely worth it. Great way to have a “late breakfast” packed with flavor, not oily and not too salty (which happens a lot with these breakfast places). Plus there is quite a bit of seating inside and a few chairs outside. Also exceptionally clean bathroom, which is always a plus

reviews.author: Danielle
reviews.text: We visited here on our trip to San Fran. My gf ordered the heist & I ordered the gluten free pancakes. Great gf pancakes. The berry topping was a nice complement. Lattes were yummy & aesthetically pleasing - we had the nutella latte & the ube latte. I’m not sure how they make the eggs but they were seasoned so well & were beyond your usual scrambled eggs. The restaurant itself is okay, a little bland. Servers were attentive. Great for solo dining or 2 people- wouldn’t recommend a large party because the space is quite small. I would eat here again.

reviews.author: Tommy Nguyen
reviews.text: I had a delightful breakfast experience. The scrambled eggs were perfectly fluffy and seasoned, while the granola bowl offered a satisfying crunch with fresh fruits and creamy yogurt. The restaurant’s cozy atmosphere and friendly staff made for an inviting dining experience. Heist is known for its breakfast and brunch offerings, including popular items like breakfast burritos, French toast, and pancakes.  They also cater to various dietary preferences, offering vegan and gluten-free options.  I highly recommend Heist Restaurant for a delicious and enjoyable meal in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Mr. “Your Personal Satan” Foss
reviews.text:
This is not a cheap breakfast. On the other hand you're getting exactly what you pay for. Every bite of this meal was absolutely scrumptious.

I am so full.

Let's see... The scrambled eggs with cheese was probably the best scrambled eggs I've had in a month of Sundays or longer.

I want to build a raft out of the bacon and sail across to Hawaii as I eat pieces of the bacon boat. Seriously solid planks of bacon were probably the most flavorful bacon I've had in my life. Just to die for bacon.

The pancake was wonderful the fried potatoes were perfectly fried and warm all the way through.

Service was top-notch. This place gets packed so get there early. Very much recommended as a special treat or if you're visiting the city.

testimonials: The breakfast at Heist’s is absolutely incredible!! The food here is high quality, fresh, and packed with flavour. Furthermore, the staff who work at this place are very attentive and friendly, they truly care about their customers here 😃🙌  This little restaurant/cafe is very minimalistic, sleek, and has a very cozy, “down-to-earth” vibe. top_10.name: Sweet Maple
top_10.address: 2101 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Lailian Park
reviews.text:
The food and atmosphere was amazing here! Try their SMSF pancakes,which are thin and soft with maple syrup, we added the berries topping with extra 5 dollars, it was worth it!!
Well roasted coffee with sweet pancakes were perfect match!
It’s my second time visiting SF, can’t believe I found such a cute brunch cafe.
I kept asking for my coffee to be refilled, and we’ve waited for the server to ask for the check,however I understood it was a busy restaurant
The only thing surprised and confused, they take 6%of your purchase for employees benefits fee 🙏

reviews.author: Asher Williamson
reviews.text: I've been to both the sweet maple in South Bay and the one in the city here. I will say that sweet maple takes an interesting approach to fusing asian cuisine with American plus some random Mexican influence. I will say that the ramen dish is delicious, however it does kinda look like a cup of noodles just was spilled on a plate. It has great flavors but from my Korean uncle said it was authentic enough. I would agree it could be more fuzed. I got the simple breakfast with million dollar bacon. I would say it was a good breakfast but nothing to write home about. It lacked seasoning, the toast was perfectly toasted, and the egg was cooked to perfection. They just need the zing to push them over to 5 stars. They used to have this sizzling dish. This would have pushed it over but unfortunately they got rid of it. I tried some of the skillet and the egg inside was salty, watery, and bubbly. Somehow this worked and tasted super lightweight. I'll have to get that the next time. 8.3/10 Pro Tip: the line goes hella fast so don't get intimidated by the lines.

reviews.author: Esther Lee
reviews.text: This was such a fun and unique brunch experience I had in SF! I went here after my brother's graduation ceremony and my family had the best time. The staff were very welcoming here and also note that the entire group needs to be present to be seated. This place seemed like a local favorite and the millionaire's bacon sounded interesting to me so I got to try it and it was SO good! The millionaire's bacon is what really stood out to me from this restaurant. I love how they consider the aesthetic of the food plating but the flavors of each dish is all amazing too. The staff constantly tended to our tables to refill our water & even though it was on the pricier end, I am so grateful that we celebrated my brother at Sweet Maple!

reviews.author: Valeria Martinez
reviews.text: BEST bacon I’ve ever had! PERIOD! The sweet and spicy flavor blowed my mind! We also ordered the Benedict eggs and they were amazing too! Great service and great food, definitely would come back :)

reviews.author: Bay Area Reviewer
reviews.text: What an amazing experience I had here from start to finish.  Arrived early on a Saturday and was seated with little wait time.  Placed order and the food came out super fast and everything was delicious.  The hostess was super friendly and kept the mamosas coming 😬.  Try the millionaires bacon sampler platter each strip is next level delicious.   I recommend the breakfast pizza 🍕,  definitely a top 10 on my list.  If in the area check this place out.  💥

top_10.name: Wooden Spoon
top_10.address: 2172 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anish Thakkar (Doc Thakkar)
reviews.text:
I have to give this place its roses. If you time it right (outside of the rush), you can come in without waiting, but people DEFINITELY know about this iconic brunch spot.

Key features:
-Fresh squeezed orange juice
-Big Breakfast platters (Loved the Big Spoon at $25)
-Crispy, tasty bacon
-Cocktails & Coffee (Espresso Martini slaps)

I also enjoyed the Original Pattern Hazy IPA on tap! Fresh ingredients and customizable breakfast plates for picky eaters and/or dining restrictions. 100% recommend!

reviews.author: Eva Li
reviews.text: The food was great. The fried chicken is so yummy. The smoked salmon soft scramble egg is nicely cooked. We were lucky that we got seated at the bar right away. There usually is a wait. Will definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Lilian Mar
reviews.text:
Nestled on the edge of the Castro and Mission, Wooden Spoon is a charming brunch spot perfect for catching up with a friend—no reservations, just walk in!

I ordered The Spoon Cobb, a light, healthy salad that doesn’t skimp on flavor—fresh greens, generous bacon bites, chicken, creamy avocado, and just enough cheese to keep things interesting. But the real conversation starter? Three egg halves. That’s 1.5 eggs. Not sure if it’s supposed to be one or two, but honestly, I kind of loved the ambiguity. It adds a little intrigue and I appreciate the extra protein.

reviews.author: missashley
reviews.text: Find this gem while in the city when I searched best brunch in SF. This place doesn’t take reservations so please expect to wait especially on a Saturday. Our party was of 6 and we waited about 30mins not too bad but when you’re hangry it’s long lol. The place looks small but it’s pretty big in the inside. Our waiter was great and the food came out pretty fast. The nada colada was so good and the lemonade spitrz. I could have had two more spitrz. For food I ordered the curried chicken salad sandwich and it was so GOOD! I was a little hesitant but definitely worth it. The potatoes were also so good with the dipping sauce and the wooden spoon salad was good just needed more dressing. My party ordered the short rib hash and the blt and the fried chicken sandwich. We loved everything. Can’t wait to go here again.

reviews.author: Anna Oh
reviews.text:
Split the hang fry and french toast with a friend. The portions are great! Service was amazing.

Came in at 11am on Sunday and waited just a little bit before we sat down.
