top_10.name: Sisterita
top_10.address: 669 Commercial St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Avinash Khemlani
reviews.text:
5 Stars – Sisterita is a Hidden Gem!

We wish we had discovered Sisterita earlier on in our San Francisco stay — it ended up being one of the best breakfasts of our trip!

The Escape from Alcatraz (their take on scrambled eggs, omelette-style) was hands down the best I’ve ever had. Perfect texture, bold flavor, and thoughtfully prepared.

We also ordered the Voila French Toast Brioche, and it was beyond amazing — airy, flavorful, and visually stunning. Every bite felt like a treat.

Service was kind, the atmosphere was charming, and the food, unforgettable. We’ll absolutely return. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Monalisa Ramsaran
reviews.text:
Sisterita is flat out my top favorite restaurant in the Bay area. Outstanding flavors, gorgeous space, delicious menu, sweetest staff. We are foodies and our bar is set very high. Sisterita was so outstanding and flavorful, we raved about it all weekend. Whatever you are doing over there, continue forever please. You hold a special place in my heart!!

Grilled Prawn Tacos - bursting with flavor!!!
Crispy Chicken Fried Rice - outstanding
French Onion Soup - packed with depth & flavor
French Fries

reviews.author: Nichelle Toma
reviews.text: The interior is really cute and cozy. I had a Bloody Mary and my boyfriend had a passion fruit mimosa - both were very good. He had the royale eggs Benedict and I had the grilled cheese and French onion soup - again, both were very good. The French onion soup was my favorite. The service was quick and friendly. The location is on a small street and parking can be tough. But I would definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Liz Best
reviews.text:
A Little Slice of French Brunch Heaven – Sisterita

If you’re on the hunt for the perfect brunch spot, look no further than Sisterita. This charming gem blends French vibes with warm hospitality, making it the kind of place you’ll want to keep coming back to.

The decor is thoughtfully done—stylish, cozy, and full of lovely little details that make the whole experience feel special from the moment you walk in. April, the owner, is an absolute delight, and you can really feel her passion in every corner of the place. The staff is friendly and welcoming, which just adds to the feel-good vibe.

Now, let’s talk about the food—absolutely delicious! Do yourself a favor and order the Florentine Benny. The eggs are perfectly poached, the hollandaise is rich and flavorful, and the homemade potatoes on the side? Out of this world. Everything on the plate was bursting with flavor.

And don’t skip the drinks—the mango mimosa is refreshing, perfectly balanced, and totally hits the spot.

Whether you're catching up with friends or just treating yourself to a delightful brunch, Sisterita is a must-visit in San Francisco. Great food, great atmosphere, and great people.

reviews.author: Elena Skurat
reviews.text:
Came here for brunch with a friend and was seriously impressed. I ordered the Alcatraz Escape omelet — probably the most delicious omelet I’ve ever had! Slightly spicy, with a Tom Yum-like flavor and perfectly cooked shrimp — such a fun Asian twist. The place has a great vibe and cool interior. It was a bit noisy, but honestly, for a lively brunch it worked.
Can’t wait to come back and try more — highly recommend!

The location is on a small street and parking can be tough. But I would definitely visit again.

top_10.name: Zazie
top_10.address: 941 Cole St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: FollowMe Moments
reviews.text:
Loved this place, feels like I'm in France every time. We enjoyed the special pancakes. Today's special pancakes where called the Miracle Pancakes (made with sour cream and poppy seeds). So good! The Crab Eggs Benedict had a good portion of fresh crab. Cannes scrambled eggs were flavorful. The Chicken apple sausage are delicious.

Seating in the back patio. They have overhead heaters to keep you warm on a chilly day.

Service was outstanding!!!

I would recommend a reservation  on the weekend.

reviews.author: Dionna Smith
reviews.text:
Zazie is hands down one of our Top 5 favorite restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, and every visit reminds me exactly why.

As someone who’s a big, big meat eater, I rarely go for a meatless option—but the lemon ricotta ravioli here is in a league of its own. Bright, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it’s one of the very few vegetarian dishes that leaves me totally satisfied without even thinking about meat. That says a lot.

Of course, when I do indulge my carnivorous side, the pork chop is absolutely divine—so tender it practically falls apart, and paired with buttery potatoes and the dreamiest mac and cheese. Rich, hearty, comforting. It’s the kind of dish you crave long after the meal is over.

The escargot deserves a special shoutout—it instantly transports me back to Paris. Delicately prepared, garlicky, and served with that unmistakable French flair. It’s the real deal.

And please, whatever you do, don’t skip dessert. The Chaud is an experience. Warm, gooey chocolate topped with toasted marshmallows—it’s like being wrapped in a hug that somehow takes you straight to Brussels. Yum, yum, YUM!

Zazie isn’t just a meal—it’s a mood, a memory, and a masterpiece every time. Whether you’re a die-hard meat lover or looking for something refined and soulful, this place delivers.

reviews.author: Max Kay
reviews.text:
American cafe with good variety of brunch options.
Good fresh delicious food with veggie options. Not typical American portion.
Service is a bit slow but responsive. It's quiet but vibrant atmosphere. Good for couple, meetup and small gathering.
Hard to find parking but possible in around streets.
Indoor setting, limited outdoor setting but nice cozy patio in the end of cafe.
Not accessible for tight inside and steps to patio.

reviews.author: Kay Shin
reviews.text: Great Brunch and lovely atmosphere. You will need to wait for half an hour depending on what time of the day you go. The Portion is quite generous. I ordered only one pancake, but it was good for two to share as it is quite thick. There is no tip, but the price is slightly on a higher side. Good quality brunch. I really liked the salsa in the egg Benedict and the home fry was very good with well roasted sweet garlics.

reviews.author: Jennifer Johns
reviews.text: I love the atmosphere here, especially the enclosed patio. It is surrounded entirely by wood slats and a full ceiling with powerful heaters. They have dog night on the patio every Monday evening. The food is outstanding and with tips included in the pricing it makes the bill very simple. The Salmon Risotto, Burger and Pork Chop were all extremely well executed. Rich sauces, simply dressed salads and a freshly baked warm roll add the French flare to what otherwise would just be yummy food.

Bright, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it’s one of the very few vegetarian dishes that leaves me totally satisfied without even thinking about meat. That says a lot.

Of course, when I do indulge my carnivorous side, the pork chop is absolutely divine—so tender it practically falls apart, and paired with buttery potatoes and the dreamiest mac and cheese. Rich, hearty, comforting. It’s the kind of dish you crave long after the meal is over.

The escargot deserves a special shoutout—it instantly transports me back to Paris. Delicately prepared, garlicky, and served with that unmistakable French flair. It’s the real deal.

And please, whatever you do, don’t skip dessert. The Chaud is an experience. Warm, gooey chocolate topped with toasted marshmallows—it’s like being wrapped in a hug that somehow takes you straight to Brussels. Yum, yum, YUM!

Zazie isn’t just a meal—it’s a mood, a memory, and a masterpiece every time. Whether you’re a die-hard meat lover or looking for something refined and soulful, this place delivers.

American cafe with good variety of brunch options.
Good fresh delicious food with veggie options. Not typical American portion.
Service is a bit slow but responsive. It's quiet but vibrant atmosphere. Good for couple, meetup and small gathering.
Hard to find parking but possible in around streets.
Indoor setting, limited outdoor setting but nice cozy patio in the end of cafe.
Not accessible for tight inside and steps to patio.

top_10.name: Eight AM Brunch
top_10.address: 1323 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Paulina
reviews.text: Breakfast at EightAM Brunch was a great experience. We had the pancakes and the avocado toast – both were delicious. The avocado toast, in particular, was very generous in size and really satisfying. The dishes were fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The menu offers a nice variety, and the cozy, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for a relaxed start to the day. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in the area!

reviews.author: Global Explorer
reviews.text: This is simply an amazing place.  For the quality, quantity, and outstanding service it is worth every penny!  Real coffee and even green tea latte! Freshly squeezed juice!  Food prepared just the way you order and served hot.  We enjoyed and will return!  A true gem!

reviews.author: Michelle Stantial
reviews.text: We loved our breakfast here. The menu has many choices and we were lucky enough to snag a table next to the window, so the atmosphere/view was enhanced. This place is very crowded- for a good reason. We had to wait about 20 minutes, but it was worth it. The staff was attentive (many coffee refills) and the food came quickly. I had the strawberry crepe and my son had some sort of stuffed croissant. Both went quickly! It was a quick walk from the Argonaut (where I plan to stay on all my trips) so I will return on my next trip.

reviews.author: Tanmay Desai
reviews.text:
Went to Eight AM for brunch based on their exceptional reviews (4.6 at the time), and honestly… it felt pretty overrated. The overall vibe was chill and the staff was friendly, but the food didn’t live up to the hype — very mediocre and definitely overpriced in my opinion.

We ordered the Egg Frittata, Nutella Crepes, Waffle, and the Avocado Toast Sampler. The frittata came with house fries and fruit, and while it was decent, it didn’t feel like it was worth $22. The avocado toast sampler was especially disappointing — $30 for what was basically plain avocado spread on toast, topped with tomato, mozzarella, and a balsamic drizzle. It had almost no flavor, and definitely didn’t justify the price tag.

The latte was just okay — nothing special — and same goes for the crepes and waffles. Not bad, but nothing memorable either.

One annoying surprise: they automatically added a 20% gratuity, which they claim is for parties over 4 — that’s fine, but it really should be clearly mentioned somewhere on the menu or told upfront. I always tip anyway, but it’s the lack of transparency that was frustrating.

Overall, it’s a cute spot with a relaxed atmosphere, but the food was underwhelming and overpriced. Giving 3 stars because it wasn’t bad, just really average and not worth the hype or cost. Wouldn’t go out of my way to return.

reviews.author: Bryan Wing
reviews.text: Unfortunately we found this place on our last day of our visit to San Francisco. It’s right around the corner from the Argonaut Hotel where we stayed. Although we found several great dinners for breakfast during our stay I have to say without a doubt this was my favorite. The food and people were excellent however, the fruit was so amazing from the presentation to the taste. They were very busy for a Monday morning, there was a wait to be seated. That’s always a good sign so we ate outside since the sun was out, it wasn’t too bad. If they’re too busy they own the dinner a few doors down so you could try that one. I noticed several employees at each location so I had to ask. They said they were a little different, one has a license to serve alcohol is the main difference. Great job, love to support small local family businesses as we are small businesses owners back in Ohio. Thanks again

The avocado toast, in particular, was very generous in size and really satisfying. The dishes were fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The menu offers a nice variety, and the cozy, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for a relaxed start to the day. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in the area!

top_10.name: Brenda's Meat & Three
top_10.address: 919 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Tania Weatherington
reviews.text:
All of the stars aligned when our group of 9 were able to grab dinner at Brenda’s (despite not having a reservation)!! We initially resigned on having to do takeaway - but magically all the seating at the bar opened up (this was also within the last hour of opening)!!

The food was absolutely delicious, generously portioned, and clearly made with a lot of love and care. My sister in law absolutely LOVED the Low Country Gumbo, my husband loved the meatloaf and cheesy grits, and I really loved the Our Burger, the fried chicken which was well seasoned and crispy to perfection!!!

As one would hope, the sides had us full of lots of ummms and aaaaaaas - and you would be remiss if you visit and don’t try the mac and cheese & collard greens!

All of their team were super friendly, and answered all our questions. The restaurant has a super cozy and trendy vibe, and I would say this is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic soul food done right!!

reviews.author: Jordan Stephens-Moseley
reviews.text: Immediately when I walked in, I felt a warm welcome. I came solo so I sat at the dining counter which is the best seat ion the house. Everyone worked well together and my food and drinks were prepared quickly. I had the fried catfish, green salad, fries, and red beans & rice and I cleaned my plate. I also indulged in a wild berry and mango mimosa and let me just say I love their proportions for the price. Will definitely be coming back to eat more items from their menu.

reviews.author: Winston Dy
reviews.text: Went to this location for the first time after trying the original location near the tenderloin. Tried the $5 Messy mess chicken sandwich. Also had the crawfish beignets and one ube beignets. The sandwich was ridiculously delicious! The chicken was so flavorful and the flavor penetrated the meat deep inside. I wish I bought two because I was sharing. The crawfish beignets were just as good as the first location. So meaty and full of crawfish. The ube beignet is still my favorite and my biggest recommendation! The service was friendly and fast. Location was so clean!

reviews.author: Damion Wright
reviews.text:
Brenda’s Meat & Three – SF Soul Food with Some Hits and Misses

Stopped by Brenda’s Meat & Three on a Friday night around 7pm, and honestly, the experience was a bit of a mixed bag.

Let’s start with the food:

Gumbo: Meh. It looked promising, but the flavor didn’t quite show up to the party. Just kinda... there.

Mac & Cheese: I really wanted to love it, but it just didn’t deliver. Ended up leaving most of it behind.

Fried Okra: Now this was the MVP of the night. Perfect crunch, great seasoning, full of flavor. If you go, don’t skip it.

Fried Chicken: Solid. Really solid. Not a mind-blowing 5-star moment, but a strong 4+—well-seasoned, juicy, and served hot.

Rum Punch: Hard pass. Didn’t enjoy it at all—wouldn’t be mad if they quietly took it off the menu.

Service: A+
The staff was wonderful—warm, welcoming, and helpful. Honestly, they made the experience feel a lot better.

Atmosphere? Eh...
I wanted to vibe with it, but it just didn’t click. Maybe it was an off night, but the energy felt kind of flat for a Friday evening.

Final take:
There are definitely some gems on the menu (hello, fried okra!), and the service is top-notch, but it wasn’t a slam dunk overall. Worth checking out—just go in with balanced expectations and maybe skip the rum punch.

3.5/5

reviews.author: Michelle Grunberg
reviews.text: Will definitely be returning! Ordered all vegan items - the po’ boy, garlic spinach, and okra. Delicious. We also really liked the ambiance and the service.

Location was so clean!

top_10.name: Lokma
top_10.address: 1801 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Nick Mecklenburg
reviews.text: Reasonable portion sizes — not too much! Grilled chicken was very tender and flavorful but the halibut dish was even better. I would recommend the dips & pita as well; baba ganoush spread was my favorite.

reviews.author: Jake Kang
reviews.text:
The halibut was DIVINE. Start your course with the hummus and pita. Get the chicken or halibut and end your meal with the baklava with ice cream. You will not be disappointed.

One of my favorite San Francisco spots to eat at, brunch or dinner, especially as the sun sets.

reviews.author: Casburn Spencer
reviews.text: This restaurant is a fantastic place to enjoy a meal. Although parking was challenging, the food, atmosphere, and attentive staff made my experience truly enjoyable. I will definitely revisit this place if I'm in the area. The beet appetizer was particularly flavorful, featuring an unexpected combination of fruit and vegetables. The Branzino, a Mediterranean sea bass, was cooked to perfection. Its delicious white fish meat was undoubtedly the highlight of the evening.

reviews.author: Alicia DiGiammarino
reviews.text: That this place is packed even around 8:30 PM tells you how good it is. The honey and pita small bite is my favorite item on the menu. A spoon is provided so that you can drip sweet honey and clotted cream over perfectly crisp, warm pita. The other dishes are decadent too of course. It’s cozy and warm with interior brick walls that make the vibe a bit edgier than it would be otherwise.

reviews.author: Ozan Ulucan
reviews.text:
f you're looking for an authentic and absolutely delicious Turkish breakfast experience in San Francisco, Lokma is a must-visit!

We ordered their Turkish breakfast spread and everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Each small dish felt thoughtfully prepared from the creamy cheeses and honey to the vibrant olives and fresh fruits. The scrambled eggs with sausage (sucuk) were fluffy and perfectly seasoned, and the warm, fluffy pita slices were the perfect match. Their spinach and cheese börek was a real highlight too flaky, savory, and topped with a light sprinkle of sesame seeds.

The presentation alone is worth mentioning everything came out so colorful and inviting. (See the photos!)

The staff were friendly, attentive, and made the experience even better. The cozy atmosphere and beautiful wooden tables made it feel like a true Turkish home.

Highly recommend Lokma for anyone craving a vibrant and hearty breakfast it's truly one of the best breakfast experiences I've had in the Bay Area!

Favorite bites:

Sucuklu Yumurta (Turkish sausage with scrambled eggs)

Spinach Börek

Homemade jams and olives

Thank you, Lokma team -- can't wait to come back!

testimonials: Reasonable portion sizes — not too much! Grilled chicken was very tender and flavorful but the halibut dish was even better. I would recommend the dips & pita as well; baba ganoush spread was my favorite.

The halibut was DIVINE. Start your course with the hummus and pita. Get the chicken or halibut and end your meal with the baklava with ice cream. You will not be disappointed.

top_10.name: Taylor Street Coffee Shop
top_10.address: 375 Taylor St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: rj r
reviews.text:
Nice little coffee shop that serves breakfast. Excellent selection to choose from. Hashbrowns are excellent, nice crispy outside. Had the crab omelet, had a slight heat from the onions that are sautéed with habenerno pepper.
Service was excellent. Plan to come back and get something with the millionaire's bacon.

reviews.author: Russell Akred
reviews.text: Nostalgic, that would be a good word for Taylor Street Coffee Shop. Authentic would be another. Good simple breakfast served fast and hot. These small shops don't have the overhead and that's a good thing.

reviews.author: Isaiah Jackson
reviews.text:
Amazing breakfast! Has the hearty and good portion down as well as the unique factor without being too over the top.

The Sailor’s hash has a great blend of seafood and the MILLIONAIRES BACON is so good!!!!

Coffee is nothing great though. And price comes out a little on the high end but I think it’s worth it.

Place is small but they are quick and amazing. Recommend for visitors!

reviews.author: Sergey Butenco
reviews.text: It was a fabulous breakfast experience on a sunny April day. I ordered primavera omelet combo which comes with omelet, English muffin, orange juice, coffee and fresh fruits. The service was excellent as well.

reviews.author: Adam
reviews.text: Great spot for breakfast or lunch. The California omelette was great, and so was the french toast.

testimonials:
Nice little coffee shop that serves breakfast. Excellent selection to choose from. Hashbrowns are excellent, nice crispy outside. Had the crab omelet, had a slight heat from the onions that are sautéed with habenerno pepper.
Service was excellent. Plan to come back and get something with the millionaire's bacon.

top_10.name: KUSAKABE
top_10.address: 584 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Tiffany Williams
reviews.text: Incredible experience! My fiancé took me here for my birthday dinner. Mika was so sweet and accommodating, making sure every course and piece was executed perfectly. High quality fish and ingredients! Everything was delicious and they made my birthday super special!

reviews.author: Anthony Lucia
reviews.text: This was our first experience at an omakase restaurant, and the bar has been set exceedingly high. We sat at the counter, directly across from Patrick--who is the sweetest, most approachable, and knowledgeable craftsman one could score to lead our experience. The food was meticulously assembled, and we loved the textures and flavors. Nothing but praise for the kitchen to the servers to every detail put into the experience. Check out the Transamerica Pyramid Redwood Park on your way!

reviews.author: Donny Pusawong
reviews.text:
I simply can not rave about this restaurant enough. It was my first time here and it defintetly not be my last!

From the moment you walk in and get greeted by the staff and sushi chefs, to the servers meticuosly clearing dishes and plates, you feel very welcomed.

The food was so well prepared, fresh, and simply delicious. It was definelty one of the best sushi i've eaten in San Francisco and the Bay Area!  18 dishes came out and i was very full. About 200 dollars for the omakaze but well worth every dollar!  I can't wait to return!

reviews.author: T
reviews.text: WOW! Best meal of the year! The quality ingredients were so fresh and clean, flavors were a fun adventure, and the service was impeccable and welcoming. I can't recommend this place enough!

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.text:
I actually ate here a few years ago, back when Kusakabe still had a Michelin star. I never got around to writing a review, but I remember the experience clearly because it really stood out.

The fish was fresh, the rice had a nice touch of seasoning, and what impressed me most was the soy-based sauce with bonito. For me, the sauce is everything in sushi or omakase. It brings the whole bite together and theirs was really well done.

It’s been a while, so I’m not sure how it is now, but back then it was definitely worth recommending. Glad I finally got around to posting this.

testimonials: Incredible experience! My fiancé took me here for my birthday dinner. Mika was so sweet and accommodating, making sure every course and piece was executed perfectly. High quality fish and ingredients! Everything was delicious and they made my birthday super special!

This was our first experience at an omakase restaurant, and the bar has been set exceedingly high. top_10.name: Saru Sushi Bar
top_10.address: 3856 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Moorissa Tjokro
reviews.text: Never disappoints and always consistent - definitely the best and most recommended place for anyone visiting San Francisco craving for nigiri, sushi and sashimi. Their 5 pieces of Salmon Omakase is absolutely heaven on earth!

reviews.author: John Rushforth
reviews.text: This place is so good! Tasty food, cosy atmosphere, friendly staff. Highlights are the appetizer spoons (in the photo) and the seaweed is possibly the best I’ve tasted.

reviews.author: Zinnia Xu
reviews.text: Very good omakase! We love coming here — one of the best places in Noe Valley.

reviews.author: T H
reviews.text: Saru hits the mark for what you would expect SF sushi to be like - excellent. The fish is FRESH, rich in flavor, and soft as butter. The tiny space is clean, well decorated with authentic beautiful Japanese plates and serving pieces. And the staff is working hard as a team to take great care of everyone.

reviews.author: APRIL Z
reviews.text:
We decided to visit Sura Sushi for a casual workday late dinner. Our experience was nothing short of delightful. We started with Buri Daikon soup, which provided comforting warmth.

Opting for a selection of Nigiri and Sashimi, we were thoroughly impressed. Each piece showcased the freshness and quality of the ingredients. From the Chu Toro to the O Tor, Engawa to Sunazuri, and Hotate, every bite was a symphony of flavors and freshness. Highly recommend this place.

testimonials: Never disappoints and always consistent - definitely the best and most recommended place for anyone visiting San Francisco craving for nigiri, sushi and sashimi. Their 5 pieces of Salmon Omakase is absolutely heaven on earth!
This place is so good! Tasty food, cosy atmosphere, friendly staff. Highlights are the appetizer spoons (in the photo) and the seaweed is possibly the best I’ve tasted.
Very good omakase! We love coming here — one of the best places in Noe Valley.

top_10.name: Kuma Sushi + Sake
top_10.address: 1040 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Manabu M
reviews.text:
I’m a Japanese who started eating raw fish at the age of 7. I can proudly say that Kuma Sushi + Sake is an amazing sushi restaurant in every way!

It’s a popular sushi place so their fish is always fresh. Here, I had the freshest Santa Barbara uni that I have ever had in my life.

The flavors are innovative & creative.  I had an appetizer of “Katsuo Tataki”and the combination of the flavors was incredible.

Their rolls are fun to try and I love “Hey Girl” and “Jackalope.” I can eat them every day!

I love how they put the origins of each fish on the menu so we know where our fish came from.

Anyways, eating is believing. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Justin Snider
reviews.text:
Delicious, quality fish and reasonably priced. I'd eat that California roll every day if I lived nearby. I don't know if there's a better $11 dish in the city.

We ate a bunch of fish and had a few sides. Service was great. I would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Matty Easton
reviews.text:
Cozy hole-in-the-wall sushi joint an industri-chic feel and plenty of options for a shareable meal.

Favorite roll had to be the Fresca — ceviche with pineapple and avocado — though Tango was a close second. Some of the salmon was extra “fishy” tasting, which wasn’t a dealbreaker but perhaps could’ve been a bit more fresh.

Standout of the meal was actually from the daily menu — local firm tofu with crunchy garlic oil. WOW, it was delicious! The chilled tofu with the spicy sauce made for a really unique and enjoyable dish.

Service was great and friendly, and we had no problem being accommodated as walk-ins. Worth checking out!

reviews.author: Hendrik van Iterson
reviews.text:
First time at Kuma Sushi and what an amazing experience! The sushi was absolutely top-notch — fresh, beautifully prepared, and full of flavor.

The atmosphere had a welcoming and local vibe, which made us feel right at home. While EDM music isn’t really my thing during dinner, it didn’t take away from the great experience.

We will definitely be back 100%! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: David Lindsey
reviews.text: Fantastic sushi restaurant with a daily menu to keep things fun. Definitely recommend getting a reservation but we enjoyed the window seat without one. Attentive service and delicious food.

testimonials:
I’m a Japanese who started eating raw fish at the age of 7. I can proudly say that Kuma Sushi + Sake is an amazing sushi restaurant in every way!

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Shiny
reviews.text: This is hands down the best vegan sushi I’ve ever had! I was lucky to snag a seat right away, with no wait. I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. The sauces and ingredients were perfectly balanced and complemented each other beautifully. Since I don’t eat raw fish, finding this vegan sushi spot was a real treat. The hype is definitely justified! The service was fantastic, and my food arrived super quickly. I can’t wait to come back and sample more dishes from the menu.

reviews.author: Rahul Somani
reviews.text:
Recommended by a family member and what an amazing spot!!! We got super lucky with being seated by walking in around 9pm on Saturday night.

The team was super helpful in accommodating us and requested we be ready to order as soon as we are seated. We ordered a bunch of different roles along with tempura and tofu appetizers.

The ambiance and comfort in this restaurant is very inviting which made the experience that much more fun. Ohhh and their hot sauce is AMAZING which is homemade!!!!

reviews.author: Jeremiah Perez
reviews.text: This was a very great dining experience. Everything the staff, the food, the atmosphere. The food comes out as things are ready which gives the table an opportunity to sample things as they are fresh. The rolls were innovative and delicious. Every bite a flavor explosion. I had two none vegans at my table and they thoroughly enjoyed the meal and felt satisfied.

reviews.author: rajat kabra
reviews.text:
Sushi here has unique flavors and presentation and the fact that they serve so many options of vegan sushi is beyond impressive.

Loved the boddy & soul  and the green mango nigiri followed by candlestick. The surprise ending was interesting and I got the habanero sushi but not as good as the three mentioned before.

Had karage for the first time ever and it was sweet so not a fan, though I'm not sure what real karage tastes like.

reviews.author: Neesha Patel
reviews.text:
A really popular vegan sushi restaurant and with good reason! There was something for every taste.

They have rotating 90 minute spots and they are usually booked. They do seat a few people at the bar. But if it’s your first time, Highly recommend reservations for the full experience.

We needed the full 90 minutes and enjoyed every minute of it. Between 2 people, we ordered shishito peppers, 2 Nigiri and 3 specialty rolls. I think 2 nigiri and 2 specialty rolls would have been the perfect amount!

Highly highly highly recommend the boddy and soul. Probably one of the best on the menu! The fine balance between textures and tastes is amazing.

I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. The ambiance and comfort in this restaurant is very inviting which made the experience that much more fun. Ohhh and their hot sauce is AMAZING which is homemade!!!!

This was a very great dining experience. Everything the staff, the food, the atmosphere. The food comes out as things are ready which gives the table an opportunity to sample things as they are fresh. The rolls were innovative and delicious. Every bite a flavor explosion. I had two none vegans at my table and they thoroughly enjoyed the meal and felt satisfied.

top_10.name: Zentarou Sushi and Sake Bar
top_10.address: 1380 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Avadawab Wabavada
reviews.text: I’ve gotta say WOW for this spot! My husband and I felt welcomed at the first step from the door of Zentarou. All staffs are energetically attentive and greeting us like one of their family. We were seated at the bar which is one of the best spot to see what chef preparing our dishes. We ordered several dishes. Zero disappointment!! We gotta say that the special kinmedai yuzu dish was totally spot on of tonight. Beef Oroshi was amazing , we ordered a few nigiris. Kyoto style nigiris provided on our plates , no extra soy sauce or wasabi needed, because they are all seasoned !! rare seasonal items are the secret (ask chef) One of the secrets is asking the server for Sake pairing!! They will provide you best sakes to pair with your dishes. (Beachy was one of the best Sake sommelier) ask him to set your Sake pairing with your food!   Not just delicious food, but We got the best experience for the whole night! We will definitely come back and shout out!!. Honestly This restaurant should certainly be one of the Michelin stars

reviews.author: Amanda Bridge
reviews.text: Best bang for your buck for an omakase in SF. $92 for a 6-course meal that was absolutely delicious. We looked around town and other omakases were $250+ per seat, and while I’m sure those places are delicious, I was so excited to find this place. We were “wow-ing” with every bite! Came here 2x during my 5-day stay in SF. For my gluten free and food allergy people, they were super accommodating and made the omakase to my needs without questioning it. 10/10 would go back a 3rd time next time in town.

reviews.author: JamieQ
reviews.text:
If you’re on the hunt for premium sushi that will blow your mind, look no further than Zentarou Sushi & Sake Bar this hidden gem in San Francisco is next-level and truly one of the city’s best-kept secrets. From the moment you step in, the vibe is elevated yet welcoming, and every dish is a masterpiece. I seriously cannot recommend this spot enough if you’re a sushi lover (or even if you’re just sushi-curious), because the quality here is unmatched, the flavors are rich, and the freshness? Insane.

Now let’s talk about the showstopper: the KIN DON. This signature bowl is an absolute luxury dream stacked with buttery Hokkaido Uni, rich caviar, briny Ikura, melt-in-your-mouth toro tartare, delicate hotate, flavorful salmon tartare, and perfectly grilled unagi. Every bite is like a flavor explosion that just melts in your mouth and makes you wonder where this has been all your life. 😍🔥

Pair it with their incredible selection of authentic Japanese sake, and you’ve got yourself a whole vibe this isn’t just dinner, it’s an experience. Whether you’re out on a foodie adventure or just looking for your new go-to spot for quality Japanese cuisine, Zentarou is where it’s at. Trust me, you’ll fall in love, become a regular, and probably tell all your friends about this spot that feels like a secret but deserves to be known.

reviews.author: Bank J
reviews.text:
We are order chawanmushi and crispy bites for starter , caraxes roll, Dora-Gon roll and Kaiho Don for main course. Every thing if yummy.
Good atmosphere and good service.

reviews.author: Emily Yim
reviews.text:
I really wanted to love Zentarou, but unfortunately, it missed the mark for me and my partner. We visited during Valentine's weekend (though not on the actual day) and opted for the Valentine's omakase special (which seemed to be the equivalent of their premium omakase, but dressed up for the occasion). At $280 for two people, we had high expectations but felt that the quality and service didn’t quite justify the price.

Our favorites were the Miyazaki A5 wagyu, Otoro, and Hokkaido uni. These were included in the Valentine's special (and also appear to be part of the premium omakase set on a regular night). For the regular omakase, these items are available as supplements. The second round of nigiri was probably the best part of the meal.

However, beyond those highlights, the rest of the experience fell short. The rice ratio and flavor on the first round of nigiri were inconsistent, and the hamachi tasted slightly overcooked. When asked about allergies and food restrictions, I specifically requested no cucumber, yet the first dish included it. The eggplant in that same dish was also tougher than expected. While we tried to keep an open mind, we couldn’t help but feel that the overall quality didn’t match the price tag.

That said, we appreciated the presentation of the dishes and the effort of the team. While the staff was friendly, they seemed a bit rushed (likely due to the busy weekend), which made the service feel less personal than we had hoped for. Perhaps it was just an off night due to the occasion, but given our experience, we’d be hesitant to return. At this price point, I believe there are better omakase experiences to be found.

top_10.name: Wabi Sabi SF at Nob Hill
top_10.address: 1517 Pine St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Gary Chan
reviews.text: I came by for lunch and got the chirashi deluxe lunch special. The sashimi, as expected, was very fresh and flavorful with distinct and clean taste. The presentation was very pretty too! Chef was very welcome and chatted with me abt their ingredients (and our love of anime) while preparing the fish and other ingredients for that day behind the counter. He and the servers also makes sure I get everything I need. I can't wait to go back next time for the nigiri!

reviews.author: Vik Chaudhary
reviews.text: Wabi-Sabi in Nob Hill off Polk in San Francisco is 💯! Yogan Roll is absolutely amazing with crab and baked salmon with spicy aioli. Hotto-Sake Roll is good but not as thrilling as the first one. And the plain ol’ California Roll was moist and tasty, perfect to balance the spunk of the other two. Try the Genmaicha tea (endless refills for $2 - one reason I love this place. This tea is a blend of green tea and brown rice kernels so half the caffeine of green tea. Very very nice staff, so personable and caring, excellent service. This has been a repeat restaurant for us as a family!

reviews.author: Sassy Sercy
reviews.text:
The service is wonderful and the food is superb,  fresh and so delicious. I had the Miso soup and avocado roll, with some miso soup to go.
Lovely comfortable atmosphere. Looking forward to our next meal here.
This is a picture of our desert.

reviews.author: Poppy Cartinelli
reviews.text: We went in super early on a Thursday and had the whole restaurant to ourselves for almost an hour. The chef came out and served us and was amazingly nice! The nigiri was spectacular, the rolls were very good, and the salmon collar was one of the best I've ever had (also the hot sake and hot tea were good)!

reviews.author: Ming-Chuan Tsai
reviews.text: If you live close by, you definitely need to drop by for their lunch menu on weekdays. No crowd. Great food. Great deal. Great service. The owner is very friendly. This is my favorite lunch spot in the neighborhood.

This is a picture of our desert.

top_10.name: Ebisu Restaurant
top_10.address: 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Bijan Shahriari
reviews.text:
This is by far my favourite restaurant in SF! The quality of the fish, the service, the flavour! Everything was top notch. If you can, try to be seated at the bar so you can talk directly to the chef… it adds to the experience!

Expect to wait 30min before getting seated. The restaurant is packed on Friday or Saturday nights!

reviews.author: Hit List
reviews.text: Sorry for not visiting sooner. Top sushi nigiri with such delicious soft sushi rice. No wonder there was a line for a seat. I will definitely be hitting this place up more often. No joke.

reviews.author: Wing Mok
reviews.text:
First when I come in they put me at the darkest corner in the restaurant and I asked to move to another table.

Second, no one ask for what I want to drink after 5 minutes I sat down. (For some reason all the staff including the chef were focusing on one specific table may be VIP I guess)

Should have more options on Omakase, I don't mind to pay more.
But if I ordered Omakase with only regular Salmon, Tuna, Albacore, Ikura and MASAGO without even 1 piece of UNI or Scallop why would I order deluxe sushi or Omakase.

Ankimo, first time ever with no sauce and I had to ask for ponzu sauce on the side .

Conclusion, way overrated for their stars.

去之前期望太高👀
食完之後食物和服務水準比預期差太遠！😔😔😔

reviews.author: Lisa Allen
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Divine! Best scallop sushi I’ve ever tasted. No complaints!!

reviews.author: SunshiineMoonRise
reviews.text: Date night! We tried this restaurant for the first time for dinner. They don't take reservations, so you sign up on a clipboard when you arrive. It's a small, cozy space, and we only had to wait 15 minutes on a Wednesday. Our server, Nori, was excellent. We ordered a few yummy appetizers, like seaweed salad, edamame, and shrimp tempura. The hand rolls were great, with fresh, crispy seaweed—there's nothing worse than old, chewy seaweed! We also loved the “chef's choice”, and my favorite was the Romeo/Juliet roll. The Aladdin sake was flavorful and unfiltered, just the way I like it. The team-based service was appreciated. Highly recommend, and we'll definitely be back!

top_10.name: Hakashi Japanese Sushi Bar & Grill
top_10.address: 474 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Amy Dahlberg
reviews.text: Came here on a Friday night and was pleasantly surprised by our overall experience. We had reservations and got seated quickly with drink orders in. We had a bunch of Nigiri, our favorite being chu toro, hamachi, and mackerel. But everything we had was high quality cuts. The rice was perfectly done as well, which I feel like that ingredient gets overlooked often. The wakame salad salad was fresh and absolutely delicious. We sat at the sushi bars and the chefs were so fun to watch and nice to chat with. The price is very fair for the quality you get here. We will absolutely be making this our new go to local sushi spot. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Aye Chan Myae
reviews.text: We sincerely appreciate your warm hospitality in hosting our boss and our team. The endless flow of drinks and the abundance of delicious food filled our stomachs beyond capacity, leaving us truly grateful for your generosity. Your kindness and effort in making us feel welcome did not go unnoticed, and we deeply appreciate the time and care you put into ensuring everyone had a wonderful time. Thank you once again for your exceptional hospitality. We truly enjoyed every moment.

reviews.author: Julian
reviews.text: Master Julio gave us a great omakase experience! The sushi items were marvelous and we enjoyed his energy and enthusiasm.

reviews.author: Todd Meaney
reviews.text:
Fantastic staff! Great to chat with the chef as he portioned out a fresh tuna cut. He offered me a piece and shared great detail on buying and serving    tuna.

Enjoying 9 pieces of very tasty and well presented nigiri. Fun and tasty experience 100% worth a stop 🍣!

reviews.author: Wes S
reviews.text: Chef Julio and his staff gave us one of the most amazing dining experiences that my wife and I have experienced. We've been to hole in the walls to Michelin starred restaurants, and this place has topped all of those experiences. You can see how much Chef Julio loves/enjoys his craft. He took his time to explain each dish in detail. Obviously, I was drunk with endorphins with each bite that I don't remember the names of all the pieces that we were pampered with. I did remember that each piece had different layers of flavors that never overpowered each other. They perfectly fused together in harmony. I overheard another patron say he just returned from Japan, and this place beats the quality there. I personally can't confirm that, but I can seriously say my wife enjoyed it so much. She told me we're ONLY coming back here for Omakase and nowhere else. Thank you, Chef, and see you again soon.

We had a bunch of Nigiri, our favorite being chu toro, hamachi, and mackerel. But everything we had was high quality cuts. top_10.name: Roka Akor - San Francisco
top_10.address: 801 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Patty Kong
reviews.text: The food was very good and well prepared. We like the different small bites to share. Scallops were nicely roasted. Some dishes had a bit of spice to them. The desserts were delicious. A little on the pricey side but good service and presentation.

reviews.author: Jessica Peters
reviews.text: I went here Saturday for a birthday dinner. The staff all around was EXCEPTIONAL. The host was super pleasant and made sure we had a cute table at a booth. She also took pictures of me and my date. The server recommended the most incredible dishes and was really pleasant. The food was tasty and fresh. The ambience was really nice also. The staff really went above and beyond to make the birthday special. I can’t wait to return for the yummy cuisine!

reviews.author: Fair reviews Based on my Experiences
reviews.text:
Roka Akor absolutely delivers when it comes to food and atmosphere. The sushi was fresh, creative, and beautifully presented—easily some of the best I’ve had. The entire menu felt thoughtfully crafted, and the flavors were spot on. You can tell the chefs here really know what they’re doing. We ordered multiple appetizers and entrees to share as well as all the desserts.  I wouldn't choose any dessert again as they were pretty mediocre

The ambiance is also top-tier. Sleek, modern, and upscale, but still warm and comfortable. It's the kind of place that feels special without being stuffy. Add to that an excellent spirits list with rare whiskies, great sake options, and inventive cocktails—it’s a dream for anyone who appreciates a good drink with their meal.

Only downside? The timing between courses was off. The brought our food to soon, making our business party of 6 feel overly rushed which  threw off the rhythm of the evening. And unfortunately, the restroom was in poor shape—not what you'd expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

All in all, Roku Akor is still 100% worth a visit for the food and vibe alone. Just hoping they tighten up service timing and take better care of the facilities next time. If they do, it’s easily a 5-star spot!

reviews.author: Mariyam Saviour
reviews.text:
The food is amazing!
We dropped by without an appointment on a Friday night and they were able to get us 4 seated in the bar & lounge area downstairs. They do have a main floor as soon as you enter which is large and roomy, but I’m really glad we got seated in the bar area. Totally different vibe - cool, dark interiors, with a very intimate feel. Love the decor.
Service was on point.

Cocktails were okay, but the sake was incredible!
For appetisers we tried the beef kimchi dumplings (so good!), beet and burrata salad (delicious) and eggplant tempura (must try!).

All the three rolls were fantastic but my favorite was the dragon roll. I’d highly recommend.

We tried the cod which was good, but not something I’d get against. The presentation of the dish was beautiful.

One dish I would definitely recommend is the mushroom and rice hot pot - we all loved it! Simple and delicious.
Overall just an awesome experience

reviews.author: Abby Romo
reviews.text: this place is fun! i came for a birthday dinner and got the omakase menu. the dishes are good, but the fish is not excellent. the best dish (which was exceptional!!) was the black cod. the staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating of dietary restrictions. the presentations were also stunning!

testimonials: The food was very good and well prepared. We like the different small bites to share. Scallops were nicely roasted. Some dishes had a bit of spice to them. The desserts were delicious. A little on the pricey side but good service and presentation.

top_10.name: Robin
top_10.address: 620 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Tian Lim
reviews.text:
as someone who has had amazing omakase in japan, this place is just below the best i've had in japan, for slightly higher cost.  still worth 5 stars in my opinion.  they take risks with creative fusion takes, and the vast majority are great. interesting sake selection, the sake flight was a great journey with unexpected finds.  great presentation, good vibes and attentive staff.

first, book the sushi bar for the best experience, talk to the chefs, ask about the ingredients.

second, set your own budget.  the chef was very up front with us and had us set how much we were willing to spend, and you can add more as you get closer to the end.

third, come with an open and adventurous mind.  try everything that you're not allergic to.

reviews.author: Drew Hinkson
reviews.text: This place is phenomenal. One of my favorite omakase experiences. Dinner came with 21 different pieces and a dessert. Some of the highlights include the Hokkaido uni with caviar, wagyu with shaved foie gras, Seabream, snapper, ocean trout and tuna belly. We loved every bite. You are given a price range of $109-$209 I believe and they tailor the menu for you. The portion of rice to fish was perfect and there is a large selection of sake and wine. You can do a sake tasting for $75 or get bottles and glasses. The service was great, an empty plate was almost never on our table and the meal came out well paced. Reservations can be made 6 weeks in advance via resy and the sushi bar is most popular. Highly recommend this place for a wonderful omakase experience.

reviews.author: brandon shi
reviews.text:
Food was good, price was crazy. $430 for 2 people. I think the omakase was inconsistent. Some pieces were incredible, some were simply not worth it.

Pros:
-a5 Wagyu beef was great.
-salmon was great.
-some staff was incredibly nice.

Cons:
-Water was empty multiple times.
-The check came with 2 errors..They didn’t charge me for my green tea, and then double charged me for 2 extra pieces of omakase.
-told me the bar was reserved, my whole night… no one sat at the omakase bar.

Unfortunately I wouldn’t go again. I love food, I love restaurants, I love supporting places, but I would have to say I’m looking for a better place next time I’m in SF!

reviews.author: Jennifer Mesa
reviews.text: This place is the biggest scam for anything omakase. TO START, they ADD additions/charges to your meal without telling you so when the bill comes it’s a massive surprise (who does that?!) and it’s $200PP already!! Truly such a disappointment. They give you plain noodles as one of the omakase! NOODLES W NOTHING! and tobiko size smaller than my pinky nail ON A POTATO CHIP! A POTATO CHIP!  There is so much fresher, better and cheaper omakase in SF for way less than $200 PP. this place would make anyone from Japan sick to their stomach. Save yourself your hard earned money. Did I mention it’s $200 per person and you get potato chip??

reviews.author: Alex Zeus
reviews.text:
We went to Robin Menlo Park before and somehow this one is just not quite as good. There were few amazing bites but also few meh bites. At this price point , all bites should be amazing. I was full by the end but my husband wasn’t and had to go home and have a burger patty.
Still good for first experience but for amazing experience would go back to the Menlo Park one

top_10.name: Sriracha Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 1319 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Елена Трикси
reviews.text: I visited this place for the first time — and it definitely won’t be the last! The atmosphere is cozy, the staff is attentive, and the food is truly delicious. Everything was top-notch: from the presentation to the flavor. I especially appreciated the attention to detail — cleanliness, music, and the speed of service all made for a really pleasant experience. Highly recommend to anyone who values quality and a warm, thoughtful approach!

reviews.author: Jonathan Phan
reviews.text:
Sriracha Thai Cuisine offers a well-rounded menu of Thai classics, from pad thai and green curry to tom yum soup and mango sticky rice. The flavors are bold and balanced, with just the right amount of heat and sweetness. The restaurant is clean and inviting, with a modern yet cozy interior.

Staff are friendly and happy to adjust spice levels or accommodate dietary needs. The lunch specials are a great value, and the dinner portions are generous. It’s a dependable go-to for Thai food that’s flavorful without being overly Americanized.

The restaurant’s attention to detail and commitment to quality make it a standout choice for Thai cuisine in the area. Whether you’re dining in or ordering takeout, Sriracha Thai Cuisine consistently delivers a satisfying and enjoyable experience.

reviews.author: zayn maddox
reviews.text: The food was wonderful - the best thai food I’ve had in SF. Loved the green and massaman curry both with exquisite flavour. For dessert, the mango sticky rice was absolutely delicious and took care of that after dinner sugar craving. Staff are lovely and accommodating. A must try! Definitely coming back!

reviews.author: Gabrielle Ibarra
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food! We ordered the duck fried rice, pad kee mow, pad Cha Tay, pad Thai, and the three flavored bass. Everything tasted so flavorful and fresh and the fact they sell different plates of duck already sold me. The vibe is immaculate and down to earth, they have so many interesting and well taken care of plants which just shows how much effort and time they put into the care and cleanliness of their kitchen and space. You're getting real authentic Thai, absolutely delicious and wonderful vibe. Dont forget to leave a review when you eat here, they give a free drink or dessert! We got the Thai iced coffee super yum 😋

reviews.author: Farah Ansari
reviews.text: This place is such a gem. Just a 10 minute walk from the botanical gardens. Super quick service and super yummy. I ordered the pesto potstickers which were tasty and unique. The pad thai medium spice needed a little extra heat but still super yummy! Thai tea was great! And great atmosphere! The other dish had great crispy chicken!

testimonials: I visited this place for the first time — and it definitely won’t be the last! The atmosphere is cozy, the staff is attentive, and the food is truly delicious. Everything was top-notch: from the presentation to the flavor. I especially appreciated the attention to detail — cleanliness, music, and the speed of service all made for a really pleasant experience. Highly recommend to anyone who values quality and a warm, thoughtful approach!

Sriracha Thai Cuisine offers a well-rounded menu of Thai classics, from pad thai and green curry to tom yum soup and mango sticky rice. The flavors are bold and balanced, with just the right amount of heat and sweetness. The restaurant is clean and inviting, with a modern yet cozy interior.

Staff are friendly and happy to adjust spice levels or accommodate dietary needs. The lunch specials are a great value, and the dinner portions are generous. It’s a dependable go-to for Thai food that’s flavorful without being overly Americanized.

The restaurant’s attention to detail and commitment to quality make it a standout choice for Thai cuisine in the area. Whether you’re dining in or ordering takeout, Sriracha Thai Cuisine consistently delivers a satisfying and enjoyable experience.

The food was wonderful - the best thai food I’ve had in SF. Loved the green and massaman curry both with exquisite flavour. For dessert, the mango sticky rice was absolutely delicious and took care of that after dinner sugar craving. Staff are lovely and accommodating. A must try! Definitely coming back!

top_10.name: New Thai Elephant
top_10.address: 393 Bay St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Prestige Consultants
reviews.text:
Perfect for the keto traveller. Tried the F04, their spicy version of the crispy pork belly. It was wonderful. The pork belly was not overcooked and really tasty as it was sauted with bell peppers, Thai basil and chilly peppers, not too spicy.

The ambience is cozy with large painted Thai murals on the wall.

The service was friendly and attentive, beyond what is typically expected, was helped by May.

Their check in and Queuing system is simple albeit manual, just write your name and number of folks in your party. Came on a wed night and had to wait a very reasonable 20 mins to be seated.

A curious observation was parties all stayed for at least 1 hour and the restaurant did not pressure anyone to leave.

The place was spotless and clean.

If are in San Francisco and looking for a wonderful keto friendly restaurant, do stop by.

reviews.author: An Pan
reviews.text: Excellent Thai food in an unassuming restaurant. They have elephant icons such as Dumbo and African elephants. The Thai iced teas was the best with a teddy bear ice mold making it very cute. Satay was good as was the Papaya salad (warning it is not very spicy on medium). Spring rolls had tofu inside and had a minty taste. The Red curry with chicken was nicely spiced and was very good with the rice. Pad See Eu noodle also was well liked with plenty of chicken. The BBQ pork fried rice was good but did not have much pork in it. Nothing was left after we finished. Service was fast. Bathrooms were clean

reviews.author: Miriam Oravcova
reviews.text:
The food was nice, though the serving can be better, it was one big pile... I asked for mild spicy and they forgotten so we took the spices from the counter...

The pineapple rice was amazing taste wise but why there were two shrimps if the description doesn't mention them? Then it looks like they "fell there" by coincidence.

Otherwise the dinner was big enough.

reviews.author: yashodhan sawant
reviews.text:
We recently dined at New Thai Elephant, and our experience was excellent. Our group of three ordered the Egg Rolls, Veggie Fresh Rolls, Thai Iced Tea, Yellow Curry, and Pineapple Fried Rice.

The food was fantastic overall! The Egg Rolls and Veggie Fresh Rolls were fresh and satisfying, and the Thai Iced Tea was perfectly sweetened. The Yellow Curry was a standout—rich, flavorful, and beautifully balanced. While we enjoyed the Pineapple Fried Rice, we found it a bit on the bland and dry side compared to the other dishes.

The service was equally impressive. The staff was attentive, friendly, and made us feel welcome throughout the meal.

We’ll definitely be back to try more of their offerings! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a quality Thai dining experience.

reviews.author: Jhanvi
reviews.text:
The Unफेंक Reviewer

Delicious Thai place with various options

Located near Bay Area of San Francisco, this restaurant has a friendly vibe with good food and clean washrooms

The ambiance is a bit dim for my taste. Could have been better and brighter.

There was a waiting line for approx half an hour hence visit accordingly since it does get crowded and a bit cramped while waiting.

Note: They should consider food allergies more seriously despite mentioning while ordering.

However, they gave me complimentary desert for their overlook :)

top_10.name: Zen Yai
top_10.address: 771 Ellis St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Tanta Siriporn Na Rajasima
reviews.text:
They serve authentic thai food! I ordered boat noodles and it came just as what i had in Thailand! My friend also ordered Pad Kapao crispy pork and it tasted great (even though i prefer not to have the green beans in pad kapao). Price is great.

The servers seemed kind. My phone was running out of battery in their restaurant and the server lady charged it for me using their outlet!

The only con would be the location because this restaurant sits on where there are many homeless people. We were walking there and it was our first time walking in San Francisco so it was a little scary.

reviews.author: T T
reviews.text: This was my first time here and the food was very very good! It's definitely in a sketchy area, but worth it! Go with a big group so you can try many different dishes. I wanted to try more. It's recommended and I would return!

reviews.author: dionis borras
reviews.text: Very authentic thai restaurant in the heart of SFO! We ended up here as suggested by a thai lady we met in a café. She suggesed Zen Yai as a genuine thai restaurant. Totally true! We ordered the sausage, papaya salad, cashew nut, pad thai and pad krapao ( last two not shown in the pictures). Everything was delicious. The waiters were very friendly. Regarding the price/quality, very reasonable. The only negative thing to mention, which is not related to the restaurant, is the fact that the neighborhood is full of people struggling with drug adiction in the streets. It is a bit shocking to see and if you come from abroad like us that we come from Europe, it was sad and confronting to see.

reviews.author: Steven Straus
reviews.text: I just had food delivered to me from a different platform from this restaurant. The boneless duck 🦆 was perfectly cooked and somewhat spicy 🌶️. The ambience of the place looks really good from the pictures I have seen. I give this place  a five star ⭐️. I highly recommend this restaurant. I may order from them again sometime again.

reviews.author: Max K
reviews.text:
Been here a couple times and I can say that the food here is pretty authentic! As someone who is half Thai, I found the food here to remind me of the food in Thailand.

I got the Pad Kra Pao and it was perfect. Had some spice to it and came with the fried egg. Exactly how I remember getting it in Thailand.

There is parking on the street in front of the restaurant and the street isn’t typically too busy so it shouldn’t be too difficult to find parking.

top_10.name: Oraan Thai Eatery
top_10.address: 3750 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Andrea Santos
reviews.text:
tasty thai restaurant in inner richmond. dishes were well executed and left happy overall, but don’t expect to be mind blown. service was also above average and appreciated the friendly servers!

crispy eggplant: appetizer was OK. safe and decent choice but didn’t stand out

yellow curry: would recommend! good flavor and filled with toppings

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: At lunch time the place was near empty. The place is super cute and the service was good. Had the Choo Chee Salmon, it was amazing! Truly, fantastic! Indulged into a Thai Pumpkin Custard, which was cute, very nicely presented, and not very sweet. Definitely want to come back here. Great spot for a romantic dinner as well.

reviews.author: Narayanan Venkatachalam
reviews.text:
We ordered Som Tum ( papaya salad), Thai fried rice &  Kang Dang.
Since we are vegetarian and wants to customize she was so nice and customized the Kang Dang with Yellow curry instead of Red curry ( Red curry had fish sauce).
The taste was so good and we pretty much emptied the whole plate without a drop.
Nice Quantity except the fried rice could be little more quantity.

The service was soo good and very peaceful place and nice atmosphere.

I would recommend if you haven’t been there to give a try.

reviews.author: Sam Loose
reviews.text:
Gai Himmaparn: 10/10 so flavor; the chicken was so crispy and the sauce was sweet and tangy and pairs well with the jasmine rice
Nuer Marakot: 10/10 the steak was so juicy and marinated to perfection; a must try!!
Pad Seew: 7/10 definitely had better; was a little cold; beef thin so it was a little dry
Mango sticky rice: 10/10 best I’ve had in SF
Thai Iced Tea: 10/10 very solid; good flavor and not overly sweet
The staff was AMAZING and the place  is so beautiful  and lighting makes the place feel cozy

reviews.author: Pam
reviews.text: We had an absolute blast at my friend’s baby shower! The food was mouthwatering, and the venue was perfect for our little celebration. All in all, we had an unforgettable time together!

testimonials:
tasty thai restaurant in inner richmond. dishes were well executed and left happy overall, but don’t expect to be mind blown. service was also above average and appreciated the friendly servers!

crispy eggplant: appetizer was OK. safe and decent choice but didn’t stand out

yellow curry: would recommend! good flavor and filled with toppings

top_10.name: Kothai Republic
top_10.address: 1398 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Tom McElderry
reviews.text: I’ve eaten at Kothai four times now and it is consistently outstanding. The food is creative, using top quality super fresh ingredients that the team here has lovingly put together into dishes that delight the eye and please the palate. I also really like the soju cocktails, which are spirit forward and perfectly balanced, never too sweet, never too sour. The service is professional but warm, and they remember you if you come back. The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

reviews.author: Wan siu
reviews.text: I’ve passed by this restaurant many times and finally got to try it. Surprisingly, everything was delicious — the flavors were great, and the textures were spot on. The service was excellent too. The chicken was juicy and tender, and the red curry was a perfect complement. They mentioned that the menu changes quite often, so I’ll definitely be back to try more next time!

reviews.author: Alma Zamora
reviews.text: The food was delicious! Generous portions and everything tasted so fresh. It is a bit pricey but worth it. The only thing we were not crazy about was the apple cheesecake for dessert. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. Chocolate mousse was amazing! Drinks were light and refreshing.

reviews.author: AJM
reviews.text: I've lived in SF for 4 years now and this is one of just 8 restaurants I've marked w "Favorite". Every dish was incredible, full of new flavors and w a beautiful presentation. Honestly, I was a happy camper eating each bite. Well done to the chef and staff. I'll be back!

reviews.author: Lexi Chen
reviews.text: It’s been a long time since I’ve enjoyed a meal where every dish amazed me! Innovative dishes brilliantly combining the best of Korean and Thai cuisines. Everything was beautifully presented and tasted incredible. Will definitely come back to explore the entire menu!

testimonials: I’ve eaten at Kothai four times now and it is consistently outstanding. The food is creative, using top quality super fresh ingredients that the team here has lovingly put together into dishes that delight the eye and please the palate. I also really like the soju cocktails, which are spirit forward and perfectly balanced, never too sweet, never too sour. The service is professional but warm, and they remember you if you come back. The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

The chicken was juicy and tender, and the red curry was a perfect complement. They mentioned that the menu changes quite often, so I’ll definitely be back to try more next time!

top_10.name: Khao Tiew
top_10.address: 272 Claremont Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Hilda Liu
reviews.text:
The price is fair and the environment is charming! I loved the decor—so many old Thai commercial posters from 20–30 years ago that give off a nostalgic 70s–80s vibe 🌟

The waitress was super attentive. Be warned though: if you come during peak dinner hours, there’s usually a long wait, but you can easily join the waitlist on Yelp!

Despite the crowd, food came out really fast. Everything we ordered had such a great balance of flavors.

💯 My top recommendations:
•	Duck breast curry – rich, flavorful, and so satisfying.
•	Kaya toast – perfectly crispy and sweet.

They also have a good drink selection, and we saw a lot of people ordering the crispy papaya salad—huge portion and definitely unique!

If you’re craving Thai food, I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Katherine Gerov
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! We went earlier to avoid the long line and were seated immediately. Lots of vegetarian options, all were really well made and full of authentic flavor. The spice was actually spicy, thankfully. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Greg Albrecht
reviews.text:
Easily the best Thai food in the city, very special and unique ingredients and cuisson on every dish. Our favorite dishes were the Pork Belly appetizer and the Beef Fried Rice entree. The Toast dessert is absolutely a must-have, it’s so good.

My only recommendation is to make a reservation since we waited 2 hours on the waitlist on a Friday night. It seems that the minimum party size for a reservation is 6 ppl.

reviews.author: sid srivastava
reviews.text:
Easily one of the best restaurants in SF, top 5 for me. Some of the best Thai food I've ever had. Beef fried rice and duck breast curry had me licking my spoon. MUST get if you go. The crab and shrimp glass noodle dish was good too, but a bit underwhelming compared to the others, and the most expensive. Wouldn't get it again.

I will return here and try more of their menu. This place is definitely pricey, but worth the money. A MUST visit in SF.

reviews.author: Jina Shih
reviews.text: The wait time is always crazy, so we did takeout. The food smells really good, and the prices are reasonable. But I don’t think waiting an hour is worth it. We didn’t order anything too special—it was just standard Thai food to us. I recommend trying takeout before waiting in line for an hour.

top_10.name: Baan Yaai
top_10.address: 2274 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: DYJ1948
reviews.text:
We spent over six weeks in Thailand in January and February this year and we ate well!! So trying to find an authentic Thai restaurant, we decided to give this a try! We’re so glad we did as we felt that there flavors and taste were so reminiscent of all the food we ate  at very local restaurants and vendors in Southern Thailand as well as Chiang Mai.

We ordered green curry with chicken and the chicken pad Thai. We also ordered brown rice. The food was perfect and brought us back to our time earlier this year in Thailand.

We coming back to try many different dishes in their menu!! Also service was excellent!!

reviews.author: Mr. “Your Personal Satan” Foss
reviews.text:
This is excellent Thai food.

We started the meal with the gyoza in red curry sauce. Very tasty. Crispy and hot.

For lunch the wife had the drunken noodle and I had the pad Thai with shrimp. My pad Thai was very solid, just exactly how you expect it. Excellent.

Now my wife is, I would say, a thai food enthusiast. I'm not sure it's her main passion, but she could probably get a PhD in loving Thai food.

This is her fourth favorite Thai food, in San Francisco. That is very high praise. When asked, she said she would eat here again, which my wife if she doesn't like the Thai food she will never go back to the city that the Thai food was made in.

She had the drunken noodle. She said it was a classic drunken noodle and very good.

We had two Thai iced teas and that was it. I'm very much recommend if you're in the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Thao Ha
reviews.text:
Smallish Thai place with some fun unique offerings. They had a Thai omurice and a beef curry I had not seen at many other places.

I think their seasoning leaned a bit too sweet for my liking and their fried rice was just okay.

Staff was pretty busy at the time and so were not super attentive and got our order wrong. But they were super nice about fixing it.

Would probably go back to try their curry fried rice and appetizers.

reviews.author: Giedrė Astrauskaitė
reviews.text:
I really enjoyed the food in Baan Yaai and would recommend it to others. The papaya/shrimp salad was refreshing and tasty with a hint of spice, although I didn’t think that the shrimp was actually grilled (really liked it regardless!) I also loved the Pad See Ew with tofu. Both portions were big and the service was lovely. The only reason I didn’t order a dessert was because I was too full!

P.s. the pictures don’t do it justice!

reviews.author: Laurence Alvarado
reviews.text: Oh my God this place is amazing! Not only is the service above and beyond but the food is chefs kiss! I ordered take out with my partner and they didn’t know a order had peanuts instead of telling us it was our fault which it was mind you they gave us extra order of the dish with no peanuts and a order their sticky sweet rice with mango!!! I’m new around here so this was such a warm welcome to the area and I just wanted them to be recognized for their great customer service and quality food!! I’m coming here in person next time and I’m bringing all my family!!!

We’re so glad we did as we felt that there flavors and taste were so reminiscent of all the food we ate  at very local restaurants and vendors in Southern Thailand as well as Chiang Mai.

We ordered green curry with chicken and the chicken pad Thai. We also ordered brown rice. The food was perfect and brought us back to our time earlier this year in Thailand.

We coming back to try many different dishes in their menu!! Also service was excellent!!
