top_10.name: Khaosoi Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 4403 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: E
reviews.text:
Pretty good food. When I went there was no wait and the service and atmosphere was really good. I thought the food was just average considering the price. The dishes were not as flavorful as I was expecting for Thai food.

Overall a cute place to grab food if you are in the area and don't want to wait.

reviews.author: J.P. Libert
reviews.text: Great food, fast service, clean area.  We left the Golden Gate park looking for a place to eat.  We found parking on a side street and walked right in at 5:30 pm.   The spring rolls and sauce was amazing.   Pad chicken was great as well.

reviews.author: Kate X
reviews.text: I got the fried chicken khao soi here and the fried chicken was crispy but juice. The curry soup was also very flavorful and went well with the chicken and toppings. I'm usually not a fan of crispy noodles, so I'm glad that they only had a little bit of it on the side.

reviews.author: Sona Tigranyan
reviews.text:
We had a great experience here! Started off with the samosas—crispy, flavоrful, and a perfect. For mains, we tried the Khao Soi Fried Chicken which was my favorite!, Green Curry with chicken, and Pad Gra Pao with beef. The Khao Soi was rich and creamy with just a hint of sweetness from the coconut curry, and the noodles were perfectly tender. The Green Curry was solid, and the Pad Gra Pao paired really well with the beеf and sauce.They let you choose your spice level, we went with mild, and it had just the right amount of kick.
Portions were generous and very satisfying. For dessert, we had “Mama’s Favorite” with sticky rice and corn and it was delicious and nicely balanced, not overly sweet. Also I tried the blue lychee drink, which was super refreshing and fun.
Service was fast, and the space itself is clean, cozy, and nicely decorated. Prices are reasonable for the quality and portion sizes.

reviews.author: François Rodigari
reviews.text: An affordable Thai restaurant with good food and friendly service. We ordered a Cucumber Salad, Pad See Ew and Pad Thai. All three dishes were very nicely presented and very good. The Cucumber Salad was generously sprinkled with Bonito flakes, giving it a strong fish flavor. The food was very nicely presented and the restaurant is bright and clean. Access to the bathroom requires a trip through the kitchen.

testimonials:
Pretty good food. When I went there was no wait and the service and atmosphere was really good. I thought the food was just average considering the price. The dishes were not as flavorful as I was expecting for Thai food.

Overall a cute place to grab food if you are in the area and don't want to wait.

Great food, fast service, clean area.  We left the Golden Gate park looking for a place to eat.  We found parking on a side street and walked right in at 5:30 pm.   The spring rolls and sauce was amazing.   Pad chicken was great as well.

I got the fried chicken khao soi here and the fried chicken was crispy but juice. The curry soup was also very flavorful and went well with the chicken and toppings. I'm usually not a fan of crispy noodles, so I'm glad that they only had a little bit of it on the side.

top_10.name: Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 710 Florida St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Dean Santos
reviews.text:
I love this place. I used to work across the street 8 years ago when I started coming here for lunch. I used to order the fried chicken or the beef noodle soup. I don’t quite remember the names but I do remember enjoying every meal I had here.

I don’t think the quality has diminished one bit. I still come by here occasionally but more often than not, I order for delivery just to get a hit of that curry dip for the fried chicken at the comfort of my home.

reviews.author: Mich Ro
reviews.text: Solid Thai restaurant but a victim of its own success. Made a reservation for 4 and based on the call, was not a problem, but still had to wait for a table. Service is solid but you aren't going to get too much attention-understandable given the volume of patrons and orders they have to deal with. Menu is extensive and priced as you might expect from the neighborhood and clientele. The food was good but came out not quite as hot (temperature) as you'd like. Interior is attractive, as are the dishes and cocktails. No freebies for birthdays, haha.

reviews.author: Tejaswini Lele
reviews.text:
We came here for Saturday lunch (later in the lunch time). The place was lively but not crowded. We didn't have a reservation but got the table right away.
Some of the staff members were nice and friendly while some were indifferent which felt borderline rude at times.
We ordered non-alcoholic Martini which I wasn't a fan of. For starters we had Crispy egg rolls and Roti Mataba, both the dishes were really tasty with good quantities. For mains we shared Pad Kee Mow which was just a perfect amount of spicy (for our South Asian taste buds)
Very mixed bag but pretty Instagrammish decor.

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.text:
We went all in and it did not disappoint:

🥟 Samosas – crispy, golden, and that sauce? Unreal.
🌱 Fresh rolls – made veggies exciting, thanks to another A+ dip.
🍖 Panang Neua – bone-in beef that’s rich, tender, and totally Luffy-approved.
🔥 Volcano Cup – Thai. Level. Spicy. Not for the faint of tongue. 🥵

Yes, it’s on the pricier side — but honestly? Worth every bite.

reviews.author: Bonnie D
reviews.text: Visited with friends from work. Very busy, but delicious food and unique drinks.  I had the Tom Yum soup with prawns and it was just spicy enough. Full of flavor and plenty of well cooked prawns. We also shared a few apps including calamari and samosas.  It was all very authentic to what we had in Thailand.  I had a drink with elderberry liquor,  I forget the name, but really loved it. Someone ordered the blue rice which was different to look at, but it's just rice. The staff was attentive and food was delivered quickly.  A very enjoyable experience.

testimonials:
I love this place. I used to work across the street 8 years ago when I started coming here for lunch. I used to order the fried chicken or the beef noodle soup. I don’t quite remember the names but I do remember enjoying every meal I had here.

I don’t think the quality has diminished one bit. I still come by here occasionally but more often than not, I order for delivery just to get a hit of that curry dip for the fried chicken at the comfort of my home.

Solid Thai restaurant but a victim of its own success. Made a reservation for 4 and based on the call, was not a problem, but still had to wait for a table. Very mixed bag but pretty Instagrammish decor.

top_10.name: House of Thai
top_10.address: 901 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Claire Cosar
reviews.text: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

reviews.author: Rob Barrish
reviews.text: Really legit Thai food. Among the best!! Also a lot of great variety. Old standbys like Pad Kee Mao and Papaya Salad are amazing plus BBQ pork like nothing I ever had is super tasty. Love the condiments in case you want to dial up the heat even more.

reviews.author: Jaimeen Mehta
reviews.text: The atmosphere and waiter is fantastic. Always serving with a smile. The food Pad Thai and cashew nut were very tasty. Definitely need to try if you like Thai food.

reviews.author: Ja De
reviews.text: I stopped by for Dinner, I started with basil beauty drink it’s good it’s just a little too sweet, papaya salad is good. Fresh roll is good too it could be better with less mixed greens which over power the rest of the ingredients, for the red curry is good could be better with a little bit more portion. Service was great, restaurant had good ambiance it’s clean as well. Overall I recommend this place for Thai restaurants among the Thai restaurants if you’re visiting SF.

reviews.author: Kaylaa' White
reviews.text: I got Kao Pad w/chicken, Peak Gai Tod, Pad Woo Sen, and Thai Tea & everything was so fresh & flavorful! Customer service was great. I'm traveling & I wanted good Thai food that worked with my dietary restrictions

testimonials: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

Really legit Thai food. Among the best!! Also a lot of great variety. Old standbys like Pad Kee Mao and Papaya Salad are amazing plus BBQ pork like nothing I ever had is super tasty. Love the condiments in case you want to dial up the heat even more.
The atmosphere and waiter is fantastic. Always serving with a smile. The food Pad Thai and cashew nut were very tasty. Definitely need to try if you like Thai food.

top_10.name: Z & Y Peking Duck
top_10.address: 606 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Nicole Yu
reviews.text: Had a fantastic meal at Z&Y Peking Duck!! Ordered the whole duck in advance when we made the reservation. Ling was a really great server and attentive! Also got the pork belly with preserved greens, spicy duck blood, and green beans - all delicious! Finished with the almond curd which was adorable and tasty, but not too sweet. Would definitely come back!

reviews.author: N R
reviews.text:
Z&Y Restaurant is hands down one of the best spots in San Francisco for Peking duck but make sure you call ahead and reserve your duck because they do run out, and it’s their star dish for a reason. The duck is top-notch: beautifully roasted, shiny and crispy skin, and not overly fatty, which makes it even better. It’s served with soft pancakes, green onions, cucumber, and even a small dish of sugar. I was curious about the sugar until I overheard the table next to me dipping the duck skin in it is game changer!

The quality is excellent, and while you might find cheaper Peking duck elsewhere, the flavor and texture here make it well worth the price. We also ordered the Chicken with Explosive Chili Pepper, which featured a generous amount of Szechuan chili peppers. It delivered that classic mouth-numbing sensation, but in a perfectly balanced way not overwhelming at all. The fried chicken pieces were seasoned perfectly and packed with flavor.

On top of the amazing food, the service stood out. Even though the place was busy, one of the servers took the time to explain the dish’s origin and the best way to enjoy it, which made the whole experience even more special.

Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic Chinese flavors especially the duck. A must-visit when in SF!

reviews.author: April Parungao
reviews.text: So glad my parents and I found this place on a whim! We ordered the Peking duck, fried rice, chow mein, and pea sprouts - everything tasted amazing and incredibly fresh. The chef was kind enough to explain to us how they traditionally eat the duck with the wrap. The restaurant itself has a chill ambience. Highly recommend and looking forward to my next trip back :)

reviews.author: Helen N
reviews.text: The Peking duck is wonderful. The wraps  were thin, which is great. The fried green beans dish was also amazingly good. Soup dumplings were awesome. The dish I was disappointed was “ Couple’s Delight”, which was too salty and sour. For the full Peking duck, they didn’t serve the duck bone. From other restaurant, we usually also got deep fried duck bone with garlic salt pepper powder, or duck bone soup without extra charges.

reviews.author: Arikka Rin
reviews.text:
Upon arrival our party realized we made a reservation at the other Z&Y. However, the host was able to help us out and get us seated as quickly as possible before the kitchen took their last orders.

The presentation of the food was attractive. Some of the standout dishes were the stir-fried crab, cumin lamb and the almond cream dessert. Loved how the crab & lamb were just sizzling on the hot plate when they came out! The soup dumplings were also a solid order with awesome texture and flavor, but the cumin lamb was my favorite. If you can handle lots of Szechuan peppers then you’ll love the crab as it’s quite numbing. The mung bean flour noodle in that dish was the intriguing part for me with their unique texture and color.

There were subtle areas of service that could be improved. For example, leaving the bottle of water on table so that we didn’t have empty glasses. Secondly, there was a server that was rushing to drop the hot plate for the crab and spilled our sauce for soup dumplings. Other than that they were efficient and gave us great recommendations and stayed on top of waters for most of the dinner.

Our favorite part of the experience was our server, Jake! He had told us he opened the location and was at the other Z&Y for 10 years. Jake was great with recommendations and had a fun sense of humor ;) He let us see and use his POS, as we were needing out since we’re all hospitality professionals. He introduced us to Chef Han, and we had an awesome time getting to know him and learn about his journey. It was a memorable experience, and well definitely be back for the Peking Duck!

testimonials: Had a fantastic meal at Z&Y Peking Duck!! Ordered the whole duck in advance when we made the reservation. Ling was a really great server and attentive! Also got the pork belly with preserved greens, spicy duck blood, and green beans - all delicious! Finished with the almond curd which was adorable and tasty, but not too sweet. Would definitely come back!

So glad my parents and I found this place on a whim! We ordered the Peking duck, fried rice, chow mein, and pea sprouts - everything tasted amazing and incredibly fresh. The chef was kind enough to explain to us how they traditionally eat the duck with the wrap. The restaurant itself has a chill ambience. Highly recommend and looking forward to my next trip back :)

top_10.name: House of Pancakes
top_10.address: 937 Taraval St, San Francisco, CA 94116, USA

reviews.author: Sam Myers
reviews.text:
House of Pancakes was one of the coziest & tastiest meals I’ve had in recent memory. The garlic green beans and the beef roll pancake were the most notable items for sure. So tasty!! The hand-pulled noodles were good as well, especially on a rainy day. The garlic green The food is what earned the five stars here.
The service and ambiance were alright. I wouldn’t say either were notable. It took me a few tries to flag down a server to get water, but they were quick with the tea and with the food! Overall, I’d definitely come back here!

reviews.author: Bonnie
reviews.text:
The beef roll pancake was SO GOOD. Definitely coming back here, just for that.

The veggie dumpling was okay (would not get again) and the rib hand pulled noodles was also delicious.

Note: cash only!

reviews.author: Phuong Luong
reviews.text: Got the beef roll, eggplant, and spicy fish fillet (not pictured). Fish was extremely oily but I should've known from the name, eggplant is well cooked but not too exceptional, and beef roll is great.

reviews.author: Alan Hu
reviews.text:
Context: Saturday dinner. Cash only as of review date.

House of Pancakes is a relatively small establishment so a line may form (~15 to 30 minutes wait time).

The food was excellent. The beef roll scallion pancake was crispy, and the beef was tender and seasoned well. The lamb noodle soup was portioned well with chewy, thin noodles. The garlic string beans were delicious as the string beans were not overcooked (still has a nice crunch) and the amount of garlic added satisfied my appetite.

Service was fine. Overall, a good dinner spot to go with friends.

reviews.author: Melodi
reviews.text:
Legendary lamb potstickers!! The beef pancake roll is also excellent, sweet, thin pancake with plenty of beef in the center. Add sauce to taste for the hand pulled noodles, still a great deal and perfectly cooked.

Prices have hardly changed in years, which I truly appreciate. Prices range from about $7-$13 per dish.

testimonials:

The hand-pulled noodles were good as well, especially on a rainy day. The garlic green The food is what earned the five stars here.
The service and ambiance were alright. I wouldn’t say either were notable. It took me a few tries to flag down a server to get water, but they were quick with the tea and with the food! Overall, I’d definitely come back here!

The beef roll pancake was SO GOOD. Definitely coming back here, just for that.

The veggie dumpling was okay (would not get again) and the rib hand pulled noodles was also delicious.

Note: cash only!

Got the beef roll, eggplant, and spicy fish fillet (not pictured). Fish was extremely oily but I should've known from the name, eggplant is well cooked but not too exceptional, and beef roll is great.

top_10.name: Dumpling Home
top_10.address: 298 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Pooya Fayyaz
reviews.text:
I’ve been to almost every dumpling spot in SF (my wife’s a big fan 😂), so I’d say I’ve got a decent benchmark. This place is solid, definitely good, but not the best in the city.

The standout for me was the spicy pork soup dumpling, full of flavor and perfectly done. The sesame boiled dumpling was also above average. But the spicy beef boiled dumpling didn’t quite hit the mark, bland and forgettable.

Be ready for a wait, there’s usually a line and it can take 20–30 minutes to get seated. Overall, worth trying, but I wouldn’t call it a top dumpling destination.

reviews.author: Anderson Angkeyile (Flying Sailor)
reviews.text: Dumpling Home offers authentic and delicious Chinese food that truly impressed me. The soup dumplings were outstanding — they held all the flavorful broth without breaking, which is a challenge even for restaurants in China. The small bites were refreshing, tasty, and full of variety. Despite the lunch rush, the business ran smoothly with efficient service. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Vanessa G
reviews.text:
Went on a thursday night. Expect a wait if you come after 6:30 pm, they don't seat you until you have the full party.

That said, service was really quick once we sat down. We ordered the pork and beef pan-fried dumplings, pork xiao long bao, sauteed grean beans, cucumber, and the Zha Jiang noodles. Everything was really good.

My favorite was the pan-fried dumplings, as I've never had that before. Just be careful as it does squirt everywhere if you bite into it. I liked the pork better than the beef dumpling. The cucumber was fresh, although I didn't really taste the garlic sauce. The xiao long bao was great, and the meat and sauce were very flavorful. Although personally, I thought they were on the bigger side. I prefer XLB that has an equal meat to pastry ratio. The green beans were perfectly crunchy.

For 6 dishes, tea and 1 beer, we paid ~$120 including tips. This is a good portion for 3 people.

Would definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Jea Kim
reviews.text:
A really popular dumpling spot outside of Chinatown.

Stopped by for lunch on a Monday around noon. Both the indoor tables and outdoor patio were completely packed, so we waited about 15 minutes to get seated. I’ve had mixed experiences with Bib Gourmand dumpling spots in the U.S., but this one was the best so far.

Beef in Special Soy Sauce & Jellyfish Salad – Standard cold apps. Nothing particularly memorable, but just wanted something light and refreshing to start with before the heavier dishes.

Dry-Cooked Green Beans – Usually not big on green beans solo, but this was highly recommended. Lightly coated in a savory sauce (probably oyster sauce plus something extra), which masked any bitterness and gave it a nice umami edge.

Juicy Pork Bao – Very similar to Shanghai-style buns with crispy bottoms and juicy, flavorful pork inside. My favorite of the dumplings. Preferred them over the xiao long bao.

Numb & Spicy Pork Xiao Long Bao – Despite the name, there was no numbing spice at all. Ended up giving them a generous pour of chili oil. So you might be better off just ordering the regular pork version.

Beef Xiao Long Bao – I don’t think I’ve had beef in XLB form before, but this was really good. Juicy, well-seasoned, and honestly just good on its own. With chili oil, though, I still slightly preferred the pork.

reviews.author: David Liu
reviews.text: This and daeho are top 2 restaurants in SF. Dumplings and baos are already one of the best foods in the world and somehow Dumpling Home has further elevated them. Almost as good as my mom's dumplings real talk. Some have told me that Dumpling Story however is even more powerful, so I will be back to try that at my earliest covenience

Would definitely come back again.

top_10.name: bao
top_10.address: 590 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Judy Hung
reviews.text: Excellent Chinese dim sum spot. I ordered the house special xiao long bao and loved the idea of serving each one in an aluminum foil cup to catch the soup drippings. I also tried the chive and shrimp pan-seared dumplings, which were delicious and generously filled with shrimp. The sweet buns were adorably designed, and the seafood fried rice had a great wok flavor. The restaurant was very clean, and the service was excellent. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Pooya Fayyaz
reviews.text: I’ve tried countless dumplings, from restaurants to frozen ones, and even some my friends made themselves. But let me tell you, this is different and the best. We’ve tried steamed shrimp dumplings, wontons, and potstickers dumplings, and each one was exceptional in its own way. However, the shrimp dumplings are simply mind-blowing. You have to try them! 😍

reviews.author: James Minor (Minor Details Media)
reviews.text: WOW!  What a Wonderful Experience!  The Soup Dumplings, the Bao, the Noodles and Amazing Vegetable options too...You can taste the Homemade Freshness in Every Bite.  A MUST Try!!!

reviews.author: Shruti Garg
reviews.text: A top tier dim sum experience. For vegetarians, this is a must try and indulgent place. There’s sooo many options and the soup dumplings were delicious. Highly recommend the sweet mixed plate baos as well to get a flavor of everything. Easy to over order but honestly worth it anyways! Noodles were also sooo good

reviews.author: Roy Shin
reviews.text:
I’m glad we finally walked into Bao. All of our orders were surprisingly tasty, flavorful yet clean.
1. Vegetarian dumplings - this was my second favorite. Flavorful and juicy, I will definitely order these again
2. BBQ pork bun - tasty, I will order them again
3. Curry puff - the curry flavor wasn’t for me but my husband loved them
4. Pineapple chicken fried rice - it was a bit wet for my liking but it was still very tasty
5. Egg tart - these were the best! They were just freshly baked and hot. We waited extra 10mins for freshly baked tarts but it was worth it!

We’ve tried steamed shrimp dumplings, wontons, and potstickers dumplings, and each one was exceptional in its own way. However, the shrimp dumplings are simply mind-blowing. You have to try them! 😍
WOW!  What a Wonderful Experience!  The Soup Dumplings, the Bao, the Noodles and Amazing Vegetable options too...You can taste the Homemade Freshness in Every Bite.  A MUST Try!!!

top_10.name: WenChang Dumpling Restaurant
top_10.address: 1650 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Philly2 anywhere
reviews.text:
Delicious food, off the beaten path, yet worth it. Fresh, high quality chicken
The sesame chicken was unique and delightful. The buns and dumplings were incredible. I devoured them without much of an appetite, literally that good. The staff works hard to keep things flowing.

reviews.author: Rick Balwani
reviews.text: Fantastic wok seared food. After driving out to Richmond for some tacos, only to discover it was closed, we stopped in at WenChang. I was craving some noodles and Mongolian beef. This place did not disappoint. Every dish was super fresh and you could actually see the wok seared marks on the noodles. Hard to capture how good the food was here. There’s not a lot of tables, so I could imagine a little wait during rush hour.

reviews.author: David Ly
reviews.text: Small Gem for Chinese food/ Dumplings.  We ordered the Mongolian Beef, 4 Seasons Chow Mein and Xiao Long Bao.  All are excellent with lots of flavors.  Portions were very generous.  Prices are very reasonable.  Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Jane Lee
reviews.text:
Went on a weekend for lunch, had to wait outside for 15-20mins as it’s a tiny restaurant with 4-5 tables. Food came pretty quickly though!

We ordered xiao long bao (soup dumpling), har gow (shrimp dumpling), potstickers, fried chicken wings, honey sesame chicken, bistro fried rice and Singaporean noodles.

All the food was decent but only the bistro fried rice was delicious! We inhaled it so fast that I couldn’t get a picture of it. The har gow and string bean were good too. We’re pretty sure the xiao long bao was not handmade which was disappointing. Potstickers and fried chicken was standard.

Would come back again if I’m in the Richmond! Price to food portion was good.

reviews.author: Connie Adachi
reviews.text: We had two w sum dishes , and the Singapore rice noodles. Both were delicious, freshly made, and I particularly enjoyed being able to pick which kind of protein for the Singapore rice noodles. Big portions, reasonable prices, leftovers for tonight!

testimonials:
Delicious food, off the beaten path, yet worth it. Fresh, high quality chicken
The sesame chicken was unique and delightful. The buns and dumplings were incredible. I devoured them without much of an appetite, literally that good. The staff works hard to keep things flowing.

Fantastic wok seared food. After driving out to Richmond for some tacos, only to discover it was closed, we stopped in at WenChang. I was craving some noodles and Mongolian beef. This place did not disappoint. Every dish was super fresh and you could actually see the wok seared marks on the noodles. Hard to capture how good the food was here. There’s not a lot of tables, so I could imagine a little wait during rush hour.

Small Gem for Chinese food/ Dumplings.  We ordered the Mongolian Beef, 4 Seasons Chow Mein and Xiao Long Bao.  All are excellent with lots of flavors.  Portions were very generous.  Prices are very reasonable.  Definitely will be back.

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Cynthia Jia
reviews.text:
A great casual and affordable place for delicious skewers! Can’t go wrong with cumin lamb, but their mushroom skewers are also delicious. It’s not hard to get a table each time I went.

The staff is super friendly - we celebrated a friend’s birthday here and they even let us keep a cake we brought in their fridge until we were ready to eat it 💕

reviews.author: Ben
reviews.text: This place is a hidden gem for Northeastern Chinese BBQ! The grilled eggplant and beef skewers are must-tries — smoky, tender, and packed with flavor. I also loved the iron pot beef and spicy peanuts, both perfect with a cold beer. Friendly staff and great late-night vibes — perfect spot for gatherings or a casual meal!

reviews.author: Jeremy Gu
reviews.text: We ordered 7 lamb skewers — excellent flavor and perfectly grilled, very much in the authentic Northern Chinese style. Highly recommended for anyone craving that regional taste.

reviews.author: Yusi
reviews.text:
Great Chinese style charcoal barbecue, tasting exactly like I had before back in China.
Meat, seafood and tofu / veggie choices are all pretty good. We were particularly impressed by the lamb skewer and the tofu.
Fully supportive of a trendy new restaurant in the city! Thank you for doing this~ much needed

reviews.author: Donna Kim
reviews.text:
I had high expectations for this place, and it completely delivered. I went with a friend who used to live in northern China, and they were impressed by how authentic it was—they absolutely loved it. The variety of skewers was great, and every single one was delicious.

The restaurant is spacious with plenty of seating, making it perfect for groups. The staff were incredibly friendly, and the food was fresh and full of flavor. I’m already looking forward to trying the mala xiang guo on my next visit.

The only drawback is the parking—you have to park on the street, so finding a spot can be a bit challenging. Other than that, everything was fantastic, and I highly recommend it!

testimonials:
A great casual and affordable place for delicious skewers! Can’t go wrong with cumin lamb, but their mushroom skewers are also delicious. It’s not hard to get a table each time I went.

The staff is super friendly - we celebrated a friend’s birthday here and they even let us keep a cake we brought in their fridge until we were ready to eat it 💕

I also loved the iron pot beef and spicy peanuts, both perfect with a cold beer. Friendly staff and great late-night vibes — perfect spot for gatherings or a casual meal!
We ordered 7 lamb skewers — excellent flavor and perfectly grilled, very much in the authentic Northern Chinese style. Highly recommended for anyone craving that regional taste.

top_10.name: Mr Szechuan
top_10.address: 890 Taraval St, San Francisco, CA 94116, USA

reviews.author: Elaine L
reviews.text: One of my favorite spots for Sichuan food. I come here several times a month when I’m craving mala dry pot. Their super dry pot is my favorite and the portions are big enough for two. Their boiled fish is also really tasty. Perfect numbing spice flavor. Service is fast and friendly. Another plus - this place is open late until 1AM!

reviews.author: Mark Anthony Relon
reviews.text: Marvelous staff. Very considerate. VERY very good food. Only took pictures of house fried rice, but got popcorn chicken, hot and sour soup, chive dumplings, cucumber salad, and tomato and egg soup

reviews.author: Amber Guan
reviews.text: My regular spot! The food is delicious and the spice is authentic. The owner provides excellent, friendly service. Highly recommend！

reviews.author: Randy Poon
reviews.text:
Honestly, all of the food we ordered was delicious.

- The cucumber was crunchy and flavorful.
- Spicy wonton was bursting of flavor
- The onion pancake was super crispy

reviews.author: Cherry Than
reviews.text: The dry pot was amazing, big portions where you can choose 4 veggie and 3 meats. The best part was also the chili wontons, had a deep peanut flavour that worked well to cut the spice. Plenty of tables inside and good for big groups, can’t wait to try their non spicy dry pot next time!

testimonials: One of my favorite spots for Sichuan food. I come here several times a month when I’m craving mala dry pot. Their super dry pot is my favorite and the portions are big enough for two. Their boiled fish is also really tasty. Perfect numbing spice flavor. Service is fast and friendly. Another plus - this place is open late until 1AM!
Marvelous staff. Very considerate. VERY very good food. Only took pictures of house fried rice, but got popcorn chicken, hot and sour soup, chive dumplings, cucumber salad, and tomato and egg soup
My regular spot! The food is delicious and the spice is authentic. The owner provides excellent, friendly service. Highly recommend！

top_10.address: 606 Broadway, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Gioa cchino (Gioacchino)
reviews.text: I came to San Francisco from Boston. This was our first time visiting San Francisco and several people recommended 606 and they were right. There were a lot of locals inside eating there so we knew that was a great sign. The food was delicious and the people were great. I can't wait to come back. This is such a beautiful city.

reviews.author: C Tang
reviews.text: We've been eating at this restaurant since its soft opening. The food is delicious, and ingredients are fresh. Alvin and Eugene treat us well each time we come to dine-in or order take-out. On our most recent visit, we ordered the pot stickers, garlic noodles, beef chow fun, and salt & pepper fish. Very tasty! We consider 606 Restaurant to be one of our go-to destinations.

reviews.author: Chethan B
reviews.text: Authentic Chinese flavors at 606! Loved the apple wine, Hong Kong tea, crispy salt and pepper chicken wings, and tasty chow mein noodles. Staff were super nice and polite. A great spot in SFO for a flavorful, satisfying meal. Will definitely return!

reviews.author: Carolyn Pisecki
reviews.text: We had dinner here and the food & service was great! The staff was friendly and fast. Lots of great variety on the menu. We had Simon’s garlic chicken, crispy egg rolls and honey walnut prawns — all were delicious! The atmosphere is cute and clean! Would definitely be back.

reviews.author: Brent Enriquez
reviews.text:
Food was just ok. Bbq pork ribs was a bit basic. Honey walnut prawns could be crisper (good flavor though). Beef stew noodle soup was more soup based instead of a stew that I was expecting, it's pretty light. Fried tofu with shrimp was also just ok, a bit plain and the sauce was nothing special. The mandarin beef a bit too sweet. Serving sizes were pretty reasonable for the price.

The service is great, they did well to get our order pretty fast and also talk about in detail what some dishes are. They also gave recommendations.

The restaurant is pretty modern and clean

testimonials: I came to San Francisco from Boston. This was our first time visiting San Francisco and several people recommended 606 and they were right. There were a lot of locals inside eating there so we knew that was a great sign. The food was delicious and the people were great. I can't wait to come back. This is such a beautiful city.

We've been eating at this restaurant since its soft opening. The food is delicious, and ingredients are fresh. Alvin and Eugene treat us well each time we come to dine-in or order take-out. On our most recent visit, we ordered the pot stickers, garlic noodles, beef chow fun, and salt & pepper fish. Very tasty! We consider 606 Restaurant to be one of our go-to destinations.

Authentic Chinese flavors at 606! Loved the apple wine, Hong Kong tea, crispy salt and pepper chicken wings, and tasty chow mein noodles. Staff were super nice and polite. A great spot in SFO for a flavorful, satisfying meal. Will definitely return!

top_10.name: San Tung
top_10.address: 1031 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Amy
reviews.text:
My group arrived there around 5pm and it was packed. However, the wait wasn’t too bad and we ended up waiting about 15 minutes.

Service was fast and efficient. There was a total of 3 people including myself in the group and we ordered the string beans, Mongolian beef, black bean noodles, and chicken wings. My boyfriend was going to order more, but the server stopped him to say that the items we ordered was enough! Thankfully, we listened to him and stopped ordering because we had leftovers after! Food came out quickly.

This spot is a must try!!! The chicken wings had a perfect texture; crispy and airy on the outside, and warm and soft on the inside. The sauce on those wings are chef’s kiss! The black bean noodles had a bit of beef, shrimp, and squid in it.  The string beans and Mongolian beef were also very tasty.

I will definitely be coming back for more!

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: Best chicken wings in town! Super recommend their string beans and sour soup as well. They get busy, don't take reservations and wait times can be pretty long. Best time to check it out is weekday lunch time. Usually no wait. Even with the wait, highly recommend them. Although they have improved a lot in the past few years, just don't expect much in terms of service. Flag a server when they are passing by and make your request.

reviews.author: Hilda Liu
reviews.text: We came here on a weekend afternoon. The line was super long and we waited about an hour before getting in. The servers were very nice and fast. We had to sit on a big table with someone else, but that wasn’t an issue. They were able to recognize the dishes even though we sat together. The interior looks like a typical old Chinese restaurant, but you can tell that it was cleaned and taken care of. The food was served very fast and fresh. It’s crispy and just seasoned correctly and authentic. The price is so cheap considering the inflation. It’s popular for a reason. We ended up taking out a lot because we ordered too much. The portion was so big.

reviews.author: Anirud Pande
reviews.text:
I visited San Tung on a Sunday afternoon around 1:30 PM, and the place was packed. We had to wait about 45 minutes for a table. The atmosphere inside was lively and a bit loud, but judging by the crowd both waiting outside and dining in, it's clear the food is well-loved.

We ordered the original dry fried chicken wings, which were delicious. They were perfectly crispy with a sweet and spicy flavor. I noticed that when you take them to go and reheat them, the spice comes through even more.

We also tried the dry black bean sauce noodles, and they really stood out. The flavor was bold and intense in the best way, and the dish was loaded with seafood like shrimp, calamari, and scallops. I really liked it.

Overall, it was a great experience and definitely worth the wait.

reviews.author: Amanda Ba
reviews.text: We got takeout to eat outside in the nice weather right before they ended their lunch shift. The wings are as good as everyone says they are. Crispy and flavorful sauce. The black bean noodles are packed with seafood and meat. The hot and sour soup is perfectly balanced and peppery with lots of high quality ingredients. Overall very impressed with their execution of chinese American classics, the flavors are top notch.

top_10.name: Harborview Restaurant & Bar
top_10.address: Street Level Drumm &, Four Embarcadero Center, Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Barbara Perez España Lara
reviews.text: It might be a dish I do not know about but please don't freak out by the dead fish and suspicious ecosystem growing in the water tank in the corridor to access the restaurant because the worst is yet to come. Firstly, the costumer service is below decent standards given that the waiters didn't understand the concept of being friendly or polite, there was also a waiter that seemed to have a cold and wanted to demosntrate it to all of us. The atmosphere was chaotic and loud. Lastly, the food was what we call "decent" some sauces are surpises because you can't really descifer what they contain and the fried food is near to tasteless.

reviews.author: Mark Dennis
reviews.text: Lovely day to sit outside on the balcony for a really nice meal. Food came quickly and was really good quality. No MSG in the food that we could detect which is a bonus. Great job girls and guys!

reviews.author: Benishay Danny
reviews.text:
In one word, Awesome.
superb restaurant, great and authentic service, extremely tasty food, resemble to the food I ate in China. will clearly come back. We were party of four and tasted from large variety. ended up with $110 per couple including tax and tip.
Be aware that the restau is crowded in the evenings

reviews.author: Sayana
reviews.text: Visited this restaurant today for dim sum, and it was a solid experience. The food was delicious, fresh, and flavorful. The service was just okay—nothing exceptional, but it got the job done. The atmosphere was incredibly busy, with a packed restaurant and a lively crowd. A nice bonus was the unexpected $50 voucher for the next visit, which made the experience even better. Overall, a good spot for dim sum, but be prepared for the hustle and bustle!

reviews.author: Lets Go
reviews.text: Was happy to find both Hong Kong and Shanghai style dumplings in one restaurant. The Xiao long bao and  the Siu Mai were wonderful and reminded me why I like Asian flavours. The Xiao long bao came with its own cookie container making it easy to enjoy. The Siu Yak (pork Belly) was wonderful. The skin was ultra crispy. The mustard with it was sharp and added to the wholeness of the dish. The beans with the pork mince were absolutely delightful. The beans were crisp, salty and yum. Could survive on them. The signature beef was tender but too sweet for my liking. The seafood fried rice could be a whole meal and didn’t need anything else with it. The restaurant is large and can be a bit noisy, but that added to the atmosphere. Should have gone with a larger group so that could have sampled more of the menu. Will be back.

testimonials: It might be a dish I do not know about but please don't freak out by the dead fish and suspicious ecosystem growing in the water tank in the corridor to access the restaurant because the worst is yet to come. Firstly, the costumer service is below decent standards given that the waiters didn't understand the concept of being friendly or polite, there was also a waiter that seemed to have a cold and wanted to demosntrate it to all of us. The atmosphere was chaotic and loud. Lastly, the food was what we call "decent" some sauces are surpises because you can't really descifer what they contain and the fried food is near to tasteless.

Be aware that the restau is crowded in the evenings

top_10.name: Himalayan Cuisine SF
top_10.address: 1412 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Andrea
reviews.text:
I recently had my first dining experience at Himalayan Cuisine SF, and I’m already planning my next visit. From the moment I walked in, the warm and friendly atmosphere made me feel welcome, setting the tone for a truly memorable meal.

The food was absolutely flavorful — each and every bite bursting with authentic spices and rich, comforting taste. There’s a wide variety of dishes to choose from, making it easy for anyone to find something they’ll love, whether you're a meat lover or prefer vegetarian options. I especially appreciated how affordable everything was, considering the generous portions and high quality of ingredients.

What really stood out was how deeply the experience immersed me in Nepali culture — from the traditional decor to the thoughtfully crafted menu. This is more than just a meal; it’s a cultural experience that transports you straight to the Himalayas.

The service was excellent, too. The staff was kind, attentive, and eager to explain dishes to a first-timer like me.

If you’re in San Francisco and want a delicious, authentic, and affordable culinary adventure, Himalayan Cuisine SF is a must-do.

Thanks to Bishow for taking us to the Himalayan Cuisine.

reviews.author: Angela S
reviews.text: I had the steamed chicken momo (my first time), and they were tasty. Service was excellent—very friendly and even gave me chai & mango lassi (not pictured) on the house! Was a great way to return back to SF after a long day of travel.

reviews.author: Holly Park
reviews.text: An amazing and friendly service. They are such a gem to have in a nice neighborhood. The environment and ambiance is so peaceful and the food is bursting with flavor that will really encapsulate your senses. Thankfully it’s fairly close to so many bus lines so it’s easily a great stop for a memorable meal. A complimentary tea for those who can be experiencing an making time.

reviews.author: Raj Padhi
reviews.text: We had ordered lamb saag and chicken korma. Chicken korma was OK. Lamb itself was good but the saag it sauce was very salty. We decided to take it home and cook it a bit more with some potato to dilute the salt taste.

reviews.author: Sachin Pandit
reviews.text: Amazing food here! Loved the service and the authenticity of the place. 10/10 would recommend for a place to eat

top_10.name: Nepa Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 507 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: Very good food, the service was also polite. Super recommend their Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan! This place gets VERY busy at night, not sure if they take reservations, but you might consider it. They also stay open late, which is amazing!!

reviews.author: Benjamin Lague
reviews.text: I had a great lunch at Nepa! Lots of vegetarian options and I was happily surprised by the flavor of the Jeera Aloo. Very yummy! Excited to come back again and try more.

reviews.author: Michael Cooke
reviews.text:
Nice casual environment. Food was incredible, over ordered to the point of scared. The Hot is perfectly spiced, I debated going higher but what am I trying to prove?
- lamb biryani
- chicken Tikka masala
- garlic naan
- Momo's

Momo's we're incredible, a surprise highlight on top of a delicious meal.

reviews.author: Preeti Joshi
reviews.text: The best food we have had in SF. Stumbled upon this restaurant on our visit to the Alamo square. It was a foggy evening and we ordered Momos, Chowmein. Everything we ordered was Amazing. The Gulab jamun was lip smacking. Ended the meal with masala chai. Not jut the food but the service was exceptional . Do give this place a try and you won’t regret it.

reviews.author: Aspi Siganporia
reviews.text:
Limited seating, super packed. Decor is neat. Several restaurants are claiming Nepali and indian. That might be for the few dishes on the menu. Otherwise very much an Indian restaurant.
Long menu. Bhindi and Vegetable chilli were good. We asked for extra sauce, they gave it in a separate bowl. Good service.
Kadhai paneer was not correct. There was one piece of bell pepper :) it was paneer with tomato gravy.
I suggest they keep paneer pieces small and cook it short period on low heat, so it is soft.

Naan and rotis were good. Paneer pakora and gobi manchurian in appetizers were fresh and tasty. We ordered fried momos. I would instead stay with steamed. Fried covering got hard and chewy

All in all, good experience.

testimonials: Very good food, the service was also polite. Super recommend their Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan! This place gets VERY busy at night, not sure if they take reservations, but you might consider it. They also stay open late, which is amazing!!
I had a great lunch at Nepa! Lots of vegetarian options and I was happily surprised by the flavor of the Jeera Aloo. Very yummy! Excited to come back again and try more.

- lamb biryani
- chicken Tikka masala
- garlic naan
- Momo's

Momo's we're incredible, a surprise highlight on top of a delicious meal.

top_10.name: Diwali Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1499 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Jack Space
reviews.text:
Amal went above and beyond — incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help. If you're unsure what to order, definitely ask for Amal. He’ll guide you based on your preferences and give you thoughtful recommendations.

I recently discovered this new restaurant, and it instantly became a favorite — especially for one standout dish: Chicken 65.

Chicken 65 at this place is the best of all restaurants that I’ve tried in all of San Francisco and San Jose. Tastes exactly like the original version from Chennai, South India. Bravo to the Chef for bringing back the true authentic taste. Chicken 65 is not spicy, it’s mild and can taste the Flavors better. Masala Dosa is a 10/10.

The restaurant itself is clean and welcoming — a perfect place for both quick bites and relaxed meals.

If you're on the hunt for authentic South Indian flavors in the Bay Area, look no further.

Here’s what I Ordered:
Chicken 65 (vibrant red, mild spicy)
Masala Dosa (has stuffed potatoes)
Mango Lassi Drink (cool, refreshing, and not overly sweet)

Restroom ✨💖
Never seen such a clean Restroom, that speaks high attention to detail. Extremely clean, super impressed how spotless they've cared for this place.

reviews.author: Kumudika Pandey
reviews.text:
Best Indian food I’ve had in SF in a while. Delicious food with amazing service. Highly recommend supporting this family run business!

This is the same spot as Dosa Corner, just under new ownership. The service was amazing and the interior was cozy. The owners were so sweet and attentive, both helped us out with choosing what to order. They recently opened this restaurant and were open to hear any feedback from us on how they can improve their service. They even offered us dessert (halwa) on the house!

We ordered a masala dosa and chicken biryani for two. The portion sizing was so big that we had enough leftovers for lunch the next day! The masala dosa was very good and tasted quite authentic. The biryani and raita was another highlight.

This is definitely going to be one of my regular spots!

reviews.author: Ale Vale
reviews.text: We love Indian food, this restaurant with new owner have some of the best home made genuine fresh flavors I have ever tasted. We truly hit gem here. Every dish is prepared with so much care and the flavors are amazing. Unique, fresh and authentic. Probably the very best Indian restaurant in the mission district so far. Our pictures don't give justice also because we took them after we ate some of the  food already... One of the best chicken biryani, tasty paneer appetizer, amazing chai, fish curry.... Veggie curry was amazing too. Different from any curry I tasted

reviews.author: Kevin Pinto
reviews.text: Pardon the half-eaten food pictures - we were absolutely starving. Stumbled upon this humble place via Yelp and decided to check it out. As an Indian, I hold a super high bar for Indian food in town and can vouch for this restaurant being authentic hands down. Was so happy to see the gigantic Mysore Dosa (typically similar size back home). The chutney and Rasam soup were incredible, and the potato feeling was just perfect - not too wet / nor cooked with too much spices. The Tandoor pomfret was actually pomfret as compared to most restaurants serving you Pompano fish. I think the fish could've been marinated for longer, but the taste of the tandoor and the fish were so fresh. My friends and I absolutely loved the food. The owners are super kind and checkin on you to see if they can make your food experience any more comfortable. The service was quick and all of the ingredients were super fresh. A solid 9.5/10 for me. Definitely stopping by again!

reviews.author: Nandu Ramani
reviews.text: Went there because of the higher ratings. More like a hole in wall rather than an upscale setting. But the food was great. The main chef is from Karur and another chef from Tanjavur. Their sambar was fresh and authentic. We had medu vada which was made fresh as opposed to refried. We had the paneer burji dosa which my son loved and I had the Mysore masala dosa. The coconut chutney was a little water for my taste. He also offered additional chutney. The fresh hot papad in the beginning was very nice!  If you are in the area highly recommend it. There seems to be decent amount of street parking nearby but it is paid parking since it is SF!

top_10.name: Trisara
top_10.address: 211 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: 한승수
reviews.text: My Nepal friend Jiwan served the most delicious Indian food with kindness. I really love this delicious curry with rice and nan! Additionally, the tanduri chicken was delicious, too! My friend Jiwan is kind and professional in treating customers. I will visit there soon to eat Indian curry! My friend Jiwan thank you. :)

reviews.author: R M
reviews.text: What does one do after cocktails, soak up the booze with some solid grub.  Tirsara came to help, especially on a windy cool SF night.  You walk into Trisara and you get the home cooking smell in the air.  It's nothing fancy, yet the food does the talking, the service is lovely and the prices just right.  Love their naan, the lamb biryani, the okra , the tandoori all yummy . Simple dishes cooked right leaving you with a smile and a happy belly.

reviews.author: Prakash Budha
reviews.text: I tried lamb Biryani & garlic naan and it was pretty good. The owners were very friendly even offered me a cup of tea. If you want to try indo/Nepalese cuisine while in San Francisco give it a try. Its also centrally loacated in downtown San Francisco.

reviews.author: padmalochan singh
reviews.text: Soul food. If you are craving for something simple and home style food after a long day .. I would recommend this place for sure .. they have other options but I was traveling and it’s a Monday and was looking forward something simple and not too much spicy and they served me the right flavors to my pallet !!!

reviews.author: Kumar Vaibhav
reviews.text:
This place deserves 5 star and I have good reasons for it. It is a Nepalese place but you will find the menu pretty similar to Indian. So what's the difference - it is how Nepalese food is made. I tried the Spinach chicken and I can totally feel authentic Nepalese taste. More turmeric, slightly higher salt, super soft chicken likely cooked in cooker with more liquidy gravy topped with generous amount of cilantro. All very typical of Nepalese style of cooking.

Even the Mango Lassi was pretty solid - felt fresh and not going sour whatsoever.

If there was anything which was a little underwhelming - it was the Aloo Paratha. It was good but it was made like Bihari/Nepali style. If you are expecting Punjabi style paratha - you will be disappointed.

Ambience is ordinary but given the place is located in SF downtown, I won't complain.

testimonials: My Nepal friend Jiwan served the most delicious Indian food with kindness. I really love this delicious curry with rice and nan! Additionally, the tanduri chicken was delicious, too! My friend Jiwan is kind and professional in treating customers. I will visit there soon to eat Indian curry! My friend Jiwan thank you. :)

top_10.name: Yarsa Nepalese & Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1310 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Lisa
reviews.text:
We enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Yarsa Nepalese yesterday. Parking can be challenging yet doable.
The interior is nicely done with Nepalese decor on the walls.
I had the cashew cream curry with medium heat- delicious! My friend ordered the ginger curry and we decided this one had the most flavor. My other friend had the Saag paneer with lamb and found it tasty.  We only ordered one rice and shared it, and still had some left,  and the garlic naan was absolutely perfect. It was crispy and soft at the same time and full of flavor.
Our server was sweet and accommodating.  I will definitely return next time I’m in the area to try other dishes.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.text: It was my first time there, and I really liked the dish that looked like a pizza. The red curry sauce was really good. However, I wasn’t a fan of the dumplings—the skin was too thick, and the filling was a bit too salty. Overall, the rest of the food was okay not surprisingly good.

reviews.author: Vijay Karthik
reviews.text:
Wow. We originally planned to go to another indian restaurant. Ended up walking extra 8 mins to Yarsa.
Polite staff. Order was well cooked and flavor was amazing.

No cushion on the chairs. That would be the only concern but we were able to manage.

This is a Nepalese restaurant. Similar to indian cuisine.

reviews.author: Tereza H.
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! Top-notch Indian and Nepalese dishes bursting with flavor. The staff are incredibly friendly, and the cozy atmosphere makes the whole experience even better. Prices are very reasonable for the quality you get. I’d 100% recommend this place to anyone who enjoys this type of cuisine!

reviews.author: Allison Vennerberg
reviews.text: Jomsom Cauliflower stole the show, but everything we tried was decent. Prices and portions are reasonable.

testimonials:
We enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Yarsa Nepalese yesterday. Parking can be challenging yet doable.
The interior is nicely done with Nepalese decor on the walls.
I had the cashew cream curry with medium heat- delicious! My friend ordered the ginger curry and we decided this one had the most flavor. My other friend had the Saag paneer with lamb and found it tasty.  We only ordered one rice and shared it, and still had some left,  and the garlic naan was absolutely perfect. It was crispy and soft at the same time and full of flavor.
Our server was sweet and accommodating.  I will definitely return next time I’m in the area to try other dishes.

It was my first time there, and I really liked the dish that looked like a pizza. The red curry sauce was really good. However, I wasn’t a fan of the dumplings—the skin was too thick, and the filling was a bit too salty. Overall, the rest of the food was okay not surprisingly good.

Wow. We originally planned to go to another indian restaurant. Ended up walking extra 8 mins to Yarsa.
Polite staff. Order was well cooked and flavor was amazing.

No cushion on the chairs. That would be the only concern but we were able to manage.

This is a Nepalese restaurant. Similar to indian cuisine.

top_10.name: Cuisine of Nepal Restaurant
top_10.address: 3486 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Claire Follis
reviews.text: This spot is truly an all time SF favorite for us. The owner and his family run the place and always make you feel at home. Every dish I’ve had is incredible. We bring our visitors here and when they come back to the city they always request to go again. If you’re looking for your new local favorite, Cuisine of Nepal will not disappoint.

reviews.author: Sigrun Payne
reviews.text: The food is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is very cozy. The owner came and talked to us and offered us free wine as it was our first time in. Service is excellent. Highly, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Rachel Ames
reviews.text: Both the food and the hospitality at this lovely restaurant are amazing. I am absolutely thrilled that Cuisine of Nepal is back open, and it is just as wonderful as it has always been. I love the momos and the spicy sauce served with them. My favorite entree is the Tofu Takari - everything I’ve tried there has been great, though, so lots of great options. One of my favorite restaurants in the city - highly recommend!

reviews.author: Stephen Matzat
reviews.text: Fantastic experience on all levels - this was my best dining experience in several years. The food was ultra flavorful and the meat (lamb, chicken, and salmon) were all perfectly tender. The staff was courteous and generous. As far as pricing goes, we felt like we time-warped back 5 years. $15 bottle of wine at a restaurant seems unheard of, and food prices were also reasonable. We got a plate of momo and 3 main dishes for 4 people and this was a perfect amount of food. We will most certainly be coming back and we hope to see you there!

reviews.author: martin hamilton
reviews.text: I have ordered from here for years and love this place so much. The food is lovingly made with high-quality ingredients and the staff is beyond kind and caring. I just called and the outgoing message says that they are reopening on June 28! Can’t wait!

testimonials: This spot is truly an all time SF favorite for us. The owner and his family run the place and always make you feel at home. Every dish I’ve had is incredible. We bring our visitors here and when they come back to the city they always request to go again. If you’re looking for your new local favorite, Cuisine of Nepal will not disappoint.

I love the momos and the spicy sauce served with them. My favorite entree is the Tofu Takari - everything I’ve tried there has been great, though, so lots of great options. One of my favorite restaurants in the city - highly recommend!

top_10.name: Sewa Nepalese and Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 815 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Pamela L
reviews.text:
The restaurant is in the Richmond Area of SF - between 9th and 10th Avenues. You can easily walk/pass the restaurant - there's no frontal or sidewalk signage. Once inside the restaurant it's quiet.  The waiter supplied superb service - wanting to please, ensuring your meal is perfect, proud of its dishes, friendly and outgoing.

Since these countries are know for their lambs and goats, we ordered a dish of each plus complementing it with side dishes; calamari pakora and chicken tikka masala momo.  All were served with just the amount of spices.  The main dishes - the sauce was thick and delicious, especially the apricot lamb. Normally, other restaurants that I ate at, their sauces where thinly thick with oil seen.   I would definitely recommend any of the apricot dishes. You won't be disappointed.  The chicken tikka masala momo is enough as a full meal. It taste better with rice. Calamari pakora I did not like.  Somehow it was not what I expected.

There were two types of Indian desserts; almond kheer and gulam jamun.  Almond kheer is usually made with almonds, sugar, saffron, cardamoms and whole milk.  Somehow, I did not taste all the ingredients.  It was lacking something and wasn't flavorful.  It was like an ordinary rice pudding. Gulam jamun was not soaked nor soggy as other restaurants.  It was just right to compliment my meal. It comes with three balls.

reviews.author: Vivek Diwade
reviews.text: Sewa in San Francisco quickly became a family favorite for us. My mom and dad loved the delicious Indian dishes and were especially impressed by the friendly, attentive service. We are already planning our next visit—highly recommended for a memorable dining experience!

reviews.author: komal dulgach
reviews.text: I ordered delivery from this place and was quite pleased. The chicken tikka momo was delicious, with a mild and creamy sauce that complemented the flavor perfectly. The chili chicken was good, but the vegetable chowmein was a bit bland for my taste. However, the portion sizes were generous and satisfying.

reviews.author: E Lee
reviews.text: Came here for an early dinner and we’re seated promptly. Samosa was good. Butter naan was one of the better ones we’ve had recently. Daal and chicken tikka were also very good. Tandoori chicken was standard. Lamb kebab was a bit dry for me but paired well with the house made yogurt. The rice pudding was not too sweet but spiced well.

reviews.author: Vince Maguire
reviews.text:
Brilliant spot for dinner.

A little heat, a little sweet, a lot of spice and flavors just right.  This spot has it all.

The service was attentive, professional and informative.

Ordered the momo (dumplings) and they were amazing!  The matter paneer and the apricot chicken had a great balance of spice.  Rice and naan rounded out a perfect meal.

Go.  Enjoy.

100% would go back.

top_10.name: Om Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1668 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Natasha Bartolome
reviews.text:
THE BEST GLUTEN FREE GARLIC NAAN OF ALL THE LAND!!!

Oh my…this place is a GODSEND for us gluten intolerant people! (Celiac here) Finally able to have garlic naan after so many years. It was glorious, especially paired with some butter chicken. Not to mention, majority of the menu is GF friendly! The salmon pakora was a nice surprise, super flavorful & interesting texture! The free papadam with the sweet sauce reminded me of fried wonton and sweet/sour sauce, which I also haven’t had in ages. I don’t think I need to tell you this, but do not skip out on the mango lassi!!! Yes it is neon orange but it’s their homemade recipe using Kesar mangoes! It’s got right balance between sweet, tangy, and tart. Perfect pairing to calm the spice ☺️

Everything was absolutely divine and well-priced. We even ordered a GF pesto garlic naan to take home, so worth. Servers were graciously nice and attentive. Ambiance—my only complaint was the front of the restaurant kind of smelled like cat pee 😅 thankfully there is a quaint dining room in the back, tucked away from that/the street!

Regardless, I would bring all my friends here. Staff was super friendly and accommodating to the couples and large groups dining in, and the menu is super inclusive. I appreciate establishments like Om Indian and I would definitely travel to eat it. Such a special place to me/us GF eaters!!

reviews.author: Joshua Yuan
reviews.text:
Not busy on a random night and got seated. Interior is a bit weird but it's ok (we were seated in some hallway next to the bathrooms...)

Food was good and didn't take too long. Very appetizing. Would come back when I'm in the area and cravd Indian food.

reviews.author: Patricia Segovia
reviews.text: Such an underrated spot! Went in for just a quick bite but ended up ordering more food because it was just that good. 🤩 Got the chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, a paneer dish, chicken tandoori, garlic naan and laasi! All four of us in our party agreed that it was one of the top 3 meals we had during our 3 week trip to the US. 👏 Wish I took more photos of the food but we devoured everything so fast 😅

reviews.author: bhumi patel
reviews.text: Allwin and his team provided very good customers service and food was really awesome. Me and my mom enjoyed great time together. It’s my first time here in San Francisco and I really appreciate and love the food. He also makes sure that my food is special and spicy as I requested. I’ll definitely recommend it to anyone 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.author: sarah halversen
reviews.text: Food, service, and vibes: awesome. We got the butter chicken, a vegan potato and eggplant curry dish, garlic naan, and a ton of complementary papadam. All was delectable. I’m unsure what I was expecting ordering the margarita, but i like what I tasted. Can’t complain. Shoutout to the kings at OM ❤️

top_10.name: Sunset Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 642 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Amy Waya
reviews.text: the food was amazing here! we got the chicken chilli and the salmon curry and both were well cooked and flavorful. service was really good! this might just be my new spot for indian

reviews.author: komarisetty supritha
reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at this Indian restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious — we ordered the Hurricane Veg Momo, Garlic Naan, and Shahi Paneer, and everything was bursting with flavour. My favourite is hurricane momo. The portions were generous, making it great value for the price. Service was impressively fast, and the prices were very reasonable. Totally worth the visit — highly recommend for anyone craving authentic and satisfying Indian food!

reviews.author: Nazim Khan
reviews.text: I ordered from this restaurant after being disappointed with another restaurant nearby this one. I have to say that the food was a big difference than what I got from the other place last night. Both the chicken vindaloo and the jeera aloo were very good. For dessert I ordered the Kheer Rice Pudding and Gulab Jamun. The Gulab Jamun was very soft and okay but definitely could be way better. It was edible but I wouldn't jump up to order it again. The Kheer Rice Pudding was okay as well but I would only order again if nothing else is opened.

reviews.author: Kapil Pundhir
reviews.text:
Sunset Indian Cuisine - A True Gem for Indian Food in San Francisco

If you’re craving authentic Indian flavors, look no further than Sunset Indian Cuisine in San Francisco. This place delivers an incredible dining experience, combining fresh ingredients, bold spices, and a welcoming ambiance.

Food Highlights:
•	The naan here is exceptional – freshly baked, soft, and perfect for scooping up their rich curries.
•	The samosas are crispy on the outside, with a perfectly spiced and flavorful filling.
•	Their lamb biryani is an absolute must-try. It’s fragrant, tender, and generously portioned – a delight for any biryani lover.

In all honesty, everything on the menu is outstanding. The dishes are prepared with care, balancing authentic Indian spices and flavors to perfection. Whether you’re a fan of vegetarian options or prefer hearty meat dishes, you’ll find something to love here.

Service and Ambiance:
The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you feel at home while enjoying your meal. The cozy ambiance makes it an excellent spot for family dinners, date nights, or casual outings with friends.

Overall:
Sunset Indian Cuisine is a standout among Indian restaurants in San Francisco. With its fresh, flavorful food and impeccable service, it’s a place you’ll want to return to again and again. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Quazi Abir Hassan Roddur
reviews.text: Very good food items. I eat the chicken biriyani. It was delicious. The amount of food is also good. More than enough for one person. My friends took Karai chicken, tandoori chicken, garlic nan and soup. Those things were also yummy. The sweetmeat were very very good. They were made by themselves. The behavior of the restaurant owner and the personnel are very polite and helpful. I personally recommend this restaurant in SF. (But unfortunately, I forgot to take the picture of the foods)

testimonials: the food was amazing here! we got the chicken chilli and the salmon curry and both were well cooked and flavorful. service was really good! this might just be my new spot for indian

We had a fantastic experience at this Indian restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious — we ordered the Hurricane Veg Momo, Garlic Naan, and Shahi Paneer, and everything was bursting with flavour. My favourite is hurricane momo. The portions were generous, making it great value for the price. Service was impressively fast, and the prices were very reasonable. Totally worth the visit — highly recommend for anyone craving authentic and satisfying Indian food!

Both the chicken vindaloo and the jeera aloo were very good. For dessert I ordered the Kheer Rice Pudding and Gulab Jamun. The Gulab Jamun was very soft and okay but definitely could be way better. It was edible but I wouldn't jump up to order it again. The Kheer Rice Pudding was okay as well but I would only order again if nothing else is opened.

top_10.name: Noe Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 4166 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: E Lee
reviews.text: Came here without a reservation on a weekend for lunch. We were seated quickly. The samosas were really good. The breads were huge. The curries definitely packed heat. The ice cream cubes to top off the meal were cute, milky, and sweet.

reviews.author: Vilmos Szabo
reviews.text:
Came here to dine on a Friday evening with some friends. The food tasted very good, especially the garlic naan bread which we thoroughly enjoyed. The starters and the choices of curries was also plentiful.

The only downside was an unpleasant smell originating from the bathroom and the pretty long wait for the food to arrive.

reviews.author: Ian F.
reviews.text:
Very nice Indian food served reasonably well in a not great environment.

Really, the menu and food quality are a cut above the typical Indian restaurant in this price range. My only minor complaint is how loud and annoying the radio is (and it does appear to actually be a radio, complete with ads between the songs).

reviews.author: EJ Lee
reviews.text: Food was really good and staff were so kind. I will visit again soon!

reviews.author: Patrizia Arroyo
reviews.text: It was divine! Loved the food, I had  samosa, Paneer Tikki Masala with yes! Gigantic! Garlic naan, chai (you get free refills) and mango lassi. I will come back! I would take out every day if I would live here!

testimonials: Came here without a reservation on a weekend for lunch. We were seated quickly. The samosas were really good. The breads were huge. The curries definitely packed heat. The ice cream cubes to top off the meal were cute, milky, and sweet.

top_10.name: Cocina Mamá Cholita
top_10.address: 3471 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Auza Anaya
reviews.text:
I am first generation Mexican descent; this mole reminds me of my mom’s cooking.

It might be the best mole in sf.

I usually scan the names of google reviews to see if mexicans have reviewed the place; in this google review section, everyone is right: this place is tasty and authentic.

reviews.author: Drake Meaney
reviews.text:
Went last year and I rarely write reviews but this was so good. I dream about that mole.

Staff were very sweet, had us sample different sauces, and we were stuffed from a late lunch but still finished our entire plates.

Probably in my top 5 meals I’ve ever had, vibes were awesome. We were actually there when they got their sign installed! That mole is made with love and you can tell.

Actually have a picture of my meal hanging above my stove so I can see that plate every day. Much love to Cocina Mama Cholita❤️

reviews.author: Maggie Driggs
reviews.text:
Such high quality food. Gave us a free sample of the mole and chicken and some sauces w chips. The chicken was SO GOOD im a big fan, I don’t really even like meat, loved the green enchiladas some of the best I’ve had. The cheese on the beans were also great. Everything just tasted fresh and homemade. The staff was very inviting and kind as well.
The mole was more of the earthy type, which according to preference can be good or bad, I personally liked it
While the prices were high ish (18 for my enchilada) the quality of the food made it worth it
I recommend the enchiladas divorciadas bc u get to taste lots of flavors
Birria tacos were great but enchiladas were better

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.text: The mole here is incredible. I had the mole enchiladas with chicken and it blew my mind. The sopes and burrito were also really tasty. They gave us a free horchata flan because they were trying out a new recipe — it was delicious and thick. It’s a quiet, very clean, and super homey relaxed atmosphere. Definitely not a hole in a wall place, it feels very nicely put together and the owners care a lot about their food. The servers were super nice and helpful. Small family owned restaurant with great food that they put a lot of love into.

reviews.author: King Crimson
reviews.text: The quesadilla was delicious and the employees and atmosphere were very authentic and inviting. The service was great and the food came out quick, hot, and delicious.

top_10.name: La Oaxaqueña
top_10.address: 2128 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Priyanka Kapoor
reviews.text: Amazing salsa, mole sauce, soyrizo (vegetarian friendly)! Lip smacking delicious. I've been looking for a good mole sauce since the time I came back from Mexico City and I got closure after having the mole sauce here 🥹 delicious food! Portion size for enchiladas is huge and can be shared by two!

reviews.author: Warwick Harris
reviews.text: I read the reviews and all were glowing. I was only in town for 1 day and was craving proper tacos. This place exceeded expectations. Clearly pride was taken in the restaurant. Bright, colourful and exceptionally clean. Service was friendly and helpful and the food… OMG the chicken taco was the best I have ever had EVER. I got the deluxe one and it was so well balanced. I’ll be dreaming of these tacos until I return to SFO again

reviews.author: Anya Gupta
reviews.text: Awesome vibes and delicious, authentic, Oaxacan food. I got the veggie burrito with mole - totally fantastic. Staff is really warm, welcoming, and excited to share their culture and cuisine. New favorite spot in SF!

reviews.author: Nicole H
reviews.text: Delicious food. We got the enchiladas con mole, plátanos maduros, mango lime drink, and a pupusa. Everything’s was delicious including the rice and the beans. The restaurant itself is very welcoming and has a nice environment. I would definitely return.

reviews.author: Dilek Sahin
reviews.text: Amazingly delicious food! We got Tejate (toasted corn/cacao drink) and the special of the day, crab enchiladas with verde sauce, rice and beans. Both were fantastic and we would definitely come back again. Highly recommended.

testimonials: Amazing salsa, mole sauce, soyrizo (vegetarian friendly)! Lip smacking delicious. I've been looking for a good mole sauce since the time I came back from Mexico City and I got closure after having the mole sauce here 🥹 delicious food! Portion size for enchiladas is huge and can be shared by two!

I’ll be dreaming of these tacos until I return to SFO again

top_10.name: Papito
top_10.address: 1457 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Marc Arcibal
reviews.text: Great place to bring friends, family or even a date.  Most of the food and drinks my friends and I ordered were delicious. The only entree that I didn't enjoy was their fajitas, they were under seasoned and lacked flavor. Definitely have to order the calamari, that red sauce is soo good 😁. The Al Pastor torta was packed with flavor and the fried chicken nachos were different in a good and delicious way. Service was good, but keep in mind that the restaurant is on the small side so there may be a bit of a wait for larger parties. Definitely coming back again!

reviews.author: Pat Brosco
reviews.text: Chicken Fajitas (white meat) are outstanding!! And trust me on this one , I’ve been too hundreds of placing in search for good fajitas , and this one is definitely in my top 2 , try it try it. You will love it. Restaurant is located in a little funky neighbourhood, go and explore it.

reviews.author: William Fiset
reviews.text: Came in for a quick snack, and ordered some guac. Some of the worse guacamole I've had, IDK how you mess it up so bad. No salt, seasoning or flavor, just mush 🤢 Tastes just like store bought stuff that's been sitting around for weeks

reviews.author: Lucy Gonzalez
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this place enough! I live for Mexican food so I've tried many Mexican restaurants and this one takes the cake. The food was delicious, it was so rich in flavor. Everything we tried was really good, we were all impressed. We ate here twice during our 3-day stay in San Francisco. The staff was also very kind! We will be returning!

reviews.author: Omar Ramirez
reviews.text: Papito Restaurant offers delicious Mexican food, though I was disappointed to find they didn’t have a veggie torta, which is what I was looking for. I opted for the cheese enchiladas instead. The flavor was good, and I enjoyed my dinner. I hope that on my next visit, they will have more vegetarian options available.
