top_10.name: El Buen Comer
top_10.address: 3435 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Abdulla Jasem
reviews.text:
I was walking to this place and wanted to eat there but it was near closing time. I was reading some reviews while walking for tips. Some people say they make great mole, so I walked faster because I love mole. I have been constantly disappointed with some mole experiences around here, so I was keen on trying this one.

I got the chicken with red mole to go. I used their restroom and when I finished, my order was just ready. As expected from an efficient, no-frill Mexican kitchen. That was a positive sign.

Got home after about 3 hours. Took a bite from the now-cold mole and, wow, this is exactly what I was looking for. A complex, well-balanced mole (not that easy to find). It was kinda addictive and I finished half of my dish cold. The chicken was fine and not very tender and the tortilla was ok, but as a whole, it was a very satisfying dish, especially when you mix a little bit of black beans with the mole and chicken and eat it with the tortilla. Buen comer, indeed.

reviews.author: R M
reviews.text:
Decided to give this corner eatery a try for a quick lunch pit stop. Lunch in my book is quick sit, refuel and go concept unless I'm on vacation.
I like the interior of the place. Very charming and inviting. I grabbed a table and ordered two tacos.  One fish and one shrimp, some chips and salsa and that was it.  I can really comment on the chips, you can equal or better in any taqueria, the salsa was alright but certainly not a home made version.  The tacos, mmmm for my taste the fish was over fried and so was the shrimp.  Nice presentation but average in taste and flavor.  Oh well maybe I have to see if dinner fare pans out better.

reviews.author: Derek Heimlich
reviews.text:
The green mole with pork was absolutely stunning. I love moles and Mexican food in general and this was one of the best.  The handmade corn tortillas are excellent.
Wait staff was very helpful and accommodating, and it did not take long to get the food once our large party had ordered.  They also have very high quality tequilas, and use G4 tequila for their margaritas, which is impressive.
Definitely going there again.

reviews.author: Matthew
reviews.text:
Excellent food and the best mole I’ve had in SF. Loved the sweetness of the mole rojo and the chicken was perfectly cooked. Started with an absolutely delicious carnitas taco.

Definitely stop here for an incredible meal with an extremely friendly and helpful team.

reviews.author: Truc Vu
reviews.text: One of the green best moles I’ve ever had, so complex in flavors, cant wait to try the other moles. Also loved their hot sauce and tortillas.

top_10.name: Tacos El Patron SF
top_10.address: 1500 S Van Ness Ave #100, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Kevin Leong
reviews.text: Excellent birria and tacos. Come with good sides nopales, refried beans, onions and radish and 4 different sauces. A generous serving of chip and salsa. Birria taco is good and consome not too oily. The Al Pastor Tace very tasty, can't wait to try to other meats. I see they have shrimp and fish tacos - which I can't wait to try soon.

reviews.author: Teck Boon
reviews.text: One of the best tacos in San Francisco. Neighborhood is a little packed with cars along the streets and can be a bit hard to parking. Tacos are really good and they can fry the items a little longer and they come out really nice and crispy. The drinks are also really good. Worth a visit.

reviews.author: amanda lee
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic tacos. I think possibly the best I have found in the bay area. We were specifically looking for a place with good birria tacos for my teen to try, and they did not disappoint. On top of that, the pollo, asada, carnitas, and pescado tacos were all fabulous. The aqua fresca was also amazing. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Stephanie Lau
reviews.text: Birria tacos were amazing, highly rated for a reason! Every order of 2+ tacos comes with free sides, and chips were also complimentary. Unfortunately, tables were very sticky

reviews.author: Andy Bungert
reviews.text: mm mm MM! Absolutely delicious birria tacos, and the tomato salsa and chips that came with it were excellent as well! Of the 4 bottled sauces/salsa they bring over, the salsa Verde was the best by far. So so glad we found this spot!

testimonials: Excellent birria and tacos. Come with good sides nopales, refried beans, onions and radish and 4 different sauces. A generous serving of chip and salsa. Birria taco is good and consome not too oily. The Al Pastor Tace very tasty, can't wait to try to other meats. I see they have shrimp and fish tacos - which I can't wait to try soon.

top_10.name: Taqueria Los Mayas
top_10.address: 331 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: vanessa cortes
reviews.text: This has been a great experience. I brought my Mexican parents here and they loved it which is saying a lot. The workers were super nice and they even let my dad go wash his hands in the sink behind the counter when the bathroom was taken. A lot of seating space and the music was perfect volume not overwhelming!!

reviews.author: Saldana Masonry
reviews.text:
It's the bomb.
Get the cochinita burrito. You will love it.
Nice people. You get your food fast .
Good beer menu too. Good salsa.
I come here all the time I'm never disappointed.

reviews.author: Jon Atkins
reviews.text: Close, fast, friendly, variety, accommodating, great flavor, seasons, spice, if it’s not on the menu they’ll make it for you (shrimp enchiladas)!

reviews.author: Adamo Stivala
reviews.text: It’s average tacos, the wait was surprising long and the restaurant was half full. The tortilla chips were cold which was not great. Mole was good flavor however

reviews.author: Cory Counts
reviews.text:
Update: tried to enjoy my meal anyways until I saw pink chicken in mood and if you want to look at and say, "oh well, that's subjective", it's not. you can see white meat right next to the pink meat....

Honestly, good was mediocre at best. I order the mole. Should have known when I ordered that from a order and pay and then  go or sit down. I've had over 100 different mole dishes and some very impressive ones at that. This didn't even come close. The beans were literally some kind of paste mixed with water. It literally shines... and then 2 small fried tortillas. I didn't ask for them to be fried and I wasn't asked. Presentation was good though.

testimonials: This has been a great experience. I brought my Mexican parents here and they loved it which is saying a lot. The workers were super nice and they even let my dad go wash his hands in the sink behind the counter when the bathroom was taken. A lot of seating space and the music was perfect volume not overwhelming!!

top_10.name: Loló
top_10.address: 974 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: beyza simsekoglu
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing experience. The staff were so warm and friendly, and the food was incredibly fresh and delicious. I highly recommend it! The ceviche was super fresh and tasty, and the churros were unbelievably good!!

reviews.author: Tara Clapper
reviews.text: A fun Mexican restaurant with unique combinations. We enjoyed the guacamole, empanadas, fried avocado tacos, cauliflower tacos, and grilled broccolini and roasted beet tostadas. Lively atmosphere and interesting décor.

reviews.author: Maria Etessam
reviews.text:
The staff is on top of everything, they were super kind and welcoming.
The food was really enjoyable, would recommend the flautas particularly. Also, the starters can be taken as main dishes.
It was pretty packed so I'd recommend you to plan ahead & make a reservation!

reviews.author: Alli McDermott
reviews.text: Super fun Mission spot. Taco tropical is not to miss and ceviche is amazing as well. Service top notch- will so be coming back!!

reviews.author: Oksanna Kasoyan
reviews.text: I was so impressed by the way the restaurant was decorated. Super colorful and the atmosphere was cozy. The food was great too. I’m glad I made a reservation because it got really busy after they opened at 5:30.

testimonials: Absolutely amazing experience. The staff were so warm and friendly, and the food was incredibly fresh and delicious. I highly recommend it! The ceviche was super fresh and tasty, and the churros were unbelievably good!!

A fun Mexican restaurant with unique combinations. We enjoyed the guacamole, empanadas, fried avocado tacos, cauliflower tacos, and grilled broccolini and roasted beet tostadas. Lively atmosphere and interesting décor.

The staff is on top of everything, they were super kind and welcoming.
The food was really enjoyable, would recommend the flautas particularly. Also, the starters can be taken as main dishes.
It was pretty packed so I'd recommend you to plan ahead & make a reservation!

top_10.name: Taqueria El Buen Sabor
top_10.address: 699 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: DYJ1948
reviews.text: We got an Al pastor wet burrito which they very kindly split in half. The burrito was bland and didn’t have a lot of flavor. After dousing it with their sausage, we still found it to need more flavoring. The atmosphere was chaos as there were kids running amuck everywhere and we couldn’t hear each other speak!!

reviews.author: Edith Pilaf
reviews.text:
Memorable corner of my youth. Always been a taqueria someone or other chooses over the ones that I preferred. Ten years later, this corner is convenient and it is one of those days that “here & now” is more important than “there & better”. Ordered a Chile Relleno burrito. The staff is prepping for the busy day ahead, it is only about 11am, carbe asada is being chopped, stews are all full to the brim, I get excited wanting to try everything eventually - maybe even today. But the burrito is a sad burrito, none of the components have flavor, and no amount of, frankly, pretty mild salsa, can fix the lack of oomph in the rice, beans, guac and chile itself.
Still a beautiful corner still beautiful murals, hard working and lovely staff, but a regrettable burrito.

reviews.author: American Angler
reviews.text:
Down on 18th with Koz Kozinski and his Gypsie girl Posiria, and decided to snag some tacos.  Koz wanted to eat at some other place on this block, but we slugged him into submission, and we settled on Taqueria El Buen Sabor!
This Taqueria is way underrated, it's perhaps in the top 5 Taquerias in SF!
Posiria and I went in and had the most Amazing tacos, and the Koz walked up the street and had hotdogs from the hotdog cart on the corner.
Taqueria El Buen Sabor is 5 stars all day long.  ☆☆☆☆☆

reviews.author: Kevin Chen
reviews.text: Ordered the Crispy Taco, Special Taco, and Suiza Quesadilla. The Crispy Taco is great for crispy taco shell lovers. The Special Taco with carne asada was a decent size and portion, a generous layer of greens and cheese on top. The Suiza Quesadilla with carnitas is more than enough for one person, it’s a sizeable amount and loaded with delicious cheese and other toppings. This location is really busy during the dinner rush and you will often see the lines running out the door. There are some tables and chairs indoors but not enough to accommodate everyone in line. Fortunately, there’s a mix of “here” and “to-go” orders so the number of available seats remains enough.

reviews.author: Sunstruck T.
reviews.text: One of the only taquerias I trust in the Mission at this point. Old school with plenty of rustic, hole-in-the-wall charm. The ingredients are fresh, authentic, and always pair well together. I personally prefer their burritos - they pack plenty of meat inside and provide ample salsa when asked. They also include chips and salsa for free with tacos and burritos, something that's becoming a rarity in San Francisco. Stop by whenever you get a chance - this place deserves it!

testimonials: We got an Al pastor wet burrito which they very kindly split in half. The burrito was bland and didn’t have a lot of flavor. After dousing it with their sausage, we still found it to need more flavoring. The atmosphere was chaos as there were kids running amuck everywhere and we couldn’t hear each other speak!!

top_10.name: Garaje
top_10.address: 475 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Pam V.
reviews.text:
We usually get the burgers and do highly recommend them as they are delicious and very satisfying.
This time we each tried something different for takeout: my husband got the OG zapato and like that very much. I got the spicy fried chicken sandwich, which to me did not register as spicy enough.. plus the BBQ sauce with it was just too much sweetness which I would also not prefer for a "spicy fried chicken sandwich". Others may like this if they can only tolerate a little amount of heat, which is balanced by sweet- it's just not for me.

reviews.author: Joshua Gilstein
reviews.text: Great vibes but pretty pricey food. Fish tacos were solid and yummy but expensive.

reviews.author: jcwainc “JerrysCanofWhoopAssinc” JerrysCanofWhoopAssinc
reviews.text: Wow really good place. Everything on the menu looked good.  I decided to go with the hot chicken 🐔 😋 sandwich 🥪.  Thought of getting a burger 🍔 or a steak 🤔 but decided to go with something I couldn't get usually. Also I wanted to say wow I loved ambiance and decorations all over the walls. If you have a chance, in the area or want to try something new before going to the Giants game give this place a try. You'll be glad you did 😊

reviews.author: Piccolos Daughter
reviews.text: Dive bar vibes. Food is okay, lots of drink options. Glad to see they have sour beer on the menu.

reviews.author: K Fakhro
reviews.text:
Amazing food and fun atmosphere. Kitchen is delicious!
They were closing soon but even let us dine in.
Really excellent customer service!

Advice :
Try their burger! It's spectacular!

Also the zapato burritos are huge, best to split with someone!

top_10.name: Cantina Los Mayas
top_10.address: 431 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Barry
reviews.text:
The Mexican Coffee is unbelievable. We had a side of plantains that were perfectly served!!!

This is a destination place for brunch on Sunday. You cannot go wrong if you love Mexican food.

reviews.author: Diana Baez
reviews.text: Visiting San Francisco all the way from Texas and we 100% recommend this family friendly restaurant. The food was authentic and delicious. We left no crumbs. The customer service was also amazing. Muchas gracias por todo! Volveremos muy pronto!

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.text: Had a delicious bday dinner here. The food and drinks were delicious. Enjoyed all of our dishes and would have loved to order more from their menu. Drink options were ample and they had an extensive wine list as well.

reviews.author: Qin Zhu
reviews.text: Food here is delicious, fresh and unique to the Yucatán area.  Favorite dish was the mixed dessert platter and pumpkin seed dip.  Service was on the slow side, took us an hour to get our appetizer, but they comped us with a free dip.  Service then picked up.   Ambience is nice and ideal for a nice sit down dinner.  Would come again.

reviews.author: Gabs
reviews.text: Yum!! This place was so good! The best dish on the menu that I will be coming back for is the scalloped chayote & potatoes! This dish was fantastic—absolutely no complaints. I highly recommend this restaurant for dinner and can't wait to try their brunch menu next!

testimonials:
The Mexican Coffee is unbelievable. We had a side of plantains that were perfectly served!!!

This is a destination place for brunch on Sunday. You cannot go wrong if you love Mexican food.

Visiting San Francisco all the way from Texas and we 100% recommend this family friendly restaurant. The food was authentic and delicious. We left no crumbs. The customer service was also amazing. Muchas gracias por todo! Volveremos muy pronto!

Had a delicious bday dinner here. The food and drinks were delicious. Enjoyed all of our dishes and would have loved to order more from their menu. Drink options were ample and they had an extensive wine list as well.

top_10.name: Daeho Kalbijim & Beef Soup
top_10.address: 1620 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Justin Wong
reviews.text: Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

reviews.author: ahkwai Lert
reviews.text: I recently visited this spot with my friends, and we decided to try the Braised Beef Rib and the Beef Brisket Soup. Honestly, I found the soup to be a bit bland for my taste. However, I really enjoyed the overall atmosphere of the place. It was bustling with people, and the food was quite good. The service was excellent as well, with friendly staff who made our experience enjoyable.

reviews.author: egc
reviews.text:
A couple friends recommended this place and decided to visit with my family. It was their first time trying kalbijjim. We got the large one with extra cheese as well as some mandu and it was enough for the four of us.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

reviews.author: B. Wai
reviews.text: I have been here for a couple of times in the last few years and this place is legit for kalbijjim. I came here on a Friday around 545PM for two people. As I arrived, the small tables for two people were filling up very quickly. Luckily I got seated right away. After 6PM, you need to wait in line, so I highly suggest to come here 5 to 6 PM. Yes it is early for dinner unless you don't mind to wait. To me, I hate waiting. Lol. I ordered B2 which was Premium Kalbijjim with regular size. This portion definitely can fill up more than 2 people. I also added extra rice cake and cheese. Both add-ons were 11 bucks. The cheese itself seemed  to be worth it, but not for the extra rice cake. I counted the total and it was like 10 pcs, so basically a handful.  The short rib was well tender and cooked. The services were on point and efficient. As soon as we were done, we paid and left because I didn't want others to wait too long. I suggest you do the same and don't sit and chat after you finished eating. It's a common courtesy. I also recommend to park at the Jtown plaza because street parking spaces are limited due to high volume of cars. I definitely come back to try other food on the menu like Seolleong Tang and Mandu Guk. Big fan. Keep up the good work!

reviews.author: Peace Love
reviews.text: First time to this location and this chain of Korean restaurants is my fav. They are truly a gem. All their locations are consistent and tasteful. I can say they are the best Korean restaurants overall currently to date. The Din Tai Fung of Korean restaurants vice versa.

testimonials: Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

The service was excellent as well, with friendly staff who made our experience enjoyable.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

top_10.name: Cocobang
top_10.address: 550 Taylor St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Andrew McCauley
reviews.text:
Coco Bang might not look super fancy from the outside, but don’t let that fool you. This place is awesome! As soon as we walked in, the staff was super friendly and made us feel welcome. The vibe inside is really cool and relaxed. It’s a great place to hang out and enjoy a meal with friends or family.

We ordered six different dishes and shared them family-style. Every single one was delicious! The flavors were amazing, and you can tell the food is made with care. It’s hard to find a place where everything you try tastes this good.

If you’re looking for great Korean food and a fun atmosphere, Coco Bang is the place to go. We had a great time and can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Rafael Medina
reviews.text:
Probably the best fried chicken entry I’ve ever had in my life. Without a doubt top 3. Me and my friend visited and wanted to come back for lunch and dinner the next day too.

Cozy, small and fast

reviews.author: Jonhan Chen
reviews.text: I’ve been here like 15 times already; it’s pretty good. Chicken is always fire and ordering the full is pretty incredible value for the money. Tangy sauce is the best IMO. There is usually a bit of a wait to get in though

reviews.author: Joua Yang
reviews.text: Food was good, service was quick. Place was very tiny and there was a sewage-like smell which made it harder to consume the food.

reviews.author: Julia Santarelli
reviews.text: This place blew me away, I came for the first time looking for a late night place to eat. I came here based on the extensive reviews and videos for late night eats in SFO. There was a bit of a wait, nothing to crazy, it’s a cute little space. The bbq short ribs are honestly to die for, I was so SO impressed. They are marinated amazing and cooked over the fire, they are so tender with an amazing char on them. We got a sizzling plate half bbq ribs, and the bulgogi beef (which was also amazing). The tofu soup was so hearty, flavourful, and warm. I ate it over rice and got the beef one. The gyoza were good, nothing special, but still good. The reviews are all accurate about this place, service was amazing and the food came out fast. Will be back next time I visit SFO.

testimonials:
Coco Bang might not look super fancy from the outside, but don’t let that fool you. This place is awesome! As soon as we walked in, the staff was super friendly and made us feel welcome. The vibe inside is really cool and relaxed. It’s a great place to hang out and enjoy a meal with friends or family.

top_10.name: SAN HO WON
top_10.address: 2170 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Rachael Annabelle Yong
reviews.text: one of my favourite meals in sf so far — we had the set menu for dinner and it was A LOt of food. every dish was incredibly well seasoned and fresh, favourites were definitely the jebi churi (beef neck fillet) and gamasot fried rice with naengi & clam  doenjjang jigae. the banana soft serve with hazelnuts and nutella was a banger. service was great too! came out to be $350 or so after tax and tip, including a bottle of makgeolli.

reviews.author: Min C
reviews.text: My review is based on my visit about one year ago. I visited here with my parents visiting from Korea and we had course menu. Overall, the foods were good but it was a bit mixed. Grilled meats were exceptionally good although we were already quite full by then. But soups (both Kimchi soup and rice soup) felt quite off to us. They tasted like they were based off of a very different ingredient from how we typically cook, which was a big disappointment for us. But the staffs were really nice and their drinks were unique in a good way. Overall we enjoyed our meal.

reviews.author: E
reviews.text:
We did a walk-in on a Friday night and lined up around ~25 minutes before opening and were able to grab a seat. We ordered the following:

Hwe Muchim: very fresh and flavorful. I don't see this dish very often so it was a pleasant surprise. Really enjoyed this one.

House Double Cut Galbi: The meat was good quality. However, the combination of the sweet sauce with minimal acidity and how fatty galbi can get I found these to be quite heavy. I would have preferred more acidity in the marinade.

Ssam: Nothing special but nice to have leaves with kbbq. Criminal pricing though.

Grilled Tteok: sickly sweet and sticky. Didn't really enjoy.

I loved their home made sauces to have with the meat. Overall, I would return to San Ho Won but their prices are on the higher end. In other cities you can probably get something 80% as good for 40% of the price.

reviews.author: S Kim
reviews.text:
The staff was very attentive and kind. Def 5/5.
It had a cozy atmosphere which we loved. So 5/5 as well.

For food, we really enjoyed Hwe mu chim, Prime beef rib cap, and Mugunji kimchi jjigae. If we had just these, 5/5 for food as well.
However, we had two other dishes which were a bit disappointing.
- "Double cut" galbi. It was way too fatty and greasy. A part of me wondered if they used a low grade galbi. The qaulity of Galbi meat tasted lower than meat i get from H Mart when I make galbi jjim.
- Jebi Churi. The quality of meat also tasted a bit low grade where it didnt have much flavor and chewy.

Overall though, we enjoyed our visit and will try this place again :)

reviews.author: Secret Society
reviews.text:
The food was pretty good, but I wish the bibimbap had more rice. The meats were cooked beautifully and super tender but tasted a bit bland and flavorless.
The dalgona cheesecake and lobster claw were super good! The presentation for the bingsu was honestly a bit off-putting, and needed more nurungji.
All in all decent experience, definitely make a reservation, and good luck trying to find parking LOL

testimonials: one of my favourite meals in sf so far — we had the set menu for dinner and it was A LOt of food. every dish was incredibly well seasoned and fresh, favourites were definitely the jebi churi (beef neck fillet) and gamasot fried rice with naengi & clam  doenjjang jigae. the banana soft serve with hazelnuts and nutella was a banger. service was great too! came out to be $350 or so after tax and tip, including a bottle of makgeolli.

My review is based on my visit about one year ago. I visited here with my parents visiting from Korea and we had course menu. Overall, the foods were good but it was a bit mixed. Grilled meats were exceptionally good although we were already quite full by then. But soups (both Kimchi soup and rice soup) felt quite off to us. They tasted like they were based off of a very different ingredient from how we typically cook, which was a big disappointment for us. But the staffs were really nice and their drinks were unique in a good way. Overall we enjoyed our meal.

We did a walk-in on a Friday night and lined up around ~25 minutes before opening and were able to grab a seat. We ordered the following:

Hwe Muchim: very fresh and flavorful. I don't see this dish very often so it was a pleasant surprise. Really enjoyed this one.

House Double Cut Galbi: The meat was good quality. However, the combination of the sweet sauce with minimal acidity and how fatty galbi can get I found these to be quite heavy. I would have preferred more acidity in the marinade.

Ssam: Nothing special but nice to have leaves with kbbq. Criminal pricing though.

Grilled Tteok: sickly sweet and sticky. Didn't really enjoy.

I loved their home made sauces to have with the meat. Overall, I would return to San Ho Won but their prices are on the higher end. In other cities you can probably get something 80% as good for 40% of the price.

top_10.name: Jagalchi
top_10.address: 63 Serramonte Center, Daly City, CA 94015, USA

reviews.author: Daniel
reviews.text:
This store is impressively clean and well-organized, with wide aisles and excellent product visibility. There's no odd smell like in some budget markets. Prices are comparable to other stores, and their frozen seafood was surprisingly fresh with no off smell. However, I wish they offered live seafood and had a better food court setup. The seating area is small and not ideal for dine-in.

Long Review
I was really impressed by how clean and visually appealing the store was. All items were neatly displayed, and the high ceilings combined with wide, open aisles made it easy to browse and find products. Unlike some budget markets, there was no strange or unpleasant smell. The prices were reasonable and in line with other markets in the area.

I also tried some of their frozen seafood, which is often hit or miss. However, here, it was fresh without the usual lingering odor that sometimes develops over time—definitely a pleasant surprise.

That said, there are a couple of areas that could be improved. First, I was a bit disappointed that they don’t offer live seafood, which is commonly found in many Korean and Asian markets. Second, the food court options felt lacking. While there is a sushi bar inside to the right of the main entrance, it seems more like a quick stop for shoppers rather than a comfortable dining space. In the center, there’s a large Korean restaurant run by a well-known chef, and to the left, there's a bakery.

They also offer pre-packed meals that can be picked up and paid for with your groceries, and there’s a designated space to eat. However, that dining area feels quite limited in size and could definitely use some expansion.

reviews.author: Yoke Fong
reviews.text: Jagalchi Supermarket is a gem for anyone craving authentic Korean groceries and cuisine! They offer an impressive selection of Korean products, from pantry staples to unique bakery items. The fresh fruits are top-notch, and the wide variety of ready-to-go Korean dishes is perfect for a quick, delicious meal. The store is spotlessly clean, creating a pleasant shopping experience. Bonus points for their range of Korean beauty products! Highly recommend for quality and variety.

reviews.author: Eda
reviews.text: My sister, niece, daughter, and I visited Jagalchi on a weekday morning, and we were blown away by the sheer size of the store! The parking was plentiful, and the massive space offered a huge variety of ready-to-eat foods. You pick your items as you shop and pay at the counter. We grabbed a bunch early on, not realizing even more tempting selections were deeper in the store! The seafood pancake was fantastic, and the Korean BBQ, served with steamed veggies and rice in separate containers, was a hit. My niece loved the vegetarian pancake. For dessert, we got chocolate cake and mango cake—both delicious, but the chocolate cake stood out for me, not too sweet and delightfully light. The prices for the prepared food were reasonable, and the place was spotless, likely because it’s new. There’s also a sit-down restaurant in the middle, plus a bakery, coffee shop, and sections for groceries and pretty much everything you need in an Asian market. We’ll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Neal
reviews.text:
Huge selection, elegant store, some items are a little pricy but also some good deals.

This is a very pleasant place to shop. The store has welcoming lighting and thoughtful signage explaining various foods and traditions. There are a lot of shoppers, but the aisles are wide so it never feels too crowded. There's an indoor dining area where you can eat the things you've purchased. There's also a restaurant right in the middle of the store and a rice bakery — great for people who can't have gluten. I loved that there's a section just for items from Jeju.

You'll be able to find at least two options for most packaged foods. They also sell beauty products, kitchen equipment, prepared foods, frozen and marinated meat in a lot of cuts, seafood, and fresh produce.

In general, the prices are a little bit higher here than at H-Mart or Kukje. However, the bibimbap for $12 is a very competitive price, as well as kimbap for $6. They sell various kinds of bugak made in-store for $6 per bag, which is really high, but they also have mass-produced kim bugak for only $2 per bag — cheaper than anywhere else. It's between $2.50 to $7 per sheet mask, which is likely the most popular beauty product here. I drink Osulloc teas so I know they're much cheaper on Amazon. The prices are really hit or miss depending on what you get.

reviews.author: Jason Nagal Estioko
reviews.text: Found lots of imported and exclusive items I cannot find at Kuhje Supermarket and H Mart like the Pepero New Jeans Limited Edition White Chocolate Box. Prices are reasonable with Korean Snacks. Very Spacious and Clean Supermarket with a hot food section. All parts of the store is like having a quick tour of Korea. I enjoyed going here on Grand Opening Day which landed on my Birthday with a good friend of mine to celebrate my birthday and enjoyed my shopping experience.

top_10.name: Hot Sauce and Panko To Go
top_10.address: 1468 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Troff
reviews.text: This is a great hole in the wall to go eatery. Placed an order online during lunch and it was ready when I got there. There is only a door for pickup and no inside seating. Waffles were made fresh and as you see they give you butter and enough syrup for it. Waffles were buttery and flavorful. The wings were a perfect match. Chris’s salty and sweet wings had me wanting more. Make sure to call or order online first or you will most likely be waiting in line to order.

reviews.author: Mike Wallach
reviews.text: I've walked past this neighborhood place dozens of times. There's always somebody waiting for their order at the window. It was time I tried it. No place to sit down, just pick up your order and go.  About a 10 minute wait hanging out on the corner. I ordered the panko fried Chicken Sandwich with cucumber wasabi sauce. Very good. Next time I'll order a sauce with a little more spice.

reviews.author: Will
reviews.text: Overall, the wings at Hot Sauce and Panko are very solid. The flavors are great, but I’d personally prefer them a bit hotter. The beer was definitely my favorite—smooth and refreshing. I also tried the Korean and Al Pastor flavors. The Korean was flavorful, but the Al Pastor didn’t quite hit the mark for me. Still, the wings themselves were crispy and juicy, and I’d definitely recommend them!

reviews.author: Keena Middleton
reviews.text:
Hot Sauce & Panko is definitely top 5 wings in the city. From the size of the wings to the crispiness and flavor options you can’t go wrong here.
Bourbon bacon wrapped is my go to always and now they have a hot version and a plain Jane bacon wrapped.
This time around I also went with the waffle & wings combo. Tried the Al pastor and they were awesomeness.
The last flavor which was basic but still perfection were the Salt and pepper wings.
15 premium wings and a waffle you can’t beat it.
Have patience or go to wingstop!

reviews.author: Steven Su
reviews.text:
Food here is always fresh and seasoned perfectly. The sauces hit different and I feel like these are the best wings in the city. Everything has so much flavor and it doesn’t taste artificial either. Prices are good for wings. Definitely recommend. Parking is a bit hard to find.

Fish and chips are surprisingly good and cheap. Lemon pepper and mango Hab are my favorite.

testimonials: This is a great hole in the wall to go eatery. Placed an order online during lunch and it was ready when I got there. There is only a door for pickup and no inside seating. I also tried the Korean and Al Pastor flavors. The Korean was flavorful, but the Al Pastor didn’t quite hit the mark for me. Still, the wings themselves were crispy and juicy, and I’d definitely recommend them!

top_10.name: Omogari
top_10.address: 154 Jackson St, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

reviews.author: Andy Ng
reviews.text:
Omogari is popping here in the Japantown neighborhood and I was excited to dine here with some friends in their outdoor patio.

With a long line for Korean food and indoor/outdoor seating, be sure to use the Yelp waitlist if you can to get ahead of the wait.

They have classic Korean dishes with fairly generous portions from what I could tell. Limited veggie options (and you'll have to ask to make sure something can be fully plant-based/vegan), but I was happy to see they could make their Mushroom Sundubu with veggie stock. I ordered that spicy and it luckily also came with rice.

The sundubu was fantastic and hit every note I could want from a tofu stew. Loved the veggies, the broth was not too salty, and the accompanied banchan was great with the meal.

Service was also pretty fast considering how busy they were and they checked in on us for just the right amount of time. Thanks Omogari for a great dinner experience.

reviews.author: Nicole Kim
reviews.text: This restaurant was a last minute find for a large group of 14. We had one long table and a small table that fit 4. I didn’t expect that much given this Korean restaurant was situated in Japan town, but I was pleasantly surprised. We shared LA Galbi, Spicy Rice Cake with Ramen (pretty mid and not enough flavor), army stew (not enough broth), and Spicy Stir Fried Squid (which was the best out of all; sweet and spicy). The banchan were all tasty, esp the bean sprouts and pickled radish. Loved the makgeolli which paired well with everything we had. The service was okay; a bit slow but they were pretty busy so understandable. If you’d like to try Korean food, would recommend.

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.text: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ What an experience and I am so thankful we stopped for lunch on the way to the airport. We had the Fondue chicken, short ribs and the chicken wings. I wouldn’t order the chicken wings again but damn, the other two dishes were SO GOOD. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Mirian P
reviews.text: This is the place for Korean food. Delicious, fast and great service. Look no further. We always order the stir fry bulgogi with veggies /bean sprouts. Feeds 2. The whole menu is very tasty and authentic

reviews.author: S SS
reviews.text:
Ordered the Galbi, Kimchi Pancake, and House Vegetable stir fry with tofu.  The dishes were good, but the banchan were just ok.

Service could have been better, but nothing to really complain about, then again nothing to write home about as well.

Overall what matters most is the food, and it was satisfying.

top_10.name: JJamPPong
top_10.address: 5249 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: James
reviews.text: Great service, super generous servings, and delicious!  We ate here for mother's Day and I think we may have ordered too much as we were not expecting the large servings, which is totally not a bad thing! I think the HK noodles were my favorite and I'd say the salt and pepper shrimps were my least. It's lacking a bit of saltiness or umami compared to other places. Overall, I will come back but probably order less. 😅

reviews.author: Philippe W
reviews.text: Very good service. The food was very tasty. One dish can easily serve two people. We’ll gladly recommend it if you’re looking for a good Korean restaurant.

reviews.author: Han Phan
reviews.text: Best Korean spicy marinated crabs I’ve ever had! You it is definitely spicy but good spicy. The crab meat is sweet and you can just suck it out the shells. It is fresh and does not have a the “ocean” smell. The marinate is spicy, a little sweet, sour, savory…just a mix of deliciousness. Eat the crab over a bed of warm white rice with pickle radish is out of the world!!!! Just wow! Perfect combination of flavors and textures. I would definitely come back and I would recommend for anyone to check this place out if you’re around San Francisco. Parking might be a little to find since it’s street parking but definitely worth it 💯 Delicious!!!!!

reviews.author: Rosary Ann Oca
reviews.text: A very simple korean restaurant with great food! We went here on Valentine’s Day and it wasn’t too full or crowded that we enjoyed a pleasant atmosphere. Serving size is good for 2-3 or up to 4 depending on your appetite. The food is very good and the sauce in the Tangsuyuk is addictive.

reviews.author: Joseph K
reviews.text: This is our new favorite place. You do pay a little more but they are generous with the portions and the food is also really good. Instead of feeding two people with an $18 entree, you feed four people with a $24 entree. Significantly better value to eat with family.  We had 3 people,  2 entrees,  one order of rice,  and we had to bring half of it home. Other places,  we'd still be hungry.

testimonials: Great service, super generous servings, and delicious!  We ate here for mother's Day and I think we may have ordered too much as we were not expecting the large servings, which is totally not a bad thing! I think the HK noodles were my favorite and I'd say the salt and pepper shrimps were my least. It's lacking a bit of saltiness or umami compared to other places. Overall, I will come back but probably order less. 😅

top_10.name: MUGUNGHWA Korean Restaurant
top_10.address: 10140 San Pablo Ave, El Cerrito, CA 94530, USA

reviews.author: ahkwai Lert
reviews.text:
I've visited this place twice, and it came highly recommended by a friend. Everything was fantastic, especially the fried chicken and tteokbokki. It was definitely worth it, and it's now my go-to spot for Korean fried chicken.

Moreover, the restaurant has a lovely modern decor. The staff were incredibly nice and friendly, frequently checking in to see if we needed anything else.

reviews.author: Andrea Novoa
reviews.text:
As a huge fan of Korean food, I can confidently say Mugunghwa is on another level. This restaurant blends elegance, tradition, and flavor in the most beautiful way.

The ambiance is serene and sophisticated perfect for a special night out or anyone who truly appreciates refined Korean cuisine. The staff made the experience even better: attentive, friendly, and incredibly knowledgeable about each dish.

Now, let’s talk food, I tried the steamed pork dumplings plump, juicy, and full of flavor. The beef japchae had that perfect sweet-savory balance with silky glass noodles. The beef tartare bibimbap was fresh, vibrant, and perfectly seasoned.

The galbi short ribs were so tender they practically melted in my mouth, and the galbi jim was rich, hearty, and deeply comforting.

But the surprise favorite? The Mugunghwa cold noodles icy, chewy, with the perfect touch of mustard heat. So refreshing and absolutely addictive.

Every dish was a hit beautifully presented, thoughtfully prepared, and full of bold, authentic flavors.

If you’re craving a next-level Korean dining experience with gorgeous views and impeccable service, Mugunghwa is it. I’ll be dreaming about this meal for a long time

reviews.author: Max Stanton
reviews.text:
Exceptional banchan, high quality dishes from pancakes to soups, large servings, and ease of ordering (tablet at table).

But orders sometimes get forgotten or missed, the order in which they come can be unpredictable, and most of the restaurant has no natural light or windows, with tight seating. It's also quite pricey and can get very loud and crowded.

Overall, still the best option around.

reviews.author: Helene
reviews.text:
Really good Korean food especially in this area. I would come all the way from Oakland to eat here. Staff was friendly. Food was served promptly. Seafood pancake and rice cakes (with cheese) were really good. Soups were also delicious.

Spacious bathrooms, handicap friendly, also with changing  table  for babies. The
Staff was nice enough to provide kids plates

reviews.author: Hanna Kang
reviews.text: A friend recommended this place, and we decided to give it a try. The wait wasn’t too bad—about 15 minutes on a Friday evening —but they were a bit unorganized. We ordered three combo sets of meat and soup, along with their famous garlic bossam. The spicy pork was a highlight for me (it had more fat than meat, though), and the soups were rich and flavorful. While the bossam was good, it was a bit too sweet and overly garlicky for my taste. Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely return when we’re craving authentic Korean cuisine!

testimonials:
I've visited this place twice, and it came highly recommended by a friend. Everything was fantastic, especially the fried chicken and tteokbokki. It was definitely worth it, and it's now my go-to spot for Korean fried chicken.

Moreover, the restaurant has a lovely modern decor. The staff were incredibly nice and friendly, frequently checking in to see if we needed anything else.

Overall, still the best option around.

top_10.name: Kiss My Seoul
top_10.address: 15 Boardman Pl, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Jason Phalla
reviews.text:
We had the kimchi smash burger - double patty.
- soft bun
- tender patties
- grilled onion
- melted cheese
- kimchi to balance

Great burger, the chef definitely know what he's doing.

Kiss my fries were also awesome. The bulgogi in dish was amazingly flavorful.

My only regrets were:
- should have gotten another burger
- should have gotten a bulgogi dish

Will return, food is delicious.

reviews.author: Alex Ochoa
reviews.text: Kiss my Seoul's Kimcheese smashburgers can gladly take my soul ! Truly a hidden gem. We ordered the kiss my fries , bulgogi cupbap,  and two smashburgers. Such a delicious lunch and we had leftovers to bring home as well. Definitely recommend this place. Food and service is amazing. The owner , Alex, brought over some mandu for us to have and that was amazing as well. Excited to try their tacos next time.

reviews.author: Wilson Tsang
reviews.text:
TLDR: inconsistently cooked Galbi makes for a very mixed review

The price for the food is a bit high for my liking but with inflation, it’s not completely unreasonable (almost $20 after tax for a galbi bowl). There were a few pieces of galbi but they were all cooked differently. The skinnier pieces were overcooked and black (refer to picture) while the fattier pieces were slightly undercooked and still pink inside.

The decor is simple and clean. They also have some convenience stores stuff on the right with ice creams, Asian snacks and drinks.

reviews.author: Jing Li
reviews.text:
We ordered KBBQ catering from Kiss My Seoul for our baby shower. Everything was absolutely delicious and our guests could not stop raving about the food. My husband picked up the order and said our car has never smelled better than when he was driving back with the food (even better than the smell of pizza)!

We got large trays of food and I was so excited to eat everything that I forgot to take a photo of my plate. We ordered the mando vegetarian dumplings, japchae (vegan), rice, tofu (vegan), chicken, pork and bulgogi beef along with steamed mixed vegetables. They also threw in two free bottles of kimchi aioli and a spicy red sauce which was very appreciated and unexpected!

I worked directly with the owner Alex on all the details for the catering order - he was super professional, very responsive to all my questions, and quick to update the invoice estimates. He also gave me some great advice about portion sizing, especially assuming everyone would go down the line and try all of the dishes.

I personally LOVED the mando and the japchae and I was pleasantly surprised to see purple rice (instead of plain white rice)! I had never seen dumplings that circular shape before, very interesting to see how consistent they were in shape/size and they were a big hit with the kids. We actually ended up running out of tofu because it looked so good that non-vegetarians also wanted to eat it! My vegan friend said that the tofu was well seasoned and packed full of flavor.

Overall, I was thrilled with the taste and quality of the food - we took a bit of a gamble ordering from Kiss My Seoul to feed our closest family and friends since we had never eaten at the restaurant before. Can't wait to go back and check out the kimcheese smashburger sometime!

reviews.author: george davis
reviews.text: Incredible food, incredible staff and ambiance/hospitality. Everything on the menu will make you say wow. The owner (Alex) has so much experience (see Tokyo, Beijing, PyeongChang Olympic games catering) it really bleeds out of him right into THE BEST bulgogi beef i’ve had in this city, bar none. You cannot come here once. It’s no coincidence there’s a mural on the wall connecting the two cities of Seoul and San Francisco here. Kiss My Seoul brings a charm and a heart to this city even 5600 miles couldn’t get between. 5/5

testimonials:
We had the kimchi smash burger - double patty.
- soft bun
- tender patties
- grilled onion
- melted cheese
- kimchi to balance

Great burger, the chef definitely know what he's doing.

Kiss my fries were also awesome. The bulgogi in dish was amazingly flavorful.

My only regrets were:
- should have gotten another burger
- should have gotten a bulgogi dish

Will return, food is delicious.

Kiss my Seoul's Kimcheese smashburgers can gladly take my soul ! Truly a hidden gem. We ordered the kiss my fries , bulgogi cupbap,  and two smashburgers. Such a delicious lunch and we had leftovers to bring home as well. Definitely recommend this place. Food and service is amazing. The owner , Alex, brought over some mandu for us to have and that was amazing as well. Excited to try their tacos next time.

TLDR: inconsistently cooked Galbi makes for a very mixed review

The price for the food is a bit high for my liking but with inflation, it’s not completely unreasonable (almost $20 after tax for a galbi bowl). There were a few pieces of galbi but they were all cooked differently. The skinnier pieces were overcooked and black (refer to picture) while the fattier pieces were slightly undercooked and still pink inside.

The decor is simple and clean. They also have some convenience stores stuff on the right with ice creams, Asian snacks and drinks.

top_10.name: Kothai Republic
top_10.address: 1398 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Tom McElderry
reviews.text: I’ve eaten at Kothai four times now and it is consistently outstanding. The food is creative, using top quality super fresh ingredients that the team here has lovingly put together into dishes that delight the eye and please the palate. I also really like the soju cocktails, which are spirit forward and perfectly balanced, never too sweet, never too sour. The service is professional but warm, and they remember you if you come back. The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

reviews.author: Wan siu
reviews.text: I’ve passed by this restaurant many times and finally got to try it. Surprisingly, everything was delicious — the flavors were great, and the textures were spot on. The service was excellent too. The chicken was juicy and tender, and the red curry was a perfect complement. They mentioned that the menu changes quite often, so I’ll definitely be back to try more next time!

reviews.author: Alma Zamora
reviews.text: The food was delicious! Generous portions and everything tasted so fresh. It is a bit pricey but worth it. The only thing we were not crazy about was the apple cheesecake for dessert. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. Chocolate mousse was amazing! Drinks were light and refreshing.

reviews.author: AJM
reviews.text: I've lived in SF for 4 years now and this is one of just 8 restaurants I've marked w "Favorite". Every dish was incredible, full of new flavors and w a beautiful presentation. Honestly, I was a happy camper eating each bite. Well done to the chef and staff. I'll be back!

reviews.author: Lexi Chen
reviews.text: It’s been a long time since I’ve enjoyed a meal where every dish amazed me! Innovative dishes brilliantly combining the best of Korean and Thai cuisines. Everything was beautifully presented and tasted incredible. Will definitely come back to explore the entire menu!

testimonials: I’ve eaten at Kothai four times now and it is consistently outstanding. The food is creative, using top quality super fresh ingredients that the team here has lovingly put together into dishes that delight the eye and please the palate. I also really like the soju cocktails, which are spirit forward and perfectly balanced, never too sweet, never too sour. The service is professional but warm, and they remember you if you come back. The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

top_10.name: Amarena
top_10.address: 2162 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Victoria Fox
reviews.text: This place was lovely!! The ambience was very classy and the staff was super friendly! All the food we had was absolutely delicious! Started off with a delicious fresh bruschetta and salad with pears! The butternut squash pasta and smoke prosciutto pasta were cooked to perfection and the chicken was packed with flavor. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Margaret K
reviews.text: Came for my second happy hour and again very pleased with my experience! Pictures attached are from both visits. From 5-6pm, 30% off one pasta and one drink is a fantastic deal especially because their pasta is extremely well made. Everyone working there is very helpful and friendly with great recommendations and have ties to Italy it seems. I sat outside my last time alone with a book, wine and pasta and was so pleased. Will be a go to spot for me!

reviews.author: Alexandra Huides
reviews.text: Excellent food, and the octopus was amazing! Truly Italian vibe! Staff were super nice and kind too! I can’t believe I lived in the neighborhood for 3 years now and never been here! And they have the gluten free pasta, so we’re definitely becoming regulars!

reviews.author: Arkajit Dey
reviews.text: This place has been on my list to visit for a while and it did not disappoint! Very attentive service and nice ambience with dim lighting. And the food was delicious. I had a nice squash ravioli and the arancini. There’s also an extensive wine list. Definitely go check it out!

reviews.author: Carmen Augusto
reviews.text:
Charming traditional Italian spot—we went with friends and sat outside, which was lovely. I have a dairy sensitivity, and while the restaurant isn’t really set up for dietary restrictions (they stick closely to how dishes are traditionally made in Italy), they were still very accommodating. They prepared the baked eggplant without cheese and offered salads without dairy, which I really appreciated. That said, if you have a dairy issue, this may not be your go-to place.

The food was delicious—every pasta dish we tried was flavorful and well-executed. We also ordered the house bread with olive oil , which was nice, though I wish the bread had been a bit fresher.

I probably wouldn’t return , but overall, the food was  good .

testimonials: This place was lovely!! The ambience was very classy and the staff was super friendly! All the food we had was absolutely delicious! Started off with a delicious fresh bruschetta and salad with pears! The butternut squash pasta and smoke prosciutto pasta were cooked to perfection and the chicken was packed with flavor. Highly recommend!!

top_10.name: Seven Hills
top_10.address: 1896 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Astral Traveler
reviews.text: I thought everything was perfect. Our waiter was EXCELLENT. We got a bottle of red from Campagna which was reasonably priced and delectable. Our two salads were delicate and refined, and the pasta was firm but tender (how is that possible by the way?) filled with delightful morsels. Nice mixed fruit pie with ice cream to complete. Recommended.

reviews.author: Tom Elwood
reviews.text: This chef is really imaginative with flavors and textures. A plateful of summer was found in the mozzarella with flamed peaches, cherries, pecans and arugula. The fresh focaccia had great herb flavor. The gem salad with clementines, avocado, and radishes and topped with hazelnut was a really lovely combination. The special was truffle tortellini with the Croatian truffle shaved right at the table and had incredible buttery richness. The budino chocolate dessert was immensely rich and smooth. What a great evening out and such lovely efficient service and beautiful ambience.

reviews.author: Kyle B
reviews.text:
Impressed, simply impressed. My fiance and I were astonished at the experience we had last night. I don't think I've ever left a review for a restaurant before, but I felt compelled after the incredibly attentive and respectful staff served us what is arguably the most deliciously balanced and  well portioned Italian meal we've ever had, at a compelling price point. The focaccia was beautifully baked, with interesting and delicate flavors that gave us an idea of what we had gotten ourselves into. Followed shortly thereafter by absolutely delectable duck liver pate and apricot crostinis. But the stars of the show were definitely the squid ink pasta and the raviolini. They were both superb: light but complex, savory but not too rich, and just enough on the plate to sate your hunger. Bravo!
If you're reading this review and you're debating dinner spots, your choice has been made for you -- choose Seven Hills.

reviews.author: Manana Hakobyan
reviews.text:
This was my second time visiting Seven Hills. The first time I tried their truffle pasta (Chef's special) and was in awe from how good it was. My experience was not as great this time around.

Food 4/5
The appetizers started very strong. We got focaccia and the chicken liver pate. Both tasted amazing. The pastas were weak though and were lacking flavor complexity.

Presentation 5/5
Service 5/5
Atmosphere 5/5
I love the vibes here. It does not try hard but is sophisticated nonetheless.

Value 4/5
In my opinion the prices are a little high for the value I get. The pasta dishes are pretty small.

reviews.author: Clare G
reviews.text: Solid Italian spot in SF. It’s got a really great selection of home made pastas. Recommend going with friends and sharing a few dishes!

testimonials: I thought everything was perfect. Our waiter was EXCELLENT. We got a bottle of red from Campagna which was reasonably priced and delectable. Our two salads were delicate and refined, and the pasta was firm but tender (how is that possible by the way?) filled with delightful morsels. Nice mixed fruit pie with ice cream to complete. Recommended.

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: YAYA FOODIE
reviews.text:
Underwhelming flavors, not a fan.

Service: 10/10 fast and super polite and friendly

Food: taste wasn’t it, entry bread w vinegar had no flavor. The pastas all lacked flavor except the gnocchi one. Tiramisu was nice and fresh we liked it a lot. Pizzas weren’t a favorite.

Overall: wouldn’t come here again, do to the food taste. Otherwise service is so nice.

reviews.author: Gary Gardner
reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. This is some delicious, fresh Italian. I have had the opportunity to eat here on two different occasions while visiting San Francisco. The first time was with my family and the second with employees. The owner is incredibly friendly and accommodating and yes, he’s an authentic Italian. The lasagna will melt in your mouth and the desserts (especially the panna cotta) is to die for!!! I will be back on my next visit to the beautiful city.

reviews.author: Melanie Alfonso
reviews.text: Walked in for a last minute dinner and they were able to sit us within 20 minutes despite being really busy. Felt at home from the minute we walked in. Servers were hilarious and helpful. Delicious pasta the amatriciana stole the show. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Denise Keefe
reviews.text: This place is great for a fun group. The staff is outgoing, attentive, and professional. The food is delicious and has large portions. It is priced very reasonably. It is not a quiet date night type place, but it is just perfect for a happy vibe. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Pasha Gleyzer
reviews.text: Oh wow.  Definitely, the best carbonara in the city.  Everything in it: spaghetti, guanciale, pecorino romana, everything is of the highest quality, expertly cooked.  Al dente, guanciale is crispy and juicy, served very hot. Margherita pizza is also very good.  The arugula salad was the freshest.  The salmon was also delicious; with garlic that did not overpower it.  After all that, Giuseppe, the owner, gave us tiramisu on the house.  It was soft as a cloud, not very sweet: delicioso.  I will be back for bucatini ala amatriciana.  The place is full of characters both who serve you, and the regulars.  On a Wednesday at 1:30pm, you can get a table easily.

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 716 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Esther Lee
reviews.text: I had the best time here with my family & friends. They do use one time use plates but I think it's because they must be extremely busy with serving & cooking. The pasta was so good but my favorite was the lasagna. Do NOT skip out on the lasagna!!! I would definitely go back to eat here again. I loved how welcoming the staff was and the pasta tasted super fresh. Although there were so many branches of this restaurant, I recommend coming here to try it in this area because this place is the place to be! I love walking around this area but make sure to stay vigilant.

reviews.author: Sili Si
reviews.text: The food at The Italian Homemade Company was tasty and fresh – the pasta had good texture and flavor. However, it didn’t quite live up to the hype. Everything was served on disposable plates, which took away from the overall dining experience. Great for a quick, casual bite, but not ideal if you’re looking for something more memorable or atmospheric.

reviews.author: Luiz Oliveira
reviews.text: I only came here because of the reviews and certainly not coming back. For $20+ pasta you’d expect at least a proper plate, not a paper plate that makes your pasta taste weird. The pasta itself seemed fresh, but the sauce was nothing special you can find way better options in Little Italy for similar price that doesn’t feel like street food. Also, the tables outdoors were probably never cleaned.

reviews.author: Rosary Ann Oca
reviews.text: We had lunch for my birthday, trying a new restaurant every time. The food was average (the ones we ordered at least) but the serving size was ok. Had high expectations for the pasta but the Fettuccine with white sauce was something I can do better at home. The meat lasagna was great at least! My favorite cake is tiramisu so I ordered one but this was also just average. The piadina (nina) was ok but nothing to rave about. Overall, if other restaurants are full and you are really hungry, this is a good and decent place to eat.

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.text: Wonderful meal on our visit to SF. The feel of the restaurant was homey and upbeat. The people working in the kitchen and at the register were an absolute delight. It seems like they enjoy each other and take pride in the delicious food that they make. The Panna Cotta is divine. I am glad we had a chance to stop by.

testimonials: I had the best time here with my family & friends. They do use one time use plates but I think it's because they must be extremely busy with serving & cooking. The pasta was so good but my favorite was the lasagna. Do NOT skip out on the lasagna!!! I would definitely go back to eat here again. I love walking around this area but make sure to stay vigilant.

top_10.name: Bella Trattoria
top_10.address: 3854 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Sanaz Deldar
reviews.text: We just had one of the best dining experiences ever at this Italian restaurant! The food was so amazing that we even forgot to take photos. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service. Our server, Kitty, was incredibly warm and friendly. She noticed we weren’t enjoying one of our dishes and promptly replaced it, then surprised us with a delightful panna cotta dessert. It’s rare to find such attentive and thoughtful customer service these days. Thanks to Kitty, our night was truly unforgettable. We’ll definitely be back and highly recommend this place to everyone.

reviews.author: L t'the O
reviews.text: Relaxed feel with an upscale ambiance. The food is delicious!! Highly recommended for a chill night out. They were very accommodating to our last-minute party of 9 celebrating a 21st birthday.

reviews.author: Leslie Mejia
reviews.text: Delicious Italian spot with exceptional staff and a cozy, welcoming ambiance. I loved the pesto pasta—it was fresh, flavorful, and not overly greasy. The bread served with sun-dried tomatoes was absolutely incredible; I’d honestly come back just for that! One star off because my partner didn’t enjoy the burrata pizza—it was more like bread topped with burrata, arugula, and ham, and lacked warmth and sauce. That said, we’re excited to come back and try other pizzas. Overall, great food and outstanding service. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Faranak Vn
reviews.text:
We took a chance on this place. Best to make a reservation; we were walk-ins and the staff was super nice and seated us after a short wait time. The food was surprisingly delicious. Service was great. The server surprised us with a complimentary ice cream for dessert.
The bathroom was clean but could use a bit of redecoration and renovation.

reviews.author: Eryn Cruz
reviews.text: I loved my time eating here. I had originally planned to eat here only once during my trip but after my first dinner, I had cancelled other dinner plans and came here again before coming back home. The bruschetta is very yummy and I could eat like 3 orders of them they are that good. It's very flavourful and is not like any other bruschetta I've had before. The fresh mozza was delicious. The Arrabiata is also very good and has a nice kick to it. I ordered the same dishes I had on my first dinner at my second dinner because I just had to have it again before leaving.

testimonials: We just had one of the best dining experiences ever at this Italian restaurant! The food was so amazing that we even forgot to take photos. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service. Our server, Kitty, was incredibly warm and friendly. She noticed we weren’t enjoying one of our dishes and promptly replaced it, then surprised us with a delightful panna cotta dessert. It’s rare to find such attentive and thoughtful customer service these days. Thanks to Kitty, our night was truly unforgettable. We’ll definitely be back and highly recommend this place to everyone.

top_10.name: La Ciccia
top_10.address: 291 30th St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA

reviews.author: Jiasheng Zhu
reviews.text:
La Ciccia is one of our favorite restaurants in SF. We’ve been coming here a bunch over the past year and took our parents here whenever they are in town

It's a small family style restaurant with a cozy vibe, and the service is always friendly

We've tried pretty much everything on the menu at this point, and our favorite dishes are the roasted calamari, baby octopus stew, and oven roasted prawns. Everything is packed with flavor. This place is perfect if you like a little bit of spice in your dishes

reviews.author: Nora Du
reviews.text: For the appetizer, we ordered Inzalaredda de Acciugasa e Arangiu, which paired perfectly with the bread. We also ordered Prupisceddu in Umidu cun Tomatiga, which was incredibly tender. Pasta Cruzza cun Arrizonis for the main course was very authentic, and eating it warm was a delightful experience. Pezza de Angioni a sa Saba was also very tender. The restaurant had a great ambiance, and the service was excellent!!!! ❤️

reviews.author: Oscar Flores
reviews.text: Quaint bistro in San Francisco Mission area with southern Italian cuisine focus. Food is fresh and there are daily specials to choose from. Reservations are highly recommended as the venue is small and often full and thus you run risk of not finding table if you they are full.

reviews.author: Arthur Glauberman
reviews.text: La Ciccia is a fabulous Sardinian restaurant with s menu that enlightened our palates with foods we had neverceaten before that was absolutely delicious!

reviews.author: Grace W
reviews.text:
Had the best evening at La Ciccia, and every dish and the wine were all delicious.  Cheryl and team are lovely, very warm and welcoming. Here’s what we ordered:

Starters: calamari, the oven roasted prawns
Mains: pasta special of the day, and the spaghetti spicy olive oil with bottariga

All were so flavorful and complex, will order everything again. Forgot what wine we had but it was recommended by our server.

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 1919 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Edwin Karlsson
reviews.text: Delicious food for a reasonable price. Pasta dishes run you just shy of $20 which is definitely well below the San Francisco average. The atmosphere inside is very casual, and has a combination of table and bar seating. The menu allows a choice of pasta with any of their 6-7 sauce options, so lots of customization available. Definitely very good and recommended!

reviews.author: Katia Martha
reviews.text: The pasta is very fresh- you can see them making it in the front window! Indoor and outdoor seating options. If you’re a vegetarian, there’s a couple options but very limited… I saw so many good reviews about the gnocchi, I tried that and had it with the marinara sauce - good and my only complaint is it went super quickly and didn’t feel very filling to me.

reviews.author: Mary Hryhorchuk
reviews.text: It was quite, not a lot of people, nice atmosphere, nice customer service. Sandwiches were a little dry, some provided sauces would have been really nice, but we paid 4$ for a small amount of sauce. Tiramisu was so good, the cream was really fluffy and it was really moist. Overall pretty good

reviews.author: Matt Maverick
reviews.text: The food was delicious, as a chef of almost 15 years.  I appreciate a homemade meal. As soon as you walk in, the staff was speaking Italian, a gentleman was working ravioli sheets and you just knew from that point this place was going to be legit and it did not disappoint at all. Found another reason worth coming back to SF and this place is it. Going to try their other locations during my next visit!

reviews.author: Акбота Зейтен
reviews.text:
The BLONDE  woman at the register completely ruined our experience. From the very beginning, she was noticeably unfriendly — she interrupted me while I was placing my order and kept rushing me, even though there was only one couple behind us who were still deciding what to get. It felt like she was deliberately speaking fast and harshly just to make it clear we weren’t welcome. It was unpleasant and unnecessary.
Later, she was the one who brought our food. She acted like she didn’t see us and just slammed the plates down on the table. That kind of attitude is unacceptable. I also noticed in the comments that many other people have complained about this same blonde woman — so it’s clearly not a one-time issue. It’s a shame, because the food was genuinely delicious, and the dark-haired guy and girl were really friendly and kind. They created a nice atmosphere, and if it weren’t for the rude behavior of the cashier, our overall impression would have been completely different.

testimonials: Delicious food for a reasonable price. Pasta dishes run you just shy of $20 which is definitely well below the San Francisco average. The atmosphere inside is very casual, and has a combination of table and bar seating. The menu allows a choice of pasta with any of their 6-7 sauce options, so lots of customization available. Definitely very good and recommended!

It was quite, not a lot of people, nice atmosphere, nice customer service. Sandwiches were a little dry, some provided sauces would have been really nice, but we paid 4$ for a small amount of sauce. Tiramisu was so good, the cream was really fluffy and it was really moist. Overall pretty good

top_10.name: Acquerello
top_10.address: NEAR VAN NESS &, 1722 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Benjamin Grover
reviews.text: This was a great location for us to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The service was absolutely unbelievable. Honestly it was so good it almost got annoying. My water glass never was less than 3/4 full and any time you left the table you napkin was refreshed. The food was beautiful and totally different than I had ever experienced. It was good but not like any food I had had before. My only issue was my tuna that I got for my main course was a little over cooked. Definitely a great experience. Also definitely as expensive as I thought it would be. It was easy to walk to from our hotel on union square.

reviews.author: Jessie W
reviews.text: Acquerello was the perfect choice for a birthday celebration! The atmosphere is so elegant, yet still felt welcoming. And oh my goodness, the pasta! It's incredible that they've been serving some of these dishes for 35 years – you can taste the history and perfection in every bite. It was definitely a standout. Combine that with impeccable service and a fantastic wine list, and you've got a truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend for any special occasion!

reviews.author: Zaila V
reviews.text:
I have been to multiple 1, 2, and 3 Michelin star restaurants and I can’t believe this place only has 2 stars. It is a must go for any food lover.
The food was exceptional! The vegetarian substitutions were made with the same, if not more, thoughtfulness. While some aspects were experimental, it was never at the expense of flavor. The pictures do not do the place justice (experience from Oct 2024).
The staff were very friendly and made solo dining a comfortable experience. The pace of dinner was spot on so I didn’t feel rushed nor was I waiting for courses. They explained the complex techniques used to make each dish which was appreciated.

reviews.author: Luciano Virgilio
reviews.text:
I received a gift certificate for a dining experience at this restaurant. The food was excellent, although after a 4 course meal, I left that I was still hungry (portion sizes are extremely tiny). Service is over the top-waiters are very attentive and anticipate your every need throughout the meal. Atmosphere is nice but a bit pretentious with a restrictive dress code. What's absolutely outrageous is the price. A meal for 2 people with wine pairing (2oz pours x4) cost us $821!!
It is an offense to poverty-if I weren't gifted a $600 gift card, I would have never dined in such place.

reviews.author: Chris Roberts
reviews.text: The presentation for these dishes were 10/10 and the ambience at the restaurant was 10/10. They have a beautiful wine cellar with many wines to choose from. This is an excellent restaurant if you like trying rare and imported wines and excellent food. The service is top notch and everyone is very hard working and attentive to the customers. My favorite dish was the ridge pasta with truffles. It is their signature dish and is delicious. My second favorite dish was the peppered crusted tuna. That was also good. The presentation of my dessert was very creative and it was amazing. I got the panna cotta. Overall, I'd recommend coming here for a nice evening with great wine, beautiful ambiance, excellent food, and service.

testimonials: This was a great location for us to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The service was absolutely unbelievable. Honestly it was so good it almost got annoying. My water glass never was less than 3/4 full and any time you left the table you napkin was refreshed. The food was beautiful and totally different than I had ever experienced. It was good but not like any food I had had before. My only issue was my tuna that I got for my main course was a little over cooked. Definitely a great experience. Also definitely as expensive as I thought it would be. It was easy to walk to from our hotel on union square.

Acquerello was the perfect choice for a birthday celebration! The atmosphere is so elegant, yet still felt welcoming. And oh my goodness, the pasta! It's incredible that they've been serving some of these dishes for 35 years – you can taste the history and perfection in every bite. It was definitely a standout. Combine that with impeccable service and a fantastic wine list, and you've got a truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend for any special occasion!

The food was exceptional! The vegetarian substitutions were made with the same, if not more, thoughtfulness. While some aspects were experimental, it was never at the expense of flavor. The pictures do not do the place justice (experience from Oct 2024).
The staff were very friendly and made solo dining a comfortable experience. The pace of dinner was spot on so I didn’t feel rushed nor was I waiting for courses. They explained the complex techniques used to make each dish which was appreciated.

top_10.name: Trattoria Contadina
top_10.address: 1800 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Kevin Mandich
reviews.text: Quality was disappointing. The Caesar salad was drenched in cheap dressing and pre-shredded cheese. The Italian soda was just sparkling water with cheap syrup dumped into it. The pork was overcooked, the pasta was very salty. On top of that the servers were in a rush to turn over our table. I came back from the bathroom with my leftover food in a box already. Bad experience.

reviews.author: J. M.
reviews.text:
My family was visiting from Japan and requested Italian.  We reserved for a party for 7. They were able to accommodate my allergy son and they are also kid friendly.  They gave our girls crayons and menus to color. We shared 2 appetizers and 4 dishes.

Definitely enjoyed our meal and time spent there.

reviews.author: jewls r
reviews.text: Lovely staff and even better pasta. I will absolutely be coming back here - we got the il davioli (8.1/10 and risotto verde(8.7/10). The perfect place for solo date night, couple date night, celebration or honestly anything. Very cozy and friendly atmosphere and genuinely the fastest food service ever. The glass of Chardonnay wasn’t the best I’ve had but it wasn’t the star of the show so that’s ok

reviews.author: Paige MacLaren
reviews.text: Wonderful cozy Italian restaurant! The service is wonderful and the waiters make you feel right at home. The food was phenomenal, every single pasta dish was a banger! The wine recommendation was also so awesome! 11/10 I do reccomend this place :)

reviews.author: Garnet Shepherd
reviews.text: We made a same-day reservation and came in for a birthday dinner. The ambience was elegant but not stuffy, and the service was both friendly and professional. As many other reviews have pointed out, their roasted bell pepper (very cheesy, with a creamy tomato sauce) is excellent. The gnocchi was perfectly cooked and very filling, with either the same or a similar sauce to the bell pepper (no complaints here!). The tiramisu was exceptionally light and balanced in flavor. We will definitely come here again, soon!

The pork was overcooked, the pasta was very salty. On top of that the servers were in a rush to turn over our table. I came back from the bathroom with my leftover food in a box already. Bad experience.

Definitely enjoyed our meal and time spent there.
