The glass of Chardonnay wasn’t the best I’ve had but it wasn’t the star of the show so that’s ok

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Todd P
reviews.text:
The restaurant is quite small and it was busy. At least last night, the best option was to eat at the bar.  From start to finish, everyone there were super friendly and efficient.

We started with a cup of clam chowder and 2 oyster shooters. The oysters were delicious and the chowder was full of clams. Yummy!

After that, we ordered the sand dabs with spinach and steamed mussels. Wow!  Huge portions of delicious food. The sand dabs were sweet and flavored with lemon.  And the mussels while small were excellent too. We went through 2 bread servings to sop up the delicious broth.

We went early and there was a waiting line when we left.

reviews.author: Nori
reviews.text:
Good seafood at reasonable price.
$2 oysters were fresh. Clams on half shell also nice.
Portions are huge. Crab Louie is a mountain of lettuce with lots of fresh, crab meat. Clam chowder was solid but didn't stand out.

Overall i enjoyed the meal.

reviews.author: Rusen
reviews.text: Great seafood restaurant—definitely worth a visit. The food was excellent and the service was good. However, the wait time was incredibly long, so I highly recommend making a reservation if possible. It is always packed. The seating arrangements could also be improved, especially for the price you pay.

reviews.author: Ajeng Wijiastuti
reviews.text: Amazing experience we had in the restaurant. Everything about it was just beautiful. All the dishes we ordered were prepared to perfection. The staff were kind, and helpful. Its a must visit for anyone in San Fransisco

reviews.author: Drowsy Naga
reviews.text:
Came for the Seafood Cioppino but ended up loving the Risotto.

The rice was cooked perfectly, not too creamy and there are some sort of secret ingredients or burning that brings out the flavor. It was a 10/10 for me.

The Cioppino was okay, nothing spectacular. Could be because I am not a big fan of tomato-based sauces.

I came on Saturday around 5pm, waited for 30mins to get a seat for 1 person. I was expecting all longer line but that wasn't too bad at all

Great seafood restaurant—definitely worth a visit. The food was excellent and the service was good. However, the wait time was incredibly long, so I highly recommend making a reservation if possible. It is always packed. The seating arrangements could also be improved, especially for the price you pay.

top_10.name: North Beach Gyros
top_10.address: 561 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Vasilisa Shmatko
reviews.text: Food was amazing and portions were huge!!! I had chicken wrap and it came with a yogurt sauce which was delicious. Absolutely loved it and will come back if my family is gonna be in San Francisco again. Our waiter, Oscar is incredible, he gave off a great energy and he is extra nice!!!

reviews.author: Giorgio Dushaw
reviews.text:
I couldn't describe a better Greek place, a staff that is more than happy to make sure their customers are satisfied and happy. Very quality Greek food, personally had the Chicken Gyros, Greek Fries, and the Baklava. It's a top choice for Greek, and it was a great option for dinner.

I was very pleased with the management and ambience, handled with a high level of expertise and professionalism that I find unmatched from other restaurants. I highly recommend this place, and enjoy your time when you visit!

Attached are a few beautiful images of the food I tried.

reviews.author: Marlon Kranz
reviews.text:
The Food here is amazing, the best Greek food I ever had in the US.
Highly recommend the beef tenderloin and the Greek Fries!
The service is very good, fast and super nice, the owner made sure we had a great time here.
We went here 2 days in a row and if I’m ever back to San Francisco I will come again!

The price is also more than fair, we only paid ~$100 for a table of 3 including drinks.

reviews.author: Eddie Hernandez
reviews.text:
Everything we ate was 100% delicious. We were greeted and welcomed so friendly and the experience just was amazing
We ordered beef tenderloin and chicken kebab plates. Everything was so tender, well seasoned and melted in our mouths.

reviews.author: Ittche 12
reviews.text:
Phenomenal food and great service and such an affordable price. I had the braised duck, and it was perfectly cooked. The rice was well-seasoned, and the fig complemented the dish well. For dessert, I had baklava, and it tasted fresh and wasn't too sweet (a good thing).

Honestly, if you're in San Francisco, you must try this place. Good price fresh food, and it tastes good. What more can I say?

testimonials: Food was amazing and portions were huge!!! I had chicken wrap and it came with a yogurt sauce which was delicious. Absolutely loved it and will come back if my family is gonna be in San Francisco again. Our waiter, Oscar is incredible, he gave off a great energy and he is extra nice!!!

We went here 2 days in a row and if I’m ever back to San Francisco I will come again!

top_10.name: The Bite
top_10.address: 996 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Jennifer Olguin
reviews.text: Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I’m definitely returning for more😌

reviews.author: Eddie Valadez
reviews.text: I was invited to lunch at The Bite. I chose the Lamb & Beef wrap and I absolutely enjoyed my meal. The wrap was huge but most importantly fresh tasting. The wrap is served with 3 different sauces and all 3 are delicious. The Bite is in a shady neighborhood but the restaurant is clean and safe. I will be returning.

reviews.author: Don Bliss
reviews.text: The Bite is one of my go-to places for lunch when I am in the area, for work or for appointments and carry-out as well.  The food is always fresh and delicious, like homemade, and the flavors are subtly unique for typical Mediterranean fare.  The service is always friendly and efficient.  The atmosphere is simple but pleasant, and even though it is in an unpleasant area, it is being cleaned up significantly and this place is worth a stop.

reviews.author: Sarah W
reviews.text: Delicious, healthy, and full of flavor! The falafel bowl is my favorite, nutritious with beautiful presentation! Staff is super sweet. One of my top favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Also the limeade is the best. You have to visit The Bite when in SF!

reviews.author: patrickhnoe
reviews.text:
Exceptional lentil soup. Never had a recipe so light and tasty with such an interesting depth of flavor. The Soma salad was also very good.
The area it is in is a little seedy but worth the trip. The restaurant itself is tidy and clean, the wait staff friendly and helpful. I will be back again for more soup and sample more food.

testimonials: Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I’m definitely returning for more😌

I was invited to lunch at The Bite. I chose the Lamb & Beef wrap and I absolutely enjoyed my meal. The wrap was huge but most importantly fresh tasting. The wrap is served with 3 different sauces and all 3 are delicious. The Bite is in a shady neighborhood but the restaurant is clean and safe. I will be returning.

The atmosphere is simple but pleasant, and even though it is in an unpleasant area, it is being cleaned up significantly and this place is worth a stop.

top_10.name: Kokkari Estiatorio
top_10.address: 200 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Abril Ruhstaller
reviews.text:
We went with a group of friends and tried several dishes from the menu. First of all, we were served a huge basket of freshly baked sourdough bread with amazing olive oil, such a great start!

We ordered a variety of plates to share, and everything was delicious and generous in portion. Highlights for us were the octopus and the massive branzino, both outstanding.

The service was excellent from beginning to end. A solid 10/10. We’ll definitely be coming back! :)

reviews.author: Kang Wang
reviews.text: Definitely one of the best Greek restaurant in the city of San Francisco! The experience starts with the extraordinary interior design of the rustic vintage farmhouse, vibe filled with energy. There is a giant skewer of kebab oven in the center of the restaurant as well. Service is great, busy lively., the food is absolutely delicious. We got lamb and various veggies. The feta and watermelon salad is surprisingly good. highly recommend.

reviews.author: Neena Taskar
reviews.text:
Most dishes are very good, we had very traditional Greek items such as saganaki, dolmades, octopus (excellent), gigantes, kolokothokeftedes (zucchini cakes). The taramosalata, typical of the Greek mezedes, was disappointing, very flavorless. The kokkinisto with lamb shank excellent. The loukoumades (doughnut balls) were disappointing, not crispy on the outside.
I have cut marks on atmosphere because of two things. Greek hospitality, filoxenia, is famous; it was completely missing. The service was what you would expect at a good restaurant, no more. Simple Greek greetings such as "kalosorizete" (welcome) and "styn iyeia sas" (to your health) after pouring the drinks would have made it more authentic. And the "kerasma" (typically a simple dessert) on the house, so inherent to the Greek culture was completely missing.

reviews.author: CHLOE CHOE
reviews.text:
This was the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The food was delicious, and the temperature and atmosphere of the restaurant were perfect.

Our server, Ben, was incredibly kind and professional. His recommendations did not disappoint. The highlights of the meal were the lamb and sea bass—both made with fresh ingredients and had an amazingly tender texture.

Everything came together perfectly. This is definitely a place I’d love to return to when I’m back in San Francisco! 👏🍽️🥂

reviews.author: Louie Smirnoff
reviews.text:
Visiting Kokkari Estiatorio was a delightful experience that I wholeheartedly enjoyed. Nestled in the heart of San Francisco, this Greek gem offers an authentic taste of Greece with a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. From the moment I stepped in, the staff greeted me warmly and provided excellent service throughout the meal.

To start, I tried the Grilled Octopus, which was tender and perfectly seasoned, providing a wonderful balance of flavors. For my main course, I opted for the Lamb Chops. They were cooked to perfection, with a juicy and succulent texture that melted in my mouth. Each bite was a testament to the restaurant’s commitment to quality and authenticity.

The ambiance at Kokkari is cozy yet elegant, with a rustic decor that makes you feel right at home. The gentle lighting and meticulous attention to detail add to the dining experience, making it perfect for both intimate gatherings and larger celebrations.

I finished my meal with a serving of Baklava, which was the perfect way to end the evening. The layers of pastry were crisp, and the sweetness was just right.

Overall, Kokkari Estiatorio exceeded my expectations. With its outstanding cuisine, attentive service, and charming atmosphere, it’s a place I would highly recommend to anyone looking to indulge in a memorable Greek dining experience. I can’t wait to return and explore more of their menu!

And the "kerasma" (typically a simple dessert) on the house, so inherent to the Greek culture was completely missing.

top_10.name: Presidio Kebab Mediterranean Restaurant
top_10.address: 3277 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Justin B
reviews.text:
Amazing food and service. We had chicken kebab plate, Turkish breakfast with sausage, lentil soup, chicken wrap, a special appetizer with three different hors d’oeuvres. We also had regular coffee and Turkish coffee which came with a Turkish delight.

It also came with freshly baked pita bread and a hot sauce, best pita bread ever.

The owner and staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. The seats and tables are very comfortable It has say quiet atmosphere with really beautiful decoration, the restroom is extremely clean too. We have been there many times and is our favorite Turkish/Middle Eastern restaurant!

reviews.author: Walter “Wally” Pietsch
reviews.text: Excellent food and very friendly service. Big portions, reasonable pricing. Nice atmosphere, background music, low noise if at all. Dinner with family. We'll be back. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Bill Wang
reviews.text: A charming spot with coastal-inspired decor, delicious Mediterranean food, and incredibly friendly service. We went with the Baba Ghanoush and the Yaprak Doner Kebab - both beautifully plated and packed with stunning flavors. The lamb in the kebab in particular had a rich taste that really stood out. Wish we had room to try more dishes - definitely a gem worth returning to!

reviews.author: weena paweena
reviews.text:
The food was so delicious and the staff were really friendly.
I made a reservation, but they even gave me a separate welcome drink to keep me waiting a bit.
I will definitely go again.   I like service❤️❤️❤️❤️

reviews.author: MANO No
reviews.text: The food was delicious, portions were generous, and everything was cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was cozy and the service was warm and friendly. Definitely a place I’ll return to!

testimonials:
Amazing food and service. We had chicken kebab plate, Turkish breakfast with sausage, lentil soup, chicken wrap, a special appetizer with three different hors d’oeuvres. We also had regular coffee and Turkish coffee which came with a Turkish delight.

It also came with freshly baked pita bread and a hot sauce, best pita bread ever.

The owner and staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. The seats and tables are very comfortable It has say quiet atmosphere with really beautiful decoration, the restroom is extremely clean too. We have been there many times and is our favorite Turkish/Middle Eastern restaurant!

Wish we had room to try more dishes - definitely a gem worth returning to!

top_10.name: Milos Meze
top_10.address: 3348 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Eric Hernandez
reviews.text: We just popped in here without a reservation and seated  immediately. Service is top notch even asking if we had any food allergies.  Food is exceptional. Great flavors present with the beef and lamb dish. Octopus 🐙 very tasty and not over grilled. Red hummus a bit spicy but delicious. Give this place a try. I don’t feel you’ll be disappointed.

reviews.author: Cemile Kalkan
reviews.text:
Had an amazing evening yesterday at Milos Meze with my brothers and a friend! 🥂✨
The appetizers and food were absolutely delicious, and we wrapped it up perfectly with their homemade baklava and other mouthwatering desserts. 🍽️🍯
The cozy tavern vibe and Mediterranean-inspired ambiance made everything even more special.

Big thanks to Chef Ali and his wonderful team for the warm hospitality — you truly deserve every award you’ve earned! 👏👏
Can’t wait to come back! 💙

reviews.author: AJM
reviews.text:
The food was excellent, every dish was full of flavor and the lamb chops were top notch. It is far too loud for me though, that alone is enough to make me cross it off my list. I had to lean in to listen to my husband on the other side of the table...I mean LOUD. So for that alone it's not my bag. The grilled Spanish octopus dish was a bit disappointing as well, size-wise. One small tentacle for the price.

Other than that, great service, delicious food and beautiful interior.

reviews.author: Vash
reviews.text: A great Mediterranean and Greek spot with a cozy, stylish setting. The small plates offered a nice variety, each with its own bold flavors. The chicken souvlaki skewers stood out—tender, juicy, and well-seasoned. The staff was warm and welcoming, making the experience even better. With its inviting interior and flavorful dishes, it’s an easy place to enjoy a relaxed, satisfying meal.

reviews.author: Carissa Brown
reviews.text: There is the cutest new Greek restaurant in the Marina. It has all the vibes. Excellent food. Excellent staff. I took my brother who was visiting from out of town, to celebrate Greek Easter. It was laid back in a beautiful atmosphere, we got a bunch of plates, wine and spilt the braised lamb. Excellent. It’s a great place to pop over for a solo date have a glass of wine, a Greek salad or to meet the girls and share apps, most definitely a great weekly date night hands down.

testimonials: We just popped in here without a reservation and seated  immediately. Service is top notch even asking if we had any food allergies.  Food is exceptional. Great flavors present with the beef and lamb dish. Octopus 🐙 very tasty and not over grilled. Red hummus a bit spicy but delicious. Give this place a try. I don’t feel you’ll be disappointed.

Other than that, great service, delicious food and beautiful interior.

top_10.name: Lokma
top_10.address: 1801 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Nick Mecklenburg
reviews.text: Reasonable portion sizes — not too much! Grilled chicken was very tender and flavorful but the halibut dish was even better. I would recommend the dips & pita as well; baba ganoush spread was my favorite.

reviews.author: Jake Kang
reviews.text:
The halibut was DIVINE. Start your course with the hummus and pita. Get the chicken or halibut and end your meal with the baklava with ice cream. You will not be disappointed.

One of my favorite San Francisco spots to eat at, brunch or dinner, especially as the sun sets.

reviews.author: Casburn Spencer
reviews.text: This restaurant is a fantastic place to enjoy a meal. Although parking was challenging, the food, atmosphere, and attentive staff made my experience truly enjoyable. I will definitely revisit this place if I'm in the area. The beet appetizer was particularly flavorful, featuring an unexpected combination of fruit and vegetables. The Branzino, a Mediterranean sea bass, was cooked to perfection. Its delicious white fish meat was undoubtedly the highlight of the evening.

reviews.author: Alicia DiGiammarino
reviews.text: That this place is packed even around 8:30 PM tells you how good it is. The honey and pita small bite is my favorite item on the menu. A spoon is provided so that you can drip sweet honey and clotted cream over perfectly crisp, warm pita. The other dishes are decadent too of course. It’s cozy and warm with interior brick walls that make the vibe a bit edgier than it would be otherwise.

reviews.author: Ozan Ulucan
reviews.text:
f you're looking for an authentic and absolutely delicious Turkish breakfast experience in San Francisco, Lokma is a must-visit!

We ordered their Turkish breakfast spread and everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Each small dish felt thoughtfully prepared from the creamy cheeses and honey to the vibrant olives and fresh fruits. The scrambled eggs with sausage (sucuk) were fluffy and perfectly seasoned, and the warm, fluffy pita slices were the perfect match. Their spinach and cheese börek was a real highlight too flaky, savory, and topped with a light sprinkle of sesame seeds.

The presentation alone is worth mentioning everything came out so colorful and inviting. (See the photos!)

The staff were friendly, attentive, and made the experience even better. The cozy atmosphere and beautiful wooden tables made it feel like a true Turkish home.

Highly recommend Lokma for anyone craving a vibrant and hearty breakfast it's truly one of the best breakfast experiences I've had in the Bay Area!

Favorite bites:

Sucuklu Yumurta (Turkish sausage with scrambled eggs)

Spinach Börek

Homemade jams and olives

Thank you, Lokma team -- can't wait to come back!

testimonials: Reasonable portion sizes — not too much! Grilled chicken was very tender and flavorful but the halibut dish was even better. I would recommend the dips & pita as well; baba ganoush spread was my favorite.

The halibut was DIVINE. Start your course with the hummus and pita. Get the chicken or halibut and end your meal with the baklava with ice cream. You will not be disappointed.

One of my favorite San Francisco spots to eat at, brunch or dinner, especially as the sun sets.

This restaurant is a fantastic place to enjoy a meal. Although parking was challenging, the food, atmosphere, and attentive staff made my experience truly enjoyable. I will definitely revisit this place if I'm in the area. The beet appetizer was particularly flavorful, featuring an unexpected combination of fruit and vegetables. The Branzino, a Mediterranean sea bass, was cooked to perfection. Its delicious white fish meat was undoubtedly the highlight of the evening.

top_10.name: Palmyra
top_10.address: 700 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Ramazan Yener
reviews.text: Excellent food and excellent people! As a Turkish person, I really enjoyed the meal. I ordered the chicken kebab plate, and it was delicious. The hummus, salad, and rice were all excellent. I also had the dessert (namoura), and I loved it!

reviews.author: Yick Doy
reviews.text: Palmyra is a Syrian culinary treasure, serving exceptional kibbeh, a vibrant mezze plate, and an exquisite kunafa dessert. The kibbeh, Syria’s national dish, is a masterpiece—perfectly spiced lamb and bulgur balls, fried to a golden crisp with a tender, flavorful core that bursts with aromatic depth. Palmyra’s commitment to authenticity shines through in every bite, making it unforgettable. The mezze plate is a delightful medley, featuring creamy hummus, zesty fattoush, and smoky baba ghanoush, all paired with warm, freshly baked pita. The interplay of textures and tangy seasonings creates a true Levantine feast. The star, however, is the kunafa—a heavenly dessert of shredded phyllo layered with gooey cheese, soaked in rosewater-infused syrup, and sprinkled with pistachios. Its perfect balance of sweetness and texture is pure bliss. Palmyra’s warm, Syrian-inspired ambiance enhances the experience, making every visit feel like a cultural embrace. For anyone seeking authentic Syrian cuisine, Palmyra’s kibbeh, mezze plate, and kunafa are must-tries that deliver joy and flavor in every mouthful. This is a destination that celebrates Syria’s rich culinary heritage with passion and precision.

reviews.author: Muhammad
reviews.text:
Palmyra - A Hidden Gem for Middle Eastern Cuisine
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I had the pleasure of dining at Palmyra in San Francisco, and it was an unforgettable experience! The food was absolutely phenomenal, and the customer service was equally impressive.

The Dishes:
The flavors were authentic and rich, with everything cooked to perfection. The grilled chicken was tender and flavorful, the lentil soup was perfectly spiced, and the kabobs were juicy and seasoned just right. The hummus was creamy with a delightful hint of sumac, and the fresh cucumber-tomato salad balanced the meal beautifully. Every dish was plated with care and served fresh.

Customer Service:
The staff (Br Yasir) was incredibly welcoming and attentive, ensuring that every aspect of our dining experience was smooth and enjoyable. They were quick to accommodate requests and made us feel like valued guests.

Ambiance:
The restaurant offers a cozy and inviting environment, perfect for a casual dinner or a special gathering.

If you’re in SF and looking for authentic Middle Eastern cuisine with exceptional service, Palmyra is a must-visit. Highly recommended—this place is a true culinary treasure!

reviews.author: Steph
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious falafel platter! Everything was fresh, well-made, simple, and yummy. The staff is lovely and I like the casual, order-at-the-counter, and easy-going atmosphere

reviews.author: Zoe Pennington
reviews.text: Best falafel and hummus. The environment feels cozy yet spacious. I love this place, it’s a staple of lower Haight.

top_10.name: Mezze and Mooore
top_10.address: 198 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Owen James
reviews.text:
Fantastic food at really reasonable prices. They didn’t serve alcohol but said we were more than welcome to bring our own wine in. We got lamb plate, lamb salad, and chicken hummus plate. The chicken hummus with a little onion on pita was a little packet of heaven, like how my ex wife must feel when she gets her alimony checks every month.

The pita bread was warm and toasty, unlike my ex wife’s heart. Very solid spot!

reviews.author: Asma Ali
reviews.text:
I am a regular at Mezze and moore and always recommend it to my friends.
I only took one star off because I was charged 4$ for a tiny bowl of Toum which is usually served with the plates& wraps based on my previous experience. Also, asked for black tea after food and got served green tea.
Although we ordered 2 mezzes, bread wasn't served. We had to ask for it.
We usually get a salad, some hot mezze and plates, but this time we went for the wraps.
Love the chicken wrap; delicious and full of flavor. Not a big fan of the kofta. The meat quality was okay.

reviews.author: Megha Jindal
reviews.text:
Simply walked in to try out this place based ok Reddit recommendations, and it was a pleasant surprise
We had chicken shawarma plate, chicken shawarma roll, hummus and pita.
All the dishes were yum, and the ambiance was good too.

reviews.author: israel leitner
reviews.text:
Mezze and Mooore – A Mediterranean Delight!

Mezze and Mooore serves up delicious, high-quality Mediterranean cuisine with bold flavors and fresh ingredients. The Mixed Grill Platter is a must-try, featuring juicy, well-seasoned meats with rice, hummus, and salad. The Crispy Roasted Cauliflower is perfectly caramelized, and the Stuffed Grape Leaves are packed with flavor. With great service and a welcoming atmosphere, this spot is a winner!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Yesh
reviews.text: Not really a fan of the food here. Tried multiple items and overall they all felt too oily with a montonous flavoring. Even the dessert we tried, the kunafe was pretty one dimensional. Felt like it was just an overdose of sugar syrup and nothing else. The seating and management was also haphazard and chaotic. It was pretty much seat yourself wherever, order at the counter or via QR at table. However, this isn't clear on arrival and some patrons stand in line while others directly go seat themselves leading to different wait times and a scramble for seating during busy times. Prices are pretty reasonable which I felt is the only saving grace for us

top_10.name: Ricco Mediterranean
top_10.address: 3145 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Stoked Ryan
reviews.text: Fantastic halal Mediterranean restaurant! The lamb shank was amazing! Everything else we tried was delicious as well. Fast, friendly service. Seated immediately for lunch on a Sunday. Accommodating to young children. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Trevor Johnson
reviews.text: Exceptionally nice food, high quality service. The marinated chicken kebab was one of the nicest I’ve tasted, succulent and moist and the basmati rice was cooked to perfect, very many thanks for making my dining experience so nice.

reviews.author: cohocton14826
reviews.text: Had the Caesar salad with lamb. Also had Salmon dish with whipped potatoes and vegetables. Good portion sizes. Very tasty and flavorful. Nice location. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Amy Maiden
reviews.text: This place was super yummy!  I had the sirloin kebab, and it was tender and well seasoned.  The inside of this restaurant is beautiful, and I was surprised that the restaurant was empty with such a high rating.  This place should be much busier!  Highly recommend!

reviews.author: A.C. Antonelli
reviews.text: In such a lively neighborhood with so many flashy places around, Ricco feels like treasure hidden in plain sight. I must have walked by a dozen times and I feel like a complete fool for not giving them a shot sooner. The food is phenomenal. First off, the dolma was the best I’ve ever had in my life. Seems simple, rice wrapped in grape leaves, right? But it was exceptional. The lamb kebab was delicious, the veggies were buttery and garlicky and perfectly cooked, the rice was flavorful, and that whole roasted tomato was like a nostalgia bomb that brought me back to my childhood. The restaurant itself is really nice too (they don’t always have little skeleton farmers atop the bar but hey it’s Halloween), and the staff is attentive and friendly. Stop scrolling around trying to figure out what you want to eat tonight. You found it, this is it.

testimonials: Fantastic halal Mediterranean restaurant! The lamb shank was amazing! Everything else we tried was delicious as well. Fast, friendly service. Seated immediately for lunch on a Sunday. Accommodating to young children. Highly recommended!

Exceptionally nice food, high quality service. The marinated chicken kebab was one of the nicest I’ve tasted, succulent and moist and the basmati rice was cooked to perfect, very many thanks for making my dining experience so nice.
Had the Caesar salad with lamb. Also had Salmon dish with whipped potatoes and vegetables. Good portion sizes. Very tasty and flavorful. Nice location. Highly recommend.

top_10.name: Bistro Mediterraneo
top_10.address: 2955 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Tadhg O'Sullivan
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Absolutely delicious food and a truly special spot! Everything is freshly made by the owner, who prepares each dish with care and attention - it really shows in the flavor. We eat here regularly because the quality is consistently outstanding.

The Mediterranean plate, loaded with fresh vegetables, creamy yogurt, and perfectly cooked rice, is a standout. Also, the falafel and rice pudding for dessert is amazing.

If you’re looking for a healthy, flavorful, and homemade meal, this place is a must-try. 10/10—highly recommend! 🙌

reviews.author: June K
reviews.text:
I was totally mistaken by the name and all the positive reviews.  Once I got there, I was disappointed at the atmosphere but wanted to give it a try.  That was a mistake.  We ordered lentil soup and a plate of gyros.  As we were waiting for food, I noticed that the kitchen was almost missing.  I am not even sure if there is any burner or any proper cooking equipment. That is not a good sign!  The food came out quickly, probably because there is no cooking done in the back.  The lentil soup was very sour (too much lemon?) and lacked flavor.    I feel like nothing is fresh there.
They should change the name to something that represents "Turkish shop selling food/snacks." There is nothing close to a bistro.

reviews.author: Matheus Dutra
reviews.text: Great food and service. I recommend the desserts, especially the ones with the ice cream (out of this world). The place is small, but very clean and cozy.

reviews.author: Ashley Rose
reviews.text: I got the Falafel wrap and my fiancé got the Gyro plate, and shared a hummus. It was so delicious and fresh. We ate it all and are so stuffed! Great little selection of Middle Eastern and American dry goods. The owner was so friendly. Would definitely recommend this place to a friend!

reviews.author: Maria Guzun
reviews.text: I especially want to highlight the service — we were served by a young man who was very polite, attentive, and did his best to make sure we had a great experience. Thank you so much for such a wonderful attitude! I truly hope this place continues to grow and expand — they absolutely deserve it. I will definitely be coming back and highly recommend it to everyone!

testimonials:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

top_10.name: Anchor Oyster Bar
top_10.address: 579 Castro St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Christopher Taktak
reviews.text:
really outstanding - was not expecting to like it this much!

6 raw oysters / so fresh, yummy, juicy, meaty. wow. outstanding. favourites were the “summer love”

the combination salad with thousand island / just to die for. perfect size. filling, fresh, and the dressing was to die for. good amount of fish on there.

10/10 will be back EXPEDITIOUSLY

reviews.author: Kami Naylor
reviews.text: If I could give a million, I would. The spot is cute and quaint, the food is spectacular, and the service is top-notch! I ordered an oyster shooter, house salad, clam chowder, and half size of the Wild Bluenose Sea Bass Puttanesca Pasta 🤌🏽🤌🏽

reviews.author: Lucy Greco
reviews.text: I really love the parklick for this restaurant. it is comfortable, cozy and the food is truly excellent seafood. the waiter really does a great job of letting you know what the dishes are and sells them just by giving a mouth watering description the specials. the night we went was a corn chowder that the description sold me instantly. lovely oysters delicious crab. the food really outstanding

reviews.author: Christopher Chung
reviews.text:
Top quality seafood, a result of the highly focused menu and passionately curated daily specials.

Stellar service — very professional. Quaint interior, perfect for a romantic date. Ask for window side seating (if possible) for great people watching along Castro.

reviews.author: Teresa
reviews.text: I found best seafood in SF at the Anchor Oyster bar. There’s a reason it’s Michelin recommend. Everything was super fresh and delicious; the raw oysters even tasted sweet. I recommend getting the scallops. We came close to closing time and the wait wasn’t bad. Even though we sat by the bar, our waitress was very attentive. I will definitely be back to try more items on the menu.

testimonials:
really outstanding - was not expecting to like it this much!

6 raw oysters / so fresh, yummy, juicy, meaty. wow. outstanding. favourites were the “summer love”

the combination salad with thousand island / just to die for. perfect size. filling, fresh, and the dressing was to die for. good amount of fish on there.

10/10 will be back EXPEDITIOUSLY

top_10.name: Pacific Cafe
top_10.address: 7000 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: chris martinez
reviews.text:
After coming here for over 4 years
From The San Joaquin Valley
Its Our Favorite Seafood Restaurant. The Menu is expanding and Delicious. Waiters do an amazing job of making sure you are attended and seated in time. Bonus for the Free Wine for waiting to be seated.

reviews.author: Lori Adams
reviews.text: Complementary wine while you wait… Need, I say more? This cozy corner spot is in demand almost every evening, because of the delicious seafood, the charming atmosphere, and the free wine.  I’ve been here two times now, and I would say that. I love the crab cakes and the Parmesan Halibut. Friends in my party. Had the shrimp Louie  salad the salmon and the delicious chocolate cake for dessert.. you really can’t go wrong. They’ve been around since the 1970s that tells you something.

reviews.author: Casey Russell
reviews.text: I was first introduced to Pacific Cafe by my uncles who have been coming here since the first year it opened. 50 years later and it still stands the test of time and is one of the best restaurants in the Bay Area. I always make it a point to stop when I'm back and visiting friends. You absolutely can't miss the calamari vinaigrette or the clam chowder. Make sure to save room for the chocolate cake, it’s to die for! I seriously cannot say enough good things about Pacific Cafe. The food, the wait staff, the old school ambience, plus the free wine while you wait doesn't hurt. Do yourself a favor and check out Pacific Cafe.

reviews.author: ana benavides
reviews.text: Having dinner here was a great experience! Everyone was so friendly and the food was great! They welcomed us with wine from the house and everyone made sure we were enjoying ourselves! Thank you Pacific Cafe

reviews.author: Lena Calif
reviews.text: We saw this small restaurant by chance. We can say that we found this restaurant by the smell.... If the smell is pleasant, then the food will be tasty. And we were not mistaken. Everything was tasty and friendly. The male waiter was very active and served us on time like the Genie from Aladdin's lamp. Good tippings and wished him all the best. Thank you.

From The San Joaquin Valley

top_10.name: Scoma's Restaurant
top_10.address: 1965 Al Scoma Way, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Rowland Short
reviews.text: This historic waterfront restaurant provided a  seafood extravaganza with fish so fresh it tasted like it just jumped out the water and onto our plates! Loved the chowder, oysters (Scoma style), anchovies, lazy man's ciopinno and fish and chips.  Eat here for lunch and then go visit the sea lions for a perfect day!  🎣🐟😋🍻👍🏼🙏🏼

reviews.author: Meng Hui Ong
reviews.text:
A blast from the past! Scoma’s started in 1965 and has remained the same since then. From the decor to the waiters in white uniforms. A precious time capsule in the modern world.

The waiter was oozing old world charm, smooth and professional. Drinks before ordering food. Sourdough bread basket only comes out after the menu has been taken away…. He’s been working there for a long time!

Bloody Mary was delicious. Well blended with the house mix. Old school style with the celery stick in a tall glass. Very drinkable.

Sourdough bread was soft with a crust. Perfect for a clam chowder and to scoop up the chunks of clams. Once again, delicious. There’s no outstanding taste, no jarring texture. Not too salty, no overpowering clam taste nor anything outstanding.

Caesar salad was good. The romaine was fresh and crispy, tossed in classic dressing with just enough cheese. A no frills salad that lets the ingredients shine. Good!

Crab cakes were also good. They were juicy, tasty and didn’t taste of breadcrumbs or any other ingredients used. Cakes were very fresh and were not overcooked. There’s over powering crab taste which is nice.

Crab Louie Salad had a mountain of crab on it. It was as fresh as it can get. Once again, there’s no overwhelming “seafood “ smell which is good.

Go for the old world charm. The fresh seafood. The waterfront and surroundings. Leave the modern world behind for an hour or two. Nice experience.

reviews.author: Douglas Robeson
reviews.text: The classic seafood restaurant! Old school vibe, excellent service, and some the best food in SF. This place is a must try even if you're not a seafood fan. There are many options on the menu. Many of the staff have worked here 20+ years. Classic cocktails made the right way. Large wine and beer selection.

reviews.author: Mara Ellen Large
reviews.text: We went to Scoma’s for lunch and had an amazing experience! The fish and chips, clam chowder, and sole fillet were all beyond delicious—fresh, perfectly cooked, and full of flavor. Our server Dale was truly the best—attentive, kind, and made us feel right at home. The Maitre D and the rest of the staff were also so warm and welcoming. Highly recommend for a memorable lunch by the water!

reviews.author: Nick Ludwiczak
reviews.text:
The main server was just okay. He spilled beer all over the table right away. He tried cleaning it up but a lot of it remained which made the table sticky for the entire time there.
The support staff was very attentive and kept up with everything very well.
The clam chowder was alright but nothing great.
The fish and chips were excellent. I would get them again.
I am not sure if I would return or recommend them.

Many of the staff have worked here 20+ years. Classic cocktails made the right way. Large wine and beer selection.

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Todd P
reviews.text:
The restaurant is quite small and it was busy. At least last night, the best option was to eat at the bar.  From start to finish, everyone there were super friendly and efficient.

We started with a cup of clam chowder and 2 oyster shooters. The oysters were delicious and the chowder was full of clams. Yummy!

After that, we ordered the sand dabs with spinach and steamed mussels. Wow!  Huge portions of delicious food. The sand dabs were sweet and flavored with lemon.  And the mussels while small were excellent too. We went through 2 bread servings to sop up the delicious broth.

We went early and there was a waiting line when we left.

reviews.author: Nori
reviews.text:
Good seafood at reasonable price.
$2 oysters were fresh. Clams on half shell also nice.
Portions are huge. Crab Louie is a mountain of lettuce with lots of fresh, crab meat. Clam chowder was solid but didn't stand out.

Overall i enjoyed the meal.

reviews.author: Rusen
reviews.text: Great seafood restaurant—definitely worth a visit. The food was excellent and the service was good. However, the wait time was incredibly long, so I highly recommend making a reservation if possible. It is always packed. The seating arrangements could also be improved, especially for the price you pay.

reviews.author: Ajeng Wijiastuti
reviews.text: Amazing experience we had in the restaurant. Everything about it was just beautiful. All the dishes we ordered were prepared to perfection. The staff were kind, and helpful. Its a must visit for anyone in San Fransisco

reviews.author: Drowsy Naga
reviews.text:
Came for the Seafood Cioppino but ended up loving the Risotto.

The rice was cooked perfectly, not too creamy and there are some sort of secret ingredients or burning that brings out the flavor. It was a 10/10 for me.

The Cioppino was okay, nothing spectacular. Could be because I am not a big fan of tomato-based sauces.

I came on Saturday around 5pm, waited for 30mins to get a seat for 1 person. I was expecting all longer line but that wasn't too bad at all

testimonials:
The restaurant is quite small and it was busy. At least last night, the best option was to eat at the bar.  From start to finish, everyone there were super friendly and efficient.

We started with a cup of clam chowder and 2 oyster shooters. The oysters were delicious and the chowder was full of clams. Yummy!

After that, we ordered the sand dabs with spinach and steamed mussels. Wow!  Huge portions of delicious food. The sand dabs were sweet and flavored with lemon.  And the mussels while small were excellent too. We went through 2 bread servings to sop up the delicious broth.

We went early and there was a waiting line when we left.

Good seafood at reasonable price.
$2 oysters were fresh. Clams on half shell also nice.
Portions are huge. Crab Louie is a mountain of lettuce with lots of fresh, crab meat. Clam chowder was solid but didn't stand out.

Overall i enjoyed the meal.

Great seafood restaurant—definitely worth a visit. The food was excellent and the service was good. However, the wait time was incredibly long, so I highly recommend making a reservation if possible. It is always packed. The seating arrangements could also be improved, especially for the price you pay.

top_10.name: Hog Island Oyster Co.
top_10.address: Ferry Building, #11, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Cisco L
reviews.text:
Right near the ferry landing on the water side of San Francisco’s Ferry Building, Hog Oyster Island Co. offers an easygoing spot to enjoy fresh seafood.

The rustic seafood stew was warm and flavorful, packed with a mix of seafood in a rich tomato broth, plus some good bread to soak it up. The shrimp po’ boy came on a soft brioche bun—crispy shrimp, tangy sauce, and a nice balance of textures. The grilled oysters with garlic butter and Cajun spice were smoky and rich, with just the right kick.

Our server—whose name we didn’t catch—was friendly, quick, and clearly knew the place well. He mentioned he’s been with the restaurant for over 10 years, and it showed in how smoothly everything ran.

Simple menu, great views, and a comfortable setting make it a solid stop if you’re in the area.

Pro tip: parking near the Ferry Building can be tricky. Try downloading the SpotHero app to snag inexpensive parking nearby—it saved us a lot of time and hassle. I paid $10.75 ! Yes, $10.75 for garage parking for 12 hrs but no in and out privileges.

reviews.author: Jamie L
reviews.text: This is my favorite seafood spot—everything is incredibly fresh. The only downside is the wait, which can be over an hour because it’s so popular. It’s perfect for a casual date or a fun night out with friends. Bring a bottle of wine and be sure to order the Dungeness crab! Both the chilled and roasted versions are amazing. And don’t forget the grilled oysters—you can’t go wrong with either. This place is always my go-to when I’m in San Francisco!

reviews.author: Janet K
reviews.text:
While I've been to other Hog Island restaurants, this one is consistently my favorite. The oysters are outstanding; the 'Hog Island Sweetwater' is particularly sweet and rich. The geoduck is also very fresh and delicious, with the citrus sauce enhancing its flavor. Everything else is equally fresh, well-seasoned, and incredibly satisfying.

The only drawback is that this place is always very crowded, leading to somewhat cramped seating.

reviews.author: EJ Palor
reviews.text:
It’s been several years since I’ve eaten here. Came here on Sunday for lunch for a party of 3. I was anticipating a long wait, however, we were seated in 5 minutes.

The staff was friendly and made sure we were well taken care of. The oysters tasted super fresh. 10 oysters, french fries, a salad, and 3 entrees (we shared) was a good amount for 3 people. Looking forward to coming back again.

reviews.author: Key Manning
reviews.text: Hog Island Oyster Co. is a must if you’re near the Ferry Building. Tucked just behind it by the docks, the setting’s unbeatable—and the oysters even more so. There’s usually a queue (sometimes before it opens!) but tables turn quickly, and it’s worth the wait. The space is bright and open, with a great outdoor area and a high-seating bar that’s actually a joy to sit at. Cold oysters are ultra-fresh, and the grilled ones are banging if that’s your thing. Bonus points for the Bloody Mary—easily one of the best I’ve ever had. Spicy, complex, and delicious.

top_10.name: Betty Lou's Seafood & Grill
top_10.address: 318 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Kawika
reviews.text: On a seafood recommendation by a resident my wife and I had a wonderful experience here. We were visiting The City for her birthday, having lived here many years ago. So many choices for good seafood, but we will surely go here again when we return.  My wife had the seafood linguine in tomato cream and I the cioppino. Mine had 1/2 a crab and was so large I thought it was for two. I ate it all! Thankfully, they had bibs. This cioppino is finger food and will decorate the tablecloth, napkins and you! So good! We both finished our plates, which is rare these days. The staff were attentive, suggestions spot on and the owner was very nice, sharing stories of his life and career. Thank you Hector and all the staff. Looking forward to our next meal!

reviews.author: E Lee
reviews.text: I like the eclectic decor. Sometimes breezy if someone leaves one of the doors open. Cioppino is definitely the way to go. I liked the large shrimp and scallops especially. Risotto was okay but a little under for the rice. Seafood was fresh. Bread was good. I could see why they charge for additional

reviews.author: D M (Bigdtravels)
reviews.text:
**A Solid Seafood Experience at Betty Lou’s Seafood Grill**

Betty Lou’s Seafood Grill offers a **pleasant dining experience in the heart of San Francisco**, delivering fresh seafood with thoughtful preparation. While the **clam chowder was thinner** than expected, it still carried a decent flavor that complemented the meal.

The highlight of the evening was the **large prawns in butter sauce**, an entrée that truly stood out. The prawns were **perfectly cooked** and paired beautifully with the accompanying potatoes, creating a rich and satisfying dish.

Service was **decent** throughout our visit—not extraordinary, but efficient enough to ensure a smooth meal.

Overall, Betty Lou’s is a **good seafood restaurant**, providing enjoyable flavors without going over the top. If you’re looking for a casual spot with well-prepared seafood, it’s certainly worth considering.

reviews.author: Shakeel Syed
reviews.text: Amazing sea food and pasta, service is fast a efficient. Servers are on top of their game and food tastes amazing. I had to ask for some red crush pepper because I would like little bit of kick on my pasta. Will visit again when in the town.

reviews.author: Camilo Arenivar
reviews.text: Delicious food! Great service, iconic location. One could not ask for more in this North Beach eatery. The calamari was really flavorful and the sea bass special was great, thankfully they filleted it for me!

top_10.name: Hook Fish Co
top_10.address: 4542 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: A.C. Antonelli
reviews.text: Hook Fish is an absolute gem. I’m not sure what drove some of these reviewers to be so critical of delicious seafood but maybe they’ll work that out in therapy at some point. Will there be a line? Yes, probably, but it moves pretty fast, and they’re going to give you a little fob that will vibrate when your order is ready, so all you’ll have to do is hang out , have a drink maybe, and enjoy some conversation with friends, or perhaps strangers that are also fresh fish enthusiasts. The poke burrito is as outstanding as it is gigantic. Make sure you try some of that tasty carrot hot sauce they’ve got hanging around too (pro-tip: shake the bottle up first).

reviews.author: Will Martin
reviews.text:
Held out on trying this place for too long. The poke burrito is the best I’ve ever had, and it’s HUGE! Worth every penny. The chips and guacamole were also very good.

Have yet to try the fish and chips or the fish tacos, which I hear are excellent. Excited to come back. FYI there’s only outdoor seating, and not too much of it so be prepared and dress appropriately.

reviews.author: Dylan Collier
reviews.text: Took a little while to get the food maybe 15 minutes or so but definitely worth the wait. Expect to spend around $20 a person. No indoor seating and outdoor seating is limited. Love to be able to see the fresh fish.

reviews.author: David Liu
reviews.text: Cute spot with some nice outdoor seating! Might have to wait a second for seating to become available tho. Worst comes to worst you can take out and go watch the sunset at ocean beach! The poke burrito was my favourite, the fish and chips were also blessed

reviews.author: Fatemeh F
reviews.text: We got the fish sandwich, fish and chips and the platter. They were all so fresh and delicious. The only bad thing about this place is that there is no inside seating, which is not suitable for SF’s weather.

testimonials: Hook Fish is an absolute gem. I’m not sure what drove some of these reviewers to be so critical of delicious seafood but maybe they’ll work that out in therapy at some point. top_10.name: Swan Oyster Depot
top_10.address: 1517 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.text:
This is one of those places you must try when you’re in the Bay Area. The food is amazing, and yes, the line is usually at least 30 minutes to an hour, but it’s worth it.

We’ve been here many times, but yesterday we had a disappointing experience. We arrived at around 1:30 PM, and the restaurant closes at 2:30 PM. After waiting in line for almost an hour, right before it was our turn, they told everyone still in line that anyone not seated by 2:30 could only order takeout.

The problem is that they don’t have a website, and this rule isn’t posted anywhere. It would be helpful if they could either stop the line at a certain point or let people know earlier that dine-in may no longer be available. It was frustrating to wait that long and not be able to sit down and eat, especially since many people don’t live nearby and can’t easily come back.

Maybe they could hand out numbered tickets once they know how many guests they can still seat. That way, people at the end of the line won’t waste time standing there for nothing. Just a simple system like that would really help manage expectations.

That said, the food is still excellent. The crab back is one of my absolute favorites, and the sashimi is super fresh.

Overall, still a five-star meal, but I hope they can improve the way they handle the end-of-day rush.

reviews.author: Rovik Robert
reviews.text: Cash-only spot that is generous with high quality seafood at actually very good prices. Counter seating with all the fixings ready for you. Oysters are a must, and I’d add the combination cocktail to the list as well. Everything else can be to your preference but I fancied the smoked salmon. Was easy to get seated as a solo diner.

reviews.author: Luca dv
reviews.text: Nice atmosphere and good food. But when I wait one hour + and spend 100$ I expect something more elevated in quality and service. All together a nice experience but I would say its not worth the hype.

reviews.author: Keith Hoggard
reviews.text:
A friend and I walked past this restaurant as we were out and about looking for lunch. The seafood in the window looked amazing and there was a line to get in already at 10:15 AM.

The food was good, but not excellent. The atmosphere, however, was excellent. I had high hopes for the bread, being in San Francisco, but it was mediocre. The clan chowder was very flavorful, maybe a little light on clams. The crab salad was good, but I found like three bits of shell while eating it; I'm not a huge fan of having to spit food out into a napkin.

It's very cozy eating right at the bar with the servers available in front of you at all times. The menu was on the wall, with a few dishes not listed, but available; for example: scallop shashimi. It was cash only.

reviews.author: Aleksander Amer
reviews.text: This place is it. I waited for little bit in line and chatted with my new friend Donn about vintage cinema and seafood. What a cool guy. We sat together and enjoyed the best seafood I’ve ever had. That’s not an exaggeration, it was an incredible experience and fresh as can be. We had a couple Crab Louie salads and oysters. Highly recommend this place and the staff were the absolute best! Great energy and so knowledgeable paired with a love for what they do. You’ll love it and make sure to bring cash!

top_10.name: Basa Seafood Express
top_10.address: 3064 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Fei Ewald
reviews.text: Very yummy small portion of fresh salmon in the Shoyu salmon poke and spicy salmon poke. The shoyu version still came with a deliciously mild chili soy sauce. I ordered with a side of rice for about $10. If you want the combo which comes with fish, rice seaweed, and a water bottle, it is only $11.50 or so. Good deal for a deliciously simple snack! There are two small benches to sit at and eat inside the store entrance, but no tables. I was the only one there around 2:30 pm on Wednesday.

reviews.author: Hana !
reviews.text: I've had this place on my radar for a while now, the only thing holding me back being my student budget and an hour of commuting—all of which were very worth it when I FINALLY got around to trying it out here.  I came in unsure of what to get near closing time and was recommended the poke.  It was so good, the best I've had in a while.  The two friends I had with me thought the same!  We ate right then and there and one of my friends went ahead and ordered some more.  The fish was fresh even by the end of the day.  The sauces were all very complimentary (light and mildly spicy) and did not mask the flavor of the fish.  Seaweed salad was crunchy and sweet.  Even the rice is good, but it's a separate charge.  Overall, I plan on coming back.

reviews.author: Debbie Theuer
reviews.text: I was in the neighborhood and noticed this spot had amazing reviews for their poke so I had to give it a try. And wow, I’m so glad I did! The spicy salmon poke was incredibly fresh, bursting with flavor, and honestly a solid 10/10. Plus, the prices are unbeatable. Just  $8 for the spicy poke and $2.50 for a large rice. A fantastic deal for both your taste buds and your wallet!

reviews.author: Apryl Chiem
reviews.text: Got the spicy salmon poke for $8 and a medium rice for $2. $10 minimum for card. The guy who rang me up was really friendly and the poke tasted good. It has a slight spicy kick with a little sweetness but the sauce doesn't overpower the salmon. Hard to find parking though. Quick service, take out style. Definitely coming back for more poke and maybe one of their rolls.

reviews.author: Katarina Makmuri
reviews.text:
Double Salmon avocado roll is potentially my favorite in the city? Made fresh, rice is soft, fish is soft, just delicious.

However the day I went, the tobiko and ikura sides I bought tasted old and overly fishy.

top_10.name: Pier 45 Seafood
top_10.address: Pier 45 Shed, #11B, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Maui World Travelers
reviews.text:
Aside from docking the floating museums of the USS Panpanito submarine and SS Jeremiah O'Brien Liberty ship, this is our favorite area to look out onto the bay while enjoying a piping hot bowl of clam chowder. It offers a great view of Alcatraz, along with the sensory experiences I associate Fisherman's Wharf with: Cool ocean breezes, boat horns, the call of seagulls, and the smell of pier wood and oil. Love it!

OVERALL:
Not overly crowded, awesome views.

reviews.author: Stoned Soup
reviews.text: Had a fun eventful day. If wanna checkout a sub and beautiful scenery. This is the place. Can get packed during weekend. Tours are not bad in price but not cheap if have large family. Still enjoyed our day.

reviews.author: Devin Williams
reviews.text:
FLANNERY SEAFOOD,  ORDERING THE FRESHEST SEAFOOD OUT OF THE WATER, INTO OUR TRUCKS AND STRAIGHT HERE FROM AS FAR AS MIAMI FLORIDA AND EAST COAST. 2 DAYS TRAVEL. GREAT SERVICE, TEMP, AND HANDLING BY US AND ESPECIALLY GREAT SERVICE WHEN THEY OPEN AT 5AM.

5 OUT OF 5 STARS

reviews.author: Angelita Saenz
reviews.text: Very educational!!! Nice scenery while you wait. Can also go into quarter arcade with a lot of old arcade games. It was a lot of fun. Great for a family outing.

reviews.author: Jason Oh
reviews.text: Pier 45 must be visited when you visit Fisherman’s Wharf area at San Francisco. A building with a lot of amazing, historical, fun, clever, intriguing, treasurable & memorable “arcade” machines from past decades. When everything was so simple & long lasting… Hours of fun playing & watching those vintage machines working to entertain you. Brought back precious memories of my grand parents. Thank you Team Pier 45! Stay Strong & Stay Safe!

top_10.name: Submarine Center
top_10.address: 820 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Louise
reviews.text:
My boyfriend was craving a sandwich, so I looked up a few spots and decided to give this place a try — and I’m so glad we did! It’s a small space but super efficient and well-run.

We ordered two subs, and they were absolutely amazing. I had the avocado with turkey, and my boyfriend went with the pastrami. Both were fresh, flavorful, and packed just right. We devoured our subs — definitely hit the spot!

Great little gem for a satisfying sandwich fix.

reviews.author: Connie Kwok
reviews.text: The to go mighty sandwich shop! Such a great variety (and generous with Avo!). We split the Italian super sub, and it was great! Ratios were perfect, and bread was nice and crusty. There were plenty of staff here ready to make fast and fresh sandwiches during the lunch hour. Nowhere to eat or sit, so ger your order to go and enjoy!

reviews.author: Hoshun Lam
reviews.text:
One of the best subs I’ve ever had! The pastrami, Swiss, bacon, and avocado is simply incredible. The staff recommended it as it was my first time there.
Sandwich was incredible. Perfectly cooked pastrami, delectable bacon, huge chunks of avocado, melting Swiss cheese, balanced mustard, and topped with a crispy bun toasted to perfection.
I want to go back and get this again.
A+ will be back.

reviews.author: Spencer Browning
reviews.text: this is hands down the best sandwich i’ve ever had in my life. i got the avocado turkey swiss with everything and it was delicious. i plan to come back and order the roast beef (“everyone’s favorite”). we are at a nearby park and the vibe was immaculate. they don’t have indoor seating but there is a park and various benches located nearby where you can enjoy your decadent sub.

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.text:
Very small deli near the west portal station of SF. My sandwich was just okay, nothing special. Heavy on the mayonnaise.
The shop has zero seating inside so you must take to go. Glad to have tried it but won’t be back.

top_10.name: Molinari Delicatessen
top_10.address: 373 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Manuel Navedo
reviews.text: Came here because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint. Sandwiches were great with tons of flavor and huge! I had lunch one day and breakfast the next :) the shop inside is also a great spot to buy different products. We came here on a Friday at 10:30 am so line was non existence although pictures suggest this become a hot spot at times. There are no seating area so one has to seat outside and can be chilling at times. Plus there is no bathroom. Overall a great spot and will highly recommend to visit and try their nice sandwiches

reviews.author: L
reviews.text:
They ran out of focaccia at 3pm

Take a number and wait to be called. When they call your number, order, then pay when you pick up

Was still good with soft bread, but not worth the 30min wait. Cheese was still cold after the sandwich was toasted

reviews.author: Todd P
reviews.text:
It was crazy busy at 2pm yesterday. We waited 30 minutes to place our order. Was it worth it?  Not really. We ordered the Italian combo on Italian bread. That was a mistake. We like crusty bread but this was tough. Taking a bite required moving the bread back and forth to tear it off.

The flavor was great but it should be for $18. People behind the counter were friendly and there are a few tables outside.

reviews.author: Jae Jun
reviews.text:
Famous Italian deli spot in the North Beach neighborhood. Popular with both tourists and local residents. We ordered the 4 different subs, and they were all delicious - my favorite was the Molinari special. Prices were around $16 per sub, which is definitely big enough for one person. They cut it in half so you can exchange with your friend/family if you wanna try multiple subs.

As you walk in, you’ll feel as if you were transported to Italy. The whole store is filled with imported food goods from Italy and it’s a great vibe that gets your appetite going. They also slice the deli meat in front of you for some cool showmanship.

Make sure to grab a ticket as soon as you walk in, as they’ll call your number to take orders at the counter. The wait might be 20-30 mins depending on the day and time. If you are low on time, I don’t think it’s an essential spot to visit as I’m sure there are other lesser known spots with just as good subs.

reviews.author: Johnathan B
reviews.text: After waiting 50-minutes, there were still 9 tickets in front of us so we gave up. Was cool to experience the buzz and see all the different ingredients and local characters coming in/out. Wouldn’t recommend unless you’re willing to wait a long time for an $18 sandwich - or you go at a time when there’s no queue.

testimonials: Came here because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint. Sandwiches were great with tons of flavor and huge! I had lunch one day and breakfast the next :) the shop inside is also a great spot to buy different products. We came here on a Friday at 10:30 am so line was non existence although pictures suggest this become a hot spot at times. There are no seating area so one has to seat outside and can be chilling at times. Plus there is no bathroom. Overall a great spot and will highly recommend to visit and try their nice sandwiches

They ran out of focaccia at 3pm

Take a number and wait to be called. When they call your number, order, then pay when you pick up

Was still good with soft bread, but not worth the 30min wait. Cheese was still cold after the sandwich was toasted

It was crazy busy at 2pm yesterday. We waited 30 minutes to place our order. Was it worth it?  Not really. We ordered the Italian combo on Italian bread. That was a mistake. We like crusty bread but this was tough. Taking a bite required moving the bread back and forth to tear it off.

The flavor was great but it should be for $18. People behind the counter were friendly and there are a few tables outside.

top_10.name: Roxie Food Center
top_10.address: 1901 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.text:
Roxie Food Center is a fantastic spot for anyone looking for a quick and delicious sandwich. The quality of the food is exceptional, with an impressive selection of fresh ingredients that cater to a variety of tastes. Whether you're in the mood for something sweet or savory, you're sure to find something that satisfies your cravings.

The service at Roxie Food Center is top-notch. The staff is friendly, welcoming, and always willing to help you with any questions you may have about the choices. They are quick to make recommendations based on your preferences and are attentive to your needs throughout your visit.

Prices at Roxie Food Center are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food provided, making it an excellent value for anyone looking for a satisfying sandwich without breaking the bank. Additionally, the food center is always clean and well-maintained, and in good condition.

Located in a convenient location with reasonable parking, Roxie Food Center is a great place to stop for a quick bite If you're in the area, I highly recommend checking it out.

reviews.author: Keena Middleton
reviews.text:
Have been coming to Roxie’s since I was in 6th grade. Favorite sandwich has always been the crab sandwich with everything on it.
In my opinion every sandwich here is good, they make it how you want it and they always give you a hefty sandwich. You can never go wrong pulling up to Roxie’s!

reviews.author: pinguino hijueputa
reviews.text: Hands down, the best sandwiches in the entire City, and they're some of the friendliest owners, too. They are San Francisco legends, and I'm proud to patronize them because their food is very good and delicious. Highly recommended and I try to frequent them regularly...

reviews.author: Mayumi Gassmann
reviews.text: Got two regular sized sandwiches on dutch crunch, which were foot long subs. I can't imagine how big the large are. I've never had dutch crunch bread before and it was so satisfying to bite into. The sandwich was hot with cheese that perfectly melted and pulled as you bit away. Staff helped guide us through our order and were very courteous. Don't shy away because it's a corner store these sandwiches are 🔥🔥🔥

reviews.author: Mordecai Salvino
reviews.text: The best corner store, hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop for sure! Tony and Simon specials were SO good!! Bread is perfectly soft with hint of a crunch and flavors of the meat and condiments that make the sandwich are SO good! My kind of spot for sure will be back! Keep it simple but delicious and this place does it!

top_10.name: Limoncello
top_10.address: 1400 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Max Kay
reviews.text:
It's an Italian market place with great selection of drinks, cooking ingredients, desserts, sweets, and deli shop. There is a coffee shop in the middle for coffee drinks and pastries.
Deli shop makes great sandwiches, pizza and pastas.
Great place for a quick bite and exotic shopping!
There are limited indoor and few tables outdoor seating.
Good for kids, seniors, small gathering.
I'll stop by again for sure for Italian Mortadella sandwich!

reviews.author: Mohsen Ghafari
reviews.text:
I love the vibe! Best customer service, cool vibe, and you will have lots of options for the type delicious sandwich you are looking for! I got the Pastrami sandwich and it was out of this world.

In addition, it has a small shop right next to it for buying some drink or grocery you need. Totally recommended.

reviews.author: Joanne Hong
reviews.text: Hands down one of the best italian sandwiches I’ve had in the city. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable - having the tables near the adjacent grocery store adds to the experience. The big windows give you a view of the busy streets as well. As for the sandwiches - we the peppers and herbs add a nice kick to the cold cut meats and the chewy, fresh bread completes the meal. I’d highly recommend calabrese.

reviews.author: Adam Gold
reviews.text:
Limoncello is a hidden gem that delivers an authentic delicatessen experience. From the moment you step inside, the warm, inviting atmosphere and friendly staff make you feel like a regular. What sets this place apart is their thoughtful curation of products from local suppliers – their commitment to supporting regional vendors shines through in the quality of their offerings.

The sandwich menu deserves special mention. Each creation showcases the fresh, high-quality ingredients they're known for. While their entire menu is tempting, the sandwiches are truly standout items that shouldn't be missed.

The welcoming team enhances the entire experience, demonstrating genuine enthusiasm for their products and creating an environment that makes you want to linger. It's the kind of place that reminds you why local establishments are so special.

I'm already planning my next visit, and I'm confident this charming spot will become a regular destination for anyone seeking a memorable lunch experience!

reviews.author: Max Kornblith
reviews.text:
Rarely in this part of the city but I was today and came by because I’ve seen them on best sandwich lists. Definitely what I was hoping for! This is their Calabrese.

Was asked to leave a review and why not.

testimonials:
It's an Italian market place with great selection of drinks, cooking ingredients, desserts, sweets, and deli shop. There is a coffee shop in the middle for coffee drinks and pastries.
Deli shop makes great sandwiches, pizza and pastas.

top_10.name: Sandy's
top_10.address: 1457 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: sid srivastava
reviews.text:
Didn't get their famous muffaletta but tried their egg sandwich and cookie. Cookie was amazing, kinda pricey at $5 but worth it for the size and quality. Egg sandwich, while good, didn't feel like it fully justified the $14 price tag. Not the most complex flavor and just put between two pieces of regular white bread.

Even with that though the customer service was great, and if I'm ever around there again I will stop by for a cookie.

reviews.author: Joshua
reviews.text:
Sandwich was A1 but the cookies oh my goodness, absolutely unreal.

And the owner recommended a few great spots with a view to eat it for which we were super grateful!

reviews.author: Paige MacLaren
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at Sandy’s! Their sandwiches are so tastyyy and they have THE BEST coleslaw in the world, very dill forward. Great service too, everyone is so kind

reviews.author: Dave Katleman
reviews.text:
Been craving a good muffuletta since our trip to NOLA five years ago, this place hits the spot and then some.

Tried their classic and their roasted mushrooms vegetarian option, loved both of them.

reviews.author: Bhavik Modi
reviews.text: mushroom muff was insane, so tasty. top notch service. great vibes. friendly employees. also their cookies are amazing. highly recommended!

testimonials:
Didn't get their famous muffaletta but tried their egg sandwich and cookie. Cookie was amazing, kinda pricey at $5 but worth it for the size and quality. Egg sandwich, while good, didn't feel like it fully justified the $14 price tag. Not the most complex flavor and just put between two pieces of regular white bread.

Even with that though the customer service was great, and if I'm ever around there again I will stop by for a cookie.

top_10.name: The Hungry Spot
top_10.address: 2077 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Maria Hunt
reviews.text: Literally the most delicious sandwich I’ve eaten in my 34 years. We felt so welcome. It was the owner’s birthday and after eating half of the HUGE sandwich she gifted us an amazing slice of chocolate mousse cake. We will absolutely be back! ♥️

reviews.author: Dianne Gong
reviews.text: Had Hayes and corn salad. Couldn't get a picture of Hayes salad because someone wanted to dig in! We will rock you and I need a hero half sheet of lazy pizza! Had salads from there before and they're always fresh and have a nice balance of ingredients! The pizzas are nice, crunchy and soft! Best eaten soon after getting it. Service is excellent! Will be back to try other things on the menu!

reviews.author: Alice Garner
reviews.text: Amazing food, beyond amazing service, and quality meal!!! Ordered the chicken pesto avocado and had the mixed bliss salad. VERY GENEROUS PORTIONS! Everything tasted super fresh and delicious. The service was outstanding. Catalina was so nice and friendly and welcoming and made our experience wonderful! She was so kind and made sure we were really cared for and was super attentive (very rare in restaurants these days to have service as good as this). We really had a great time dining here and are going to come here again!!! The only problem is that there is limited seating if you are coming with a bigger party but other than that, 11/10 experience!!

reviews.author: American Angler
reviews.text:
Then he said ..we'll go over to The Hungry Spot to clear our senses with a meatball sandwich!  My old pal Ringo Lasater just got back from Hanoi, and he brought back a few Durian fruit, and wanted me to experience the thing.  He said it was to aromatic to cut open in his flat because it would stink up the entire building, so we walked one over to the park and cut it open there.
WOW!  The stench of rotting meat was almost overpowering, but being a huge fan of moldy cheeses including Limburger, I was all in!  The texture and flavors were Amazingly delicious, but my sinuses were melting away, so the wonderful Meatball sandwich from The Hungry Spot truly hit the spot!   5 stars ☆☆☆☆☆

reviews.author: Logan Brokering
reviews.text: My family from St. Louis came during the 4th of July and it was definitely the best sandwich’s we have ever had. The pizzas are also incredible. The workers are definitely the kindest people and the environment is fun and relaxing. I am not sure why there is a one star review but I would give this more than 5 stars. If you ever come to San Francisco this is definitely a great meal. Thank you for a great experience!

The only problem is that there is limited seating if you are coming with a bigger party but other than that, 11/10 experience!!

top_10.name: Banh Mi Crunch
top_10.address: 646 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Luke Murry
reviews.text:
Delicious sandwich, quick service.
Ordered 3 Banh Mi and fries on phone. Walked 15 minutes to restaurant and the nice gentleman that works there was just walking out of kitchen with my order when I arrived. Perfect timing.

The beef sandwich was my favorite, followed by combo, followed by chicken- all were great. We asked for extra pickled veggies on each sandwich- $1 charge per but worth it!

The fries were crisp and well priced at $5, good portion.

We wanted to order again tonight- but alas, we are to late! Next time!

Thank you for the high quality food and great service, Banh Mi Crunch!

reviews.author: Lisa
reviews.text: Wonderful spot to grab a quick lunch. There’s counter seating only but it provides great people watching the vegetarian. Vermicelli was quite tasty with very fresh vegetables in it. I love the Vietnamese iced coffee as well. The prices are really reasonable.

reviews.author: Artemis Huntsman
reviews.text: I eat here everytime I come to SF cause they never miss 🔥 good portion of meat and veggies, tried the garlic noodles ($8.95) for the first time today and loved those too. No tables to sit at, only counters so it gets pretty crowded inside

reviews.author: Matt B
reviews.text:
Excellent banh mi sandwiches for a great price! This will become my new banh mi spot in the Sunset. They also make a decent shrimp spring roll, though I don’t love the spicy peanut sauce.

Really enjoyed the grilled pork one, and will have to try more meats in my subsequent visits.

reviews.author: Prince Villanueva
reviews.text: Located in a prime area, this shop offers indoor seating with a welcoming atmosphere. The friendly staff provides fast service. I ordered a grilled chicken banh mi, shrimp spring roll, and Vietnamese coffee.

testimonials:
Delicious sandwich, quick service.
Ordered 3 Banh Mi and fries on phone. Walked 15 minutes to restaurant and the nice gentleman that works there was just walking out of kitchen with my order when I arrived. Perfect timing.

The beef sandwich was my favorite, followed by combo, followed by chicken- all were great. We asked for extra pickled veggies on each sandwich- $1 charge per but worth it!

The fries were crisp and well priced at $5, good portion.

We wanted to order again tonight- but alas, we are to late! Next time!

Thank you for the high quality food and great service, Banh Mi Crunch!
