top_10.name: The M Stop Deli
top_10.address: 2598 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Alejandra
reviews.text:
First time here and it was great! I ordered 2 of the T Line sandwich and asked kindly for avocado instead of cheese. The worker was really nice and made the sandwiches very fast. Both sandwiches were big and lots of deli meat in them. The dutch bread was also very fresh.

Also got the rice krispie banana dessert, great combination idea. Recommend getting it if you want something sweet.

Extremely good and great atmosphere!

reviews.author: American Angler
reviews.text:
The M Stop Deli, that's where we'll get our lunch, then he said we'll take our lunch out to Ocean Beach along with that pail of sardines, catch a sea lion and drop it off at Union Square like Hobert and I did last month....it'll be funny as F!  Well... we were just about to put that darn sea lion in the truck when a game warden spotted us and made us put it back in the ocean!
And...in all that excitement, all I could think about was how amazing that sandwich from the M Stop Deli was.  It was truly spectacular!
5 stars all day ✨️   ☆☆☆☆☆

reviews.author: Kevin Nguyen
reviews.text:
The M Stop Deli is a great stop for a satisfying sandwich in SF. I’ve tried the M Line, T Line and the P Line on Dutch Crunch bread. All were amazing, but my favorite was definitely the M Line with the really tender beef tri-tip!

Portions were generous, ingredients tasted fresh, and it’s great having a halal deli option like this in the city. I’d definitely recommend giving it a try.

reviews.author: Leslie Gomez
reviews.text: This place has such a warm atmosphere ✨ So Perfect for a couples who like to split a bite! When I tell them I'm splitting it with my husband, sometimes they write cute stuff like Hers & His

reviews.author: Rosabel Carter
reviews.text:
What a gem! The M Stop Deli
blew me away with its delicious food and impeccable service. The staff was not only friendly but also genuinely helpful in suggesting the best options. I went with their classic chicken Caesar sandwich, and it was fantastic – the chicken was grilled just right, and the Caesar dressing added a creamy, flavorful touch. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with comfortable seating and a rustic decor that made me feel right at home. I can’t wait to return and try more from their menu!

testimonials:

Also got the rice krispie banana dessert, great combination idea. Recommend getting it if you want something sweet.

Extremely good and great atmosphere!

top_10.name: Le Sandwich
top_10.address: 752 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: sid srivastava
reviews.text:
One of the best sandwich shops in SF. Owner is super goated, small little location and everything tastes fresh.

I got the Reuben this time, didn’t expect the corned beef to be cold but besides that the sandwich was great. Will have to go back and try other things on the menu.

reviews.author: Derek Webb
reviews.text: My extended family ordered 9 sandwiches today. We called ahead and couldn’t recommend this place more. They were quick and extremely kind. The price point is incredible for the size of the food! If you get a chance you have to try this place!!!

reviews.author: Tripper BvT
reviews.text: We had a delightful chat with Elias while he made our delicious sandwiches with what can only be described as love. He recommended watching Rally for Rangers, something that he's been a part of for years now - sounds amazing, going to watch it on the flight back to Ottawa Canada.

reviews.author: Afshin Afshar-Ghasemlou
reviews.text:
Where Taste Meets Friendly Service

A few days ago, I was walking by Le Sandwich, and I noticed them for the first time in the four years they've been in business! That should say something about my attention to my surroundings! I walked in to see what they offer. I ended up having a very friendly chat with the owner, Elias (Eli-S). He is a personable man and shared everything I needed to know, making me want to return and try one of his popular sandwiches. I say "popular" because while I was there, neighbor after neighbor walked in to place an order, and they all seemed to be repeat customers. Anyhow, I got myself a drip coffee and, as I walked out, made a mental note to be back after the Thanksgiving holiday.

Today, I went back and asked Elias for his personal favorite sandwich. He obliged me, and I asked him which one it was when he handed me the hefty sandwich. He replied, "You won't find it on the menu!"

I hurried home with the sandwich and took my first bite. It was delicious! The roasted chicken breast strips were cooked perfectly, juicy, and flavorful. The pesto sauce enhanced the taste, and the bread was toasted, thin, and hollowed out, holding everything together nicely! The sandwich had more than chicken and pesto sauce, but I was too hungry to slow down and analyze it!

Le Sandwich has a couple of tables outside where, on a nice day, one can sit and enjoy their meal. They also have a few stools at a counter facing the window. You can get your sandwich to go, as I did, or eat it there before it gets cold!

In addition to sandwiches, Le Sandwich offers a variety of other items, including salads, and pastries. It also has a selection of beverages, from coffee and tea to fresh juices. The prices are reasonable, and the portions are generous. Le Sandwich is open from 9 AM to 3 PM every day except Sunday when it is closed.

I highly recommend giving Le Sandwich a try. You won't be disappointed if you're in the mood for a quick bite or a leisurely meal.

reviews.author: David Curry
reviews.text: What a great find. Sandwiches are delicious. The Primo was the best Italian sandwich I've ever had. The chef is super friendly and you can tell he takes pride in his craft. We ate inside at the small counter and enjoyed listening to all the North Beach locals having conversations with the owner and each other while he made their sandwiches. Highly recommended.

testimonials:
One of the best sandwich shops in SF. Owner is super goated, small little location and everything tastes fresh.

I got the Reuben this time, didn’t expect the corned beef to be cold but besides that the sandwich was great. Will have to go back and try other things on the menu.

We had a delightful chat with Elias while he made our delicious sandwiches with what can only be described as love. He recommended watching Rally for Rangers, something that he's been a part of for years now - sounds amazing, going to watch it on the flight back to Ottawa Canada.

top_10.name: Q's Sandwich Shop
top_10.address: 258 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Foseguera54
reviews.text: I’m not from the area but I found this place on google. Seemed like a good place to have sandwiches. Man I am impressed these sandwiches are super amazing rich in taste. I got the turkey pesto guy recommended it. Super helpful and offer substitutions. Glad I came here !!

reviews.author: J Toney
reviews.text: Wow. Incredible sandwiches at a decent price. The menu had just enough options to make for some unique choices, but not so many as to take away from the quality. I’m not even a sandwich person, but my roast beef on sourdough with bacon jam was to die for. Pickled onions are worth their weight in gold. Even my picky daughter finished her grilled ham and cheese.

reviews.author: Laudan
reviews.text: Ordered the turkey pesto sandwich on focaccia bread and substituted avocado for the bacon. It was so delicious! Bread was soft and the flavors were well balanced. All the ingredients were also very fresh. The store owner was incredibly friendly and very welcoming. Would definitely recommend and visit again.

reviews.author: Kamila Tishaeva
reviews.text: My friend and I were here for lunch, it was delicious! We had the pulled pork and the tuna sandwich, it was so juicy and flavorful. Will def be coming back!!!

reviews.author: American Angler
reviews.text:
Slingshot Betty told me about Q's Sandwich Shop and said they put out the best roast beef sandwich in the city.  Well....That's a pretty tall statement, so I put on my kickin boots fired up the Ram and headed straight to SF.  I made the Golden Gate in an hour and was heading up Divisadero like I owned it, found a great parking spot, and only had to walk a half block to Q's
It was a typical unassuming neighborhood joint, a spot the locals would go to everytime they wanted real honest food.  I got that roast beef sandwich that Slingshot was so proud of and let me describe it in 2 words...
Wow and Amazing!  ☆☆☆☆☆

testimonials: I’m not from the area but I found this place on google. Seemed like a good place to have sandwiches. Man I am impressed these sandwiches are super amazing rich in taste. I got the turkey pesto guy recommended it. Super helpful and offer substitutions. Glad I came here !!

Even my picky daughter finished her grilled ham and cheese.

Ordered the turkey pesto sandwich on focaccia bread and substituted avocado for the bacon. It was so delicious! Bread was soft and the flavors were well balanced. All the ingredients were also very fresh. The store owner was incredibly friendly and very welcoming. Would definitely recommend and visit again.

top_10.name: Philmore Creamery
top_10.address: 1840 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Nicholas Pun
reviews.text:
Wonderful gelato! Reminds me of Italy. (Don't believe me? Just check my post history.) That said, we don't glaze and "Italy" is not the goal. This gelato is great in and of itself. Light, but still creamy in texture. Clean flavours, exactly as described by their names. My only disappointment is buying a small and not going for something larger.

Do stop by if you have a chance. Really good gelato, especially around SF bay area.

reviews.author: Alex DeMartino
reviews.text:
Very tasty gelato. We got a medium with coconut almond chocolate chip and the cinnamon cookie.
The coconut was very refreshing and the cookie was like creamy biscoff.

reviews.author: Jaydee Sheppard
reviews.text: House-made delicious ice cream in the heart of San Fransisco.  we got the mandarin, the berry, the cherry, and the crème brûlée, and all four were absolutely delicious! Our favorite was a mandarin, each cup comes with a cookie. Other specialty items like ice cream, popsicles, cakes, cream, puffs, and to go pints are available. Parking is limited since it’s in the middle of San Francisco.

reviews.author: JEONGBUM SEO
reviews.text: They use Sicily Bronte Pistachio DOP to make that flavor. I’ve never seen any gelato like this in Bay area! Perfectly sweet and so flavorful! This becomes My #1 gelato and sorbet in SF bay area!

reviews.author: Mat Lit
reviews.text: Probably the best stratiatella I’ve had outside Europe. Perfectly smooth, creamy and addictive. Passionfruit sorbetto was bracingly sharp in a good way. The gentleman who helped me was really impatient and grumpy. Really hope he has a better day.

testimonials:
Wonderful gelato! Reminds me of Italy. (Don't believe me? Just check my post history.) That said, we don't glaze and "Italy" is not the goal. This gelato is great in and of itself. Light, but still creamy in texture. Clean flavours, exactly as described by their names. My only disappointment is buying a small and not going for something larger.

Do stop by if you have a chance. Really good gelato, especially around SF bay area.

Very tasty gelato. We got a medium with coconut almond chocolate chip and the cinnamon cookie.
The coconut was very refreshing and the cookie was like creamy biscoff.

House-made delicious ice cream in the heart of San Fransisco.  we got the mandarin, the berry, the cherry, and the crème brûlée, and all four were absolutely delicious! Our favorite was a mandarin, each cup comes with a cookie. Other specialty items like ice cream, popsicles, cakes, cream, puffs, and to go pints are available. Parking is limited since it’s in the middle of San Francisco.

top_10.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
top_10.address: 688 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Beauty Simplified XO
reviews.text: Everyone comes to this place. Lines can be out the door sometimes.  While it's pricey, and no, I can't compare it to nowhere else because i don't buy ice cream elsewhere. They have a huge variety of flavors. I got coffee and tofee espresso, and it was really good. You also get to try any ice cream before you buy, which I find great. I got a double scoop of 2 different ice creams, and they charge an additional $2 for the scoop.. based on what we were told.

reviews.author: PJ Pasricha
reviews.text:
Mitchell’s Ice Cream is absolutely worth the hype! Yes, the wait can be long, but trust me, it’s 100% worth it. Curtis took our order, and his incredible customer service made the experience even better—friendly, attentive, and just an all-around great guy.

I ordered the Grasshopper, and let me tell you, it was so delicious I can still taste its minty, chocolatey goodness as I write this review. Every bite was perfection!

A heads-up: parking can be tricky due to the area’s foot traffic, so plan to spend some extra time finding a spot and waiting in line. But once you take that first bite, you’ll forget about all of that. Highly recommend Mitchell’s for anyone looking for amazing ice cream and top-notch service!

reviews.author: Andy Bungert
reviews.text:
Well dang this was an excellent find in our travels! A scoop Sticky Monkey on top of a scoop of Mocha Fudge was AMAZING! EACH WERE INDIVIDUALLY EXCELLENT AND TOGETHER THEY WERE ALSO AMAZING!

Also sampled the avocado ice cream. Don't sleep on that. That's pretty dang good.

My only regret is that we couldn't take any with us. They definitely have A ton that you can purchase to bring home for your own freezer!

reviews.author: Karl Stratos
reviews.text: I understand the historical significance, but just for the value of your money this place ain't worth it. I've had plenty of more interesting and creative ice cream elsewhere at higher quality and cheaper price. The crowd is annoying as well.

reviews.author: David Famero
reviews.text: I used to buy tubs of their Mango to keep in the fridge. My wife enjoys the Grasshopper Pie and it's her favorite because nobody else's tastes like Mitchell's. Had to let our son try a spoonful of each and of course he really enjoyed Mango just like papa!

testimonials: Everyone comes to this place. Lines can be out the door sometimes.  While it's pricey, and no, I can't compare it to nowhere else because i don't buy ice cream elsewhere. They have a huge variety of flavors. I got coffee and tofee espresso, and it was really good. You also get to try any ice cream before you buy, which I find great. I got a double scoop of 2 different ice creams, and they charge an additional $2 for the scoop.. based on what we were told.

top_10.name: Garden Creamery
top_10.address: 3566 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Clark Chan
reviews.text:
Tried many flavors of ice cream here. Would definitely recommend. Some of the flavors are shown in the photos below.

The black sesame was well balanced with their creaminess and their intensity of the black sesame, and was not overly sweet.

The Japanese strawberry sherbet was perfectly tart. it had a decently, strong strawberry taste, also not overly sweet.

The salty kaya was well balanced. It was sweet and umami at the same time. My only critique is that it was a little bit too salty then I would have liked.

The Matcha Oreo was OK. Was not that big of a fan of the Matcha, the Oreo was just decent.

The Ube pandan was absolutely delicious. Strong Ube taste,. The pandan worked very well with the Ube. Altogether, it was not overly sweet. very good combo

The lychee black tea was also very good. Strong lyches taste, and a moderately strong black tea taste as well. Very good combo

reviews.author: Agustin Farias
reviews.text: Loved Garden Creamery! As of 2025 is one of the best gelatos in SF in my opinion. Great neighborhood place. Low key but a destination in itself. Seems Im not the only one as there is usually a big line outside even on weekend nights. Line moves fast so be patient. Their unique sorbets flavors are amazing. My favorites so far are the Lime, Mango and Strawberry. A plus they are dog friendly…

reviews.author: Haitham Abu
reviews.text: The ice cream was absolutely incredible! Made with locally sourced ingredients and infused with love, it was a delightful experience. The sweetness level was just right, not too overpowering. The flavors were unique and not overly similar to other shops. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be returning. On top of all that, the prices are very reasonable!

reviews.author: Yusi
reviews.text:
Amazing flavors - and most importantly there are options for low sugar content ice cream! There’s no option for sugar free but low sugar is good enough for us. It’s very rare around town to have low sugar ice cream (normally 10-20% sugar content).
Ps, the dark chocolate flavor has the lowest sugar content.
The jasmine tea flavor is very tasty! A must try ~

reviews.author: Lamarr English
reviews.text: Garden creamery is pretty solid. The wait was 20 mins to get in. The flavors are vast and unique. Very Asian inspired choices. The prices were really good too. If you’re an ice cream connoisseur, it might be worth standing in line.

testimonials:
Tried many flavors of ice cream here. Would definitely recommend. Some of the flavors are shown in the photos below.

The black sesame was well balanced with their creaminess and their intensity of the black sesame, and was not overly sweet.

The Japanese strawberry sherbet was perfectly tart. it had a decently, strong strawberry taste, also not overly sweet.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 586 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Ha Nguyen
reviews.text: I had one scoop of the goat cheese berry habanero and the coffee and nuts (half half). They were good. Not overly sweet at all. I also tried (sample) olive oil and pear blue cheese. They were good but not distinct flavors for the names. Def come back. Love it. Have outdoor seating. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

reviews.author: Shane Tjin
reviews.text:
Oh man, where do I even start with Salt & Straw? This place is like if a rogue alchemist snuck into a dairy farm and started experimenting with forbidden elixirs. I strolled in with high hopes and emerged victorious with a milkshake that’s basically liquid gold: sea salt caramel as the silky base, crowned with two scoops of their olive oil ice cream. Olive oil in ice cream? It sounds like a madcap plot twist, but it delivers; creamy with a whisper of earthy savoriness that dances with the caramel like old flames rekindling. Each slurp was a symphony of rich, balanced bliss. I felt like I’d unlocked a secret level in the game of desserts.
But wait, the drama unfolds: the straw. And hey, “Straw” is literally in their name... talk about irony! This biodegradable bad boy decided to split clean down the middle quicker than a celebrity couple in tabloid headlines. One moment it’s heroically tackling the thick shake; the next, it’s in two pieces, forcing me to improvise like a survivalist in the wilderness. Ended up tilting the cup back like I was toasting the gods. Pro tip: pack a backup straw forged from adamantium, or just lean into the mess.
Even with the straw’s split-second betrayal, this was an epic win. Salt & Straw, you’re the flavor wizard I didn’t know I needed. 5 stars, no notes, because who needs perfection when you’ve got pure, chaotic joy? 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.author: Isaac Wendland
reviews.text:
This ice cream shop benefits greatly from its prime location in a key shopping area, close to several city venues, and it does offer a water station and restroom, which are definite pluses. While the shop boasts some interesting and more exotic ice cream flavors that might tempt adventurous palates, the overall experience left something to be desired.

The employees were polite and met basic customer service expectations, but their apparent preoccupation with socializing amongst themselves didn't foster a sense of enthusiastic assistance. Parking is also a significant drawback. While street parking is available, the prices felt outrageously high, and the nearest garage is a few blocks away.

Perhaps the most unsettling aspect was the emptiness of the store. Despite having shelves and coolers, they were largely bare, giving off an odd, almost going-out-of-business vibe. This unfortunately made the grubbiness of the walls quite noticeable.

Personally, the shop felt like it was trying too hard to cultivate a cool and trendy image without fully delivering on it. While the availability of some unique flavors elevates it beyond a three-star rating, the numerous downsides prevent it from reaching a four. It has potential, but it just not there.

reviews.author: Christine Chao
reviews.text: I consider this one of those establishments which is too hyped up and also ‘tries too hard’ so ends up being hit or miss. Many flavors, in fact, probably the majority of flavors, are unique and sound interesting but arguably sometimes just taste too weird or downright not yummy. Their limited traditional flavors like chocolate and vanilla are solid. I guess if one is an adventurous type and or bored of the usual flavors, this would be a great place, but those who prefer the standard and or tried and true flavor combos may not find their menu a bit over the top. Luckily, they do allow samples, otherwise it would be difficult and possibly disastrous to commit to an entire serving (which is of course pricey as expected for SF, without trying first.) interior was clean and nice, with 4 stools for seating (there are benches outside as well). Service was friendly and prompt.

reviews.author: Michael Sitompul
reviews.text:
Delicious Gelato in San Fransisco.
I really love the freckled mint chocolate chip, which is suitable for vegan. The waiters & waitresses are so friendly and fast response. U can ask to try several flavors. There is also free water.

testimonials: I had one scoop of the goat cheese berry habanero and the coffee and nuts (half half). They were good. Not overly sweet at all. I also tried (sample) olive oil and pear blue cheese. They were good but not distinct flavors for the names. Def come back. Love it. Have outdoor seating. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

top_10.name: Marco Polo Italian Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3886 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Hilda Liu
reviews.text: I’ve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They’re definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can’t wait to come back to try more.

reviews.author: Brad Kremer
reviews.text: Marco Polo Ice Cream is a true gem in San Francisco, especially if you’re craving something beyond the usual. This spot serves up delicious gelato-style ice cream with a unique Asian twist. Flavors like durian, jackfruit, Thai tea, and matcha bring bold, authentic taste profiles you won’t find at most ice cream shops. Each scoop is creamy, rich, and packed with flavor. They also offer traditional favorites like chocolate and vanilla, so there’s something for everyone. Whether you’re an adventurous eater or just want something cool and refreshing, Marco Polo is absolutely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Brandon Cadelinia
reviews.text:
Been going to Marco Polo since it was on Taraval St for the last 20 plus years. The new location is nice. I usually order the mango and jack fruit but not I just resort to jack fruit. There are no words to describe the taste but delicious! Go and try the different flavors.

Tip: there is a Marco Polo in SJ too

reviews.author: Jovan Kun
reviews.text: This is their new place, they moved from Taraval st. The place is small only has 2-3 tables. The ice cream tastes a little bit different than the old place,  the durian and double choc are good. Around $6.00 for 2 scoops and you can choose 2 different taste.

reviews.author: The Hungry Taiga
reviews.text: Super yummy! They have so many Asian inspired flavors and this is now my favorite spot in all of San Fran! I went here in the dead of winter and it was so worth it, even sitting out in the cold. Can’t wait to go back, that durian ice cream has a GRIP on me.

testimonials: I’ve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They’re definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can’t wait to come back to try more.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 2201 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Asher Williamson
reviews.text: So yummy every time. The ice cream is so interesting with it changing every month. I would recommend that you try all the OG flavors. Then do the monthly ones after you have your baseline for every other time that you go. My face is the snickerdoodle. In the photo I have the coffee stone fruit and the banana sherbet 8.5/10

reviews.author: Michelle P
reviews.text:
Im drooling just thinking about this ice cream again.

Got the gooey brownie and the salted, malted, cookie dough. The sizes were a good portion. Can definitely taste the salt in the cookie dough, which helps balance the other flavors. && brownies were gooey with a touch of fudge? Lovely.

reviews.author: Saurabh inator
reviews.text: Tried the peanut butter and caramel flavor. Loved it. Having a vegan option which isn't just sorbets is great. Need to get another one before I leave 😆.

reviews.author: Jo V
reviews.text: This is honestly one of the best ice creams in San Francisco. The cones are very big and the scoops are also very big I love the cookie dough flavour. The ques are usually long, but when we wont on Saturday afternoon there was no que. The ice cream is super good and there are many options. Cone is charged separately, so add up the prices and add tax extra.

reviews.author: Aki Fujikawa
reviews.text:
I ordered the sea salt & caramel ribbon (recommended apparently) - it’s extremely sweet! I couldn’t even finish it

Edit: In response to the owner’s comment, I did sample different flavours and they’re all still extremely sweet. $20 for two cones? (Including a somewhat mandatory tip as a tipping screen will be shown after you pay) Outrageous!

testimonials: So yummy every time. The ice cream is so interesting with it changing every month. I would recommend that you try all the OG flavors. Then do the monthly ones after you have your baseline for every other time that you go. My face is the snickerdoodle. In the photo I have the coffee stone fruit and the banana sherbet 8.5/10

Im drooling just thinking about this ice cream again.

Got the gooey brownie and the salted, malted, cookie dough. The sizes were a good portion. Can definitely taste the salt in the cookie dough, which helps balance the other flavors. && brownies were gooey with a touch of fudge? Lovely.
Tried the peanut butter and caramel flavor. Loved it. Having a vegan option which isn't just sorbets is great. Need to get another one before I leave 😆.

top_10.name: GIO Gelati San Francisco
top_10.address: 1998 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Katia Martha
reviews.text: Pretty good selection & they let you try samples. Very tiny inside so you’ll be lucky if you get a table. They have some milk-based and some without dairy. The passion fruit is tangy & zingy. The creamy fig was interesting.. very melty and creamy. Overall, a solid option in the area but does not get an overly enthusiastic endorsement from me- it’s competitive if you start comparing gelato and ice cream places in SF because there’s a lot of them and I’ve honestly had better elsewhere. The nice thing about this place is it’s located close to a lot of food/dinner spots so you can get dinner, walk around, and then come here for dessert.

reviews.author: Carli Brunner
reviews.text: The gelato here is absolutely amazing—so delicious with tons of flavors to choose from! We stopped by one Thursday night, and even though a big birthday party came in right at closing, Evan went out of his way to keep the place open and make sure everyone was served. He was super friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. This is hands down the best gelato spot in the Marina and definitely worth a visit!

reviews.author: Theodore Kramer
reviews.text:
GIO Gelati is more than just a gelato shop, it is a community staple that puts smiles on all of its customers.

They are constantly innovating with their flavors, products and marketing.

Pro tip: their coffee is great. I put some vanilla gelato in mine.

reviews.author: Donald Dunn
reviews.text: Great gelato. Went around 9:30 pm on Saturday night. We got a table and enjoyed our dessert.

reviews.author: amanda lee
reviews.text: I was excited to try the gelato here especially because I read that they had several vegan flavors. We arrived and they did indeed have multiple vegan flavors (mostly fruity like lemon, mango, strawberry, passion fruit, plum, banana, etc. We didn't end up ordering or eating though because I noticed that many of the vegan flavors were about half liquid. I don't know why they were partially melted like that, but I really didn't look appetizing. It wasn't a warm day at all - 64 and cloudy, so it made me wonder if something wasn't right about their temperature control. I'd be willing to come back another day and try again because I know business can have an off day, but I wanted to share my experience.

top_10.name: Matcha Cafe Maiko
top_10.address: 1581 Webster St # 175, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Vee H
reviews.text: Tasty matcha vanilla ice cream. Red bean was good and not too sweet. The mochi balls were so soft and chewy (too bad you only get two little ones). The cup it came in was rather small and doesn't even fill to the top!

reviews.author: Kate X
reviews.text: We came here around 9:30pm at night for dessert. There was a short line that moved very quickly, and the staff fulfilled our order within minutes. The matcha and vanilla ice cream cone was good, but the waffle cone was the highlight since it was crispy and not too heavy. I also got the cheese foam matcha latte just to compare it with the ones I got from Izumi Matcha and Maruwu Seicha. The cheese foam here felt slightly heavy, and the matcha latte tasted slightly watery and wasn't creamy enough. I would say this place is better than Izumi Matcha, but Maruwu Seicha is still the best for both drinks and soft serve.

Love the matcha ice cream. They sprinkle some matcha on top of the soft serve to balance out the bittersweet taste and let me tell you that i am overreacting when I say that this is probably the best ice cream I have ever had. The honeydew ice cream is good but very sweet. The ice creams have this perfect consistency that is creamy and yummy love it so much. Recommend to anyone who wants worlds best Ice cream.  COME HERE NOW!!!

reviews.author: Sadaf Rahmanian
reviews.text: The drinks here are unreal. My favourite is the Matcha Latte Float. The Hojicha Latte Float was also delicious. The quality of the matcha is great too.

reviews.author: Thuy Ngan Le
reviews.text: I ordered matcha and vanilla ice cream. Delicious ice cream flavor, not too sweet. The queue was quite crowded due to the holiday, but the staff worked quite quickly so I didn't have to wait long. It takes about 10 minutes to have ice cream. The small shop has no seats, you can bring ice cream to a chair in the middle of the mall to eat.

testimonials: Tasty matcha vanilla ice cream. Red bean was good and not too sweet. The mochi balls were so soft and chewy (too bad you only get two little ones). The cup it came in was rather small and doesn't even fill to the top!

COME HERE NOW!!!

top_10.name: Miyako Old Fashion Ice Cream
top_10.address: 1470 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Iyana Blackwell
reviews.text:
This is a historical landmark and place, in its own right, as this is a family run business, long standing, in the community and they've kept the prices low and competitive! The sandwiches and ice cream cones are crafted with love, as the original owner is still active, serving flavorful ice cream cones to his patrons and crafting those delicious sandwiches. You have to stop by and treat yourself to a cone, of one of the owner's various selections of flavors, including specialty flavors. Or maybe you would like one of his delicious sandwiches, including hot pastrami, with nacho chips and your choice of potato salad or cole slaw. I recommend the slaw: it's delicious. 💯😋
All for a REMARKABLE price. 👌🏾

reviews.author: Jaci Smith
reviews.text: This a fascinating place; what a city jewel!  It took me back from when I was a kid. The store is dated, dusty yet magical. They carry unique old fashioned ice cream flavors and also a variety of candy in old jars behind the counter. A sweet old folk helps you in the nicest, kindest demeanor. If you want a different kind of experience, this place  is a must visit!  But beware is not a glamorous, commercial, bougie place, is more like an alternative grungy but awesome place

reviews.author: Cloé Jalbert
reviews.text: What a nice place! The ice cream is really delicious, and the man that served us was adorable. The avocado and banana flavours are my personal favourites. I will come back for sure on my next visit!

reviews.author: Dan's Inferno
reviews.text: A visit to this ice cream shop yielded a simple, decent milkshake, although a little too milky.  The prices are too low, in my opinion. I think the owner should consider a price hike. I don't know if the older gentleman was the owner, but he was friendly and seemed to be an institution. I feel like there's probably some history here that's worth exploring the next time I'm back in the area. Looking for something other than an ice cream? There are plenty of other sweets as well. By the way, I'm not sure where the one hundred flavors tagline came from. Perhaps it's referencing all of the various items in the shop, not just the ice cream.

reviews.author: Austin Wong
reviews.text: Old fashioned ice cream joint with a wide variety of flavors. Walked into the shop and I immediately felt transported to the past. Delicious ice cream and the owner is a joy to be around. Truly rare to meet such a kind hearted person. Please check out this lovely business!

testimonials:
This is a historical landmark and place, in its own right, as this is a family run business, long standing, in the community and they've kept the prices low and competitive! The sandwiches and ice cream cones are crafted with love, as the original owner is still active, serving flavorful ice cream cones to his patrons and crafting those delicious sandwiches. You have to stop by and treat yourself to a cone, of one of the owner's various selections of flavors, including specialty flavors. Or maybe you would like one of his delicious sandwiches, including hot pastrami, with nacho chips and your choice of potato salad or cole slaw. I recommend the slaw: it's delicious. 💯😋
All for a REMARKABLE price. 👌🏾

This a fascinating place; what a city jewel!  It took me back from when I was a kid. The store is dated, dusty yet magical. They carry unique old fashioned ice cream flavors and also a variety of candy in old jars behind the counter. A sweet old folk helps you in the nicest, kindest demeanor. If you want a different kind of experience, this place  is a must visit!  But beware is not a glamorous, commercial, bougie place, is more like an alternative grungy but awesome place
What a nice place! The ice cream is really delicious, and the man that served us was adorable. The avocado and banana flavours are my personal favourites. I will come back for sure on my next visit!

top_10.name: Bi-Rite Creamery
top_10.address: 3692 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Sohrob H
reviews.text:
🍦 Delicious Ice Cream:
The ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery is genuinely delicious. It's rich, creamy, and clearly made with high-quality ingredients, resulting in fantastic flavors that truly satisfy.

😊 Super Friendly Staff:
The staff here are incredibly friendly and welcoming. As first-time visitors, we especially appreciated how accommodating they were, allowing us to sample quite a few flavors before we settled on our choices. This made the experience even more enjoyable.

👍 First-Timer Friendly:
Their willingness to let us sample multiple flavors made our first visit a very positive and memorable one. It's great for discovering new favorites.

📍 Overall Impression:
Bi-Rite Creamery is a must-visit for ice cream lovers in San Francisco. The combination of delicious ice cream and wonderfully friendly service makes for a truly delightful experience. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jea Kim
reviews.text:
Perfect ice cream stop before heading to the park next door.

Heard this was one of the best ice cream shops in the city, so we swung by after a late brunch around 3PM. The line was long. Took us about 20 minutes to get inside and order, but it was totally worth the wait.

We tried a few of their most popular flavors: Black Sesame, Balsamic Strawberry, and Honey Lavender. My personal favorites were the latter two. Both had delicate, nuanced flavors. The balsamic and lavender notes were subtle, just enough to leave a pleasantly aromatic finish without overwhelming the creamy base.

reviews.author: jade
reviews.text:
My second fav ice cream in the world. Creme brulee is insane!!!
Its a smidge icy, just enough to perfectly melt in your mouth and not coat your tongue in fatty cream. Not too sweet but developed flavours. Amazing
Organic sugar cones also 🥹🙏

reviews.author: Abdulla Jasem
reviews.text: This place is my favorite in San Francisco. The honey lavender, balsamic strawberry, and roasted banana are amazing. Salted caramel and black sesame are also really good. It’s also right next to Mission Dolores Park, so you get to eat the best ice cream and then go enjoy the best views of San Francisco.

reviews.author: Clark Chan
reviews.text:
Tried many flavors in the store. This place really does not disappoint! Their basic flavors like cookies and cream and vanilla Have some uniqueness to it compared to what you would find elsewhere like Baskin-Robbins.

Candy Cane had strong flavors of candy cane. Not overly sweet, and they were able to balance the sweetness and the peppermint in their ice cream. Very good!

Honey lavender had a decently creamy texture. Had a strong floral scent, but not overpowering. Not too sweet. Very good!

Eggnog was absolutely the best I have ever tried! The employees told me that each scoop had roughly one teaspoon of brandy. The alcohol was strong, but overall a very strong balance of flavors.

Their ricanelas, triple chocolate coconut,  and pumpkin cheesecake were beautiful done. The texture of the triple chocolate was velvety and the taste of coconut was apparent. The ricanelas was pleasantly sweet, and not overpowering. All three of these flavors managed to balance, sweetness, and richness beautifully.

The rose ice cream was amazing. I tasted a lot of rose essence , but was not overpowering , nor was it too sweet. I really like the floral hint of the flavor.

Earl Grey was pretty good, but I have had better. It could use just a slight bit of intensity, and then it will be perfect.

The candied spice and ginger ice cream was really good. All the flavors worked very well together. I like the bits of the ginger. It had a good texture, and was not overwhelming.

Overall, they do not skimp on the ingredients, and they are not cheap with it. The quality of the vast majority of their flavors are apparent to the taste. Definitely the top three ice cream shops in San Francisco. I will definitely visit again. Can’t wait for their next seasonal flavors!

testimonials:

The ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery is genuinely delicious. It's rich, creamy, and clearly made with high-quality ingredients, resulting in fantastic flavors that truly satisfy.

top_10.name: The Interval at Long Now
top_10.address: Center Building A, 2 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Brittany Erin Hausmann
reviews.text: Sophie was an absolutely wonderful bartender, she made excellent suggestions for craft cocktails that we will remember for years to come! The vibe is immaculate if you’re looking for something a bit unique and off the beaten path of Fisherman’s Wharf. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Robby Ticknor (TicknorPhoto)
reviews.text: Super cool bar. Very trendy.  Delicious cocktails 🍸 We had Paxton's arrow! A chili infused drink that was really good!

reviews.author: sid srivastava
reviews.text:
Easily of the best, if not the best bar in SF. Such unique drinks that are all so tasty and relatively worth their price tag compared to most other bars in the city.

The vibe of the place is also super, super cool and in the summer especially it’s just great.

reviews.author: AnnaMarie Cicitta
reviews.text:
Interval at Long Now is one of the most unique and thoughtfully curated coffee shops I’ve ever visited. Located right on the water, the space blends a striking aesthetic with a sense of purpose. It’s part café, part library, part time capsule—designed to spark curiosity and conversation. The environment is warm and inspiring, filled with books, ambient lighting, and displays centered around long-term thinking and sustainability.

The drinks are excellent. I always go for the ginger tea—it’s simple, grounding, and perfectly brewed—but their coffee options are equally impressive, with a focus on quality and balance. Whether you’re grabbing a quick drink or planning to stay a while, the experience feels elevated.

There’s something to learn in every corner, including the restrooms, where even the walls offer infographics and thought-provoking visuals. Bar seating, ample space, and a calm energy make it ideal for solo visits or quiet meetings.

The staff are knowledgeable and welcoming, happy to answer questions or offer recommendations. This place is more than a café—it’s a full sensory and intellectual experience. Easily one of my favorite coffee shops in the world.

reviews.author: Olga V. Mack
reviews.text: Bar + coffee shop + bookstore = the ultimate hidden gem! The vibe is pure magic—a cabinet of curiosities meets an art gallery, where every corner tells a story and brims with character and charm.

testimonials: Sophie was an absolutely wonderful bartender, she made excellent suggestions for craft cocktails that we will remember for years to come! The vibe is immaculate if you’re looking for something a bit unique and off the beaten path of Fisherman’s Wharf. Can’t wait to come back!
Super cool bar. Very trendy.  Delicious cocktails 🍸 We had Paxton's arrow! A chili infused drink that was really good!

Easily of the best, if not the best bar in SF. Such unique drinks that are all so tasty and relatively worth their price tag compared to most other bars in the city.

The vibe of the place is also super, super cool and in the summer especially it’s just great.

top_10.name: Holy Water
top_10.address: 309 Cortland Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: A.C. Antonelli
reviews.text: Fall on your knees! O hear the angel voices! Or, you know, pull up a stool and order a drink. An exceptional cocktail can feel like a religious experience, and you will certainly have one here. Phenomenal cocktails, great craft beer selection, highly skilled and friendly staff, and just a casual amount of religious decor. Holy Water is up there with the best.

reviews.author: Sahin Karatas
reviews.text: One of the best/strong drinks in Sf. So in other bars usually either drink is taste so good but not strong or drink is strong but taste is not good. This bar knows how to do great cocktails. They have good bartenders and ambiance is lovely too.

reviews.author: Lorenzo H!
reviews.text: When you go holla at Chris for me and to tip him will. He was surgical when it came to making cocktails. how he can work on 3 and 4 at a time amazed me. He's friendly and social. The ambiance is just wow. The dark Christmas lights and lantern lit place is where you want to be!

reviews.author: Jimmy Chen
reviews.text: I’ve told many people that this was my favorite bar in the city and they’re shocked that it’s a seemingly small hole in the wall in a sleepier part of town. That’s precisely its charm. Holy Water has very intimate but welcoming vibe- the decoration and the people are all top notch. The selection of beer is top notch. The bourbon, rye, scotch whisky selection is top notch and actually quite affordable. It’s never too crowded and you can even bring food in. What more can one ask for?

reviews.author: Lorenzo Tanada
reviews.text: Cozy bar on Cortland Ave in SF Bernal Heights with Catholic decor. I like the dim lighting. Drinks only, no food. I tried the After the Gold Rush signature cocktail and enjoyed it. Mixed drinks are around $16 and beers $9.

testimonials: Fall on your knees! O hear the angel voices! Or, you know, pull up a stool and order a drink. An exceptional cocktail can feel like a religious experience, and you will certainly have one here. Phenomenal cocktails, great craft beer selection, highly skilled and friendly staff, and just a casual amount of religious decor. Holy Water is up there with the best.

top_10.name: Smuggler's Cove
top_10.address: 650 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Alexander Lach
reviews.text:
This is an amazing part of tiki history, worth visiting at least once. The service was good. The drinks were solid, though leaned sweeter than I expected, especially the Zombie (not pictured). My favorite was the Rum Barrel. The presentation of the drinks was somewhat understated.

I think “tiki culture” has come a long way, with incredible bars in SF and elsewhere. Perhaps Smuggler’s Cove hasn’t quite kept up. Still a great spot and worth a visit though!

reviews.author: Cynthia De Las Salas
reviews.text: This place! So mysterious and adorable! When you first walk in you’re like, “Oh my where am I going?” Then you enter this super cute place and you see a different place here in San Francisco. You are transported to Captain Jake’s place or something. I don’t think I am doing it justice so you will have to try it yourself! Servers were so great and attentive and the drinks delicious! . I truly hope you #enjoy and keep following me on my journey to finding these gems and sharing them with you ❤️. All love!

reviews.author: Ashley H
reviews.text: Bartenders were great, helped us get 2 seats when things were busy. I planned on having more than one drink, but they warned me, they make em strong! I chose the Undead Gentleman. Tasty. Shout-out out to Melissa, she'll take good care of you, and she loves to pose for pictures, so head on down and let her know she's appreciated!

reviews.author: Rovik Robert
reviews.text: Pretty cool bar with lots of decorations and artifacts! Drinks are strong and tasty, and there’s a broad selection. Three floors so you have options on seating and vibes!

reviews.author: Robbie Morris
reviews.text:
Some of the best tiki vibes you can find at a tiki bar. Even has a 2 story water fall!
Drinks are top notch across the board.
You do have to order at the bar at this establishment. They’ll call your name when your drinks are ready. Many tiki bars I’ve been to in the past will have someone wait on you. It can be a little busy at times.

A little disappointed that there were no fiery drinks or group drinks.

top_10.name: Pacific Cocktail Haven
top_10.address: 550 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Wilfred Cho
reviews.text:
A must if you visit SF and enjoy cocktails.

They have a long list of drinks and everyone would find one that they would enjoy. It gets crowded, but we were able to find seats a little late into the night.

Definitely a younger vibe, but not a crazy crowd.

reviews.author: Rodger Groves
reviews.text:
PCH was on our list of bars to hit during this trip to the city. What a fantastic choice we made! "T", our bartender, was awesome. Engaging, super knowledgeable, and just a pleasure to talk to. Made the visit THAT more enjoyable!
Incredible craft cocktails here at Pacific Cocktail Haven! If you're in San Francisco, you need to stop by. Opens at 5pm...

reviews.author: Charlie Te
reviews.text: This was our first stopping place of the night, and it was a great place to begin. We came shortly after they opened and were able to snag a section. They have both interior and exterior seating. The interior is well designed and doesn't make it feel small.  They have a great selection of spirits and cocktail list. I had the Malty By Nature, which was a japanese single malt based and a little more on the spirit forward side, but tasty. My friend had their Thrilla in Manilla, and that had more of a refreshing taste. The staff here were friendly and attentive. I would come back here again to try more of their drinks.

reviews.author: Ivan Zarate
reviews.text:
"The cocktails are excellent, with an average price of $20 each. The waitresses are very friendly and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations based on your flavor preferences.

Keep in mind that this spot is strictly a bar, so it's best to grab a bite to eat beforehand."

reviews.author: Hilda Liu
reviews.text: I have heard of this place for a long time. They were so crowded on a weekend night and we couldn’t really find a seat. We got lucky and someone left so we just grabbed the spot. The cocktails were very unique. It’s one of the best bar I have been. They don’t have any food to serve on the side. It tells you how much confident they have for their cocktail. The environment is very chill. It’s definitely not quiet, but not loud enough that you cannot hear other people. They are also very professional. I would recommend here if you wanna try unique cocktails.

testimonials:

Definitely a younger vibe, but not a crazy crowd.

top_10.name: Martuni's
top_10.address: 4 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Krishin Asnani
reviews.text:
Martuni’s is a cabaret , a piano bar, where the enthusiastic and talented step up to the mic, singing melodies which help craft the soundtrack for one night of your life. The opera singer was the clear standout. And the gin martini? Supersized, making me fly to the moon.

Our server was excellent. And so was the popcorn.

reviews.author: Sarah Larson
reviews.text: Always a good time at Martuni’s! Great martinis and a plethora of options. Live music on a piano with local singers galore! If you’ve never been and you’re a martini fan - you must! Great spot to take visitors too, always a fun experience.

reviews.author: Dan O
reviews.text: Fantastic atmosphere, piano was superb. It really suited my fancy. The lychee martini is a must drink. You must try it!

reviews.author: Jabal Engelhard
reviews.text:
This place is THE BEST for martinis and a relaxed atmosphere during the afternoon 🤠 Iconic SF piano bar at night and quite possibly... meet a new friend! Very good service and the bartenders are experts 🙏 🍸
Full bar and fresh popcorn...yet the martinis 😋

reviews.author: Dan B
reviews.text: Great place for one of the best martinis in town. Super cozy atmosphere, excellent bar service!  Fun and entertaining piano bar experience after 9pm in the back room. I call it advanced and tasteful karaoke.

testimonials:
Martuni’s is a cabaret , a piano bar, where the enthusiastic and talented step up to the mic, singing melodies which help craft the soundtrack for one night of your life. The opera singer was the clear standout. And the gin martini? Supersized, making me fly to the moon.

Our server was excellent. And so was the popcorn.

Fantastic atmosphere, piano was superb. It really suited my fancy. The lychee martini is a must drink. You must try it!

top_10.name: Vesuvio Cafe
top_10.address: 255 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Patrick Ho
reviews.text: Pretty cool bar! Came on a Sunday afternoon and it was quite popping! Very trendy and artsy. Love it! Bartenders are really friendly. First come first serve seating. They also have a second floor area

reviews.author: Asher Williamson
reviews.text: If y'all want a drink, they gottem. It was pretty busy when we got there on a Friday night (to be expected). However it took a long time to get drinks, the space is very compact and seemed to be a hangout spot for the normal work week. The saving grace was the outside space where we could stretch out and chill with our drinks.

reviews.author: Cam W
reviews.text: As classic as it gets! Vesuvio has been here for forever and there is a reason why it has such a stellar reputation. The atmosphere is absolutely perfect -- nothing beats crushing a few beers up on that second floor balcony. Love this bar and am excited to be back again soon!

reviews.author: Munir Paul Moacdieh
reviews.text:
Vesuvio Cafe has some of the best vibes I've ever experienced in a bar! Every single piece of artwork has a different story to tell.

Service was fast. The drinks tasted great and were surprisingly cheaper than expected.

Try to get a table on the second floor overlooking the bar to get a nicer view.

One of my favorite bars in San Francisco. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Marios Passaris
reviews.text: This place is fantastic for cocktails.  Their prices are really reasonable, which is always a plus.  I highly recommend trying their margaritas, they're absolutely delicious.  The bartenders are skilled and clearly know what they're doing.  The atmosphere is also quite pleasant, making it a great spot to relax and unwind.  It's definitely worth checking out if you're looking for a good drink.  I'll certainly be back for more.  They also have a wide variety of other drinks if margaritas aren't your thing.

testimonials: Pretty cool bar! Came on a Sunday afternoon and it was quite popping! Very trendy and artsy. Love it! Bartenders are really friendly. First come first serve seating. They also have a second floor area

If y'all want a drink, they gottem. It was pretty busy when we got there on a Friday night (to be expected). However it took a long time to get drinks, the space is very compact and seemed to be a hangout spot for the normal work week. The saving grace was the outside space where we could stretch out and chill with our drinks.

As classic as it gets! Vesuvio has been here for forever and there is a reason why it has such a stellar reputation. The atmosphere is absolutely perfect -- nothing beats crushing a few beers up on that second floor balcony. Love this bar and am excited to be back again soon!

top_10.name: Last Rites
top_10.address: 718 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Neal
reviews.text:
Fun decor, but overpriced drinks and lack of snacks make this bar worth skipping.

After walking inside this dimly-lit, plane crash themed establishment, be ready to look at a soiled menu and pay at least $14 for even the most basic drinks — plus a mandatory 5% fee — and a tip. There's going to be a mandatory 20% gratuity charge for checks split 3 or more ways, open tabs, and parties of six or more. Food is not allowed to be brought in, so either sneak it in or pay $5 for wonton strips. While some of the cocktails are alluring, you can find similar options for less, without going very far.

If you do decide to visit, this bar is good for groups of up to eight people because there are two nooks in the back with a bunch of seats. Service was great, the restrooms were tidy, and the tables and seats were clean.

Bottom line: This isn't a bad place, but get ready to pay for it.

reviews.author: Rocky Petroni
reviews.text:
One of the best modern tiki bars in SF!
The signature drink, named after the establishment, is spot on for what a tiki drink should taste like. The music was pretty much a frank ocean radio so I guess that kinda works, but Last Rites is definitely a must hit tiki destination when visiting SF!

reviews.author: rajat kabra
reviews.text:
The ambiance in this place is fun and interesting. It's a dangerous jungle vibe with greenery everywhere, skulls, water sound and more.

Drinks are good, both in taste and presentation. Recommended last rite (which is a well presented mai tai) and violet vixen.

reviews.author: Dillon
reviews.text:
Easily one of the best Tiki Bars in San Francisco. The crashed airplane theme and inventive cocktails of all spirits make for a great time, and there is a seriously stellar group of bartenders.

The line can get a bit long, so it’s best not to come with overly large groups.

As a rum lover, Last Rites easily has one of the best selections in San Francisco behind maybe just Smuggler’s Cove.

Be sure to try their namesake cocktail, but you really can’t go wrong with anything on the menu. Cheers!

reviews.author: Jordan C
reviews.text: The BEST bar to spend Halloween! I walked in anticipating a quick drink and seeing some costumes on Halloween. Little did I know, there was a whole involved themed murder mystery with a cult and the FBI unfolding! So many props to Last Rites and its staff for coming up with this incredible puzzle, which brought the entire place together to try to solve its mysteries.

top_10.name: Cityscape
top_10.address: 333 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Best Drone
reviews.text:
Gorgeous view, and crazy contrast from what's going on outside this building. A glass of beer is $17 but it's definitely worth it.

While you get to this building, on reasonable sidewalks, and crowds of homeless people, and then you get a royal view and crazy contrast.

reviews.author: ankit devani
reviews.text:
The panoramic skyline views are simply unbeatable, especially during sunset. It's the perfect spot to unwind with a cocktail while taking in iconic landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, City Palace, Salesforce tower and Bay bridge.

The ambiance is sleek and modern, with comfortable seating and a relaxed vibe. The drink menu is creative, and the small bites are tasty, though a bit on the pricey side. Service was friendly, but it did take a while to get our drinks during peak hours.

reviews.author: Gari C
reviews.text: The location is good for sunsets (as advertised), but when we arrived, we were refused seating  (in an abrupt manner) on the side that would enable us to watch the sunset by one of the staff, claiming that the west side was booked for a private party. They appeared to make everyone sit on the opposite side from the sunset. We left after sunset, and there was still no one seated there.  That seemed unnecessary and made me wish I had gone somewhere else to see the sunset. Unfortunately, once we had arrived, there was no chance of making it anywhere else for the sunset, so we stayed.  I'd suggest calling ahead to see if they are actually seating people on the west side to avoid a disappointing experience.  The food and drink were good, but overpriced. That would have been fine, had we seen the sunset from our table. On the plus side, we did get to walk over to the sunset side for a few minutes before we left without being ejected. But it wasn't the experience we expected from the reviews and website. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, but the initial greeting left me feeling somewhat unwelcome.

reviews.author: Michelle Barnes
reviews.text: Fantastic views of San Francisco! My friend and I visited on a Sunday right around opening at 4pm. We had a little trouble getting up there because the elevator we chose wouldn't let you go to the top floor, but we eventually made it by using a different elevator. It's quite a large space with almost every table having a view as there's a lower level with couches and tables for 2 facing the view and a slightly higher level with high top tables and chairs. We were told we could sit at any seat we wanted, so chose one facing the high rise buildings and Coit tower. The other side had a nice view of Golden Gate bridge but was partially closed off for a private party and got very bright just before sunset. I ordered Rising Sign and my friend ordered the cosmic cooler mocktail to start. My drink had a nice passion fruit flavor, but my friend thought hers was quite sour, we're guessing due to the blackberry and lime ingredients. For the second round, I ordered Baileyana Chardonnay and my friend ordered the Sunset Spritz. Unfortunately, I wasn't a fan of the Chardonnay but my friend much preferred our mocktail this time. Would love to go back for sunset or to see the view at night.

reviews.author: Jay Pi
reviews.text:
Very disappointing service. Made the whole experience not as good as expected.

One of the waiter was not very service oriented and rushed us. The other one made it better.

They didn't have the cheese plate available at all in the very early evening, replaced by a charcuterie board too expensive for this quality /quantity of meat.

Cocktails were okay for that price. We had to finish the evening in another great cocktail bar to make the evening more memorable.

Cityscape bar :you should work on the quality of the service and offer.

testimonials:
Gorgeous view, and crazy contrast from what's going on outside this building. A glass of beer is $17 but it's definitely worth it.

While you get to this building, on reasonable sidewalks, and crowds of homeless people, and then you get a royal view and crazy contrast.

The panoramic skyline views are simply unbeatable, especially during sunset. It's the perfect spot to unwind with a cocktail while taking in iconic landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, City Palace, Salesforce tower and Bay bridge.

The ambiance is sleek and modern, with comfortable seating and a relaxed vibe. The drink menu is creative, and the small bites are tasty, though a bit on the pricey side. Service was friendly, but it did take a while to get our drinks during peak hours.

The location is good for sunsets (as advertised), but when we arrived, we were refused seating  (in an abrupt manner) on the side that would enable us to watch the sunset by one of the staff, claiming that the west side was booked for a private party. They appeared to make everyone sit on the opposite side from the sunset. We left after sunset, and there was still no one seated there.  That seemed unnecessary and made me wish I had gone somewhere else to see the sunset. Unfortunately, once we had arrived, there was no chance of making it anywhere else for the sunset, so we stayed.  I'd suggest calling ahead to see if they are actually seating people on the west side to avoid a disappointing experience.  The food and drink were good, but overpriced. That would have been fine, had we seen the sunset from our table. On the plus side, we did get to walk over to the sunset side for a few minutes before we left without being ejected. But it wasn't the experience we expected from the reviews and website. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, but the initial greeting left me feeling somewhat unwelcome.

top_10.name: Blackbird
top_10.address: 2124 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Gloria Bakerian
reviews.text: We went to this bar for a business mixer. The atmosphere is incredible. The staff is super friendly. The drinks were spot on. We will definitely go back!

reviews.author: Christina McCarthy
reviews.text: What a great place! It was busy, but the bartenders were so nice and attentive. We are in SF for a visit, but will definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Daniel Boles (Danisdaman12)
reviews.text:
Bartender Megan is a KILLER behind the bar. John Taffer himself would say this bar runs on Megan.

She made the best drinks and she was working the whole night without a break compared to her other coworkers. She knows a good cocktail and made sure to straw test every drink we ordered.

Every bar needs more Megan!

reviews.author: Haarika Srinath
reviews.text: Drinks were delicious. Got the down the rabbit hole and the newton. Dog friendly. Nice bartenders

reviews.author: Kara Adams
reviews.text: Came for happy hour and did not feel welcomed. The bar itself is cute, but given the unequal treatment from one of the bartenders, we won’t be back.

testimonials: We went to this bar for a business mixer. The atmosphere is incredible. The staff is super friendly. The drinks were spot on. We will definitely go back!
What a great place! It was busy, but the bartenders were so nice and attentive. We are in SF for a visit, but will definitely come back here again.

Bartender Megan is a KILLER behind the bar. John Taffer himself would say this bar runs on Megan.

She made the best drinks and she was working the whole night without a break compared to her other coworkers. She knows a good cocktail and made sure to straw test every drink we ordered.

Every bar needs more Megan!

top_10.name: Local Edition
top_10.address: 691 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Asher Williamson
reviews.text: No food here, but that's okay the cool underground jazz club feel was just what I needed for a late night escapade. The drinks were good and fairly priced. I would recommend you read all the funky news papers on the wall and take a closer look at all the type writers on the wall. 8.1/10

reviews.author: Debisree Ray
reviews.text: We stumbled upon this spot late at night while on the hunt for a drink — and honestly, it was a vibe. A super cool underground bar with an intimate, low-lit atmosphere that instantly set the mood. It was definitely on the louder side (as expected), but that only added to the energy of the place. The drinks? Spot on. We didn’t end up ordering any food — pretty sure the kitchen had already wrapped up for the night — but that didn’t take away from the experience. We wrapped up and headed out around 1:20 AM, feeling like the night owed us nothing. Overall, a solid late-night find.

reviews.author: Alex Fashandi
reviews.text:
I had such a nice time here! The vibes of this are immaculate down to all the details. The typewriters, suitcases, and newspapers provide the perfect decor and the dark lighting give everything a dreamy romantic look. The place is deceptively large but that actually works against it because some of the back seats seem like they have no view of the stage at all.

Bartenders are all very friendly and knowledgeable. Tried four different drinks on the menu and each had it's own unique flavor. Some, like the under market, had weird flavor combinations that I felt didn't work well together. My favorite was the Dublin down because I'm a sucker for egg white foam in a cocktail and also the different components of the drink gave it a great depth of flavor. They had a fantastic espresso martini even if it still doesn't beat my personal favorite in SF (Persona on sutter street,btw).

I made reservations based on recommendations from other reviews but they didn't seem necessary for a random Wednesday night. That being said, it seems like a reservation does get you a better seat.

Finally, obviously have to talk about the live music. It's the thing that ties all the different elements of this bar together to form the perfect experience. Nothing else in the world can compare to the vibe of listening to live jazz in a low lit room while sipping on a craft cocktail. It really feels like stepping back in time.

reviews.author: RA
reviews.text:
Used to be a favorite, but recent changes are concerning

I’ve always loved The Local Edition and have recommended it to visiting friends and family for years. The vibe, the cocktails, the music — it used to strike a great balance. But after a recent visit, it feels like something’s changed, possibly new management?

The music was so loud it made it hard to hold a conversation — which is surprising for a place known for its chill, sit-down cocktail experience. We ended up cutting the night short after one drink.

Also, the cocktails are now $18, which would be fine if the portion hadn’t been noticeably smaller. It’s hard to justify the value, especially when this place used to offer both quality and consistency.

Lastly, the new furniture looks fresh but is genuinely uncomfortable — especially the chairs with wheels and bouncy springs. Not great for a lounge-style setting.

I’m sharing this not to complain, but because this place has been a staple in SF and I’d love to see it stay that way. The foundation is still there — it just needs a course correction before regulars like me stop coming back.

reviews.author: Christopher Delance
reviews.text: This place isn't quite a speakeasy, but it does have the vibes of one. The reservations were a bit hard to get, so plan ahead. The live music was a massive boost to the ambiance. The espresso martini was really good but the Old  Fashioned was rather disappointing. There aren't many thrills about this location, but it is pretty nice. If I travel here again, I will give another shot.

top_10.name: Capelo's Barbecue
top_10.address: 2655 Middlefield Rd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

reviews.author: Yellow Bluebonnet
reviews.text:
As a Texan, I must say that the ribs and brisket are just okay. The sides are decent as well. I wouldn't recommend the cilantro peanut slaw or the seasonal sauteed vegetables. The desserts however looked phenomenal!

The interior is very nice and clean and the people here were awesome! It was a good dining experience overall.

reviews.author: Wei-Ai Tai
reviews.text: Delicious barbecue joint in Redwood City. The beef brisket was amazingly soft and moist, possibly the best brisket I’ve had on the Peninsula. Pulled pork was juicy, and the Mac and cheese and creamed corn were both very good. Fast and friendly service. Small parking lot with limited parking, though.

reviews.author: Jocelyn F.
reviews.text:
A Smokin' Good Time at Capelo’s BBQ!

My first time dining and I'm hooked! If you're in the area and craving amazing barbecue, you've gotta stop by.

I devoured the brisket – tender, smoky, and absolutely delicious. They have a great selection of sauces available to add extra flavor to your meat, and the pickles and pickled onions were a perfect tangy addition. My sides, mac & cheese and peanut slaw, were also on point.

They've got great outdoor seating and a convenient beer spot. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Isaiah R
reviews.text: Got the Dino Bites(2) and was not disappointed! One of em was a bit fatty but over all solid on the taste! Employees were all very nice. They were sold out of brisket so I didn’t get to try but overall I give those Dino Bites 9/10

reviews.author: Michael Price
reviews.text: Fantastic brisket and delicious potato salad. We love, love, loved the peach cheesecake too. We picked up our food, ordering online. It was ready as I got there and the BBQ sauces were abundantly there to fill little dipping cups to take with me. We also ordered a few nights later and the pork ribs were divine. ❤️❤️❤️

testimonials:
As a Texan, I must say that the ribs and brisket are just okay. The sides are decent as well. I wouldn't recommend the cilantro peanut slaw or the seasonal sauteed vegetables. The desserts however looked phenomenal!

The interior is very nice and clean and the people here were awesome! It was a good dining experience overall.

top_10.name: Henry's World Famous Hi-Life
top_10.address: 301 W St John St, San Jose, CA 95110, USA

reviews.author: julian liu
reviews.text:
Their check-in process is a bit unusual, but make sense. When we arrive, we had to get a number. When our number was up, the host came to take our order and we continued to wait at the bar. Then when the table was ready, we got seated and the food came quickly. Unusual, but quite efficient process.

I went there specifically for their prime rib. I would say it was average. The pork belly side order was very good!  Their Long Island Ice tea was quite strong.

reviews.author: Regina Rimes
reviews.text: So the hi-life has been there my entire life and it never fails even back in the day when flooding used to be a problem they would rally and become even more awesome. Every time I come to town it's my very first stop I literally go from the airport to the Hi-Life and as always they deliver amazing food and a fabulous atmosphere with super great employees! This will continue to be in my very first stop anytime I travel into the state and back home as long as they exist 😊

reviews.author: Mike K
reviews.text:
This place is great. Very laid back while maintaining strong quality.

Came here for dinner after my flight got canceled and I had to spend an extra night in san jose. The bartender, Ryan, was awesome and had great banter.

Got the ribs and ribs plate and it was fantastic. Smoky and tasty. Excellent beer and booze selection as well.

If you want a relaxed venue that delivers great meat and alcohol, this spot is tough to beat.

reviews.author: Ekaterina Terekhova
reviews.text:
As always, great service and food.
Authentic american bar and restaurant.

We ordered:
1. $29 Half rack of baby back Ribs + salad + baked potato
2. $29 Pork Chop + backed potato + salad

The portions are huge.

Thank you!

reviews.author: ramos95023
reviews.text: Second time back, first time many years ago. This time not the same. Some items and sides off the menu, food was just ok. I had a sirloin, others loved the tri-tip sandwich. Bartender couldn't make a drink, said didn't have ingredients but who doesn't stock lime juice, sugar and ice - the main liquor was seen on the counter. Make sure to grab a number if you visit.

top_10.name: Brenda's Meat & Three
top_10.address: 919 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Tania Weatherington
reviews.text:
All of the stars aligned when our group of 9 were able to grab dinner at Brenda’s (despite not having a reservation)!! We initially resigned on having to do takeaway - but magically all the seating at the bar opened up (this was also within the last hour of opening)!!

The food was absolutely delicious, generously portioned, and clearly made with a lot of love and care. My sister in law absolutely LOVED the Low Country Gumbo, my husband loved the meatloaf and cheesy grits, and I really loved the Our Burger, the fried chicken which was well seasoned and crispy to perfection!!!

As one would hope, the sides had us full of lots of ummms and aaaaaaas - and you would be remiss if you visit and don’t try the mac and cheese & collard greens!

All of their team were super friendly, and answered all our questions. The restaurant has a super cozy and trendy vibe, and I would say this is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic soul food done right!!

reviews.author: Jordan Stephens-Moseley
reviews.text: Immediately when I walked in, I felt a warm welcome. I came solo so I sat at the dining counter which is the best seat ion the house. Everyone worked well together and my food and drinks were prepared quickly. I had the fried catfish, green salad, fries, and red beans & rice and I cleaned my plate. I also indulged in a wild berry and mango mimosa and let me just say I love their proportions for the price. Will definitely be coming back to eat more items from their menu.

reviews.author: Winston Dy
reviews.text: Went to this location for the first time after trying the original location near the tenderloin. Tried the $5 Messy mess chicken sandwich. Also had the crawfish beignets and one ube beignets. The sandwich was ridiculously delicious! The chicken was so flavorful and the flavor penetrated the meat deep inside. I wish I bought two because I was sharing. The crawfish beignets were just as good as the first location. So meaty and full of crawfish. The ube beignet is still my favorite and my biggest recommendation! The service was friendly and fast. Location was so clean!

reviews.author: Damion Wright
reviews.text:
Brenda’s Meat & Three – SF Soul Food with Some Hits and Misses

Stopped by Brenda’s Meat & Three on a Friday night around 7pm, and honestly, the experience was a bit of a mixed bag.

Let’s start with the food:

Gumbo: Meh. It looked promising, but the flavor didn’t quite show up to the party. Just kinda... there.

Mac & Cheese: I really wanted to love it, but it just didn’t deliver. Ended up leaving most of it behind.

Fried Okra: Now this was the MVP of the night. Perfect crunch, great seasoning, full of flavor. If you go, don’t skip it.

Fried Chicken: Solid. Really solid. Not a mind-blowing 5-star moment, but a strong 4+—well-seasoned, juicy, and served hot.

Rum Punch: Hard pass. Didn’t enjoy it at all—wouldn’t be mad if they quietly took it off the menu.

Service: A+
The staff was wonderful—warm, welcoming, and helpful. Honestly, they made the experience feel a lot better.

Atmosphere? Eh...
I wanted to vibe with it, but it just didn’t click. Maybe it was an off night, but the energy felt kind of flat for a Friday evening.

Final take:
There are definitely some gems on the menu (hello, fried okra!), and the service is top-notch, but it wasn’t a slam dunk overall. Worth checking out—just go in with balanced expectations and maybe skip the rum punch.

3.5/5

reviews.author: Michelle Grunberg
reviews.text: Will definitely be returning! Ordered all vegan items - the po’ boy, garlic spinach, and okra. Delicious. We also really liked the ambiance and the service.
