Location was so clean!

top_10.name: Hot Sauce and Panko To Go
top_10.address: 1468 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Troff
reviews.text: This is a great hole in the wall to go eatery. Placed an order online during lunch and it was ready when I got there. There is only a door for pickup and no inside seating. Waffles were made fresh and as you see they give you butter and enough syrup for it. Waffles were buttery and flavorful. The wings were a perfect match. Chris’s salty and sweet wings had me wanting more. Make sure to call or order online first or you will most likely be waiting in line to order.

reviews.author: Mike Wallach
reviews.text: I've walked past this neighborhood place dozens of times. There's always somebody waiting for their order at the window. It was time I tried it. No place to sit down, just pick up your order and go.  About a 10 minute wait hanging out on the corner. I ordered the panko fried Chicken Sandwich with cucumber wasabi sauce. Very good. Next time I'll order a sauce with a little more spice.

reviews.author: Will
reviews.text: Overall, the wings at Hot Sauce and Panko are very solid. The flavors are great, but I’d personally prefer them a bit hotter. The beer was definitely my favorite—smooth and refreshing. I also tried the Korean and Al Pastor flavors. The Korean was flavorful, but the Al Pastor didn’t quite hit the mark for me. Still, the wings themselves were crispy and juicy, and I’d definitely recommend them!

reviews.author: Keena Middleton
reviews.text:
Hot Sauce & Panko is definitely top 5 wings in the city. From the size of the wings to the crispiness and flavor options you can’t go wrong here.
Bourbon bacon wrapped is my go to always and now they have a hot version and a plain Jane bacon wrapped.
This time around I also went with the waffle & wings combo. Tried the Al pastor and they were awesomeness.
The last flavor which was basic but still perfection were the Salt and pepper wings.
15 premium wings and a waffle you can’t beat it.
Have patience or go to wingstop!

reviews.author: Steven Su
reviews.text:
Food here is always fresh and seasoned perfectly. The sauces hit different and I feel like these are the best wings in the city. Everything has so much flavor and it doesn’t taste artificial either. Prices are good for wings. Definitely recommend. Parking is a bit hard to find.

Fish and chips are surprisingly good and cheap. Lemon pepper and mango Hab are my favorite.

top_10.name: Daeho Kalbijim & Beef Soup
top_10.address: 1620 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Justin Wong
reviews.text: Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

reviews.author: ahkwai Lert
reviews.text: I recently visited this spot with my friends, and we decided to try the Braised Beef Rib and the Beef Brisket Soup. Honestly, I found the soup to be a bit bland for my taste. However, I really enjoyed the overall atmosphere of the place. It was bustling with people, and the food was quite good. The service was excellent as well, with friendly staff who made our experience enjoyable.

reviews.author: egc
reviews.text:
A couple friends recommended this place and decided to visit with my family. It was their first time trying kalbijjim. We got the large one with extra cheese as well as some mandu and it was enough for the four of us.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

reviews.author: B. Wai
reviews.text: I have been here for a couple of times in the last few years and this place is legit for kalbijjim. I came here on a Friday around 545PM for two people. As I arrived, the small tables for two people were filling up very quickly. Luckily I got seated right away. After 6PM, you need to wait in line, so I highly suggest to come here 5 to 6 PM. Yes it is early for dinner unless you don't mind to wait. To me, I hate waiting. Lol. I ordered B2 which was Premium Kalbijjim with regular size. This portion definitely can fill up more than 2 people. I also added extra rice cake and cheese. Both add-ons were 11 bucks. The cheese itself seemed  to be worth it, but not for the extra rice cake. I counted the total and it was like 10 pcs, so basically a handful.  The short rib was well tender and cooked. The services were on point and efficient. As soon as we were done, we paid and left because I didn't want others to wait too long. I suggest you do the same and don't sit and chat after you finished eating. It's a common courtesy. I also recommend to park at the Jtown plaza because street parking spaces are limited due to high volume of cars. I definitely come back to try other food on the menu like Seolleong Tang and Mandu Guk. Big fan. Keep up the good work!

reviews.author: Peace Love
reviews.text: First time to this location and this chain of Korean restaurants is my fav. They are truly a gem. All their locations are consistent and tasteful. I can say they are the best Korean restaurants overall currently to date. The Din Tai Fung of Korean restaurants vice versa.

testimonials: Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

I recently visited this spot with my friends, and we decided to try the Braised Beef Rib and the Beef Brisket Soup. Honestly, I found the soup to be a bit bland for my taste. However, I really enjoyed the overall atmosphere of the place. It was bustling with people, and the food was quite good. The service was excellent as well, with friendly staff who made our experience enjoyable.

A couple friends recommended this place and decided to visit with my family. It was their first time trying kalbijjim. We got the large one with extra cheese as well as some mandu and it was enough for the four of us.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

top_10.name: SAN HO WON
top_10.address: 2170 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Rachael Annabelle Yong
reviews.text: one of my favourite meals in sf so far — we had the set menu for dinner and it was A LOt of food. every dish was incredibly well seasoned and fresh, favourites were definitely the jebi churi (beef neck fillet) and gamasot fried rice with naengi & clam  doenjjang jigae. the banana soft serve with hazelnuts and nutella was a banger. service was great too! came out to be $350 or so after tax and tip, including a bottle of makgeolli.

reviews.author: Min C
reviews.text: My review is based on my visit about one year ago. I visited here with my parents visiting from Korea and we had course menu. Overall, the foods were good but it was a bit mixed. Grilled meats were exceptionally good although we were already quite full by then. But soups (both Kimchi soup and rice soup) felt quite off to us. They tasted like they were based off of a very different ingredient from how we typically cook, which was a big disappointment for us. But the staffs were really nice and their drinks were unique in a good way. Overall we enjoyed our meal.

reviews.author: E
reviews.text:
We did a walk-in on a Friday night and lined up around ~25 minutes before opening and were able to grab a seat. We ordered the following:

Hwe Muchim: very fresh and flavorful. I don't see this dish very often so it was a pleasant surprise. Really enjoyed this one.

House Double Cut Galbi: The meat was good quality. However, the combination of the sweet sauce with minimal acidity and how fatty galbi can get I found these to be quite heavy. I would have preferred more acidity in the marinade.

Ssam: Nothing special but nice to have leaves with kbbq. Criminal pricing though.

Grilled Tteok: sickly sweet and sticky. Didn't really enjoy.

I loved their home made sauces to have with the meat. Overall, I would return to San Ho Won but their prices are on the higher end. In other cities you can probably get something 80% as good for 40% of the price.

reviews.author: S Kim
reviews.text:
The staff was very attentive and kind. Def 5/5.
It had a cozy atmosphere which we loved. So 5/5 as well.

For food, we really enjoyed Hwe mu chim, Prime beef rib cap, and Mugunji kimchi jjigae. If we had just these, 5/5 for food as well.
However, we had two other dishes which were a bit disappointing.
- "Double cut" galbi. It was way too fatty and greasy. A part of me wondered if they used a low grade galbi. The qaulity of Galbi meat tasted lower than meat i get from H Mart when I make galbi jjim.
- Jebi Churi. The quality of meat also tasted a bit low grade where it didnt have much flavor and chewy.

Overall though, we enjoyed our visit and will try this place again :)

reviews.author: Secret Society
reviews.text:
The food was pretty good, but I wish the bibimbap had more rice. The meats were cooked beautifully and super tender but tasted a bit bland and flavorless.
The dalgona cheesecake and lobster claw were super good! The presentation for the bingsu was honestly a bit off-putting, and needed more nurungji.
All in all decent experience, definitely make a reservation, and good luck trying to find parking LOL

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Cynthia Jia
reviews.text:
A great casual and affordable place for delicious skewers! Can’t go wrong with cumin lamb, but their mushroom skewers are also delicious. It’s not hard to get a table each time I went.

The staff is super friendly - we celebrated a friend’s birthday here and they even let us keep a cake we brought in their fridge until we were ready to eat it 💕

reviews.author: Ben
reviews.text: This place is a hidden gem for Northeastern Chinese BBQ! The grilled eggplant and beef skewers are must-tries — smoky, tender, and packed with flavor. I also loved the iron pot beef and spicy peanuts, both perfect with a cold beer. Friendly staff and great late-night vibes — perfect spot for gatherings or a casual meal!

reviews.author: Jeremy Gu
reviews.text: We ordered 7 lamb skewers — excellent flavor and perfectly grilled, very much in the authentic Northern Chinese style. Highly recommended for anyone craving that regional taste.

reviews.author: Yusi
reviews.text:
Great Chinese style charcoal barbecue, tasting exactly like I had before back in China.
Meat, seafood and tofu / veggie choices are all pretty good. We were particularly impressed by the lamb skewer and the tofu.
Fully supportive of a trendy new restaurant in the city! Thank you for doing this~ much needed

reviews.author: Donna Kim
reviews.text:
I had high expectations for this place, and it completely delivered. I went with a friend who used to live in northern China, and they were impressed by how authentic it was—they absolutely loved it. The variety of skewers was great, and every single one was delicious.

The restaurant is spacious with plenty of seating, making it perfect for groups. The staff were incredibly friendly, and the food was fresh and full of flavor. I’m already looking forward to trying the mala xiang guo on my next visit.

The only drawback is the parking—you have to park on the street, so finding a spot can be a bit challenging. Other than that, everything was fantastic, and I highly recommend it!

testimonials:
A great casual and affordable place for delicious skewers! Can’t go wrong with cumin lamb, but their mushroom skewers are also delicious. It’s not hard to get a table each time I went.

The staff is super friendly - we celebrated a friend’s birthday here and they even let us keep a cake we brought in their fridge until we were ready to eat it 💕

This place is a hidden gem for Northeastern Chinese BBQ! The grilled eggplant and beef skewers are must-tries — smoky, tender, and packed with flavor. I also loved the iron pot beef and spicy peanuts, both perfect with a cold beer. Friendly staff and great late-night vibes — perfect spot for gatherings or a casual meal!
We ordered 7 lamb skewers — excellent flavor and perfectly grilled, very much in the authentic Northern Chinese style. Highly recommended for anyone craving that regional taste.

top_10.name: Baby Blues BBQ
top_10.address: 3149 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: R M
reviews.text:
I'm not typically going for a BBQ joint but I think the warm weather or the moon position sort gave me the feeling of trying Baby Blues.  Honestly I'm happy I went and it for sure didn't give me the blues.  Yes the place is rustic some might call it funky but it works.  I like the big L shaped bar in the middle on which you can sit from both sides. That somehow gives you the opportunity to strike up conversations with random other guests or just enjoy the moment by yourself.
I tried their Cesar salad Mac and Cheese and pulled pork shoulder sandwich.  I like that the pork wasn't smothered in sauce .  Sauces came on the side so to each its own.  You can bathe in them, simply dip or forgo them.

The presentation is rather smartly done.  The Caesar , oh well it's a Caesar not much to say about it.  The mac and cheese was rather tasty but could have stayed in the oven a bit longer to make it a bit less saucy.  The pulled pork was tasty. I didn't care for the brioche as it loses its texture too quickly.   I'd love to try it on a French baguette or a sourdough roll with a crust and id add gruyere.  Again the sandwich was good it just gave me ideas on how I'd try to enhance it.

Well done thanks chef

reviews.author: Michael Dillon
reviews.text:
What a surprise , stumble upon this quirky restaurant. So happy we did the food was amazing and service was fantastic. Very interesting layout and design. The root beer was the best I’ve had .
Have to order pig candy bacon .
If you in San Francisco you have give this place a go.
Thank you chef and waitress 🙏🏻.
If this review has been a help let me know ❤️

reviews.author: Joshua Brathwaite
reviews.text: So I finally decided to try this place. I tried out the sausage plate with a chile verde cheddar pork sausage that comes with rice & beans and cornbread. The flavor of the sausage was delicious but some of my beans were undercooked and hard. I thought the cornbread was horrible and lacked that cornbread texture and flavor. For a $27.16 price tag with a drink I was highly disappointed with only two small sausages. That was definitely not $30 worth of food or service when the guy played dominoes the whole time I was there with a customer. I highly doubt I will try anything else from here again!

reviews.author: Chuck L
reviews.text: I really like this place. I learned about them from the SF locals so during breaks from work I will find a park and come here and throw down. The food is always fresh and the staff is always friendly. I’ve tried multiple items here including the blackened catfish and the brisket which is awesome also. I like the beef links to. This is a laidback gem in the mission.

reviews.author: Vernaya Dennis
reviews.text: BBQ ribs were good. Macaroni and cheese was okay.  The baked beans were nasty.  The facility is pretty old. The tables were wobbly and the bathroom was dark. The light didn't work.  The waitresses were nice and attentive. Greens were bomb!

top_10.name: Fikscue Thrive City
top_10.address: 7 Warriors Way Suite 208, San Francisco, CA 94158, USA

reviews.author: Travis S
reviews.text: Holy cow this new BBQ is good. The meat is perfectly cooked and tender with a great smoke ring. The sides are killer, I had the slaw which was fantastic but I want to try them all. They also have a really nice location with lots of seating and beautiful views of the bay. Place is kid friendly and there is a brewery next door for the adults. 10/10 would recommend

reviews.author: Ryan Carlson
reviews.text: Delicious combination of Indonesian food combined with Texas bbq style meats.  I live in Austin and visit SE Asia annually, so am familiar with the two separate styles and really feel Fikscue elevated the combination of both together.  Portion sizes are great and it’s a beautiful view to sit and enjoy while eating.

reviews.author: Ken Wong
reviews.text:
July 2025:
Stopped by for dinner and ordered the rendang plate which has slow cooked smoked brisket in coconut milk and Indonesian spices. Flavors were out of this world 🌎😋.

The plate was served with steamed rice, kale curry, a potato fritter, an egg, and chips.

This was my second time here. I had come in May during their soft opening and had brisket, ribs and a few sides (slaw, mac goreng, and coconut rice). Everything was super delicious 😋.

Will definitely be back again for more delicious food!

reviews.author: Pam V.
reviews.text: Lives up to the hype. Highly recommend going out of your way to come here if you're on this side of the bay which may save you time from waiting in line. Great views of the new park and water. They share a patio space right next to Harmonic Brewing too, so there's plenty of beer and wine options you can get from there and have with your food from Fikscue!

reviews.author: Kevin Delos Santos
reviews.text: Some of the best bbq I’ve had in the Bay. I had the Dino beef rib, the jalepeno cheddar sausage, and the slaw. The beef rib was the winner and well worth it. The slaw was also great and complemented the dish well. I definitely intend on coming back and trying everything else before I go to Valkyries games! There’s also plenty of seating to take in views of the bay while the cool breeze helps you with your meat sweats.

testimonials: Holy cow this new BBQ is good. The meat is perfectly cooked and tender with a great smoke ring. The sides are killer, I had the slaw which was fantastic but I want to try them all. They also have a really nice location with lots of seating and beautiful views of the bay. Place is kid friendly and there is a brewery next door for the adults. 10/10 would recommend

top_10.name: Tempest Bar & Box Kitchen
top_10.address: 2940 431 Natoma St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Key Manning
reviews.text:
This is a dive bar’s dive bar—the kind of place that smells like beer and stories. Even if you think it’s not your vibe, go once for the people-watching alone. It’s a wild mix of locals, tourists, wealthy eccentrics, and people who may or may not live there.

The pool table’s the main attraction, cold beer flows, tunes are solid. Don’t eat beforehand—there’s a magical hole-in-the-wall kitchen next door and you can bring the food in. No frills, no fuss, just absolute peak San Francisco madness. I loved it.

reviews.author: Natalia M
reviews.text:
I was there today with some friends over a late lunch and I loved it. The yummiest burger ever! The size is totally insane and the flavor is soo good. I had it with an extra egg, omg! Glorious 😍😍 our server seemed to be alone today at the bar but he did amazing, super polite, attentive, made sure we had our waters and anything we needed.
10 out of 10
Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Christopher Fox
reviews.text:
A true hidden gem in SF. Laid-back vibes, incredible food, and dog-friendly to boot.

Came here during a work trip and once again Tempest Bar & Box Kitchen proved why it’s one of my favorite SF spots. I visited last year to catch a Stanley Cup Final game and made a point to come back this year. It didn’t disappoint.

The setup is unique and works perfectly: food is ordered from Box Kitchen just outside the bar, but it’s all part of the same experience. I showed up on a Thursday night and had no trouble grabbing a table, then snagged two seats at the bar after about a 45-minute wait (worth it). Super dog-friendly. My buddy brought his pup, and there were at least two others hanging out. Dogs, beer, and hockey? Yes please.

The atmosphere is casual and cool, with music playing and plenty of regulars chatting up the bartenders. You can tell it’s a neighborhood joint. Friendly staff, people actually talk to each other, and the bartenders were cracking jokes and making everyone feel welcome.

Now the food? Ridiculous. I don’t usually wax poetic about tomato soup, but theirs deserves a TED Talk. I had it last year and literally came back for it. Big portion, perfectly toasted bread on the side, and chunks of cheese floating in that rich tomato goodness. It’s comfort food that punches above its weight. Also, get the mac & cheese eggrolls. You won’t regret it. The whole Box Kitchen crew was friendly and made ordering a breeze.

If you want a local spot with personality, legit food, and a come-as-you-are vibe, this place is it. Already looking forward to next year’s trip so I can go back again.

reviews.author: Susan J H
reviews.text: Did go twice for the margaritas but only liked them from a specific bartender (In the pic, the guy way to the right pouring one). The food was good and you can order at the bar, or takeout only - no table service. Kinda hit or miss on the crowd/ vibe which is typical for a bar I suppose!

reviews.author: Lori Ludlow
reviews.text: One of the top five burgers in the city! I’ve lived down the street from this place for 12 years and never get tired of the Box Burger, it’s amazing - it has crunchy onions bits and a bacon reduction sauce (containing chunks of bacon) on it. Their other food is good too - not your standard bar fare. If they have the lemongrass Brussels Sprout on the menu when you’re ordering I recommend ordering those as well. The decor is pretty eclectic - a giant mural of a naked succubus in the corner, old bike frames hanging from the ceiling, almost every inch of wall space covered in posters/stickers/something, and four tvs all showing a different sport.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen & Bar Chestnut
top_10.address: 3340 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: kapil khatri
reviews.text:
HINODEYA Ramen 🍜 is one of the best franchise restaurant in San Francisco , this is my second time eating Japanese food, and I love it ,
My  friends try first time Japanese food, and they also like it, the staff was very friendly, Manager also very nice and kind person, Food is fantastic.
I highly recommend this restaurant.
I’m going to visit this restaurant soon  🥰❤️ it .

reviews.author: Kelly Pierce
reviews.text:
Everything about our meal was spectacular. I ordered the Ultimate Scallop Ramen with Fried Spring Rolls and Edamame and my coworker chose the Spicy Ramen.

Both were spectacular. Tasty and hot the spot.  I ate every bite if that tells you anything.

Highly recommended!!!!

reviews.author: Nars
reviews.text: I love to eat here, at first I thought it was small resto. But its spacious inside. The Japanese guy who might be the owner/manager is really nice. Definitely will be back, if in the area again. We also love the food esp the ramen! 🇯🇵🍜🍥🥢

reviews.author: Susana Medina
reviews.text: Delicious food and great service. All the staff was very welcoming. Much better service and experience than O'Farrell location. Would definitely come again

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.text: We had a great dinner here. I enjoyed all of the dishes we ordered, the spicy edamame appetizer was very tasty. The corn miso ramen was also very tasty. Enjoyed this SF ramen spot and would gladly return.

testimonials:

My  friends try first time Japanese food, and they also like it, the staff was very friendly, Manager also very nice and kind person, Food is fantastic.
I highly recommend this restaurant.

top_10.name: MENSHO
top_10.address: 4258 Piedmont Ave, Oakland, CA 94611, USA

reviews.author: Manny Perez
reviews.text: Food is really tasty, quality ingredients. Mostly paid parking along the street. Fun neighborhood. No reservation option, had to wait about an hour for a group of 6, Friday at 6:30pm. Space is a little cramped. On the pricier side for ramen, like adding a staple like an egg is an extra topping charge. Appetizers are smaller size, especially for a group of 6.

reviews.author: Natalie Chu
reviews.text: I have a wonderful time with Belinda as my server! She was so friendly and explained everything on the menu for us. I had a wonderful time dining at Mensho. All the items we ordered were 11/10!

reviews.author: Candyce Clines
reviews.text: The ambiance was so great. Anusha was our server and she was so warm and welcoming. I got the Kani Tantanmen and added the egg. The egg surprised me and was smokey but so delicious, I’ll be thinking about that for a while. My partner got the Vegan Spicy Garlic Knockout and I couldn’t keep my spoon out of his bowl. The broth was amazing.

reviews.author: E. O. K.
reviews.text: We went a little after lunch time on a Sunday. We were seated immediately but our server was a bit overloaded. The spicy lamb was fantastic. Also the wagyu jerk hand roll. I have not had good experience with most Bay Area restaurants that have a lot of hype but I was very satisfied.

reviews.author: J
reviews.text: The best ramen I’ve ever had in my life! Mensho is from Japan and they hand make the noodles themselves and it makes such a difference! In addition the broth is so flavorful! They have quite a few vegan ramens as well with different broth flavors. Theres often a wait but to be expected as this is a smaller restaurant.

Space is a little cramped. On the pricier side for ramen, like adding a staple like an egg is an extra topping charge. Appetizers are smaller size, especially for a group of 6.

The egg surprised me and was smokey but so delicious, I’ll be thinking about that for a while. My partner got the Vegan Spicy Garlic Knockout and I couldn’t keep my spoon out of his bowl. The broth was amazing.

top_10.name: Torraku Ramen - Lombard
top_10.address: 1449 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Adam
reviews.text: The food was delicious. We went from 5-7pm which is their happy hour, (discounted prices on select dishes). I got the Katsu Don with pork. It was crispy and fresh. They also gave us some pistachio ice cream at the very end. Would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Marwah Ibrahim
reviews.text: I got the beef yakisoba and my firend got seafood ramen—both were super tasty! The yakisoba had tender beef and great flavor, and the seafood ramen came with fresh shrimp and squid in a rich, comforting broth. Portion sizes were generous, and the service was smooth. Will definitely come back next time I’m craving ramen! Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Owee Angare
reviews.text:
A small place in the heart of San Francisco with cozy atmosphere, fast service and great food!

Recommendations:
Vegan/Vegetarian
Appetizer: Edamame and soy nuggets
Must try! Absolutely delicious nuggets served in a light, delicious broth.
Ramen: Miso Vegan Ramen
Decent and tasty ramen broth with great seaweed, tofu, tender bamboo shoots and soy protein chashu.

For Meat lovers
Appetizer: Chicken Karaage
Crispy, tasty and wonderful. Must try!
Ramen: Paitan Ramen
Tasty broth and good Ramen!

Dessert
Splendid way to end the meal with coffee flavored ice cream!

reviews.author: Polina Goranova
reviews.text: Still one of the best ramen experiences of my life — maybe even the best! The broth was rich and flavorful, the noodles perfectly cooked, and every bite was just pure comfort. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff were genuinely kind and attentive. Highly recommend to any ramen lover — this place is a gem!

reviews.author: Blaze Lesco
reviews.text:
I got the Shoyu Ramen with the pork shoulder. I don't have any complaints at all but I'll start the rundown:

Bowl was full, Broth was yummy, meat was tender enough, egg was PERFECT, the table spices were so yummy, and the employees were kind! On top of that the bowl was fuller than I've seen a few others lately. I'll remember her for sure 💜.

What's cool too is that tip is included AND they gave me complimentary ice cream samples. 10/10

testimonials: The food was delicious. We went from 5-7pm which is their happy hour, (discounted prices on select dishes). I got the Katsu Don with pork. It was crispy and fresh. They also gave us some pistachio ice cream at the very end. Would highly recommend.

I got the beef yakisoba and my firend got seafood ramen—both were super tasty! The yakisoba had tender beef and great flavor, and the seafood ramen came with fresh shrimp and squid in a rich, comforting broth. Portion sizes were generous, and the service was smooth. Will definitely come back next time I’m craving ramen! Highly recommended.

A small place in the heart of San Francisco with cozy atmosphere, fast service and great food!

Recommendations:
Vegan/Vegetarian
Appetizer: Edamame and soy nuggets
Must try! Absolutely delicious nuggets served in a light, delicious broth.
Ramen: Miso Vegan Ramen
Decent and tasty ramen broth with great seaweed, tofu, tender bamboo shoots and soy protein chashu.

For Meat lovers
Appetizer: Chicken Karaage
Crispy, tasty and wonderful. Must try!
Ramen: Paitan Ramen
Tasty broth and good Ramen!

Dessert
Splendid way to end the meal with coffee flavored ice cream!

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Shiny
reviews.text: This is hands down the best vegan sushi I’ve ever had! I was lucky to snag a seat right away, with no wait. I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. The sauces and ingredients were perfectly balanced and complemented each other beautifully. Since I don’t eat raw fish, finding this vegan sushi spot was a real treat. The hype is definitely justified! The service was fantastic, and my food arrived super quickly. I can’t wait to come back and sample more dishes from the menu.

reviews.author: Rahul Somani
reviews.text:
Recommended by a family member and what an amazing spot!!! We got super lucky with being seated by walking in around 9pm on Saturday night.

The team was super helpful in accommodating us and requested we be ready to order as soon as we are seated. We ordered a bunch of different roles along with tempura and tofu appetizers.

The ambiance and comfort in this restaurant is very inviting which made the experience that much more fun. Ohhh and their hot sauce is AMAZING which is homemade!!!!

reviews.author: Jeremiah Perez
reviews.text: This was a very great dining experience. Everything the staff, the food, the atmosphere. The food comes out as things are ready which gives the table an opportunity to sample things as they are fresh. The rolls were innovative and delicious. Every bite a flavor explosion. I had two none vegans at my table and they thoroughly enjoyed the meal and felt satisfied.

reviews.author: rajat kabra
reviews.text:
Sushi here has unique flavors and presentation and the fact that they serve so many options of vegan sushi is beyond impressive.

Loved the boddy & soul  and the green mango nigiri followed by candlestick. The surprise ending was interesting and I got the habanero sushi but not as good as the three mentioned before.

Had karage for the first time ever and it was sweet so not a fan, though I'm not sure what real karage tastes like.

reviews.author: Neesha Patel
reviews.text:
A really popular vegan sushi restaurant and with good reason! There was something for every taste.

They have rotating 90 minute spots and they are usually booked. They do seat a few people at the bar. But if it’s your first time, Highly recommend reservations for the full experience.

We needed the full 90 minutes and enjoyed every minute of it. Between 2 people, we ordered shishito peppers, 2 Nigiri and 3 specialty rolls. I think 2 nigiri and 2 specialty rolls would have been the perfect amount!

Highly highly highly recommend the boddy and soul. Probably one of the best on the menu! The fine balance between textures and tastes is amazing.

I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen 680 Clay
top_10.address: 680 Clay St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Hadleigh Painter
reviews.text: Honestly I was disappointed- I was really excited to try since this is one of my friends favorite restaurants and made her fall in love with San Francisco but it really did not do it for me. The meat wasn’t soft and barely had flavor. My friend said the meat is normally like this. The noodles were great though. I have heard other locations (like the Japantown one) aren’t as great but this did not match my expectations. Marafuku does a better job

reviews.author: lay hoon.
reviews.text: Efficient and friendly service.  Flavourful soup, ramen texture and firmness is just the way i like it.  Takoyaki is crispy outside and tender inside.

reviews.author: Christopher Fox
reviews.text:
We came during their 6th anniversary event, and I won a sake glass in their raffle!

Whenever I’m in SFO for work, I make sure to have lunch at Hinodeya at least once.
My goto is the spicy miso ramen, lvl 1 & no chili oil, add poached egg. Try it next time you’re here!
The broth carries a lot of flavor and enough heat for me. You can always add chili oil!

reviews.author: Rose Jiang Liu
reviews.text: Had a really nice meal! The noodles are not the typical straight ramen, but a nice curl to it! Lots of scallions, which I’m a fan of! The atmosphere is chill! We came at a good time and it wasn’t crazy busy where you had to wait.

reviews.author: Daniel Bedell
reviews.text: We love this place!  Great ramen and nice atmosphere and great service.  Our server the last time, Taro, was super friendly. When it’s warm, they put a few tables out front and that’s a nice change.

testimonials: Honestly I was disappointed- I was really excited to try since this is one of my friends favorite restaurants and made her fall in love with San Francisco but it really did not do it for me. The meat wasn’t soft and barely had flavor. My friend said the meat is normally like this. The noodles were great though. I have heard other locations (like the Japantown one) aren’t as great but this did not match my expectations. Marafuku does a better job

top_10.name: Spark Social SF
top_10.address: 601 Mission Bay Boulevard North, San Francisco, CA 94158, USA

reviews.author: Lauren Lim
reviews.text: Great venue.  Perfect comfortable, cozy, and clean  setting for large parties.  Love that guests have a selection of foods to choose from. Customer service was welcoming (Thank you. My apologies for not remembering the lovely reps name but I believe it began with letter “M”).  Looking forward to renting space in The Alcove again soon.

reviews.author: Saul Aleman (the adventurer)
reviews.text: Went for the first time last week on a Sunday. Had a bunch of fun. Great food and cool vibe. We took both of our dogs and it was cool to see a bunch of other dogs. Definitely want to go back and try more food. Forgot where I ordered from but the burger and sandwich we had were amazing.

reviews.author: Rexety
reviews.text:
Attended a company event here. Vibe of the place is on point, very good for bigger groups to hang out. Lot of seating area, food options are also various. Ordered from Gyro truck and veggie plate was very good.
Overall a fun place with limited food choices for vegetarians.

reviews.author: Susie McCarthy
reviews.text: Reserved one of their fire pits for a family gathering today and it was great! Reserved the pit very easily online. Amani was our host.  She met us on arrival with smore making kits and we had a ball.  We had a group with 6 kids who were burning through the smore making suppplies.  Amani and her crew were so gracious and continued to keep up with the demand.  Absolutely fabulous time.  We will be back again!

reviews.author: Stephen
reviews.text:
So many choices it was awesome.  Got this burger from Upper Cut. Super tasty.
Side note: clean bathrooms!

testimonials: Great venue.  Perfect comfortable, cozy, and clean  setting for large parties.  Love that guests have a selection of foods to choose from. Customer service was welcoming (Thank you. My apologies for not remembering the lovely reps name but I believe it began with letter “M”).  Looking forward to renting space in The Alcove again soon.

Attended a company event here. Vibe of the place is on point, very good for bigger groups to hang out. Lot of seating area, food options are also various. Ordered from Gyro truck and veggie plate was very good.
Overall a fun place with limited food choices for vegetarians.

top_10.name: Ushi Taro Ramen SOMA
top_10.address: 343 8th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: Small joint that blew me away! The broth is packed with flavor, the meat nicely cut and the eggs perfectly cooked. But the best thing was their tempura mushrooms! OMG! And I'm not a big fan of fried food. Super recommend, give it a try!

reviews.author: 박밍또
reviews.text: The food was very delicious, though a bit salty for my taste. It went really well with beer. The portion size was just right. The tables were a bit close together, which was slightly uncomfortable, but understandable since it’s a small place. I liked that you can add sides to every menu item.

reviews.author: Chris White
reviews.text:
Beautiful cosy restaurant with top class food and service.

We are visiting from the UK and we were looking for a ramen restaurant near our hotel on Mission.

This restaurant didn't disappoint. We had the Gyoza + Traditional & Shoyu Ramen. All dishes were served with care and full of flavour.

Highly recommended! Thanks for looking after us.

reviews.author: Cory Anderson
reviews.text:
Really delicious ramen! I got the Spicy Miso Kimchi Ramen (sub tofu for vegetarian), which is not on the normal menu, but on in-restaurant cards. LOVED the spice level (medium, maybe 3/5) of the broth.

The mushroom appetizer was DELICIOUS, the texture is great. Would be great if paired with a sauce.

reviews.author: Stella Lu
reviews.text:
Cozy atmosphere. Fantastic ramen - broth is flavorful, but not overwhelming, and the egg was perfect. Noodles had just the right amount of bite.

Eat the beef first, before it becomes overcooked!

testimonials: Small joint that blew me away! The broth is packed with flavor, the meat nicely cut and the eggs perfectly cooked. But the best thing was their tempura mushrooms! OMG! And I'm not a big fan of fried food. Super recommend, give it a try!

The food was very delicious, though a bit salty for my taste. It went really well with beer. The portion size was just right. The tables were a bit close together, which was slightly uncomfortable, but understandable since it’s a small place. I liked that you can add sides to every menu item.

Beautiful cosy restaurant with top class food and service.

We are visiting from the UK and we were looking for a ramen restaurant near our hotel on Mission.

This restaurant didn't disappoint. We had the Gyoza + Traditional & Shoyu Ramen. All dishes were served with care and full of flavour.

Highly recommended! Thanks for looking after us.

top_10.name: Marufuku Ramen
top_10.address: 1581 Webster St #235, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Kang Wang
reviews.text: It’s definitely worth the wait! We got the regular pork belly Ramen: the broth, the veggie, the condiment, the noodles, the egg everything is like a Symphony harmonically dancing together. Just fight through your hunger and impatience while being in line but the end is all worth it! It currently kids, friendly restaurant, providing kids water cups kids utensils. The service is very fast.

reviews.author: Wolf Fivousix
reviews.text: Great broth, full of flavor. Tried their Hakata Tonkotsu Dx, the egg was perfect, the meat very tender and the corn definitely sweet and delicious! This location is always packed and there's usually a long wait at peak hours. It's a cute place, especially if you sit by the windows in the back of the restaurant, but it felt a bit cramped. The tables are so close that it almost feels like you are sitting at a bar counter. Which, of course, makes quite a bit uncomfortable if you're looking to have a somewhat private conversation over a meal. At least if you are at a counter you can whisper, not the case here. The service was polite, helpful. Overall a great ramen place!

reviews.author: Alexandra Shinn
reviews.text: Beautiful atmosphere and some of the best ramen you will ever have. It was well worth the wait to have this delicious broth and noodles to accompany it. While waiting there is plenty to explore all around so it feels like no time at all. Every dish we had was delicious and the service was lovely.

reviews.author: denise hernandez
reviews.text: Very crowded means very good food. We did have to wait for an hour for a table since it's a first fome first serve, but honestly, it was fine since you have so much to see. It's located inside the Japan center mall, so there is plenty of shopping, drinks, food and some claw machines while you wait. Our server was amazing. She explained everything to us that we had questions about, I have a food allergy, and she tripled checked if what I ordered had my allergy. Unfortunately, it did, but she was able to recommend something quick. We had a great time, and the kids loved it.

reviews.author: Shyam Prabhu
reviews.text:
We visited the Marufuku Ramen location in San Francisco, inside the Japan Center (Kinokuniya Building), and it did not disappoint. We got there pretty close to closing time, but the staff was super friendly and didn’t rush us at all.

The Tonkotsu ramen was absolutely incredible—just like what I had at their Oakland location. The broth was rich, creamy, and full of flavor. A lot of places mess this up and serve something too thin or watered down, but Marufuku nails it. The chashu was perfectly cooked, tender, and packed with flavor. Portions were generous too, which is always a plus.

We also tried the takoyaki and the shrimp buns, and both were awesome. The takoyaki had that perfect soft-inside, crispy-outside texture, and the shrimp buns were flavorful and satisfying. The karaage was decent, though it felt more like regular fried chicken than classic Japanese-style karaage.

The space is upstairs in the Kinokuniya building, with a casual vibe and a solid drink menu as well.

Overall, this is an amazing spot for ramen and small bites in the city. Whether you’ve been to their other locations or not, this one’s absolutely worth checking out. Highly recommend!

We got the regular pork belly Ramen: the broth, the veggie, the condiment, the noodles, the egg everything is like a Symphony harmonically dancing together. Just fight through your hunger and impatience while being in line but the end is all worth it! It currently kids, friendly restaurant, providing kids water cups kids utensils. The service is very fast.

The service was polite, helpful. Overall a great ramen place!

top_10.name: Mensho Tokyo SF
top_10.address: 672 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Maui World Travelers
reviews.text:
I asked a fellow reviewer where their favorite ramen shop in the city was, in which they replied Mensho. Sold! Mensho is a chain of ramen bars from Japan.

It was 10:30pm on a Thursday night, a full 45-minutes prior to closing. I thought for sure there'd be no line. Surprise, surprise, we were greeted with a short line about 10 deep. Haters passed by, obnoxiously saying "OMG, it's noodles and water!?" And "This was the worst place I've ever eaten at!" Well, you know what? You don't know JACK, f'n top ramen haters!

ATMOSPHERE:
The tiny shop sports 3 communal high tops and a low-seat counter for a grand total of about 30 warm bodies. You will wait and you will sit with, amongst, or even in between strangers. While hangrily waiting outside, I was getting annoyed at the patrons inside who were SLOWLY eating their ramen, thinking they were doing it deliberately. Explanation will be revealed below.

MENU:
Ramen, mazesoba & aburasoba (soup-less ramen), rice, beer, sake. I didn't see tsukemen listed.

FOOD:
Tori Paitan
I've heard of this broth style and was anxious to try it. I added a shoyu ajitama. It's been a while since a bowl of ramen made me moan. Wow to the rich, thick, creamy and searing hot broth. I was expecting it to be white in color but it was tannish/light brown. The noodles were wavy and thick, cooked springy al dente and served piping hot too, YES! Included toppings were kale (which I could do without due to its tough stalk), bamboo, dried burdock shavings, green onion, pork chashu and something I've never had, duck chash that was amazing. Nearing the end of the bowl, you're so full from the broth's richness and thickness, you will slow down. Sorry for talking crap about those inside before me who I thought were table camping, lol. Highly recommended for the ramen connoisseur.

Enoki Mushroom Chips
Yum, like mushroom tempura! The squeeze of lemon and sprinkling of a red spicy-looking salt really weren't needed.

Organic Shoyu Ramen
I'm a shoyu broth fanatic so this was a must-try. The broth had a strong smoky-bonito flavor which I loved. Unfortunately they ran out of both miso & shoyu ajitamas 2 hours after opening, but I did get added bean sprouts and the included pork and duck chashu, bamboo, nori square and yucky kale, though the kale sprouts were good. The noodles in this version were flat and wide, still cooked perfectly chewy and came out searing hot. This ranks right up there for me with the version at Momofuku.

Spicy Lamb Ramen
If you think the Tori Paitan is thick and rich, this sucker is beats it. It's a miso broth topped with ground lamb, pork chashu, nira (Chinese leeks) bamboo and green onions. No egg for my spouse either as they ran out, but he did receive burdock shavings. The spoonful of broth I tasted was intense and a bit like curry. Personally, I'd stick to the paitan for a rich broth, but he absolutely loved it.

SERVICE:
No reservations are made. We were seated in about 35 minutes. The staff were friendly and professional, and food service was quick. The only hiccup was the absence of a requested glass of water.

TIPS:
The menu posted at the sidewalk entry is less detailed than the menu given at the table (some ramen styles and toppings weren't listed).

There's an automatic 15% gratuity to all parties, something I despise. What a shame because I would've left 20%.

OVERALL:
Was it worth the wait? Absolutely.

reviews.author: Kimmy Joe
reviews.text:
We come here everytime we visit!

We have tried just about everything they offer and it’s all amazing.

I got the limited A5 Wagyu last time and the taste was not my favorite personally but everything else is 10/10, including the presentation.

Typically a long line to get in so expect to eat at least 30-60min.

reviews.author: Clark Chan
reviews.text:
The fried enoki was not my cup of tea. It tasted slightly bitter and the dryness was getting to me. I did not finish it.

The GKO ramen was good. The noodles were al dente. The pork belly was soft, sliced thin and was well marinated. The egg was perfectly done. The broth was more flavorful compared to the signature, but it would have been perfect Had it been a little bit more watery, with more oomph in the broth

The signature spicy ramen was good. The noodles were al dente. The pork belly was soft, sliced thin, and was well marinated. The egg yolk was perfectly done. My only critique is that the broth is way too thick compared to its flavor profile. I would like the broth to be a little bit more watery to balance out the savoriness of the broth, otherwise it will taste weird and unbalanced.

reviews.author: EddyOneTake
reviews.text: I highly recommend Mensho for anyone who loves ramen but especially for vegan food enthusiasts! The ambience was very intimate and atmosphere was very clean. We were greeted and served by Earn who was genuine and kept a smile the entire time. She was very insightful and knowledgeable about the the dishes especially the vegan options. I was absolutely impressed. Mensho is great to go alone or with a partner whether you're one the go and need a quick lunch or an authentic diner date. Mensho is my number one recommendation for authentic vegan noodles in the San Francisco area.

reviews.author: Melanie Arakaki
reviews.text:
I almost skipped this place since I was visiting SF alone and it’s located in the Tenderloin, an area many people advised me to avoid, especially on my own. I’m so glad I went anyway!

I arrived early, around 5 PM on a Saturday, and was seated almost immediately. The service was fast and the ramen was delicious. I ordered the vegan garlic knock out (GKO). The toppings were great too, especially the carrots, which added a perfect texture and flavor.

I also tried the enoki chips (loved them) but the real surprise were the corn wings, these were unexpectedly delicious.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen Japantown
top_10.address: 1737 Buchanan St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Prim Rose
reviews.text: I absolutely love the Hamaguri Clam Ramen here! The clear, flavorful broth is perfect for someone like me who’s not into creamy soups. My friend ordered the Spicy Miso Butter Corn Ramen and fell in love with it at the very first sip. rich, bold, and super satisfying. We also tried several appetizers and every single one was delicious. Bonus points for the outdoor seating with a heater, which makes it so convenient for people like me who bring their fur baby along. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: M M
reviews.text:
Awesome service, staff, and style. Love the restaurant. The food was amazing and tasty. 2 bathrooms, and the ambiance is welcoming. Carlos answered my questions with such politeness. He even doubled checked to make sure he was correct in his response with his boss.
I will 100% recommend this place to anyone and everyone, especially if traveling alone (like me). Glad there’s places like this that cater to tables for one!!!!

reviews.author: mili mondal
reviews.text:
Ramen break in SFO! 🍜
Our family loves ramen, so while visiting San Francisco today, we checked out this cozy spot. It’s not a fancy restaurant, but the food was really good!

I usually go for vegetarian ramen (because it’s often the only option), but this place had a chicken ramen made entirely with chicken broth—no pork or beef, which was a pleasant surprise! 🙌

It’s great to finally have more than one option when craving ramen.

One small thing: I felt the veggie ramen was a bit too leafy—maybe they could balance it with some other veggies.

Overall, really happy with the experience. Would definitely go back! 😊🍜

reviews.author: Russell Akred
reviews.text: With Japanese Ramen noodles and some rolled chicken sliced into disks, the pretty spirals, and the shoots made a beautiful presentation. It was a little noisy but it is all in fun. The flavor was creamy and spicy.

reviews.author: Magda G
reviews.text:
Friend was craving a vegan ramen so we went. There have two different kinds of vegan ramen so we had one each, he got the vegan creamy which I tired and it had lots of flavor. I went with the vegan zen which is advertised as "light & healthy" but I found it very heavy with way too much oil, the ramen just sit in my throat and was not feeling it at all. Very salty as well. The marinated tofu was very sweet.

It was an ok place but I will not be going back there, the food arrived almost instantly after we ordered but once our food was served, the waitress did not check on us at all and place was not busy at all.

Outside sitting was cool so you can people watch.

CC accepted.

testimonials: I absolutely love the Hamaguri Clam Ramen here! The clear, flavorful broth is perfect for someone like me who’s not into creamy soups. My friend ordered the Spicy Miso Butter Corn Ramen and fell in love with it at the very first sip. rich, bold, and super satisfying. We also tried several appetizers and every single one was delicious. Bonus points for the outdoor seating with a heater, which makes it so convenient for people like me who bring their fur baby along. Can’t wait to come back!

Awesome service, staff, and style. Love the restaurant. The food was amazing and tasty. 2 bathrooms, and the ambiance is welcoming. Carlos answered my questions with such politeness. He even doubled checked to make sure he was correct in his response with his boss.
I will 100% recommend this place to anyone and everyone, especially if traveling alone (like me). Glad there’s places like this that cater to tables for one!!!!

Ramen break in SFO! 🍜
Our family loves ramen, so while visiting San Francisco today, we checked out this cozy spot. It’s not a fancy restaurant, but the food was really good!

I usually go for vegetarian ramen (because it’s often the only option), but this place had a chicken ramen made entirely with chicken broth—no pork or beef, which was a pleasant surprise! 🙌

It’s great to finally have more than one option when craving ramen.

One small thing: I felt the veggie ramen was a bit too leafy—maybe they could balance it with some other veggies.

Overall, really happy with the experience. Would definitely go back! 😊🍜
